Text

[The Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons were of [those people who do not dine]158-those people who do not dine . [They]56-the polkingtons lunched , though few besides [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny , who did not count , had been invited to share that meal with [them]56-the polkingtons . [They]56-the polkingtons took tea , the daintiest , pleasantest , most charming of teas , as [the élite of [Marbridge]61-denah]159-the élite of marbridge knew ; [everybody]160-everybody — or , rather , [a selection of [everybody]160-everybody]161-a selection of everybody , had had tea with [them]56-the polkingtons one time or another . After that there was no record ; [the élite , who would as soon have thought of going without]163-the élite , who would as soon have thought of going without [their]163-the élite , who would as soon have thought of going without heads as without [their]163-the élite , who would as soon have thought of going without dinner , concluded [they]163-the élite , who would as soon have thought of going without dined , because [they]163-the élite , who would as soon have thought of going without were " one of [us]3304-us . "[163-the élite , who would as soon have thought of going without] But [some humbler folk]164-some humbler folk were of opinion that [they]56-the polkingtons only dined once a week , and that after morning service on Sundays ; but even this idea was dispelled when [the eldest Miss Polkington]58-julia was heard to excuse [her]58-julia non - appearance at an organ recital because " lunch was always so late on Sunday . "[58-julia] Let it not be imagined from this that [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons were [common people]165-common people — [they]56-the polkingtons were not ; [they]56-the polkingtons were extremely well connected ; indeed , [their]56-the polkingtons connections were one of the two striking features about [them]56-the polkingtons , the other was [[their]56-the polkingtons handicap]166-their handicap , [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington , late of the — — th [Bengal Lancers]167-bengal lancers . [He]59-captain polkington was well connected , though not quite so much so as [[his]59-captain polkington wife]168-his wife ; still — well , but [he]59-captain polkington was not very presentable . If only [he]59-captain polkington had been dead [he]59-captain polkington would have been a valuable asset , but living , [he]59-captain polkington was decidedly rather a drawback ; there are [some relatives]169-some relatives like this . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington bore up under it valiantly ; in fact , [they]56-the polkingtons all did so well that in time [they]56-the polkingtons , or at least [she]60-mrs. polkington and [two of [[her]60-mrs. polkington three daughters]171-her three daughters]170-two of her three daughters , came almost to believe some of the legends [they]56-the polkingtons told of [the Captain]172-the captain . [The Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons lived at [No . 27 East Street]2-no . 27 east street , which , as [all who know [Marbridge]61-denah]173-all who know marbridge are aware , is [a very good street in which to live]174-a very good street in which to live . [The house]175-the house was rather small , but [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room was good , with two beautiful Queen Anne windows , and a white door with six panels . The rest of [the house]175-the house did not matter . On the whole [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room did not so very much matter , because [visitors]179-visitors seldom went into [it]176-the drawing - room when [the Miss Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons were not [there]180-there ; and when [they]179-visitors were , [no one]181-no one but [a jealous woman]182-a jealous woman would have noticed that the furniture was rather slight , and there were no flowers except those in obvious places . There was only one [Miss Polkington]58-julia in [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room that wintry afternoon — [Julia]58-julia , [the middle one of the three]184-the middle one of the three , [the only one who could not fill even a larger room to the complete obliteration of furniture and fitments]185-the only one who could not fill even a larger room to the complete obliteration of furniture and fitments . [Julia]58-julia was not pretty , therefore [she]58-julia was seldom to be found in [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room alone ; [she]58-julia knew better than to attempt to occupy that stage by [herself]58-julia . But it was now almost seven o'clock , too late for [any one]187-any one to come ; also , since there was no light but the fire , deficiencies were not noticeable . [She]58-julia felt secure of interruption , and stood with one foot on the fender , looking earnestly into the fire . That day had been an important one to [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons ; [Violet]101-violet , [the eldest of [the sisters]189-the sisters]188-the eldest of the sisters , had that afternoon accepted an offer of marriage from [the Reverend [Richard Frazer]63-richard frazer]190-the reverend richard frazer . [The young man]191-the young man had not left [the house]175-the house an hour , and [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington was not yet returned from some afternoon engagement more than half , but already the matter had been in part discussed by [the family]193-the family . [Julia]58-julia , standing by [the drawing - room fire]194-the drawing - room fire , was in a position to review at least some points of the case dispassionately . [Violet]101-violet was two and twenty , tall , and of a fine presence , like [[her]101-violet mother]195-her mother , but handsomer than [the elder woman]196-the elder woman could ever have been . [She]101-violet had undoubted abilities , principally of a social order , but not a penny apiece to [her]101-violet dower . [She]58-julia had this afternoon accepted [Richard Frazer]63-richard frazer , though [he]63-richard frazer was only [a curate]197-a curate — [an aristocratic one]198-an aristocratic one certainly , with a small private income , and [an uncle]199-an uncle lately made [bishop of one of the minor sees]200-bishop of one of the minor sees . [Violet]101-violet was fond of [him]63-richard frazer ; [she]101-violet was too nice [a girl]201-a girl to accept [a man [she]101-violet was not fond of , though too well brought up to become fond of one who was impossible]202-a man she was not fond of , though too well brought up to become fond of one who was impossible . The engagement , though it probably did not fulfil all [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington 's ambitions , was in [Julia]58-julia 's opinion a good thing for several reasons . There was a swish and rustle of silk by the door — [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington did not wear silk skirts , only a silk flounce somewhere , but [she]60-mrs. polkington got more creak and rustle out of it than [the average woman]203-the average woman does out of two skirts . [An imposing woman]204-an imposing woman [she]60-mrs. polkington was , with an eye that had once been described as " eagle , "[60-mrs. polkington] though , for that , it was a little inquiring and eager now , by reason of the look - out [she]60-mrs. polkington had been obliged to keep for a good part of [her]60-mrs. polkington life . [She]60-mrs. polkington entered [the room]205-the room now , followed by [[her]60-mrs. polkington eldest and youngest daughters]206-her eldest and youngest daughters , [Violet]101-violet and [Chèrie]64-chèrie . " At twelve to - morrow ? "[60-mrs. polkington] [she]60-mrs. polkington was saying as [she]60-mrs. polkington came in . " Is that when [he]3305-he is coming to see [[your]60-mrs. polkington father]3306-your father ? "[60-mrs. polkington] [Violet]101-violet said it was ; then added , in a tone of some dissatisfaction , " [I]60-mrs. polkington suppose [he]3305-he must see [father]3307-father about it ? [We]3308-we could n't arrange something ? "[60-mrs. polkington] " Certainly not , "[60-mrs. polkington] [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington replied with decision ; " it is not for [me]60-mrs. polkington to give or refuse consent to [your]60-mrs. polkington marriage . Of course , [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer knows [[your]60-mrs. polkington father]3306-your father does not have good health , or trouble [himself]65-mr. frazer to mix much in society here — it is not likely that [an old military man]3310-an old military man should , but in a case like this [he]65-mr. frazer would expect to be called upon ; it would have shown a great lack of breeding on [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer 's part had [he]65-mr. frazer suggested anything different . "[60-mrs. polkington] [Violet]101-violet agreed , though [she]101-violet did not seem exactly convinced , and [Julia]58-julia created a diversion by saying — " Twelve is rather an awkward time . A quarter of an hour with [father]3307-father , five minutes — no , ten — with [you]60-mrs. polkington , half an hour with [Violet]101-violet , altogether brings it very near lunch time . "[58-julia] " [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer will , of course , lunch with [us]56-the polkingtons to - morrow , "[60-mrs. polkington] [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington said , as if [stray guests]207-stray guests to lunch were the most usual and convenient thing in [the world]208-the world . [The Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons kept up a good many of [their]56-the polkingtons farces in private life ; [most of [them]56-the polkingtons]209-most of them found it easier , as well as pleasanter , to do so . " The cold beef , "[60-mrs. polkington] [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington said , mentally reviewing [her]60-mrs. polkington larder , " can be hashed ; that and a small boned loin of mutton will do , [he]57-johnny would naturally expect to be treated as [one of [the family]193-the family]3312-one of the family ; fortunately the apple tart has not been cut — with a little cream — "[60-mrs. polkington] " [I]58-julia thought [we]56-the polkingtons were to have the tart to - night , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia interrupted , thinking of [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny , who was coming to spend the evening with [[her]58-julia father]210-her father . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington thought of [him]57-johnny too , but [she]60-mrs. polkington did not change [her]60-mrs. polkington mind on this account . " [We]56-the polkingtons ca n't , then , "[60-mrs. polkington] [she]60-mrs. polkington said , and turned to the discussion of other matters . [She]60-mrs. polkington had carried these as far as the probable date of marriage , and the preferment [the young man]191-the young man might easily expect , when [the little servant]212-the little servant came up to announce [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington did not express impatience . " Is [he]57-johnny in [the dining - room]3314-the dining - room ? "[60-mrs. polkington] [she]60-mrs. polkington said . " [I]60-mrs. polkington hope [you]58-julia lighted the heater , [Mary]67-mary . "[60-mrs. polkington] For a little [none of [the three girls]214-the three girls]213-none of the three girls moved , then [Julia]58-julia rose . " Are [you]58-julia going down to [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat ? "[58-julia] [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother asked . " There really is no necessity ; [he]216-he is perfectly happy with the paper . "[216-he] Perhaps [he]216-he was , though the paper was a half - penny morning one ; [he]216-he did not make extravagant demands on fate , or anything else ; nevertheless , [Julia]58-julia went down . [[The Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons ' house]217-the polkingtons ' house was furnished on an ascending scale , which found its zenith in [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room , but deteriorated again very rapidly afterwards . [The dining - room]3314-the dining - room , being midway between [the kitchen]220-the kitchen and [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room , was only [a middling - looking apartment]222-a middling - looking apartment . [They]56-the polkingtons did not often have a fire [there]180-there ; a paraffin lamp stove stood in the fire - place , leering with its red eye as if it took a wicked satisfaction in its own smell . Before [the fire - place]224-the fire - place , re - reading the already - known newspaper by the light of one gas jet , sat [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny . [Poor old [Johnny]57-johnny , with [his]57-johnny round , pink face , whereon a grizzled little moustache looked as much out of place as on [a twelve - year - old school - boy]226-a twelve - year - old school - boy]225-poor old johnny , with his round , pink face , whereon a grizzled little moustache looked as much out of place as on a twelve - year - old school - boy . There was something of [the school - boy]227-the school - boy in [his]57-johnny look and in [his]57-johnny deprecating manner , especially to [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington ; [he]57-johnny had always been a little deprecating to [her]60-mrs. polkington even when [he]57-johnny had first known [her]60-mrs. polkington , [a bride]228-a bride , while [he]57-johnny [himself]57-johnny was [the wealthy bachelor friend of [[her]60-mrs. polkington husband]230-her husband]229-the wealthy bachelor friend of her husband . [He]57-johnny was still [a bachelor]231-a bachelor , and still [[[her]60-mrs. polkington husband]230-her husband 's friend]233-her husband 's friend , but the wealth had gone long ago . [He]57-johnny had now only just enough to keep [him]57-johnny , fortunately so secured that [he]57-johnny could not touch [the principal]234-the principal . It was a mercy [he]57-johnny had it , for there was no known work at which [he]57-johnny could have earned sixpence , unless perhaps it was road scraping under [a not too exacting District]235-a not too exacting district [Council]3-council . [He]57-johnny was [a harmless enough person]236-a harmless enough person , but when [he]57-johnny took it into [his]57-johnny head to leave [[his]57-johnny lodgings]237-his lodgings in [town]238-town for [others]239-others , equally cheap and nasty , at [Marbridge]61-denah , [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington felt fate was hard upon [her]60-mrs. polkington . It was like having [two Captain Polkingtons]240-two captain polkingtons , of a different sort , but equally unsuitable for public use , in [the place]241-the place . In self defence [she]60-mrs. polkington had been obliged to make definite rules for [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's coming and going about [the house]175-the house , and still more definite rules as to [the rooms in which [he]66-mr. gillat might be found]243-the rooms in which he might be found . [The dining - room]3314-the dining - room was allowed [him]66-mr. gillat , and there [he]66-mr. gillat was when [Julia]58-julia came . [Julia]58-julia went to it . " [Dear]3320-dear , [dear]3320-dear ! "[66-mr. gillat] [he]66-mr. gillat exclaimed . " No ? Really ? " The sooner [Violet]101-violet is married , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " the sooner [we]3326-we can reduce some of the expenses ; [we]3326-we are living beyond [our]3326-we income now — not a great deal , perhaps , still a bit ; [Violet]101-violet 's going would save enough , [I]58-julia believe ; [we]3326-we could catch up then . That is one reason , but [the chief]3327-the chief is that a long engagement is expensive ; [you]3328-you see , [we]3326-we should have to have meals different , and fires different , and all manner of extras if [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer came in and out constantly . [We]3326-we should have to live altogether in a more expensive style ; [we]3326-we might manage [it]3329-it for three months , or six if [we]3326-we were driven to [it]3329-it , but for a year — it is out of the question . "[58-julia] " But , "[66-mr. gillat] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat protested , " if [they]3330-they ca n't afford it ? [You]66-mr. gillat said [he]65-mr. frazer could not ; [he]65-mr. frazer is [a curate]197-a curate . "[66-mr. gillat] " [He]65-mr. frazer must get a living , or a chaplaincy , or something ; or rather , [I]66-mr. gillat expect [we]3326-we must get it for [him]65-mr. frazer . "[66-mr. gillat] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat looked at [her]250-her uneasily ; every now and then there flitted through [his]66-mr. gillat mind a suspicion that [Julia]58-julia was clever too , as clever perhaps as [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother , and though not , like [her]58-julia , [a moral and social pillar standing in [the high first estate from which [he]66-mr. gillat and [the Captain]172-the captain had fallen]253-the high first estate from which he and the captain had fallen]252-a moral and social pillar standing in the high first estate from which he and the captain had fallen . [Julia]58-julia had never been that , never aspired to it ; [she]58-julia was no success at all ; content to come and sit in [the dining - room]3314-the dining - room with [him]66-mr. gillat and [Bouquet]68-bouquet ; [she]58-julia could not really be clever , or else [she]58-julia would have achieved something for [herself]58-julia , and scorned to consort with failures . [He]66-mr. gillat smiled benignly as [he]66-mr. gillat remembered this , observing , " [I]66-mr. gillat dare say something will be done — [I]66-mr. gillat hope it may ; [[your]58-julia mother]3323-your mother 's [a wonderful woman]3322-a wonderful woman , a wonderful — "[66-mr. gillat] [He]66-mr. gillat broke off to listen ; [Julia]58-julia listened too , then [she]58-julia rose to [her]58-julia feet . " [You]58-julia should n't do it , [you]58-julia know , "[210-her father] [he]210-her father said , with mild reproof ; " [you]58-julia really should n't . "[210-her father] " Do it ! "[172-the captain] [the Captain]172-the captain cried . " Do what ? "[172-the captain] [Julia]58-julia looked up from the floor where [she]58-julia knelt trimming the stove - lamp . " Have five whiskeys and sodas , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , examining [[her]58-julia father]210-her father judicially . [He]210-her father did not deny the charge ; [Julia]58-julia 's observation was not to be avoided . " And what is five ? "[210-her father] [he]210-her father demanded with dignity . "[58-julia] " Is that [your]58-julia opinion , [Gillat]57-johnny ? "[59-captain polkington] [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington asked . " Is that what [you]58-julia meant ? "[59-captain polkington] " [I]57-johnny was n't thinking of the whiskey , "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny said apologetically ; " it was the gees . "[57-johnny] [The Captain]172-the captain groaned , but what [he]172-the captain said more [Julia]58-julia did not hear ; [she]58-julia went out into [the kitchen]220-the kitchen to get paraffin . But [she]58-julia had no doubt that [he]172-the captain defended the attacked point to [his]172-the captain own satisfaction , as [he]172-the captain always had done — cards , races , and kindred pleasant , if expensive , things , ever since the days long ago before [he]172-the captain sent in [his]172-the captain papers . These same pleasant things had had a good deal to do with the sending in of the papers ; not that they had led [the Captain]172-the captain into anything disgraceful , the compulsion to resign [his]172-the captain commission came solely from [relatives]272-relatives , prin cipally those of [[his]172-the captain wife]168-his wife . It was [their]274-their opinion that [he]172-the captain worked too little and played too much , and an expensive kind of play . That [he]172-the captain drank too much was not said ; of course , the Indian climate and life tempted to whiskey pegs , and nature had not fitted [him]172-the captain for them in large quantities ; still that was never cast up against [him]172-the captain . Enough was , however , to bring things to an end ; [he]172-the captain resigned , relations helped to pay [his]172-the captain debts , and [he]172-the captain came [home]249-home with the avowed intention of getting some gentlemanly employment . Of course [he]172-the captain never got any , it was n't likely , hardly possible ; but [he]172-the captain had something left to live upon — a very small private income , [a clever wife]276-a clever wife , and some useful and conscientious relations . Somehow [the family]193-the family lived , quite how in the early days [no one]181-no one knew ; [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington never spoke of it at the time , and now , mercifully , [she]60-mrs. polkington had forgotten part , but the struggle must have been bitter . [Herself]60-mrs. polkington disillusioned , [[her]60-mrs. polkington daughters mere children]279-her daughters mere children , [her]60-mrs. polkington position insecure , and [[her]60-mrs. polkington husband]230-her husband not yet reduced to submission , and always prone to slip back into [his]230-her husband old ways . But [she]60-mrs. polkington had won through somehow , and time had given [her]60-mrs. polkington the compensations possible to [her]60-mrs. polkington nature . [She]60-mrs. polkington was , by [her]60-mrs. polkington own untiring efforts , a social factor now , even a social success ; [[her]60-mrs. polkington eldest daughter]281-her eldest daughter was engaged to [a clergyman of sufficient , if small , means]282-a clergyman of sufficient , if small , means , and [[her]60-mrs. polkington youngest]283-her youngest was almost [a beauty]284-a beauty . As to [the Captain]172-the captain , [he]172-the captain was still [there]180-there ; time had not taken [him]172-the captain away , but it had reduced [him]172-the captain ; [he]172-the captain gave little trouble now even when [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny came ; [he]172-the captain kept so out of the way that [she]60-mrs. polkington had almost come to regard [him]172-the captain as a negligible factor — which was a mistake . Both [the Captain]172-the captain and [[his]172-the captain friend]245-his friend had a great respect for [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington , though [both]289-both felt at times that [she]60-mrs. polkington treated [them]289-both a little hardly . [The Captain]172-the captain especially felt this , but [he]172-the captain put up with it ; after all it is easier to acqui esce than to assert [one]3325-one 's rights , and , as [Johnny]57-johnny pointed out , it was on the whole more comfortable , in spite of horse - hair chairs , down in [the basement]258-the basement than up in [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room . There was no need to make polite conversation down here , and [one]3325-one might smoke , no matter how cheap the tobacco , and put [one]3325-one 's feet up , and really [Bouquet]68-bouquet was almost as good as a fire when [you]296-you once get used to it . [Johnny]57-johnny was of a contented mind , [he]57-johnny even looked contented sitting by the empty stove when [Julia]58-julia came back with the paraffin ; [the Captain]172-the captain , on the other hand , appeared to be very gloomy and unhappy ; [he]172-the captain sat silent all the time [[his]172-the captain daughter]298-his daughter was present . As [she]60-mrs. polkington was leaving [the room]205-the room [Johnny]57-johnny tried to rouse [him]172-the captain . " [We]3342-we might have a game , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny suggested , looking towards a pack of cards that stuck out of a half - opened drawer . " [I]57-johnny have nothing in [the world]208-the world that [I]57-johnny can call [my]57-johnny own , "[57-johnny] [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington answered , without moving . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat felt in [his]66-mr. gillat own lean pockets surreptitiously . " [We]3342-we might play for paper , "[66-mr. gillat] [he]66-mr. gillat said . And as [she]58-julia went up - [stairs]300-stairs [Julia]58-julia listened to hear [their]301-their chairs scroop on the kamptulikon floor as [they]301-their drew [them]302-them to the table ; [she]58-julia was surprised not to hear the sound , but [she]58-julia imagined the game must have been put off a little so that [[her]58-julia father]210-her father could talk over [his]210-her father troubles . Which , indeed , was the case , though the magnitude of those troubles [she]58-julia did not guess .

[Violet]101-violet 's engagement was an accepted fact . [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer came to see [the Captain]172-the captain , who received [him]172-the captain in [the dining - room]3314-the dining - room — the combined ingenuity of [the family]193-the family could not make the down - [stairs room]307-stairs room presentable . The interview was short , but satisfactory ; so also was the one with [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington which followed ; with [Violet]101-violet it was longer , but , no doubt , equally satisfactory . [Lunch]69-lunch , too , was all that could be desired . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington 's manners were always gracious , and to - day [she]60-mrs. polkington had a charming air of taking [Richard]63-richard frazer into [the family]193-the family — after having shut all the doors , actual and metaphorical , which led to anything real and personal . [The Captain]172-the captain was rather twittery at lunch , at times inclined to talk too much , at times heavily silent and always obviously submissive to [[his]172-the captain wife]168-his wife . [Yesterday]70-yesterday 's excitement was not enough to account for this in [Julia]58-julia 's opinion . " [He]172-the captain has been doing something , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia decided , and wondered what . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington and [[her]60-mrs. polkington daughters]311-her daughters all went out that afternoon ; [Julia]58-julia , however , returned at about dusk . As [the others]312-the others had no intention of coming back so soon , there was no drawing - room tea ; a much simpler meal was spread in [the dining - room]3314-the dining - room . [Julia]58-julia and [[her]58-julia father]210-her father had only just sat down to it when [they]315-they heard [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny 's knock at the front door , followed a minute afterwards by [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat [himself]66-mr. gillat ; but when [he]66-mr. gillat saw that [the Captain]172-the captain was not alone , [he]66-mr. gillat stopped on the threshold ; [Julia]58-julia 's presence , contrary to custom , seemed to discompose [him]66-mr. gillat . [He]66-mr. gillat , then , was in [[her]58-julia father]210-her father 's secret , whatever it might be ; [she]58-julia guessed as much when [she]58-julia saw [his]66-mr. gillat perturbed pink face . However , [she]58-julia did not say anything , only invited [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat to have some tea . [Johnny]57-johnny sat down , and put a small and rather badly tied parcel beside [him]66-mr. gillat ; next minute [he]57-johnny picked it up again , and began surreptitiously to put it into first one pocket and then another . It was rather a tight fit , and in [his]57-johnny efforts to do it unobtrusively , [he]57-johnny made some disturbance , but [no one]181-no one remarked on it ; [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington because [he]59-captain polkington was too despondent , [Julia]58-julia because it did not seem worth while . Conversation languished ; [Julia]58-julia did what [she]58-julia could , but [[her]58-julia father]210-her father answered in monosyllables , and [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat said , " Very true , "[66-mr. gillat] or " Ah , yes , yes , "[210-her father] eating slice after slice of thick bread and butter , and filling [his]210-her father mouth very full as if to cork it up and so prevent [his]210-her father having to answer awkward questions . At last [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington rose ; " [Gillat]57-johnny , "[59-captain polkington] [he]59-captain polkington said , " if [you]57-johnny have finished , [we]3344-we may as well go down - [stairs]300-stairs . "[59-captain polkington] [Johnny]57-johnny set down [his]57-johnny half - finished cup of tea with alacrity , and with alacrity followed [the Captain]172-the captain . [She]58-julia was not , however ; on the contrary , [she]58-julia showed every sign of accompanying [them]323-them to [the little room]324-the little room behind . " Do [you]58-julia want anything , [Julia]58-julia ? "[172-the captain] [He]172-the captain paced the hearthrug with outraged dignity , but [Julia]58-julia only drew one of the horse - hair chairs to the table . " [You]57-johnny would do better to tell [me]58-julia , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia might be able to help [you]57-johnny — [Johnny]57-johnny , wo n't [you]57-johnny sit down ? "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny took the cane deck - chair , sitting down nervously and so near the edge that the old chair creaked ominously . " It is money , of course , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia went on ; " [I]58-julia suppose [you]57-johnny lost at the races yesterday — how much ? "[58-julia] " Yes , yes , "[59-captain polkington] [he]59-captain polkington said , rather eagerly ; " [I]59-captain polkington borrowed — that was it ; of course [I]59-captain polkington was going to pay back — [I]59-captain polkington am going to pay back . "[59-captain polkington] " From whom did [you]59-captain polkington borrow ? "[172-the captain] Another pause , and the question again , then [the Captain]172-the captain explained confusedly : " The cheque — it came a day early — [I]172-the captain merely meant to make use of it for the day — "[172-the captain] " The cheque ! "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia repeated , with dawning comprehension . " The cheque from [Slade]71-slade & [Slade]71-slade that [mother]3346-mother was speaking of this morning . [Our]3349-our cheque , the money [we]3349-our have to live on for the next three months ? "[58-julia] " [My]210-her father cheque , "[210-her father] [[her]58-julia father]210-her father said , with one last effort at dignity ; " made out to [me]210-her father — [my]210-her father income that [I]210-her father have a perfect right to spend as [I]210-her father like ; [I]210-her father used [my]210-her father own money for [my]210-her father own purposes . "[210-her father] [He]210-her father forgot that a moment back [he]210-her father had excused the act as a borrowing ; [Julia]58-julia did not remind [him]210-her father , [she]58-julia was too much concerned with the facts to trouble about mere turns of speech . They , like words and motives , had not heretofore entered much into [her]58-julia considerations ; consequences were what was really important to [her]58-julia — how the bad might be averted , how the good drawn that way , and all used to the best advantage . This point of view , though it leaves a great deal to be desired , has one advantage — [those who take it]332-those who take it waste no time in lamentation or reproof . For that reason [they]332-those who take it are perhaps some of [the least unpleasant people to confess to]333-the least unpleasant people to confess to . [Julia]58-julia wasted no words now ; [she]58-julia sat for a brief minute , stunned by the magnitude of the calamity which had deprived [them]334-we of the largest part of [their]334-we income for the next three months ; then [she]58-julia began to look round in [her]58-julia mind to see what might be done . [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington offered a few not very coherent explanations and excuses , to which [she]58-julia did not listen , and then relapsed into silence . [Johnny]57-johnny sat opposite , rubbing [his]57-johnny hands in nervous sympathy , and looking from [father]3307-father to [daughter]336-daughter ; [he]57-johnny took the silence of [the one]337-the one to be as hopeless as that of [the other]338-the other . " [We]334-we thought , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny ventured at last , tugging at the parcel now firmly wedged in [his]57-johnny pocket . " [We]334-we hoped , that is , [we]334-we thought perhaps [we]334-we might raise a trifle , it would n't be much help — "[57-johnny] But [neither of the others]339-neither of the others were listening to [him]57-johnny , and [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington interrupted with [his]59-captain polkington own remedy , " [We]334-we shall have to manage on credit , "[59-captain polkington] [he]59-captain polkington said ; " [we]334-we can get credit for this three months . "[59-captain polkington] " [We]334-we ca n't , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia assured [him]59-captain polkington ; " the greater part of that money was to have paid outstanding bills ; [we]334-we ca n't live on credit , because [we]334-we have n't got any to live on . "[58-julia] " That 's nonsense , "[210-her father] [[her]58-julia father]210-her father said ; " it can be done with care and economy , and retrenchments . "[210-her father] [Julia]58-julia did not answer , so [Johnny]57-johnny took up the words . " Yes , yes , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said , " [one]3325-one can always retrench ; it is really marvellous how little [one]3325-one can do with , in fact [one]3325-one is better for it ; [I]57-johnny feel [a different man]3353-a different man for having to retrench . [[Your]58-julia mother]3323-your mother 's [a wonderful woman"—he]3355-a wonderful woman"—he[57-johnny] stopped , then added doubtfully as [he]57-johnny thought of the lost apple tart—"I suppose , though , [she]3323-your mother would want to make a good appearance just now , with the engagement , [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer in and out . There were some field - glasses , a breast pin , and a few other such things ; when [he]57-johnny had put them all out [he]57-johnny felt in [his]57-johnny waistcoat - pocket for [his]57-johnny watch . " [They]3356-they would fetch a trifle , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said , regarding the row a little proudly . " Those ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked , puzzled . " Yes , "[58-julia] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat said ; " not a great deal , of course , but it would be a help — it might pay [the butcher]3357-the butcher 's bill . It 's a great thing to have [the butcher]3357-the butcher 's bill paid ; [I]66-mr. gillat 've heard [[my]66-mr. gillat landlady]3359-my landlady say so ; it gives a standing with [the other tradespeople]3360-the other tradespeople , and that 's what [you]57-johnny want — [she]3359-my landlady often says so . "[66-mr. gillat] " [You]58-julia mean [you]57-johnny think of selling them for [us]3361-us ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked , fixing [her]58-julia keen eyes on [Johnny]57-johnny , so that [he]57-johnny felt very guilty , and as if [he]57-johnny ought to excuse [himself]57-johnny . But before [he]57-johnny could do it [she]58-julia had swept [his]57-johnny belongings together . " [You]57-johnny wo n't do anything of the kind , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . " Why not ? "[58-julia] " Oh , but , "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny protested , " it would be a little help , it would indeed ; [they]3362-they would fetch something , the glasses are good ones , though a bit old - fashioned , and the watch — "[57-johnny] " [I]58-julia do n't care , [I]58-julia wo n't have it , "[58-julia] and [Julia]58-julia took the matter into [her]58-julia own hands , and began with a flushed face to re - pack the things [herself]58-julia . " Is it that [you]58-julia think [I]58-julia ca n't spare them ? "[58-julia] [Gillat]57-johnny asked , still bewildered . " [I]57-johnny can — what an idea , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny laughed . " What do [I]57-johnny want with field - glasses , now ? And as to a watch , [my]57-johnny time 's nothing to [me]57-johnny ! "[57-johnny] " No , [I]58-julia dare say not , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said , but [she]58-julia tied the parcel firmly , then [she]58-julia gave it to [him]57-johnny . " Take it away , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " and do n't try to sell a thing . [The relations]354-the relations would have to help ; not with money ; [they]354-the relations would not do that to a useful extent , but with invitations . [Chèrie]64-chèrie was easily provided for ; [Aunt Louise]76-aunt louise had before offered to take [her]64-chèrie abroad for the winter ; [Chèrie]64-chèrie did not in the least want to go ; it was likely to be nothing nicer than acting as [unpaid companion to [a fidgety old lady]356-a fidgety old lady]355-unpaid companion to a fidgety old lady ; but under the present circumstances [she]64-chèrie would have to go . [The élite]407-the élite called to congratulate [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington on [[her]60-mrs. polkington daughter]408-her daughter 's engagement . "[60-mrs. polkington] Here [the visitor]374-the visitor usually made polite inquiries about this same winter abroad , and heard of a delightful prospect of several months to be spent in [the south of [France]6-france]411-the south of france , unnecessary and unpleasant details all omitted . " [You]60-mrs. polkington do agree with [me]60-mrs. polkington ? "[60-mrs. polkington] [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington would then ask rather anxiously , as if [[her]60-mrs. polkington hearer]412-her hearer 's opinion was the one that really mattered to [her]60-mrs. polkington . " [You]60-mrs. polkington do think it wrong to allow [Chèrie]64-chèrie to refuse this invitation for [Violet]101-violet 's sake ? [I]60-mrs. polkington am very glad [you]60-mrs. polkington think so . [I]60-mrs. polkington had quite a difficulty in persuading [her]101-violet ; but , as [I]60-mrs. polkington told [her]101-violet , it was not a chance [she]101-violet was likely to have again . So [she]101-violet is going , and [Violet]101-violet will have to spend [her]101-violet winter in [Bath]5-bath . [Julia]58-julia ? Oh , [Julia]58-julia was not asked in either case ; [she]58-julia will be staying at [home]249-home with [me]60-mrs. polkington . "[60-mrs. polkington] From all of which it is clear that part of [Julia]58-julia 's plan was to be adopted . The other part must have found favour , too , for soon it became known that [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons were without [a servant]413-a servant . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington made inquiries among [[her]60-mrs. polkington friends]414-her friends , but could not hear of any one suitable ; [she]60-mrs. polkington said it was very tiresome , especially as [they]414-her friends had taken advantage of [[the girl]415-the girl 's empty room]416-the girl 's empty room to invite [an old Anglo - Indian friend of [[her]60-mrs. polkington husband]230-her husband 's]417-an old anglo - indian friend of her husband 's to stay . Thus was the difficulty tided over , and with so good a face that [few in [Marbridge]61-denah]419-few in marbridge had any idea that it existed . Certainly [none]420-none knew of the pinching and screwing and retrenching which went on indoors at [No . 27]373-no . 27 . [One or two tradesmen]422-one or two tradesmen could have told of long accounts unpaid , and [some relations living at a distance]423-some relations living at a distance were troubled by appeals for help , a form of begging which , at this date of [their]414-her friends history did not hurt [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons ' sensibility much . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington suffered in body , if not in mind , during this hard time , though fortunately [she]60-mrs. polkington was able to be away a month . [The Captain]172-the captain suffered a good deal more , which was perhaps only just ; and [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny suffered with [him]57-johnny , which was not just , though that did not seem to occur to [him]57-johnny . As for [Julia]58-julia , [she]58-julia minded least of any one , though in some ways [she]58-julia had the most to put up with ; but the plan was [hers]58-julia , and consequently [she]58-julia was too interested in its success to trouble about the inevitable discomforts of the working out . There was one matter which did trouble [her]58-julia , however — the debt to [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew . [She]58-julia had no money , and no possibility of raising any ; yet it must and should be paid , for [[her]58-julia father]210-her father 's name could not otherwise be cleared . [She]58-julia turned over in [her]58-julia own mind how [she]58-julia could earn enough , but there was little hope of that ; it seemed rather a large sum for [a girl]201-a girl to earn , and any sum was impossible to [her]58-julia ; [she]58-julia had no gifts to take to market , no ability for any of the arts , not enough education for teaching , no training for commerce . The only field open to [her]58-julia was that of [a nursery - governess]427-a nursery - governess or [companion]428-companion ; neither was likely to enable [her]58-julia to pay this debt of honour quickly . Once , nearly a year ago , [she]58-julia had had a sort of half - offer of the post of [companion]428-companion . It was while [she]58-julia was staying with [a friend]430-a friend ; during the visit there had come to [the house]175-the house [an old Dutchman of the name of [Van Heigen]77-joost]432-an old dutchman of the name of van heigen , [a business acquaintance of [[her]58-julia host]434-her host]433-a business acquaintance of her host . [He]432-an old dutchman of the name of van heigen had stayed nearly a week , and in that time taken a great fancy to [her]58-julia . In those first bad days after [the Captain]59-captain polkington 's leaving [the army]435-the army , [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons had lived , or perhaps more accurately , drifted about , a good deal abroad . It was then that [Julia]58-julia picked up [her]58-julia only accomplishment , a working knowledge of several languages . [She]58-julia had also acquired one other thing , perhaps not an accomplishment , a rather unusual knowledge of [divers men]436-divers men and divers ways . It may have been that these qualities made [her]58-julia more attractive to [the old Dutchman]437-the old dutchman than [the purely English game - expert daughters of [the house]175-the house]438-the purely english game - expert daughters of the house . Or it may have been [her]58-julia admirable cooking ; [the cook]440-the cook was ill during the greater part of [her]58-julia visit , and [her]58-julia offer to help was gladly ac cepted and duly appreciated . Something , at all events , pleased [the old man]441-the old man , so that before [he]441-the old man left [he]441-the old man asked [her]58-julia , half in fun , if [she]58-julia would come and live with [[his]441-the old man wife]168-his wife . [This lady]443-this lady , it seemed , had bad health , and [no daughters]444-no daughters ; [she]443-this lady always had [a companion of some sort]445-a companion of some sort , and was never satisfied with the one [she]443-this lady had . In [Holland]7-holland , as in [England]8-england , it seemed posts were not easy to fill satisfactorily , for [those often in want of employment]446-those often in want of employment were also constitutionally inefficient . At the time [Julia]58-julia had laughingly refused the offer , now [she]58-julia recalled it , and thought seriously about it . It would not be very nice , a mixture of [upper servant]447-upper servant and [lady help]448-lady help ; [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens were [bulb growers]449-bulb growers , [old - fashioned people]450-old - fashioned people , [the lady]451-the lady [a thorough huisvrouw]452-a thorough huisvrouw , nothing more probably . Still that did not matter ; such things need not be considered if the end could be attained that way . But unfortunately it did not look very likely ; [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens would pay less to [a companion]453-a companion than [English people]454-english people would , not enough to buy clothes ; there was practically nothing to be made out of it . [Julia]58-julia was obliged to admit the fact to [herself]58-julia , and reluctantly to dismiss [the Dutchman]455-the dutchman and [his]455-the dutchman offer from [her]58-julia thoughts . But curiously enough , [they]456-they were brought to [her]58-julia mind again before long ; not later , indeed , than that evening , when [she]58-julia went to a dance at [[a neighbour]457-a neighbour 's house]458-a neighbour 's house . At this dance [she]58-julia met [a Mr. Alexander Cross]79-cross . [He]79-cross was not [a native of [Marbridge]61-denah]459-a native of marbridge , not at all like any of [them]460-them ; it is quite possible that [they]460-them would have rather looked down upon [him]79-cross ; [Julia]58-julia recognised that [he]79-cross barely came up to [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother 's standard of [a gentleman]3384-a gentleman . [He]79-cross seemed to be [a keen business man of the energetic new sort]463-a keen business man of the energetic new sort ; [he]79-cross also seemed to deal in most things , flowers among them . [He]79-cross told [Julia]58-julia something about that part of [his]79-cross business , for [he]79-cross and it interested [her]58-julia so much that [she]58-julia asked [him]79-cross lead ing questions . [He]79-cross explained how the beautiful orchid [he]79-cross wore in [his]79-cross coat had decreased in value lately . A few years ago , when there had been but one specimen with just that marking in all [the world]208-the world , the plant had sold for £ 900 ; now that it had been multiplied it was worth only £ 25 , nothing practically . " It was a novelty then , "[79-cross] [he]79-cross explained ; " some novelties are worth a great deal . There 's one [I]79-cross know of now [I]79-cross could do some good business with if [I]79-cross could get hold of it . But [I]79-cross ca n't ; [the old fool]3409-the old fool that 's got it wo n't sell [it]3410-it for any price , and [he]3409-the old fool ca n't half work it [himself]3409-the old fool . It 's a blue daffodil — Narcissus Triandrus Azureum [he]79-cross calls it ; or rather , to give [it]3410-it its full title , Narcissus Triandrus Azureum Vrouw Van Heigen ; so called , [I]79-cross believe , in honour of [[his]79-cross wife]168-his wife , or [[his]79-cross mother]3412-his mother . "[79-cross] [Julia]58-julia wondered if [the Van Heigen who owned the precious flower]77-joost was [the old Dutchman of [her]58-julia acquaintance]465-the old dutchman of her acquaintance . " Is [he]79-cross [a bulb grower]3413-a bulb grower ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked , though without giving any reason for [her]58-julia question . " Yes , "[58-julia] [Cross]79-cross answered , " [a Dutch bulb grower]3414-a dutch bulb grower ; that 's why [he]79-cross wo n't make the profit [he]79-cross might ; [he]79-cross comes of [generations of [growers]3416-growers]3415-generations of growers , and [they]3415-generations of growers venerate [their]3415-generations of growers bulbs . [He]79-cross has cranky notions of how things ought to be done , and no other way will do for [him]79-cross . "[79-cross] " How did [he]79-cross get a blue daffodil ? Do [you]79-cross think it is real ? It seems very unusual . "[58-julia] " It is unusual ; that 's where the value comes in ; but it 's real fast enough , though [I]58-julia do n't believe [he]79-cross grew the first , as [he]79-cross says , in [[his]79-cross own garden]3417-his own garden . It 's [my]58-julia opinion that [one of [[his]79-cross collectors]3419-his collectors]3418-one of his collectors sent [him]79-cross the first bulb ; [he]79-cross has collectors all over [the world]208-the world , [you]58-julia know , looking for new things . "[58-julia] " What is [he]79-cross going to do with it ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked . " [He]79-cross is multiplying it at present ; at first [he]79-cross had only one , now , of course , [he]79-cross has a few more ; when [he]79-cross has got enough [he]79-cross will hybridise . [You]58-julia do n't know what that is . Cross - breed with it ; use the blue with the old yellow daffodil as parents to new varieties . That 's ticklish work ; [growers]3416-growers ca n't afford to do it till [they]3416-growers have a fair number of the new sort ; but , of course , [they]3416-growers occasionally get something good that way . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia listened , much interested , though , to tell the truth , the money value of the thing fascinated [her]58-julia more than anything else . " Will [he]79-cross never sell any of [his]79-cross blue bulbs ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked . " Oh , yes , in time , "[58-julia] [Cross]79-cross answered ; " but not while they are worth anything much to [the growers]3422-the growers . "[79-cross] " What are [they]3423-they worth ? [I]58-julia mean , what would it be worth if there was only one ? "[58-julia] " [I]79-cross do n't know ; [I]79-cross dare say [I]79-cross could get £ 400 for the single bulb . "[79-cross] " But if there were more [they]3423-they would not be worth so much ? If there were five , what would [they]3423-they be worth ? "[79-cross] " Pretty well as much , very likely £ 300 for one bulb . [Van]77-joost [Heigen]77-joost would give a written guarantee with it not to sell another bulb to [another grower]3424-another grower . "[58-julia] " But [he]79-cross could keep [the others]312-the others [himself]79-cross ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked . " That would be eating [his]79-cross cake and having it too . Tell [me]58-julia , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , feeling [she]58-julia was imitating [the Patriarch]466-the patriarch when [he]466-the patriarch was pleading for [Sodom]80-sodom and [Gomorrah]81-gomorrah , " if there were ten bulbs , what could [you]79-cross get for one . "[79-cross] [Cross]79-cross was amused by [her]58-julia interest . " A hundred pounds , [I]79-cross dare say , "[79-cross] [he]79-cross said ; " but [I]79-cross shall never have the chance . The trade will never touch those blue daffodils while they are worth having . When [the old man]441-the old man does begin to sell them — when they are worth very little to [the growers]3422-the growers — [he]79-cross will sell to [collectors]3428-collectors , [cranky old connoisseurs]3429-cranky old connoisseurs , from choice . " For a consideration , of course , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . " Something would naturally stick to [my]58-julia fingers , "[58-julia] [Cross]79-cross answered , amused rather than offended . [He]79-cross was a good deal amused by [[his]79-cross partner]467-his partner , finding [her]467-his partner more interesting than most of [the girls [he]79-cross met]468-the girls he met that evening ; afterwards [he]79-cross forgot [her]467-his partner , for two days later [he]79-cross left [the place]241-the place , and thought no more either about [Miss Polkington]58-julia or the talk [he]79-cross had had with [her]467-his partner . Shortly afterwards , as soon as the dictionary came , [she]467-his partner set to reading the edifying work , and found it easier than [she]467-his partner expected . What [one]3325-one learns from necessity in childhood stays in the memory , and a good knowledge of German and [a smallish one of [Dutch]83-dutch]473-a smallish one of dutch will carry one through greater difficulties than [Gil Blas]82-gil blas . Before [[her]467-his partner mother]195-her mother and [sisters]475-sisters came back to [Marbridge]61-denah , [Julia]58-julia had written to [the old Dutchman]437-the old dutchman . When [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington heard [Julia]58-julia wanted to go to [Holland]7-holland and live in [a Dutch family]477-a dutch family [she]60-mrs. polkington was surprised . This news was not given to [her]58-julia till the spring had fairly set in , for it was not till then that [Julia]58-julia had been able to get everything arranged . It is no use telling [people]3334-people [your]479-you plans unless [you]479-you are quite sure of carrying them out , and [you]479-you are never sure of that long before starting ; at least , that was [Julia]58-julia 's opinion . It was also [her]58-julia opinion that it was quite unnecessary to tell all details . [She]58-julia said [she]58-julia was tired of being at [Marbridge]61-denah , and wanted a complete change ; also that when there were [three grown - up sisters]480-three grown - up sisters at [home]249-home it seemed rather desirable that [one]3325-one should go away , for a time at least . When [Violet]101-violet suggested that it was odd to have chosen [Holland]7-holland in preference to [France]6-france or [Germany]10-germany , [she]101-violet replied truthfully that the one was possible to [her]101-violet , [the others]312-the others were not . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington , who quite approved of the plan , saw no objection to [Holland]7-holland , adding as a recommendation , " It is so much more original to go [there]180-there . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia did not fail to remark on the originality when [she]58-julia embroidered [Julia]58-julia 's going to [[her]58-julia friends]414-her friends and [acquaintances]485-acquaintances . [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington was [the only member of [the family who regretted this going]487-the family who regretted this going]486-the only member of the family who regretted this going . [He]59-captain polkington had always regarded [Julia]58-julia as something between [an ally and a tolerant go - between]488-an ally and a tolerant go - between ; and since [she]58-julia had wrung from [him]59-captain polkington the confession of [his]59-captain polkington difficulties , and helped in the arrangement of [them]489-them , [his]59-captain polkington feeling for [her]58-julia had leaned more and more towards [the former]490-the former . [He]59-captain polkington had even come to feel a certain protectiveness in [her]58-julia presence , which made [him]59-captain polkington really sorry [she]58-julia was going . [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny was sorrier still . [Johnny]57-johnny had gone back to [dismal lodgings in [town]238-town]491-dismal lodgings in town now ; [he]57-johnny only heard of the plan by letter , and [the Captain]172-the captain 's letters were very prolix , and not informing . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's own letters were even worse , for if they lacked the prolixity , they lacked the little information also . On receipt of [the Captain]172-the captain 's information [he]59-captain polkington merely wrote to ask when [Julia]58-julia was going , and what time [she]58-julia would be in [London]9-london , as [he]59-captain polkington would like to give [himself]59-captain polkington the pleasure of meeting [[her]58-julia train]495-her train . [He]59-captain polkington did give [himself]59-captain polkington that pleasure ; [he]59-captain polkington was at [the station]496-the station half an hour and ten minutes before [the train]497-the train , so as to be sure of being in time . [He]59-captain polkington was on [the platform]498-the platform when [the train]497-the train came in ; [Julia]58-julia saw [him]59-captain polkington , [a rather ridiculous figure]500-a rather ridiculous figure , [his]59-captain polkington shabby coat tremendously brushed and tightly buttoned , a gay tie displayed to the uttermost to hide a ragged shirt front , [his]59-captain polkington round , pink face , with its little grizzled moustache , wearing a look of melancholy which made it appear more than ordinarily foolish . [He]59-captain polkington was standing where the part of [the train]497-the train which came from [Marbridge]61-denah could not possibly stop , much in the way of [porters]502-porters and [trucks]503-trucks ; [Julia]58-julia had to find [him]59-captain polkington and find [her]58-julia luggage too , but [he]59-captain polkington seemed to think [he]59-captain polkington was of much service . [Julia]58-julia 's hard young heart smote [her]58-julia when [he]59-captain polkington gave twopence to [[her]58-julia porter]504-her porter . " [Johnny]57-johnny , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , as [he]59-captain polkington took [her]58-julia ticket on [the District Railway]505-the district railway , " [I]58-julia am going to pay for [my]58-julia ticket . "[58-julia] It was only threepence , but there are [people who have to consider the threepences]506-people who have to consider the threepences ; if [Julia]58-julia was one , [she]58-julia knew that [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat was another , and [she]58-julia had allowed for this threepence , and [he]59-captain polkington probably had not . [He]59-captain polkington demurred , but [she]58-julia insisted . " Then [I]58-julia wo n't let [you]59-captain polkington come with [me]58-julia ; "[58-julia] and [he]59-captain polkington gave way . " Oh , no , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " [mother]3346-mother and [the girls]3439-the girls think it is a good thing [I]58-julia am going . "[57-johnny] " Yes ; [I]58-julia 'll miss [you]58-julia very much — [we]507-we both shall ; [we]507-we shall sit down - stairs , each side of [the fire - place]224-the fire - place , and think how [you]58-julia used to come [there]180-there sometimes . But perhaps [you]58-julia 'll be back before winter comes round again ? "[58-julia] " [I]58-julia do n't know when [I]58-julia shall be back , "[58-julia] was all [Julia]58-julia could find to say . The idea of being missed like this was new and strange to [her]58-julia ; [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons ' feelings were so much guided by what was advisable , or expedient , that there was not usually much room for simple emotions . [She]58-julia felt somehow grateful to [Johnny]57-johnny for caring a little that [she]58-julia was going , though at the same time [she]58-julia was unpleasantly convinced that [she]58-julia did not deserve it . " It wo n't be at all the same at No . 27 , "[66-mr. gillat] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat was saying . " [[Your]58-julia mother]3323-your mother — [she]3323-your mother 's [a wonderful woman]3322-a wonderful woman , [a wonderful woman]3322-a wonderful woman , and [Miss Violet]101-violet 's [a fine girl]3452-a fine girl , so 's the other , [handsome both of [them]3453-handsome both of them]3453-handsome both of them ; but [they]3453-handsome both of them 're in [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room , [you]58-julia know , and [you]58-julia — [you]58-julia used to come down - [stairs]300-stairs . "[66-mr. gillat] It did not sound very explicit , but [Julia]58-julia understood what [he]66-mr. gillat meant . Just then [the train]497-the train stopped at [a station]511-a station , and [other passengers]512-other passengers got in , so [they]513-they had little more talk . In time [they]513-they reached [Mark Lane]11-mark lane , from whence it is no great walk to [the Tower Stairs]12-the tower stairs . There is a cheap way of going to [Holland]7-holland from there for [those who do not mind spending twenty - four hours on the journey]514-those who do not mind spending twenty - four hours on the journey ; [Julia]58-julia did not mind . When [she]58-julia and [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny arrived at [the Tower Stairs]515-the tower stairs [they]513-they saw [the steamer]516-the steamer lying in [the river]517-the river , [a small Dutch boat]518-a small dutch boat , still taking in cargo from [loaded lighters alongside]519-loaded lighters alongside . [A waterman]520-a waterman put [them]513-they on board , or , rather , took [them]513-they to the nearest waiting lighter , from whence [they]513-they scrambled on board , [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat very unhandily . [A Dutch steward]521-a dutch steward received [them]513-they , and taking [Johnny]57-johnny for [a father]522-a father come to see [[his]522-a father daughter]298-his daughter off , assured [them]513-they in bad English that [she]298-his daughter would be quite safe , and well taken care of . " [She]298-his daughter shall haf [one cabin to [herself]298-his daughter]3456-one cabin to herself , a bed clean . Yes , yes ; there is [no passenger]3457-no passenger but one , [a Holland gentleman]3458-a holland gentleman ; [he]3458-a holland gentleman will not speak with [the miss]3459-the miss , [he]3458-a holland gentleman is [friend of [captain]3461-captain]3460-friend of captain . "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny nodded a great many times , though [he]57-johnny did not quite follow what was said . Then [Julia]58-julia told [him]57-johnny [he]57-johnny had better go , and not keep [the waterman]524-the waterman any longer . [He]57-johnny agreed , and began fumbling in [his]57-johnny pocket , from whence [he]57-johnny pulled out one of [his]57-johnny badly - tied parcels . " A keepsake , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said , putting it into [her]58-julia hand ; then , without waiting to say good - bye , [he]57-johnny scrambled over the side in such a hurry that [he]57-johnny as nearly as possible fell into [the river]517-the river . [Julia]58-julia ran to the side in some anxiety ; [some one]3318-some one shouted , " Look out , "[3318-some one] and [some one else]527-some one else , " Hold up , "[3318-some one] and a third something less complimentary . Then [a man]406-a man laid hold of [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's legs and guided [him]57-johnny safely on to the bobbing lighter . There [he]57-johnny turned and waved [his]57-johnny hat to [Julia]58-julia before [he]57-johnny got into [the waiting boat]529-the waiting boat . " Good - bye , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny called . " Good - bye , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered . " Oh , do be careful ! "[58-julia] [He]57-johnny was not careful , but [the waterman]524-the waterman had [him]57-johnny now , and took [him]57-johnny ashore . [She]58-julia watched [him]57-johnny , [his]57-johnny round face was suffused with smiles ; [he]57-johnny waved [his]57-johnny hat once more just as [he]57-johnny reached the stairs . [He]57-johnny slipped once getting up them , but [he]57-johnny was up now , and turned to wave once before [he]57-johnny started down [the street]366-the street . It was not till then that [Julia]58-julia became aware of a small sound close at hand ; there was a good deal of noise going on , shouting , the rattling of cranes , and the thud of shifting bales , with now and then the hoot of [a steamer]532-a steamer and the escape of steam , and under all , the restless lapping of the water . But through it all [she]58-julia now heard a much smaller sound quite close , a regular tick , tick . [She]58-julia glanced at the parcel [she]58-julia had forgotten , then in an instant , as a sudden idea occurred to [her]58-julia , [she]58-julia had the paper off . Yes , it was . It was [Johnny]57-johnny 's great old - fashioned gold watch , with the fetter chain dangling at the end . [She]58-julia stood quite still with the thing in [her]58-julia hand , [her]58-julia mouth set straight , and [her]58-julia eyes growing glitteringly bright . The round gilded face stared up at [her]58-julia , reminding [her]58-julia in some grotesque way of [Johnny]57-johnny ; [poor , generous , honest , foolish old Johnny]533-poor , generous , honest , foolish old johnny ! [She]58-julia looked away quickly , a sudden desire not to go with [this moon - faced companion]534-this moon - faced companion took possession of [her]58-julia — a desire not to go at all , a horrible new - born doubt about it . But feelings for abstract right and wrong , like personal likes and dislikes , do not grow strongly where ex pediency and advisability and advantage have to rule ; [she]58-julia was only going to do what [she]58-julia must in [Holland]7-holland ; the debt must be paid , honour demanded no less ; the blue daffodil was the only hope of paying it . [She]58-julia was not going to steal a bulb exactly ; [she]58-julia was going to get it somehow , as a gift , perhaps , opportunity must show how ; and when it was [hers]58-julia , [she]58-julia could do with it as [she]58-julia pleased , there was no wrong in that . [She]58-julia must go ; [she]58-julia must do it ; the thing was so necessary as to be unavoidable , and not open to question . [She]58-julia looked down , and [her]58-julia eye fell on the watch again ; it stared up at [her]58-julia in the same vacant way as [Johnny]57-johnny had done that day when [he]57-johnny wanted to sell it and [his]57-johnny other things to help [them]535-them out of [their]535-them justly earned , sordid difficulties . With shame [she]58-julia had prevented that , feeling the cause unworthy of the sacrifice . But this sacrifice , for a still more unworthy cause , [she]58-julia was too late to prevent . [Johnny]57-johnny had gone . [She]58-julia looked earnestly to see if [he]57-johnny was among [those who loitered about the stairs]536-those who loitered about the stairs , or those in [the more distant street]537-the more distant street . But [she]58-julia could not see [him]57-johnny , [he]57-johnny was gone clean from sight ; there was only the busy , unfamiliar life of [the river around]538-the river around ; yellow , sunlit water ; [the crowded craft]539-the crowded craft , and the great stately wonder of [the Tower Bridge]540-the tower bridge silently raising and parting [its]540-the tower bridge solid roadway to let [some boat]541-some boat go , as [she]58-julia would soon go down to [the sea]542-the sea .

[Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder , [[the notary]543-the notary 's wife]544-the notary 's wife , sat by [her]84-vrouw snieder window at work on a long strip of red crochet lace . From [[her]84-vrouw snieder place]545-her place [she]84-vrouw snieder could see [all who came up [the street]366-the street]546-all who came up the street , and , there being a piece of looking - glass set outside , at right angles to the pane , also [most who came down it]548-most who came down it . This , though doubtless very informing , did not help the progress of the lace ; but that was of no consequence , [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw always had some red lace in making , and it might as well be one piece as another . With [her]84-vrouw snieder , were [[her]84-vrouw snieder two daughters]549-her two daughters , [Denah]61-denah and [Anna]61-denah , though [Anna]61-denah had no business [there]180-there , being supposed just then to be preparing vegetables for dinner . [She]84-vrouw snieder had only come into [the room]205-the room to fetch keys , but a remark from [[her]84-vrouw snieder mother]195-her mother brought [her]84-vrouw snieder to the window . " There goes [[Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen 's English miss]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss , "[553-the old lady] [the old lady]553-the old lady said , and [both]289-both [[her]84-vrouw snieder daughters]311-her daughters looked at once . " [She]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss has been marketing , [I]553-the old lady see ; [she]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss seems [a good housewife]3463-a good housewife . "[553-the old lady] " [She]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss walks in [the road]3464-the road , "[61-denah] [Denah]61-denah observed critically ; " It is so conspicuous , [I]61-denah could not do it ; besides , [one]3325-one might be run over . "[61-denah] " [The English]87-the english always walk in [the road]3464-the road , "[556-her sister] [[her]61-denah sister]556-her sister answered ; " [they]87-the english think everything will get out of [their]87-the english way , and [they]87-the english do not at all mind being conspicuous . "[556-her sister] " [The English miss]3467-the english miss should mind , "[61-denah] [Denah]61-denah said , " for [she]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss is not pretty ; [no one]181-no one looks at [her]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss to admire ; besides [she]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss is poor and has to work hard . "[61-denah] " Yes , yes , "[195-her mother] [[her]61-denah mother]195-her mother agreed placidly ; " [she]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss is [a fine worker]3469-a fine worker . [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen is full of [her]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss praises ; [such a cook]3470-such a cook — [she]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss has twenty new dishes , and everything is done quickly , [one]3325-one can not tell how ; it is like having a magician in [the house]175-the house , so [she]3462-vrouw van heigen 's english miss says . Ah , there is [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's [Marthe]89-marthe going into [the apothecary 's]3473-the apothecary 's . [I]195-her mother wonder now — "[195-her mother] But [[her]195-her mother daughters]311-her daughters were not interested in [Marthe]89-marthe ; [the English girl]559-the english girl at the [Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ' interested [them]311-her daughters a great deal more . [They]311-her daughters continued to talk about [her]559-the english girl a great deal afterwards , [Denah]61-denah going back with [[her]61-denah sister]556-her sister to [the kitchen]220-the kitchen and the vegetables , so as to be able to do so undisturbed . " [I]195-her mother will help [you]311-her daughters with these , "[195-her mother] [she]195-her mother said ; " then [we]311-her daughters can go out . "[195-her mother] [She]195-her mother sat down and took up a knife . " It is strange how much [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen thinks of [that girl]3474-that girl , "[195-her mother] [she]195-her mother said . " [She]3474-that girl has been there but one month and already there is [no one]181-no one like [her]3474-that girl . [She]3474-that girl does not keep [her]3474-that girl in [[her]3474-that girl place]545-her place very well ; were [she]3474-that girl [a daughter]3477-a daughter more could not be said . [I]195-her mother wonder how [Mijnheer]90-joost likes it . "[195-her mother] " It was [Mijnheer]90-joost who engaged [her]3474-that girl , "[61-denah] [Anna]61-denah said . " It is not likely that [he]90-joost regrets . [I]61-denah hear that [she]3474-that girl has written some English letters for [him]90-joost since [one of [the clerks]3479-the clerks]3478-one of the clerks has been ill . [[My]61-denah father]3392-my father says [she]3474-that girl can cook like [a Frenchwoman]3481-a frenchwoman , and that is something . As for [Joost]90-joost , it is surely of little importance to [him]90-joost , [he]90-joost is too quiet to say anything to [her]3474-that girl ; [she]3474-that girl talks little ; [she]3474-that girl must be shy . "[61-denah] [Denah]61-denah had nothing to say to this , although , seeing in which person [her]61-denah own interest in [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens lay , [she]61-denah possibly found some comfort in the assurance . After a little [she]61-denah remarked , " [That girl]3474-that girl has no accomplishments ; [she]3474-that girl is as old - fashioned as [[our]3483-us Aunt]3484-our aunt [Barje]91-barje , [a huisvrouw]3485-a huisvrouw , no more . It is strange , for [the English women]3486-the english women make fun of [us]3483-us for this , and pretend that [they]3486-the english women are educated and advanced above [us]3483-us ; [she]3474-that girl is not , [she]3474-that girl can do nothing but speak a few languages ; [she]3474-that girl can not sing nor play , [she]3474-that girl has read no science , [she]3474-that girl can not draw , nor model in wax , nor make paper flowers , nor do bead work ; [she]3474-that girl could not even crochet till [I]61-denah showed [her]3474-that girl how . [I]61-denah wonder if [she]3474-that girl has made any progress with the pattern [I]61-denah gave [her]3474-that girl . Shall [we]3483-us go and see by and by ? [I]61-denah might set [her]3474-that girl right if [she]3474-that girl is in a difficulty , and [we]3483-us could at the same time inquire after [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw 's throat ; [she]3474-that girl had a weakness , [I]61-denah noticed , on Tuesday . "[61-denah] [Anna]61-denah agreed ; [she]61-denah was [a most obliging sister]562-a most obliging sister , and a while later [they]563-they set out together for [the [Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ' house]564-the van heigens ' house . [They]563-they did not walk in [the wide , clean road]565-the wide , clean road , but were careful to keep to [the path]566-the path , pausing a moment to consult before starting for the other side when it was necessary to cross over . [[The Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ' house]564-the van heigens ' house stood on [the outskirts of [the town]569-the town]568-the outskirts of the town , a long way back from [the road]3464-the road . [The bulb garden]571-the bulb garden lay all round [it]564-the van heigens ' house , though immediately in front was a lawn so soft and green that [no one]181-no one ever walked on [it]564-the van heigens ' house . [The house]175-the house was of wood , painted white , and had a high - pitched roof of strange , dark - coloured tiles ; [a canal]574-a canal lay on two sides , which ought to have made [it]574-a canal damp , but did not . [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen was pleased to see [the girls]3439-the girls , and received [them]3439-the girls with an effusiveness which might have suggested that a longer time than four days had elapsed since [they]563-they last met . [She]86-vrouw van heigen kissed [them]3439-the girls on both cheeks , and led [them]3439-the girls in by the hand ; [she]86-vrouw van heigen asked particularly how [they]3439-the girls were , and how [[their]3439-the girls mother]576-their mother was , and how [[their]3439-the girls father]577-their father was , and if [they]3439-the girls were not very tired with [their]3439-the girls walk , and would [they]3439-the girls not have lemonade — yes , [they]3439-the girls must have lemonade . " [Julia]58-julia , [Julia]58-julia , "[86-vrouw van heigen] [she]86-vrouw van heigen called , " bring lemonade , bring glasses and the lemonade . "[86-vrouw van heigen] [Julia]58-julia came from [a little room which led off [the sitting - room]579-the sitting - room]578-a little room which led off the sitting - room , carrying the things required on a papier - maché tray . [She]58-julia wore a large , blue - print apron , for [she]58-julia had been shelling shrimps when [she]58-julia was called , and though [she]58-julia stayed to wash [her]58-julia hands , [she]58-julia did not think it necessary to remove [her]58-julia apron . [She]58-julia had observed it to be the custom hereabouts to wear an apron of some sort all day long , and [she]58-julia did not differentiate between the grades of aprons as [Denah]61-denah and [Anna]61-denah did . [She]58-julia set down the tray and shook hands ceremoniously with [the sisters]189-the sisters and made all the proper inquiries in the properest way ; [she]58-julia had also observed that to be the custom of [the place]241-the place . Then [she]58-julia poured out the lemonade and handed it round , and was afterwards sent to fetch a glass for [herself]58-julia and a little round tray to set it on — [every one]582-every one had a little tray for fear of spoiling the crimson plush table - cover . [Julia]58-julia can not be said to have been anxious for lemonade ; [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen 's growing affection for [her]58-julia often found expression in drinks at odd times , a good deal more often than [she]58-julia appreciated . On this occasion , since [she]58-julia was doing the pouring out [herself]58-julia , [she]58-julia was able to get off with half a glass . [They]583-they all sat round the table and talked ; [Julia]58-julia talked a great deal the least , but that did not matter , [the others]312-the others had so much to say . [She]58-julia listened , admiring the way in which one little incident — a dog running on the tram line and being called off just in time by [its owner]585-its owner — served [them]583-they for a quarter of an hour . What economy of ideas it was , and how little strain to make conversation ! Then came [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw 's throat , the little hoarseness [Denah]61-denah had noticed on Tuesday . It was nothing , [the good lady]586-the good lady declared , [she]586-the good lady had not felt it . Oh , if [they]583-they insisted on noticing it , [she]58-julia would own to a weakness but no more than was usual to [her]58-julia when the dust was about , and truly the dust was terrible now , [she]58-julia could not remember when it had been so bad so early in June . And so on , and so on , until [they]583-they somehow came round to crochet lace , when [Julia]58-julia was obliged to confess that [she]58-julia had not made much progress with the pattern . [She]58-julia exhibited a very small piece with several mistakes in it . " Why , "[61-denah] cried [Denah]61-denah , " [I]58-julia have done already almost half a metre of the piece [I]58-julia began at the same time . Is it difficult for [you]58-julia ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said it was , and [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen added by way of apology for [her]58-julia , that [she]58-julia had been busy making a cool morning dress . " For [yourself]58-julia ? "[61-denah] [Anna]61-denah asked . " Do [you]58-julia make [your]58-julia dresses ? "[61-denah] " This is for [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ; " but [I]58-julia can make [my]58-julia own . "[58-julia] [The Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons had had to , and also to put an immense amount of thought and work into it , because [they]56-the polkingtons were bound to get a fine effect for a small expense , and that is not possible without a large outlay of time and consideration . [Julia]58-julia did not explain this to [the present company]587-the present company , it would have been rather incomprehensible to [them]587-the present company . [Anna]61-denah was at once fired with a desire to make [herself]61-denah a cool morning dress , and asked a dozen questions as to how , while [Denah]61-denah 's busy fingers undid the faulty crochet work , and [her]61-denah tongue explained the mistakes . [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw did not listen much to either , but noticing the glasses were empty , pressed [the visitors]588-the visitors in vain to have more lemonade . [They]588-the visitors refused , and finding [them]588-the visitors quite obdurate [she]61-denah toddled into [the little room where [Julia]58-julia had been doing the shrimps]589-the little room where julia had been doing the shrimps , to come back again , bearing a large bladder - covered bottle of peach - brandy . [The girls]3439-the girls declined this very firmly , but [Julia]58-julia was sent for more glasses , and soon [they]3439-the girls were all sipping the rich flavoured liqueur without protestation . It was over this that [they]3439-the girls planned an expedition to [the wood]591-the wood . [No one]181-no one knew quite who suggested it ; when [people]3334-people all talk at once it is not easy to say who originates an idea ; anyhow , it was agreed that the weather was so dry and the trees so lovely and [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw so seldom went out . [She]61-denah really felt — did [she]61-denah not?—that [she]61-denah would enjoy making a small excursion , [she]61-denah was so wonderfully well — for [her]61-denah . What did [Anna]61-denah think [[her]61-denah mother]195-her mother would say ? Perhaps [they]3439-the girls might join together for a drive ? [Anna]61-denah thought [[her]61-denah mother]195-her mother would be delighted ; indeed , [she]195-her mother often spoke of the charms of a country excursion ; [Denah]61-denah was called upon to corroborate , and did so volubly . Where should [they]3439-the girls go ? [Half - a - dozen different places]596-half - a - dozen different places were suggested ; why not go here , or there , or to [the wood]591-the wood ? Yes , [the wood]591-the wood , that would be lovely . [They]3439-the girls could take [their]3439-the girls tea out ; if [they]3439-the girls were well wrapped up , of course , protected from the damp and the wind , might it not be possible ? So by degrees the plan was brought to the first stage .
