[Denah]61-denah and [Anna]61-denah were to talk it over with [[their]3439-the girls mother]576-their mother , and if [she]576-their mother thought favourably of it , then " [we]3439-the girls must see . "[576-their mother] By that time [Denah]61-denah had set the crochet work quite straight , and with kisses and hand - shakings [the visitors]588-the visitors departed . [Julia]58-julia went back to [the little room]324-the little room where first [she]58-julia washed the glasses that had been used , afterwards [she]58-julia finished the shrimps and washed them and put them ready for supper in a china dish like a large soap dish on three feet . When that was done , it was necessary to lay the table for dinner and superintend the getting of that meal . [The Van Heigens]78-the van heigens dined at four . It had taken [Julia]58-julia all the month [she]58-julia had been with [them]78-the van heigens to in any way get used to that time . [Mijnheer]90-joost and [the only son]602-the only son , [Joost]90-joost , came in from [the office]603-the office for two hours then . [The office]603-the office joined [the house]175-the house and [the great dim orderly bulb barns]606-the great dim orderly bulb barns joined [the office]603-the office , so [the father]608-the father and [son]609-son had not far to come in whichever place [they]78-the van heigens might be . [Julia]58-julia and [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw fetched the food from [the kitchen]220-the kitchen and cleared the table , as well as getting [their]78-the van heigens own meal ; but that was nothing when [you]611-you were used to it , any more than was the curious butter and nutmeg sauce that always seemed to play a part at dinner . [Mijnheer]90-joost had a good deal to say to [Julia]58-julia , principally about [his]90-joost business . The letters [she]58-julia had written for [him]90-joost during the illness of [the clerk who usually did [his]90-joost English correspondence]612-the clerk who usually did his english correspondence , had given [her]58-julia some little insight into it . This [she]58-julia had profited by , being in the first instance really interested , and , in the second , not slow to see that [the old man , far from resenting it]613-the old man , far from resenting it , had been pleased . [He]90-joost talked a good deal about [his]90-joost affairs now , giving [her]58-julia little bits of information and explaining rather proudly [his]90-joost method of doing business , and [[his]90-joost father]614-his father 's and [[his]90-joost grandfather]615-his grandfather 's before [him]90-joost . [Joost]90-joost , as usual , said little or nothing ; [he]90-joost must have been five or six and twenty , but [he]90-joost had hardly ever left the parental roof , and was usually so hard at work that [he]90-joost had little time or inclination for frivolity . [He]90-joost had earnest child - like blue eyes that [Julia]58-julia did not care to look at , any more than [she]58-julia did the round yellow face of [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's watch . This was rather a pity as [she]58-julia could not always avoid it , and certainly [he]90-joost looked at [her]58-julia a good deal , in fact whenever [he]90-joost thought [he]90-joost was not observed . Of course [he]90-joost always was observed , by [her]58-julia at least ; that was a foregone conclusion ; the observation gave [her]58-julia some uneasiness . After dinner [the father]608-the father and [son]609-son went to sit on [the veranda]618-the veranda , and [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw helped [Julia]58-julia take the dishes into [the white marble kitchen]619-the white marble kitchen and the glasses into [the little off - room]620-the little off - room . Later , [Julia]58-julia came to sit on [the veranda]618-the veranda , too — [it]618-the veranda was somewhat stuffy being all closed in with glass windows . There [they]622-they drank pale tea , the pot kept simmering on a spirit - stove , and read the foreign papers which had just come . [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw did not read , [she]58-julia made tea and did crochet work , a strip like [Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder 's , only yellow instead of red . [Julia]58-julia , it is to be feared , did not try to master the pattern so kindly set right by [Denah]61-denah ; [she]58-julia could not resist the breath from the outside world which the papers brought . At six o'clock [Mijnheer]90-joost and [[his]90-joost son]623-his son went back to [the office]603-the office , and [Julia]58-julia , having washed the tea - cups , joined [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw in [the sitting - room]579-the sitting - room . It was never very light in [that room]626-that room , for the walls were covered with a crimson flock paper and the woodwork was black ; while the windows , which looked on [the canal]627-the canal , were always shaded till dark . [They]622-they sat [here]371-here at work on the morning gown , till supper time . [Mijnheer]90-joost sometimes came in an hour before supper , as early as half - past eight ; [Joost]90-joost had usually too much to do to come in before half - past nine . After supper , when the things were cleared away , [they]622-they had prayers ; [Mijnheer]90-joost read a chapter from the Bible , and [they]622-they sat round the table and listened , and afterwards [he]90-joost said , " Now [we]622-they will pray , "[90-joost] and [they]622-they sat a while in silence . [Julia]58-julia sat , too , [her]58-julia keen , observing eyes cast down and a curious stillness about [her]58-julia . After that [every one]582-every one went to bed ; [Julia]58-julia and [the maidservant]630-the maidservant had [two little rooms right up in the eaves of [the house]175-the house]631-two little rooms right up in the eaves of the house ; [the family]193-the family slept on the floor below . [Julia]58-julia was glad of this , though it was possible to imagine [[her]58-julia room]400-her room would be very hot in summer and very cold in winter . But [she]58-julia was glad to be well above [the sleeping house]635-the sleeping house , and to be able to look from [her]58-julia window across [the wide country]636-the wide country , over [the dark bulb gardens]637-the dark bulb gardens — laid out like a Chinese puzzle with [their]637-the dark bulb gardens eight - foot hedges — to the lights of [the town]569-the town on the one hand , and , better still , to the dim curve of [the Dunes]13-the dunes on the other . It is to be feared [she]58-julia sometimes spent a longer time at [her]58-julia window than was wise , seeing the early hour at which [she]58-julia had to rise ; but [no one]181-no one was troubled by it , for [she]58-julia was careful to take off [her]58-julia shoes first thing ; [the rooms]640-the rooms were unceiled , and it was necessary to tread lightly if [one]3325-one would not disturb [people below]642-people below . On the day after that of [Anna]61-denah and [Denah]61-denah 's visit , [Herr Van Heigen]92-herr van heigen offered to show [Julia]58-julia [the bulb barns]643-the bulb barns . It was a Saturday , and so after dinner , [the workmen]644-the workmen having all gone [home]249-home , there was [no one]181-no one about and [she]58-julia could ascend the steep barn ladders without any suffering in [her]58-julia modesty . At least that was what [Mijnheer]90-joost thought ; [Julia]58-julia , [her]58-julia modesty being of a very serviceable order , may have given the matter less consideration , but [she]58-julia accepted the offer . [The barns]647-the barns were very large and high , many of [them]647-the barns three storeys and [each storey lofty]648-each storey lofty . The light inside was dim , a sort of dun colour , and the air very dry and full of a strange , not unpleasant smell . Everything was as clean as clean could be ; no litter , no dirt , the floor nicely swept , the shelves that ran all round and rose , tier upon tier , in an enormous stand that occupied the whole centre of [the place]241-the place , all perfectly orderly . On the shelves the bulbs lay , every one smooth and clean and dry , sorted according to kind and quality ; [Mijnheer]90-joost knew them all ; [he]90-joost could , like [a book - lover with [his]90-joost books]650-a book - lover with his books , put [his]90-joost hand upon any that [he]90-joost wished in the dark . It seemed to [Julia]58-julia that there were hundreds upon hundreds of different sorts . Not only hyacinths and tulips and such well - known ones in endless sizes and varieties , but little roots with six and seven syllable names [she]58-julia had never heard before , and big roots , too , and strange cornery roots , a never - ending quantity . [Mijnheer]90-joost told [her]58-julia they were not yet all in ; many were in the ground and had still to be lifted . This [she]58-julia knew , for [she]58-julia had seen the dead tops of some in the little enclosed squares where they grew ; from [her]58-julia bedroom window , too , [she]58-julia saw others still in bloom — a patch , the size of a tennis - lawn squared , of scarlet ranunculous , little blood - red rosettes , sheltered by a high close - clipped hedge . And another patch of iris hispanica , fairy flowers of palest gold and lavender , quivering at the top of their grey - green stalks like tropical dragon - flies hovering over a field of growing oats . These it seemed , and many others , would be brought in by and by , then [the great barns]651-the great barns would be really full . [Mijnheer]90-joost took up a root here and there , telling [her]58-julia something of the history of each ; explaining how the narcissus increased and the tulips grew ; showing [her]58-julia hyacinth bulbs cut in half - breadthways with all the separate severed layers distended by reason of the growing and swelling of the seeds between . " Each little seed will be a bulb by and by , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said , " but not yet . When [we]3487-we cut the root first , [we]3487-we set it in the ground and these begin to grow and become in time as [you]58-julia see them now . Afterwards [they]651-the great barns grow bigger and bigger till [[their]651-the great barns parent]3488-their parent can no longer contain them . "[90-joost] " Does it take long for [them]651-the great barns to grow full size ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked . " It takes five years to grow the finest hyacinth bulbs , "[90-joost] [Mijnheer]90-joost answered , " but inferior ones are more quick . And when the bulb is grown , there is one bloom — fine , magnificent , a truss of flowers — after that it deteriorates , it is , [one]3325-one may say , over . Ah , but it is magnificent while it is there ! There is no flower like the hyacinth ; had [I]90-joost [my]90-joost way , [I]90-joost would grow nothing else , but [people]3334-people will not have them now . [They]3334-people must have novelties . ' Give [us]3487-we narcissus , ' [they]3334-people say ; ' [they]3334-people are so graceful'—I do not see the grace—'Or iris'—well , some are fine , [I]90-joost allow , but they do not last in bloom as do hyacinths . The mourn iris of [Persia]14-persia is very beautiful ; [we]3487-we have not one flowering yet , but [we]3487-we shall have by and by . [I]90-joost will show [you]58-julia then ; [you]58-julia will think it very handsome . When it blooms [I]90-joost go to it in the morning and dust the sand from the petals . [I]90-joost feel that [I]90-joost can reverence that flower ; it is most beautiful . "[90-joost] " Is it very scarce ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked . " Somewhat , "[58-julia] [Mijnheer]90-joost answered ; " but [we]3487-we have things that are more so , [we]3487-we have many novelties so called . Ah , but [we]3487-we have one novelty that is a true one , it is a wonder , it has no price , it is priceless ! "[90-joost] [He]90-joost drew a deep breath of almost awed pride . " It is the greatest rarity that has ever been reared in [Holland]7-holland , a miracle , in fact — a blue daffodil ! "[90-joost] [Julia]58-julia refrained from mentioning that [she]58-julia had heard of the rarity before ; [she]58-julia leaned against the centre stand and listened while [the old man]441-the old man grew eloquent , with the eloquence of [the connoisseur]653-the connoisseur , not [the tradesman]654-the tradesman , over [his]441-the old man treasure . There was no need for [her]58-julia to say much , only to put a question here and there , or make a sympathetic comment ; with little or no effort [she]58-julia learned a good deal about the wonderful bulb . It seemed that it really had been grown in [the [Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ' gardens]655-the van heigens ' gardens , and not imported from [Asia]15-asia , as [Mr. Cross]79-cross thought . There were six roots by this time ; not so many as had been hoped and expected , it did not increase well , and was evidently going to be difficult to grow . " Would [you]58-julia like to know the name which it will immortalise ? "[441-the old man] [the old man]441-the old man asked at last . " It is called [Narcissus Triandrus Azurem Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen . "[441-the old man] " [You]58-julia named it in honour of [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , [I]58-julia suppose ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said . " [I]58-julia did not ; [Joost]90-joost did . "[58-julia] " [Mijnheer Joost]90-joost ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia repeated . " Yes , "[608-the father] [the father]608-the father answered . " It is [his]90-joost , [not]3491-not [mine]608-the father ; to [him]90-joost belongs the honour . It is [he]90-joost who has produced this marvel . How ? That is a secret ; perhaps even [I]608-the father could not tell [you]3492-you if [I]608-the father would ; [Nature]93-nature is wonderful in [her]93-nature ways ; [we]3493-we can only help [her]93-nature , [we]3493-we can not create . Yes , yes , it is [Joost]90-joost who has done this . [He]90-joost seemed to [you]3492-you [a retiring youth]3494-a retiring youth ? Yet [he]90-joost is [the most envied and most honoured man of [our]3493-we profession]3495-the most envied and most honoured man of our profession . [I]608-the father would sooner — there are [many men in [Holland]7-holland]3496-many men in holland who would sooner — have produced this flower than have a thousand pounds . And [he]90-joost is [[my]608-the father son]3497-my son — [you]3492-you may well believe that [I]608-the father am proud . "[608-the father] And [Mijnheer]90-joost beamed with satisfaction in [[his]90-joost son]623-his son and [his]90-joost blue daffodil . But [Julia]58-julia leaned against the stand in the dry twilight , saying nothing . Money , it appeared , was not then the measure of all things ; neither intrinsically , as with [Mr. Alexander Cross]79-cross , nor for what it represented in comfort and position , as with [[her]58-julia own family]659-her own family , did it rank with [these bulb growers]660-these bulb growers . [They]660-these bulb growers , [these people whom [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother would have called [market gardeners]663-market gardeners]661-these people whom her mother would have called market gardeners , [tradespeople]664-tradespeople , it seemed , loved and reverenced [their]660-these bulb growers work ; [they]660-these bulb growers thought about it and for it , were proud of it and valued distinction in it , and nothing else . The blue daffodil was no valuable commercial asset , it was an honour and glory , an unparalleled floral distinction — no wonder [Cross]79-cross could not buy or exploit it . In a jump [Julia]58-julia comprehended the situation more fully than [that astute business man]665-that astute business man ever could ; but at the same time [she]58-julia felt a little bitter amusement — it was this , this treasured wonder , that [she]58-julia thought to obtain . The next day , Sunday , [Julia]58-julia went to [church]666-church with [Mijnheer]90-joost and [Joost]90-joost ; [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw did not find [herself]85-mevrouw well enough for [church]666-church , but [she]85-mevrouw insisted that [Julia]58-julia should not stay at [home]249-home on [her]85-mevrouw account . Accordingly [the girl]415-the girl accompanied [father]3307-father and [son]609-son to [the Groote Kerk]672-the groote kerk and listened to the rather dull service [there]180-there . For the most part [she]415-the girl sat with [her]415-the girl eyes demurely cast down , though once or twice [she]415-the girl looked round [the old barn - like place]674-the old barn - like place , and wondered if there were any frescoes under the whitewash of the walls and whence came the faint , all pervading smell , like a phantom of incense long forgotten . When service was over and [they]675-they came out into [the sunny street]676-the sunny street , [Mijnheer]90-joost announced that [he]90-joost was going to see [a friend]430-a friend . [Julia]58-julia , of course , must hurry [home]249-home to set the table for the mid - day coffee drinking , and afterwards prepare for dinner . [Joost]90-joost was going back , likewise , and to [her]58-julia it was so natural a thing [they]675-they should go together that [she]58-julia never thought about it . It did not , however , seem so to [him]90-joost , and after walking a few paces in embarrassment , [he]90-joost said — " [You]415-the girl would perhaps prefer [I]90-joost did not walk with [you]415-the girl ? "[90-joost] " Oh , no , "[415-the girl] [she]415-the girl answered , in some surprise ; " [I]415-the girl shall be pleased , if [you]90-joost are going the same way , that is . "[415-the girl] [He]90-joost fidgeted , becoming more embarrassed . " [You]415-the girl are sure [you]415-the girl do not mind ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said . " It is a little conspicuous for [you]415-the girl . "[90-joost] Then [she]415-the girl understood , and looked up with twinkling eyes . " [I]415-the girl am afraid [I]415-the girl am conspicuous , anyhow , "[415-the girl] [she]415-the girl said . This was true enough , for [her]415-the girl clothes , fitting like [an Englishwoman]679-an englishwoman 's , and put on like [a Frenchwoman]3481-a frenchwoman 's ( [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons all knew how to dress ) , were unlike any others in sight . [Her]415-the girl face , too , dark and thin and keenly alert , was unlike , and [her]415-the girl light , easy walk ; and if this was not enough it must be added that [she]415-the girl was now walking in [the road]3464-the road because [the pavement]682-the pavement was so crowded . [Joost]90-joost stepped off [the path]566-the path to make room for [her]415-the girl and [she]415-the girl saw by [his]90-joost face that [his]90-joost mind was not at ease . " Pray , [Mijnheer]90-joost , "[415-the girl] [she]415-the girl said , in [her]415-the girl softest tones , and [her]415-the girl voice had many tones as [[her]415-the girl companion]684-her companion had not failed to notice , though [he]90-joost was not aware that the softest was also usually the most mischievous , " will [you]90-joost not walk the other side of the way ? Then [you]90-joost will not be conspicuous at all . "[415-the girl] " [I]90-joost do not mind it , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said , blushing , and [Julia]58-julia decided that [[his]90-joost father]614-his father 's description of [him]90-joost as [a retiring youth]3494-a retiring youth was really short of the mark . [They]687-they walked along together down [the quiet , bright streets]688-the quiet , bright streets ; there were [many people about]689-many people about , but [nobody in a hurry]690-nobody in a hurry , and all in Sunday clothes , bent on visiting or decorous pleasure - making . Everywhere was sunny and everything looked as if [it]691-it had had [its]691-it face washed ; week days in [the town]569-the town always looked to [Julia]58-julia like Sundays , and Sundays , this Sunday in particular , looked like [Easter]94-easter . In time [they]687-they came to [the trees that bordered [the canal]627-the canal]693-the trees that bordered the canal ; there were [old Spanish houses]695-old spanish houses [here]371-here , a beautiful purplish red in colour , and with carving above the doors . [Julia]58-julia looked up at [her]58-julia favourite doorpiece — [a galleon in full sail]697-a galleon in full sail , a veritable picture in relief , unspoiled by three hundred years of wind and weather . " [I]58-julia think this is [the most beautiful town [I]58-julia was ever in]3498-the most beautiful town i was ever in , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . [[Her]58-julia companion]684-her companion looked surprised . " Do [you]58-julia like it ? "[684-her companion] [he]684-her companion asked . " It must be quite unlike what [you]58-julia are used to , all of it must be . "[684-her companion] " It is , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered , " all of it , as [you]684-her companion say — [the place]241-the place , the ways , [the people]3500-the people . "[58-julia] " And [you]684-her companion like it ? [You]684-her companion do not think it — [you]684-her companion do not think [us]3501-us what [you]684-her companion call slow , stupid ? "[58-julia] [She]58-julia was a little surprised , it had never occurred to [her]58-julia that [he]684-her companion , any more than [the others]312-the others , would think about [her]58-julia point of view . " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered , " [I]58-julia admire it all very much , it is sincere , [no one]181-no one appears other than [he]684-her companion is , or aims at being or seeming more . [[Your]90-joost house]3503-your house is the same back and front , and [you]90-joost , none of [you]90-joost have a wrong side , the whole life is solid right through . "[58-julia] [Joost]90-joost did not quite understand ; had [she]58-julia not guessed that to be likely [she]58-julia would hardly have spoken so frankly . " [I]684-her companion fear [I]684-her companion do not understand [you]58-julia , "[684-her companion] [he]684-her companion said ; " it is difficult when [we]3504-we do not know [each other]3407-each other 's language perfectly . "[684-her companion] " [We]3504-we know it very well , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ; " as well as possible . If [we]3504-we were born in [the same place]3506-the same place , in [the same house]3507-the same house , [we]3504-we should not understand it better . "[58-julia] [He]684-her companion still looked puzzled ; [he]684-her companion was half afraid [she]58-julia was laughing at [him]684-her companion . " [You]58-julia think [I]684-her companion am stupid ? "[684-her companion] [he]684-her companion said , gravely . [She]58-julia denied it , and [they]700-they walked on a little in silence . [They]700-they were in [the quieter part of [the town]569-the town]701-the quieter part of the town now and could talk undisturbed ; after a little [he]684-her companion spoke again , musingly . " Often [I]684-her companion wonder what [you]58-julia think of , [you]58-julia have such great , shining eyes , they eat up everything ; [they]3508-they see everything and through everything , [I]684-her companion think . [They]3508-they sweep round [the room]205-the room , or [the persons]3510-the persons or [the place]241-the place , and gather all — may [I]684-her companion say it?—like some fine net — to [me]684-her companion it seems [they]3508-they draw all things into [your]58-julia brain , and there [you]58-julia weave them and weave them into thoughts . "[684-her companion] [Julia]58-julia swallowed a little exclamation , and by an effort contrived not to appear as surprised as [she]58-julia was by this too discerning remark . [She]58-julia was so young that [she]58-julia did not before know that [children]703-children and [child - like folk]704-child - like folk sometimes divine by instinct the same conclusions that [very clever people]705-very clever people arrive at by much reasoning and observation . [She]58-julia felt decidedly uncomfortable at this explanation of [Joost]90-joost 's frequent contemplations of [herself]58-julia . " [You]90-joost seem to think [me]58-julia very clever , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . " Of course , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost answered simply , " [you]58-julia are clever . "[90-joost] " No , [I]58-julia am not , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia returned ; " ask [[your]90-joost mother]3323-your mother ; ask [Denah Snieder]95-denah ; [they]3513-they do not think [me]58-julia clever . What can [I]58-julia do , except cook ? Oh , yes , and speak a few foreign language as [you]90-joost can [yourself]90-joost ? [I]58-julia can not paint , or draw , or sing ; [I]58-julia do not understand music ; why , when [you]90-joost play [Bach]96-bach , [I]58-julia wish to go out of [the room]205-the room . "[58-julia] " That is true , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost admitted ; " [I]90-joost have felt it . "[90-joost] [Julia]58-julia bit [her]58-julia lip ; [she]58-julia had never before expressed [her]58-julia opinion of [Bach]96-bach , and [she]58-julia did not feel in the least gratified that [he]90-joost had found it out for [himself]90-joost . " It is absurd to call [me]58-julia clever , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . " [I]58-julia have little learning and no accomplishments . [I]58-julia can not even get on with the crochet work [Denah]95-denah showed [me]58-julia , and [I]58-julia do not know how to make flowers of paper . "[58-julia] " But why should one make flowers of paper ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost asked , in [his]90-joost serious way . " They are not at all beautiful . "[90-joost] " [Denah]95-denah makes them beautifully , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered . The argument did not seem to carry weight , but [Julia]58-julia advanced no other ; [she]58-julia thought silence the wisest course . [They]706-they had almost reached [home]249-home now ; a little before [they]706-they came to the gate , [Joost]90-joost opened the subject of [herself]90-joost again . " [I]90-joost think sometimes [you]90-joost must make fun of [us]706-they ; do [you]90-joost not sometimes in [your]90-joost heart laugh just a little bit ? "[90-joost] " [I]58-julia laugh at everything sometimes , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [myself]58-julia most of all . Do [you]90-joost never laugh at [yourself]90-joost ? [I]58-julia expect not ; [you]90-joost are very serious . [I]58-julia will tell [you]90-joost what it is like : [a little goblin]3515-a little goblin comes out of [your]90-joost head and stands in front of [you]90-joost ; the goblin is [you]90-joost , a sort of [you]90-joost ; the other part , the part [people]3334-people know , sits opposite , and [the goblin]3517-the goblin laughs at it because it sees how ridiculous the other is , how grotesque and how futile . [[My]58-julia goblin]3518-my goblin came out into [[my]58-julia room]3519-my room last night and laughed and laughed ; [you]90-joost would almost have heard [him]3518-my goblin if [you]90-joost had been [there]180-there . "[58-julia] [They]708-they had reached the gate now , and as [Joost]90-joost held it open for [her]709-she to pass through , [she]709-she saw that [he]90-joost had blushed to the ears at the lightly spoken words — if [he]90-joost had been in [[her]709-she room]400-her room last night ; the impropriety of them to [him]90-joost was evident . For a moment [she]709-she blushed , too , then [she]709-she recovered [herself]709-she and grew impatient with one so artificial — and yet so simple , so self - conscious — and yet so unconscious , so desperately stupid — and yet so uncomfortably clear - sighted .

The following Monday was fine and warm , and since the whole previous week had also been fine and warm , [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw thought [they]708-they might venture to make the talked - of excursion . Messages were accordingly sent to [the Snieders]97-the snieders , and from [the Snieders]97-the snieders back again , and after a wonderful amount of talk and arranging , everything was settled . Dinner was a little early that day , and a little hurried , though , since [the carriage]711-the carriage was not to come till after five o'clock , there was perhaps not much need for that . However , it is not every day in the week one makes an excursion , so naturally things can not be expected to go quite as usual when such an event occurs . [The carriage]711-the carriage came , [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw had been waiting ten minutes , and three times been to see why [Julia]58-julia was not waiting with [her]58-julia . At the sound of wheels [Julia]58-julia came out ; [she]58-julia had just finished washing the glasses ( which [she]58-julia had been told not to touch , as there was certainly no time ) . [She]58-julia was quite ready , but [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw at that moment discovered that [she]85-mevrouw had the wrong sunshade . [Julia]58-julia fetched the right one and carried it out for [the old lady]553-the old lady ; also an umbrella with a bow on the handle , a mackintosh , a shawl , and a large basket . [Mijnheer]90-joost came from [the office]603-the office with [his]90-joost spectacles pushed up on [his]90-joost forehead , and a minute later [Joost]90-joost also came to say good - bye ; even [the maidservant]630-the maidservant came from [the kitchen]220-the kitchen to see [them]717-them start . [The carriage]711-the carriage drew up ; it was [a strange - looking vehicle]719-a strange - looking vehicle , in shape something between [a hearse]720-a hearse and [an ark on wheels]721-an ark on wheels , but with the greater part of the sides open to the air . [Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder and [[her]84-vrouw snieder two daughters]549-her two daughters were already within , with [their]723-their bow - trimmed umbrellas , sunshades , mackintoshes , shawls and basket . There was necessarily a good deal of greeting ; [Mijnheer]90-joost and [Joost]90-joost shook hands with [all the three ladies]724-all the three ladies , and inquired after [Herr Snieder]98-herr snieder , and received polite inquiries in return . Then [Denah]95-denah insisted on getting out , so that [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw should be better able to get in ; also to show that [she]85-mevrouw was athletic and agile , like [an English girl]725-an english girl , and thought nothing of getting in and out of [a high carriage]726-a high carriage . [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw kissed [[her]85-mevrouw husband]230-her husband and [son]609-son , twice each , very loud , called a good - bye to [the servant]729-the servant , and got in . [Julia]58-julia shook hands , said good - bye , and also got in . [Denah]95-denah watched [her]58-julia , and observed the shape of [her]58-julia feet and ankles jealously . [She]58-julia glanced sharply at [Joost]90-joost , but [he]90-joost was not guilty of such indecorum as even thinking about [any girl]730-any girl 's legs , so , having said [her]58-julia good - bye , [she]58-julia got in reassured . Finally [they]731-they drove away amid wishes for a safe drive and a pleasant excursion . Of course there was a little settling to do inside [the carriage]711-the carriage , the wraps and baskets to be disposed of , and [each person]733-each person to be assured that [the others]312-the others had enough room , and just the place [they]312-the others preferred to any other . By the time that was done [they]731-they stopped again at [the house of [[Mijnheer]90-joost 's head clerk]736-mijnheer 's head clerk]735-the house of mijnheer 's head clerk ; here [they]731-they were to take up [two children]737-two children , [girls of fourteen and fifteen , who had been invited to come with the party]738-girls of fourteen and fifteen , who had been invited to come with the party . [The carriage]711-the carriage was not kept waiting , [the children]740-the children were out before it had fairly stopped ; [they]740-the children were [flaxenly fair girls]741-flaxenly fair girls , wearing little blue earrings , Sunday hats , and cotton gloves of course — [all the party]742-all the party wore cotton gloves ; it was , [Julia]58-julia judged , part of the excursion outfit . Now [they]731-they were really off , driving out beyond [the outskirts of [the town]569-the town]568-the outskirts of the town ; along flat roads where the wheels sank noiselessly into the soft sand , and the horses ' feet clattered on [the narrow brick track in the centre]745-the narrow brick track in the centre . For a time [they]731-they followed [the canal]627-the canal closely , but soon [they]731-they left [it]627-the canal , and saw in the distance nothing but [[its]627-the canal high green banks]747-its high green banks , with the brown sails of [boats]748-boats showing above , and looking as if they were a good deal higher than [the carriage road]749-the carriage road . [They]731-they passed [small fields]750-small fields , subdivided into yet smaller patches , and all very highly cultivated . And [small black and white houses]751-small black and white houses , and small black and white cows , and black and white goats , and dogs , and even cats of the same combination of colour . Everything was rather small , but everywhere very tidy ; nothing out of [its]752-its place or wasted , and [nobody]3448-nobody hurrying or idling ; all were busy , with a small bustling business , as unlike aggressive English idleness as it was unlike the deceptive , leisurely power of English work . [Denah]95-denah and [Anna]61-denah looked out of either side of [the carriage]711-the carriage , and pointed out things to [Julia]58-julia and [the two little girls]755-the two little girls . Here it was what [they]731-they called [a country seat]756-a country seat , a sort of castellated variety of overgrown chalêt , surrounded by [a wonderful garden of blazing flower - beds]757-a wonderful garden of blazing flower - beds and emerald lawns , all set round with rows and rows of plants in bright red pots . Or there it was [a cemetery , where the peaceful aspect]758-a cemetery , where the peaceful aspect made [Denah]61-denah sentimental , and the beauty of the trees drew [Anna]61-denah 's praise . [The two elder ladies]759-the two elder ladies paid less attention to what [they]731-they passed ; [they]759-the two elder ladies contented [themselves]759-the two elder ladies with leaning back and saying how beautiful the air was , and how refreshing [the country]760-the country . [The girls]3439-the girls said that as well ; [they]3439-the girls all agreed six times within the hour that it was a delightful expedition , and [they]3439-the girls enjoying it much . In time [they]731-they came to [the wood]591-the wood . [An unpaved road]763-an unpaved road ran through [it]591-the wood of soft , deep sand , which deadened every sound ; on either hand the trees rose , pines and larch and beech principally , with a few large - leafed shivering poplars here and there . There was no undergrowth , and few bird songs , only the dim wood aisles stretching away , quiet and green . Suddenly it seemed to [Julia]58-julia that [the world]208-the world 's horizon had been stretched , the little neatness , the clean , trim brightness , the bustling , industrious [toy world]765-toy world was gone ; in [its]591-the wood place was the twilight of the trees , the silence , the repose , the haunting , indefinable sense of home which is only to be found in [these cathedrals of Nature]766-these cathedrals of nature 's making . " Ah , [the wood]591-the wood ! "[61-denah] [Denah]61-denah said , with a profound sigh . " [The beautiful wood]3522-the beautiful wood ! [Miss Julia]58-julia , do [you]58-julia not love it ? "[61-denah] [Julia]58-julia did not assent , but [Denah]61-denah went on quite satisfied , " [You]58-julia can not love it as [I]61-denah do ; [I]61-denah think [I]61-denah am [a child of Nature]3523-a child of nature , nothing would please [me]61-denah more than always to live [here]371-here . "[61-denah] " [You]61-denah would have to go into [the town]569-the town sometimes , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said , " to buy gloves ; the ones [you]61-denah have would not last for ever . "[58-julia] [Denah]61-denah looked a little puzzled by the difficulty ; [she]61-denah had not apparently thought out the details of life in a natural state ; but before [she]61-denah could come to any conclusion [one of [the little girls]768-the little girls]767-one of the little girls cried , " Music — [I]767-one of the little girls hear music ! "[767-one of the little girls] All [the ladies]769-the ladies said " Delicious ! "[769-the ladies] together , and " How beautiful ! "[769-the ladies] and [Denah]61-denah , content to ignore [Nature]93-nature , added rapturously , " Music in [the wood]591-the wood ! Ah , exquisite ! [two beauties]3527-two beauties together ! "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia echoed the remark , though the music was that of a piano - organ . The horizon had drawn in again , and the prospect narrowed ; the silence was full of noises now , voices and laughter , amidst which the organ notes did not seem out of place . And near at hand under the trees there were tables spread and [people]3334-people having tea , enjoying [themselves]3334-people in a simple - hearted , noisy fashion , in no way suggestive of cathedral twilight . [The carriage]711-the carriage was put up , the tea ordered , and in a little [they]768-the little girls , too , were sitting at one of the square tables . [Each lady]772-each lady was provided with a high wooden chair , and a little wooden box footstool . A kettle on a hot potful of smouldering wood ashes was set on the table ; cups and saucers and goats ' milk were also supplied to [them]768-the little girls , and opaque beet - root sugar . The food [they]768-the little girls had brought in [their]768-the little girls baskets , big new broodje split in half , buttered and put together again with a slither of Dutch cheese between . These and , to wind up with , some thin sweet biscuits carried in a papier - maché box , and handed out singly by [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen , who had brought [them]768-the little girls as a surprise and a treat . " Do [they]768-the little girls have such picnics as this in [England]8-england ? "[61-denah] [Anna]61-denah asked , as [she]61-denah gathered up the crumbs of [her]61-denah biscuit . " [I]58-julia have never been to one , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered , and inwardly [she]58-julia thought of [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother and [Violet]101-violet driving in [a wheeled ark]774-a wheeled ark to [the wood]591-the wood , there to sit at little wooden tables and stretch [their]768-the little girls mouths in the public eye . " Ah ! "[84-vrouw snieder] said [Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder ; " then it is all the more of a pleasure and a novelty to [you]58-julia . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said it was , and soon afterwards [they]768-the little girls rose from the table to walk in the wood . [The two elder ladies]759-the two elder ladies did not get far , and before long came back to sit on [their]759-the two elder ladies wooden chairs again . [The girls]3439-the girls went some little distance , all keeping together , and being careful not to wander out of sight and sound of the other picnic parties . Once when [they]768-the little girls came to the extreme limit of [their]768-the little girls walk , [Julia]58-julia half - hesitated . [She]58-julia looked into [the quiet green distance]778-the quiet green distance . It would be easy to leave [them]768-the little girls , to give [them]768-the little girls the slip ; [she]58-julia could walk at double [their]768-the little girls pace with half [their]768-the little girls exer tion , [she]58-julia could lose [herself]58-julia among the trees while [they]768-the little girls were wondering why [she]58-julia had gone , and making up [their]768-the little girls minds to follow [her]58-julia ; and , most important of all , when [she]58-julia came back [she]58-julia could explain everything quite easily , so that [they]768-the little girls would not think it in the least strange — an accident , a missing of the way , anything . Should [she]58-julia do it — should [she]58-julia ? The wild creature that had lived half - smothered within [her]58-julia for all the twenty years of [her]58-julia life fluttered and stirred . It had stirred before , rebelling against the shams of the [Marbridge]61-denah life , as it rebelled against the restrictions of the present ; it had never had scope or found vent ; still , for all that it was not dead ; possibly , even , it was growing stronger ; it called [her]58-julia now to run away . But [she]58-julia did not do it ; advisability , [[the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons ' patron saint]779-the polkingtons ' patron saint , suggested to [her]58-julia that [one]3325-one does not learn to shine in the caged life by allowing [oneself]3325-one the luxury of occasional escape . [She]58-julia turned [her]58-julia back on the green distance . " Shall [we]768-the little girls not go back to where the music is playing ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . [They]768-the little girls went , walking with [their]768-the little girls arms entwined as [other girls]781-other girls were doing , [Julia]58-julia between [the broad , white - skinned sisters]782-the broad , white - skinned sisters , like a rapier between cushions . [The two younger girls]783-the two younger girls ran on in front . " There is [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , "[783-the two younger girls] [they]783-the two younger girls cried . " [She]85-mevrouw is calling [us]768-the little girls . [The carriage]711-the carriage is ready , too ; oh , do [you]783-the two younger girls think it is already time to go ? "[783-the two younger girls] It seemed as if it really was the case . [Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder stood clapping [her]84-vrouw snieder hands and beckoning to [them]768-the little girls , and [the coachman]784-the coachman appeared impatient to be off . With reluctance , and many times repeated regrets , [they]768-the little girls collected [their]768-the little girls wraps and baskets , and got into [the carriage]711-the carriage . " Good - bye , beautiful wood , good - bye ! "[61-denah] [Denah]61-denah said , leaning far out as [they]768-the little girls started . " Oh , if one could but remain here till the moon rose ! "[61-denah] " It would be very damp , "[195-her mother] [[her]61-denah mother]195-her mother observed . " The dew would fall . "[195-her mother] To which incontestable remark [Denah]61-denah made no reply . The return journey was much like [the drive]787-the drive [there]180-there , with one exception ; [they]768-the little girls passed one object of interest [they]768-the little girls had not seen before . It was when [they]768-the little girls were nearing [the outskirts of [the town]569-the town]568-the outskirts of the town that [Anna]61-denah exclaimed , " [An Englishman]3529-an englishman ! Look , look , [Miss Julia]58-julia , [a compatriot of yours]3530-a compatriot of yours ! "[61-denah] The season was full early for [tourists]791-tourists , and at no time did [the place]241-the place attract [many]793-many . [Englishmen who came now]794-englishmen who came now probably came on business which was unlikely to bring [them]794-englishmen who came now out to [these quiet , flat fields]795-these quiet , flat fields . [But [Anna]61-denah and [Denah]61-denah , who joined [her]61-denah in a much more demonstrative look - out than [Marbridge]61-denah would have considered well - bred]61-denah , were insistent on the nationality . " [He]3529-an englishman walks like [an Englishman]3529-an englishman , "[61-denah] [Anna]61-denah said , " as if all [the world]208-the world belonged to [him]3529-an englishman . "[61-denah] " And looks like one , "[61-denah] [Denah]61-denah added ; " [he]3529-an englishman has no moustache , and wears a glass in [his]3529-an englishman eye , look , [Miss Julia]58-julia . "[61-denah] [Julia]58-julia looked , then drew back rather quickly . [They]796-they were right , it was [an Englishman]3529-an englishman ; it was of [all men]798-all men [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew . What was [he]3529-an englishman doing [here]371-here ? By what extraordinary chance [he]3529-an englishman came to be in [this unlikely place]800-this unlikely place [she]58-julia could not think . [She]58-julia was very glad that [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw felt the air chilly , and so had had the leather flaps pulled over part of the open sides of [the carriage]711-the carriage ; this and [the eager sisters]802-the eager sisters screened [her]58-julia so well that it was unlikely [he]3529-an englishman could see [her]58-julia . " Is [he]3529-an englishman not [an Englishman]3529-an englishman ? "[61-denah] [Anna]61-denah asked . " Yes , "[61-denah] [she]61-denah answered ; " [one]3325-one could not mistake [him]3529-an englishman for anything else . "[61-denah] " [I]61-denah wonder if [he]3529-an englishman recognised [you]58-julia as [a country - woman]3535-a country - woman , "[61-denah] [Anna]61-denah speculated ; and [Julia]58-julia said [she]58-julia did not consider [herself]58-julia typically English in appearance . [The sisters]189-the sisters talked for the rest of the way of [the Englishman]804-the englishman ; of [his]804-the englishman air and bearing , and the fact , of which [they]189-the sisters declared [themselves]189-the sisters convinced , that [he]804-the englishman was [a person of distinction]805-a person of distinction . But it was not till the drive was over , and [the party]806-the party had separated , that [Denah]61-denah was able to say what was burning on [her]61-denah tongue . [They]189-the sisters had left [[the clerk]807-the clerk 's children]808-the clerk 's children at [[their]189-the sisters house]809-their house , said good - bye to [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen and [Julia]58-julia , and were within [[their]189-the sisters own [home]249-home]810-their own home at last ; [the girls]3439-the girls went up to [[their]189-the sisters bedroom]813-their bedroom , and [Denah]61-denah carefully fastened the door , then [she]61-denah said mysteriously , " [Miss Julia]58-julia knows [that Englishman]3536-that englishman . "[61-denah] [Anna]61-denah jumped at the intelligence , and still more at the tone . " Did [she]58-julia tell [you]58-julia ? "[61-denah] [she]61-denah asked . " No , "[61-denah] [Denah]61-denah replied with some scorn ; " [she]58-julia would not tell [any one]187-any one , [she]58-julia wishes it concealed ; [she]58-julia thinks it is so , but [I]61-denah saw it . "[61-denah] The tone and manner suggested many things , but [Anna]61-denah was [a terribly matter - of - fact person , to whom suggestions were nothing]814-a terribly matter - of - fact person , to whom suggestions were nothing . " Why should [she]58-julia wish it concealed ? "[61-denah] [she]61-denah inquired . " [I]61-denah do not know why , "[61-denah] [Denah]61-denah answered ; " that remains to be seen . As for how [I]61-denah know it , [I]61-denah saw it in [her]61-denah face ; when [she]61-denah looked at [him]3538-you [her]61-denah lips became set , and [her]61-denah eyes — [she]61-denah looked — "[61-denah] [She]61-denah hesitated for a word , and dropped to the homely , " [She]61-denah looked as if [she]61-denah would bite with annoyance that [he]3538-you should be [here]371-here . The expression was gone in a moment ; [she]61-denah spoke with an ease and naturalness that was astonishing , even disgusting ; but it had been there . [I]61-denah do not trust [her]61-denah . "[61-denah] The last was said with great seriousness , and for a little [Anna]61-denah was impressed . But not for long , [she]61-denah could not accept such evidence as this ; in [her]61-denah opinion it was " fancy . "[61-denah] " [You]3538-you read too many romances , "[61-denah] [she]61-denah said ; " [your]3538-you head is full of such things . [I]61-denah do not believe [Miss Julia]58-julia knew [the Englishman]99-the englishman , [she]58-julia would not have hidden from [us]3540-us [her]58-julia knowledge if [she]58-julia did ; it is not so easy to hide [one]3325-one 's feelings in the flash of an eye , besides there was no reason . Also"—this[61-denah] as an afterthought—"he was [a man of good family]3542-a man of good family ; [you]3538-you could see at a glance that [he]3542-a man of good family was of [the aristocracy]3543-the aristocracy , while [she]58-julia is [a paid companion to [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen]3544-a paid companion to vrouw van heigen ; [she]58-julia could never before have met [him]3542-a man of good family . "[61-denah] [Denah]61-denah , however , was not convinced ; [she]61-denah only repeated darkly , " [I]61-denah mistrust [her]58-julia . "[61-denah] [Julia]58-julia , in the meantime , was busy with [her]58-julia household duties , talking over the excursion the while with [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , and helping to detail it to [Mijnheer]90-joost . At last the table was ready for supper and the coffee made . [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw sat with [her]85-mevrouw crochet , and [Mijnheer]90-joost opposite [her]58-julia with [his]90-joost paper . It wanted more than a quarter of an hour to supper time , [Julia]58-julia had been too quick ; still it did not matter , the coffee would not hurt standing on the spirit - stove ; it stood there half the day . [She]58-julia had all this time to spare , but [she]58-julia did not fetch [her]58-julia crochet work ; [she]58-julia went outside to [the veranda]618-the veranda . [It]816-it was almost dark by this time , as dark as it ever got on these nights ; the air was still and warm . [She]58-julia opened the glass door and went out and sat down on the step . There was a smell of water in the air , not unpleasant , but quite un - English , and mixed with it a faint smell of flowers , the late blooming bulbs have little scent on the whole ; it was more the heavy dew than the flowers themselves which [one]3325-one could smell . It was very quiet out here ; [the town]569-the town , at no time noisy , was some distance away — so quiet that [Julia]58-julia could hear the ticking of [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's large watch in [her]58-julia belt . [She]58-julia pushed it further down ; [she]58-julia did not want to hear it . [She]58-julia propped [her]58-julia elbows on [her]58-julia knees , and [her]58-julia chin on [her]58-julia hands . [She]58-julia wished [she]58-julia had not seen [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew that day ; [she]58-julia wished [she]58-julia was not [here]371-here , [she]58-julia wished there was no such thing as a blue daffodil ; [she]58-julia was vaguely angry and dissatisfied , but not willing to face things . It was unlikely that [the man]820-the man had seen [her]58-julia , unlikely that [she]58-julia would see [him]820-the man again ; but [he]820-the man was incongruous in this simple life , and [he]820-the man brought [forcibly]821-forcibly home the incongruity of [herself]58-julia and [her]58-julia errand . [She]58-julia had come for the blue daffodil , it was no good pretending [she]58-julia had not ; [she]58-julia told [herself]58-julia angrily , as [she]58-julia had told [herself]58-julia when [she]58-julia had first looked at [Johnny]57-johnny 's yellow - faced watch , that [she]58-julia was going to get it in some way that was justifiable . Only it was not so easy to believe that now [she]58-julia knew more about it and the [Van Heigens]78-the van heigens . But [she]58-julia must have it , that was the argument [she]58-julia fell back on , the necessity was so great that [she]58-julia was justified ( [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons had always found necessity a justification for doing things that could be anyhow made to square with [their]56-the polkingtons position ) . [She]58-julia wished [she]58-julia had not been for the excursion to - day , that [she]58-julia lived less really in [their]56-the polkingtons simple , sincere life . [She]58-julia wished from [her]58-julia heart that [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens had been [different sort of people]822-different sort of people — almost any other sort , then [she]58-julia would not have had these tiresome feelings — [Johnny]57-johnny and [Johnny]57-johnny 's watch , [Joost Van Heigen]77-joost — there was something about [them]56-the polkingtons all that was hatefully embarrassing . [No self - respecting thief]823-no self - respecting thief robbed [a child]824-a child ; [even the most apathetic conscience]825-even the most apathetic conscience revolted at such an idea . [No gentleman worthy of the name]826-no gentleman worthy of the name attacked [an unarmed man]827-an unarmed man , the preparedness of [the parties]828-the parties made all the difference between murder and fair fight . Of course , in the abstract , stealing was stealing under all conditions , and killing killing , and both open to condemnation ; but in the concrete , in fact , the equality of [the two persons]829-the two persons made all the difference , at least to honour . [Julia]58-julia moved uneasily and looked , without seeing , across [the dark garden]830-the dark garden . The monotonous sound of voices floated out indistinctly ; [the old pair in the sitting - room]831-the old pair in the sitting - room were talking in the lamplight , [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw going over once again the little incidents of the day . [Joost]77-joost was in [the drawing - room at the other end of [the house]175-the house]832-the drawing - room at the other end of the house ; [he]77-joost had been playing some of [[his]77-joost favourite composer]834-his favourite composer ; [he]77-joost had stopped now , and was doubtless sorting [his]77-joost music and putting it away , each piece four - square and absolutely neat . Day by day , and year by year , [they]835-they lived this quiet life , with a drive for a rare holiday treat , and the discovery of a new flower as the goal of all hope and ambition . Things did not happen to [them]835-they , bad things that needed doubtful remedies ; [they]835-they had never had to scratch for [their]835-they living , and show one face outwards and another in . [They]835-they , [none of [them]835-they]836-none of them , ever wanted to do things ; [they]835-they had not the courage . How much of virtue was lack of courage and a desire not to be remarkable ? [Julia]58-julia asked [herself]58-julia the question defiantly , and did not hear [Joost]77-joost come out of [the house]175-the house . [He]77-joost was carrying a lantern , and was going to make [his]77-joost nightly round of [the barns]647-the barns . [She]58-julia did not hear [his]77-joost step , and so started when [she]58-julia saw the light swing across the ground at [her]58-julia feet . [He]77-joost was quite as startled to see [her]58-julia as [she]58-julia was to see [him]77-joost , but [his]77-joost greeting was a very usual question in [Holland]7-holland , " Will [you]58-julia not catch cold ? "[58-julia] [She]58-julia shook [her]58-julia head , and [he]77-joost asked , " What are [you]58-julia doing ? Thinking ? Weaving in [your]58-julia head all that [you]58-julia have seen and heard to - day ? "[77-joost] " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered ; " [I]58-julia was thinking about courage . "[58-julia] " Courage ? "[77-joost] [he]77-joost repeated , puzzled . " Yes , it is very different in different places ; [some people]3545-some people are afraid to tell the truth , so [they]3545-some people lie ; and [some]3546-some are afraid to be dishonest , so [they]3546-some are honest ; [I]77-joost believe it depends partly on fashion . "[77-joost] [Joost]77-joost set down the lantern in sheer surprise . " Such things can not depend on fashion , "[77-joost] [he]77-joost said severely . " [I]58-julia am not so sure , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ; " lots of things [you]77-joost would not expect depend on it . [I]58-julia know people who sometimes go without the food [they]3547-they want so that [they]3547-they can buy expensive cakes to show off when [[their]3547-they acquaintances]3548-their acquaintances come to tea — that 's silly , is n't it ? Then [I]58-julia know [other people who blush if a pair of breeches , or something equally inoffensive]3549-other people who blush if a pair of breeches , or something equally inoffensive , are mentioned ; that seems equally silly . [One lot of [people]3334-people]3550-one lot of people is ashamed to be seen eating bread - and - cheese suppers , another lot is ashamed to be seen walking off the side - walk , and with no gloves on . [One]3325-one would hardly expect in , yet [I]58-julia almost believe these silly little things somehow make a difference to what [the people]3500-the people think right and wrong . "[58-julia] [Joost]77-joost regarded [her]58-julia doubtfully , though [he]77-joost could only see the outline of [her]58-julia face . " Are [you]58-julia making fun ? "[77-joost] [he]77-joost asked . " [I]77-joost do not know when [you]58-julia are making fun ; [I]77-joost think [you]58-julia must be now . Are [you]58-julia speaking of [us]3554-us ? "[77-joost] " [I]58-julia never felt less like making fun in [my]58-julia life , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ignoring the last question . Something in [her]58-julia tone struck [Joost]77-joost as sad , and [he]77-joost forgot [his]77-joost question in sympathy . " [I]77-joost am sorry , "[77-joost] [he]77-joost said ; " [you]58-julia are unhappy , and [I]77-joost have intruded upon [you]58-julia ; will [you]58-julia forgive [me]77-joost ? [You]58-julia are thinking of [[your]58-julia home]3555-your home , no doubt ; [you]58-julia have not had a letter from [England]8-england for a long time . "[77-joost] [Julia]58-julia wished [he]77-joost did not notice so many things . " [I]58-julia did not expect a letter , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [[my]58-julia eldest sister]3556-my eldest sister was married last week , there would be no time to write to [me]58-julia till everything was over ; most likely [I]58-julia shall hear to - morrow . "[58-julia] " Is [[your]58-julia sister]3557-your sister married ? "[77-joost] [he]77-joost asked ; " and [you]58-julia were not able to be present ? "[77-joost] " It is too far to go [home]249-home from here , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; then asked , " Were [you]77-joost going to [the barns]647-the barns ? "[58-julia] " Yes , "[77-joost] [he]77-joost answered , suddenly reminded of the fact . Then seeing [she]58-julia did not resume [her]58-julia seat on the steps , [he]77-joost ventured diffidently , " Will [you]58-julia come too ? "[77-joost] [She]58-julia assented , and [they]839-they started together in silence , [Joost]77-joost thinking [her]58-julia homesick , not knowing quite what to say . When [they]839-they came to [the first of [the dark buildings]841-the dark buildings]840-the first of the dark buildings [they]839-they went in , and [he]77-joost swung the lantern round so that their shadows danced fantastically . Then [he]77-joost tried various doors , and glanced up the wall - ladder to the square opening which led to the floor above . There was no need to examine [the place]241-the place minutely , [it]241-the place was all quiet and dark ; if there had been any one about [they]839-they would certainly have heard , and if there had been anything smouldering — a danger more to be feared , seeing that [the men]843-the men smoked everywhere — it could have been smelt in the dry air . " [I]58-julia like [these barns]3560-these barns , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said , looking round : " [they]3560-these barns are so big and quiet and orderly , somehow so respectable . "[58-julia] " Respectable ! "[77-joost] [he]77-joost repeated , as if [he]77-joost did not approve of the word . " Is that what [you]58-julia like ? [The respectable]3561-the respectable ? "[77-joost] " Yes , in its place ; and its place is here . "[77-joost] " [You]58-julia think [us]839-they respectable ? "[58-julia] " Well , are [you]77-joost not ? [I]58-julia think [you]77-joost are [the most respectable people in [the world]208-the world]3562-the most respectable people in the world . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia led the way through to [the next barn]844-the next barn as [she]58-julia spoke . " [You]77-joost are going [here]371-here , too , [I]58-julia suppose ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . " [I]77-joost will just look round , "[77-joost] [he]77-joost answered . [They]845-they went on together until [they]845-they came to [the last barn of all]846-the last barn of all ; while [they]845-they paused there a moment [they]845-they heard a rustling and movement in the dark , far corner . [Joost]77-joost started violently , then [he]77-joost said , " It is a rat , [you]58-julia must not be afraid ; it will not run this way . "[77-joost] " [I]58-julia am not afraid , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said with amusement . " Do [you]77-joost think [I]77-joost am afraid of rats ? "[77-joost] " [Girls]3565-girls often are . "[77-joost] " Well , [I]58-julia am not , "[58-julia] and it was clear from [her]58-julia manner that [she]58-julia spoke the truth . " Would [you]58-julia be afraid to come out here alone ? "[77-joost] [he]77-joost asked curiously . " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " any night that [you]77-joost like [I]58-julia will come [here]371-here alone , go through [the barns]647-the barns and fasten the doors . "[58-julia] " [I]77-joost do not believe there are many [girls who would do that]3568-girls who would do that , "[77-joost] [he]77-joost said ; [he]77-joost was thinking of [Denah]61-denah and [Anna]61-denah . [Julia]58-julia told [him]77-joost there were plenty who would . As [they]847-they came back , stopping to fasten each door after [them]847-they , [he]77-joost remarked , " [I]77-joost think [girls]3565-girls are usually brought up with too much protection ; [I]77-joost mean [girls of [our]3571-our class]3570-girls of our class , [they]3565-girls are too much shielded ; one has [them]3565-girls for [the house]175-the house only ; if [they]3565-girls were flowers [I]77-joost would call [them]3565-girls stove - plants . "[77-joost] [Julia]58-julia laughed . " [You]77-joost believe in the emancipation of [women]3573-women then ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [you]77-joost would rather [a woman]3574-a woman could take care of [herself]3574-a woman , and not be afraid , than be womanly ? "[58-julia] " No , "[77-joost] [he]77-joost answered ; " [I]77-joost would like [them]3573-women to be both , as [you]58-julia are . "[77-joost] [They]848-they had come outside now ; [she]58-julia was standing in the misty moon - light , while [he]77-joost stayed to fasten the last door . " [I]58-julia ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [you]77-joost seem to think [me]58-julia [a paragon]3575-a paragon — clever , brave , womanly . Do [you]77-joost know what [I]58-julia really am ? [I]58-julia am bad ; by a long way [the wickedest person [you]77-joost have known]3576-the wickedest person you have known . "[58-julia] But [he]77-joost did not believe [her]58-julia , which was perhaps not altogether surprising .

[Violet Polkington]101-violet was married , and , as a consequence , the financial affairs of [the family]193-the family were in a state that can only be described as wonderful . [They]193-the family were intricately involved , of course , and there was no chance of [their]193-the family being clear again for a year at least ; but , also , there was no chance of [them]193-the family being found out , appearances were better than ever . [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer had been given a small living , whether by the deserved kindness of fortune , or by reason of [his]65-mr. frazer own efforts , or [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons , is not known . Anyhow [he]65-mr. frazer had it , and [he]65-mr. frazer and [Violet]101-violet were married in June with all necessary éclat . Local papers described the event in glowing terms , [appreciative friends]850-appreciative friends said it was the prettiest wedding in years , and in due time [Chèrie]64-chèrie wrote and told [Julia]58-julia about it . [The Captain]172-the captain also wrote ; [his]172-the captain point of view was rather different , but [his]172-the captain letter filled up gaps in [Chèrie]64-chèrie 's information , and [Julia]58-julia 's own past experience filled up the remaining gaps in both . The letters came on Tuesday , as [Julia]58-julia expected , a little before dinner time ; [she]58-julia was still reading them when [Mijnheer]90-joost and [[his]90-joost son]623-his son came in from [the office]603-the office . [Joost]90-joost smiled sympathetically when [he]90-joost saw [she]58-julia had them , glad on [her]58-julia account ; and [she]58-julia , almost unconsciously , crumpled together the sheets that lay on the table beside [her]58-julia , as if [she]58-julia were afraid they would betray their contents to [him]90-joost . " [You]58-julia have good news from [home]249-home ? "[90-joost] said [Mijnheer]90-joost ; " [[your]58-julia parents]3578-your parents are well ? "[90-joost] " Quite well , thank [you]90-joost , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered . [She]58-julia had just come to the place in [[her]58-julia father]210-her father 's letter where [he]210-her father regretted that such very light refreshments were the fashion at wedding receptions . " It is , of course , as [[your]58-julia mother]3323-your mother says , less expensive , but at such a time who would spare expense — if it were the fashion ? [I]58-julia assure [you]58-julia [I]58-julia had literally nothing to eat at the time , or afterwards ; [[your]58-julia mother]3323-your mother thinking it advisable as soon as [we]3581-we were alone , to put away the cakes for [future visitors]3582-future visitors . At such a time , when [a man]406-a man 's feelings are nearly touched , [he]406-a man needs support ; [I]58-julia did not have it , and [I]58-julia can not say that [I]58-julia have felt [myself]58-julia since . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia read to the end of the letter ; [Mijnheer]90-joost had by this time taken up a paper , but [Joost]90-joost watched [her]58-julia as [she]58-julia folded the sheets . [He]90-joost did not speak , it seemed [he]90-joost would not intrude upon [her]58-julia ; there was something dog - like in this sympathy with what was not understood . [She]58-julia felt vaguely uncomfortable by reason of it , and spoke to break the spell . " Everything went off very well , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . The words were for [him]90-joost alone , since [Mijnheer]90-joost was now reading , and also knew nothing of the subject . The smile brightened on [his]90-joost face . " Did it ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost answered . " [I]58-julia am very glad . [They]3584-they must have missed [you]58-julia much , and thought often of [you]58-julia . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia nodded . [Chèrie]64-chèrie had said . " [I]64-chèrie must say [I]64-chèrie think it is a pity [you]58-julia were not [here]371-here ; it is important to have [some one with a head in the background]3586-some one with a head in the background ; [mother]3346-mother and [I]64-chèrie had to be [the fore]3588-the fore , so of course [we]3589-we could not do it ; if [you]58-julia had been [here]371-here several things would have gone better , and some waste have been saved . "[64-chèrie] This remark [Julia]58-julia did not communicate to [Joost]90-joost ; [she]58-julia put the letter in [her]58-julia pocket , and went to fetch the dinner . After dinner [she]58-julia was to go on an errand for [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw . It would take a long time , all the evening in fact , for it was to [an old relative who lived in [a village about three miles from [the town]569-the town]856-a village about three miles from the town]855-an old relative who lived in a village about three miles from the town . Walking was the only way of getting to [the place]241-the place , except twice a week when [a little cargo boat]859-a little cargo boat went down [the canal]627-the canal , and took some hours about it . This was neither the day nor the time for [the boat]861-the boat , [Julia]58-julia would have to walk ; but , as [she]58-julia assured [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , [she]58-julia much preferred it . Accordingly , as soon as dinner was finished , [she]58-julia was given a great many messages , mostly of a condoling nature , for [the old lady]553-the old lady was ill in bed , some strengthening soup , and a little bottle of the peach - brandy . With these things packed in a substantial marketing basket , [she]58-julia started . Through [the town]569-the town [she]58-julia went with that easy step and indifference to the presence of [other people that [Denah]61-denah]864-other people that denah so criticised , faster and faster [her]58-julia spirits rising . Once or twice [she]58-julia looked in at the low windows that stood open on the shady side of [the street]366-the street ; there [she]58-julia saw the heads of [families]866-families smoking [their]866-families after - dinner pipes , while [[their]866-families wives]867-their wives and [daughters]868-daughters sat crocheting and watching [the passersby]869-the passersby . There were chairs with crimson velvet seats in [most of [the rooms]640-the rooms]870-most of the rooms , and funny little cabinet , or side - board things of bright red mahogany , with modern Delft vases , very blue indeed , upon them . And always there was a certain snugness , perhaps even smugness , about [the rooms]640-the rooms . At least , so it seemed to [her]58-julia as [she]58-julia looked in , almost insolently pleased to be outside , to be free and alone . In time [she]58-julia came to [the outskirts of [the town]569-the town]568-the outskirts of the town , [the canal]627-the canal lay on [her]58-julia right , and on [her]58-julia left , flat green fields , cut up by innumerable ditches , and set with frequent windmills , all black and white , and mostly used for maintaining the water level . There were [people]3334-people busy in [the fields]877-the fields , but to [Julia]58-julia [they]3334-people only gave the idea of ants , and did not intrude upon [her]58-julia mind in the least . It was all very quiet and green around , and quiet and blue above , except for the larks singing rapturously . Certainly it was very good to be away from [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens , away from the ceaseless little reiteration of [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw 's talk , from the minute , punctilious conventions , from [Joost]90-joost 's quiet gaze , from the proximity of the hateful , necessary blue daffodil . With a violent rebound [Julia]58-julia shook off the feeling that had been growing on [her]58-julia of late , and was once more possibly reckless , but certainly free , and no longer under the spell of [her]58-julia surroundings . [Her]58-julia young blood coursed quickly , [her]58-julia eyes shone , the basket [she]58-julia carried grew light ; [she]58-julia might have sung as [she]58-julia went had not [Nature]93-nature , in withholding the ability , also kindly withheld the inclination . Soon after leaving [the town]569-the town , [a side road]879-a side road cut into [the main one]880-the main one ; a waggon was lumbering down [it]879-a side road at no great pace , but just before [the branch road]881-the branch road joined [the main one]880-the main one [the driver]883-the driver cracked [his]883-the driver whip loudly , so that [his]883-the driver team of young horses started forward suddenly . Too suddenly for the comprehension of [some children who were playing in the road]884-some children who were playing in the road ; for a second or more [they]884-some children who were playing in the road looked at the approaching waggon , then , when the necessity dawned upon [them]884-some children who were playing in the road , [they]884-some children who were playing in the road ran for safety , one one way , one another , and [the third]885-the third , [a baby boy , like a chicken]886-a baby boy , like a chicken , half across the way to the right , then , after a scurry in the middle , back again to the left , under the horses ' feet . [Julia]58-julia shouted to [him]886-a baby boy , like a chicken , but in the excitement of the moment [she]58-julia spoke English , and not Dutch , though it hardly mattered , for [the little boy]887-the little boy was far too frightened to understand anything . It certainly would have fared badly with [him]886-a baby boy , like a chicken had [she]58-julia not followed up [her]58-julia cry by darting into [the road]3464-the road , seizing [him]886-a baby boy , like a chicken by the shoulder , and flinging [him]886-a baby boy , like a chicken with considerable force against the green wayside bank . [She]58-julia was only just in time ; as it was , the foremost horse struck [her]58-julia shoulder and sent [her]58-julia rolling into the dust . For an instant [she]58-julia lay there , perilously near the big grinding wheels ; an almost imperceptible space , yet somehow long enough for [her]58-julia to decide quite calmly that it was impossible to scramble to [her]58-julia feet in time , so [she]58-julia had better draw [her]58-julia legs up and trust to the wheels missing [her]58-julia . Then suddenly the wheels stopped , and some one who had seized the horses ' heads addressed the waggoner with the English idiom that is perhaps most widely known . [Julia]58-julia heard " [damned fool]3591-damned fool "[58-julia] in quite unemotional English , and almost simultaneously the guttural shrieks of [two peasant women]889-two peasant women who approached . [She]58-julia picked [herself]58-julia up , then moving two paces to the side , stopped to put [her]58-julia hat straight with a calmness [she]58-julia did not quite feel . There was a volley of exclamations from [the peasant women]890-the peasant women , and " Are [you]58-julia hurt ? "[890-the peasant women] [the man who had stopped the horses]891-the man who had stopped the horses asked [her]58-julia , speaking now in Dutch , though with an English accent . " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered , winking back the water which had come into [her]58-julia eyes with the force of the blow , and [she]58-julia turned [her]58-julia back on [him]891-the man who had stopped the horses so that [he]891-the man who had stopped the horses should not see [her]58-julia do it . " [[My]58-julia good women]3592-my good women , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said shortly to [the peasants who , with upraised hands and many gestures , stared at [her]58-julia]892-the peasants who , with upraised hands and many gestures , stared at her , " there is nothing the matter , there is no reason why [you]892-the peasants who , with upraised hands and many gestures , stared at her should stand there and look at [me]58-julia ; [I]58-julia assure [you]892-the peasants who , with upraised hands and many gestures , stared at her [no one]181-no one has been hurt , and [no one]181-no one is going to be ; [you]892-the peasants who , with upraised hands and many gestures , stared at her had much better go on [your]892-the peasants who , with upraised hands and many gestures , stared at her way , as [I]58-julia shall do . Good - afternoon . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia walked a few paces down [the road]3464-the road , not in the direction [she]58-julia intended to go certainly , but [she]58-julia was too shaken for the moment to notice which way [she]58-julia took , and was only actuated by a desire to get away and put an end to a scene . The movement and the words were not without effect ; [the two women]894-the two women , a good deal astonished , obeyed automatically , and , picking up the burdens [they]894-the two women had set down , trudged on [their]894-the two women way , not realising for some time how much offended [they]894-the two women were at the curt behaviour of [the " mad English]3595-the " mad english . "[896-the waggoner] [The children]740-the children by this time had ceased staring and returned to [their]740-the children play ; [the waggoner]896-the waggoner , muttering some surly words , drove on . [Julia]58-julia sat on [the bank]897-the bank by [the roadside]898-the roadside , and tried to brush the dust from [her]58-julia dress . [The Englishman]804-the englishman , after making some parting remarks to [the waggoner]896-the waggoner , this time in Dutch , though still in the quiet , drawling voice which was much at variance with the language , had gone to pick up the basket . [She]58-julia wished [she]58-julia had thanked [him]804-the englishman for [his]804-the englishman timely assistance when [she]58-julia first scrambled to [her]58-julia feet , and gone on at once , then [she]58-julia could have done this necessary sitting down when [he]804-the englishman was out of sight , and come back for the stupid basket when [she]58-julia remembered it . But now [she]58-julia would have to thank [him]804-the englishman formally , and perhaps explain things , and say expressly that [she]58-julia was not hurt , and this while [she]58-julia was shaken and dusty . Mercifully [he]804-the englishman was English , and so would not expect much ; [she]58-julia looked at [his]804-the englishman back with satisfaction . [He]804-the englishman was scarcely as tall as [many Hollanders]901-many hollanders , but very differently built . To [Julia]58-julia , looking at [him]804-the englishman rather stupidly , [his]804-the englishman proportions , like [his]804-the englishman clothes , appeared very nearly perfect after those [she]58-julia had been used to seeing lately . When [he]804-the englishman turned and [she]58-julia saw for the first time [his]804-the englishman face , [she]58-julia was not very much surprised , though really it was surprising that [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew should still be hereabouts . [Their]902-their eyes met in mutual recognition . Afterwards [she]58-julia wondered why [she]58-julia did not pretend to be [Dutch]83-dutch , it ought to have been possible ; [he]804-the englishman had only seen [her]58-julia once before , and [her]58-julia knowledge of the language was much better than [his]804-the englishman . And even if [he]804-the englishman had not been deceived , [he]804-the englishman would have been bound to acquiesce to [her]58-julia pretence , had [she]58-julia persisted in it . But [she]58-julia did not think of it before [their]902-their mutual recognition had made it too late . " [I]804-the englishman hope [you]58-julia are not hurt , "[804-the englishman] [he]804-the englishman said , as [he]804-the englishman crossed [the road]3464-the road with the basket . " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered , " thanks to [you]804-the englishman — "[58-julia] But [he]804-the englishman , evidently sharing [her]58-julia dislike for a fuss , was even more anxious than [she]58-julia not to dwell on that , and dismissed the subject quickly . [He]804-the englishman began to wipe the bottom of the basket , from which soup was dripping , talking the while of the carelessness of [continental drivers]904-continental drivers and the silliness of [children of all nations]905-children of all nations , perhaps to give [her]58-julia time to recover . [She]58-julia agreed with [him]804-the englishman , and then repeated [her]58-julia thanks . [He]804-the englishman again set them aside . " It 's nothing , "[804-the englishman] [he]804-the englishman said ; " [I]804-the englishman am glad to have had the opportunity , especially since it also gives [me]804-the englishman the opportunity of offering [you]58-julia some apology for an unfortunate misunderstanding which arose when last [I]804-the englishman saw [you]58-julia .
