[You]58-julia must feel that it needs an apology . "[804-the englishman] For a moment [Julia]58-julia 's eyes showed [her]58-julia surprise ; an apology was not what [she]58-julia expected , and , to tell the truth , it did not altogether please [her]58-julia . [She]58-julia knew that [she]58-julia and [[her]58-julia father]210-her father had no right to it while the money was unpaid . " Please do not apologise , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " there is no need , [I]58-julia quite understand . "[58-julia] " [I]75-rawson - clew was labouring under a false impression , "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew explained . [She]58-julia nodded . " [I]58-julia know , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " but it is cleared up now ; [no one]181-no one who spoke with [[my]58-julia father]3392-my father could possibly imagine [he]3392-my father lived by [his]3392-my father wits . "[58-julia] Which ambiguous remark may have been meant to apply to [the Captain]172-the captain 's mental outfit more than [his]75-rawson - clew moral one . When [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew knew [Julia]58-julia better [he]75-rawson - clew came to the conclusion it probably did , at the time [he]75-rawson - clew thought it wise not to answer it . " Here is [your]58-julia basket , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said ; " [I]75-rawson - clew think it is clean now . "[75-rawson - clew] [She]58-julia made a movement to take it , but [her]58-julia arm was numb and powerless from the blow [she]58-julia had received ; it was the right shoulder which had been struck , and that hand was clearly useless for the time being ; with a wince of pain , [she]58-julia stretched out the left . But [he]75-rawson - clew drew the basket back . " [You]58-julia are hurt , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said . " No , [I]75-rawson - clew 'm not , nothing to speak of ; it only hurts [me]75-rawson - clew when [I]75-rawson - clew move that arm ; [I]75-rawson - clew will carry the basket with the other hand . "[75-rawson - clew] " How far have [you]75-rawson - clew to go ? "[58-julia] [She]58-julia told [him]75-rawson - clew to [the village]908-the village and back . " [You]58-julia had better go straight [home]249-home at once , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said . " [I]58-julia ca n't do that , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered . [She]58-julia did not explain that [she]58-julia did not want to , the pain in [her]58-julia shoulder not being bad enough to make [her]58-julia want to give up this first hour of freedom . " [My]58-julia shoulder does not hurt if [I]58-julia do not move it , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia can carry the basket with the other hand . "[58-julia] " Perhaps [you]58-julia will allow [me]75-rawson - clew to carry it for [you]58-julia ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew suggested ; " [I]75-rawson - clew am going the same way . "[75-rawson - clew] " No , thank [you]75-rawson - clew , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia returned . " Thanks very much for the offer , but there is n't any need ; [I]58-julia can manage quite well . [I]58-julia expect [you]75-rawson - clew will want to go faster than [I]58-julia do . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia spoke decidedly , and turned about quickly ; as [she]58-julia did so , [she]58-julia caught sight of the bottle of peach - brandy in the grass . " Oh , there 's the brandy , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia exclaimed ; " [I]58-julia must n't go without that . "[58-julia] [He]75-rawson - clew fetched the fortunately unbroken bottle and put it in the basket , but [he]75-rawson - clew did not give it to [her]58-julia . " [I]75-rawson - clew will carry this , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said ; " if [our]3599-our pace does not agree , if [you]58-julia would prefer to walk more slowly , [I]75-rawson - clew will wait for [you]58-julia at [the beginning of [the village]908-the village]3600-the beginning of the village . "[75-rawson - clew] [Julia]58-julia rose to [her]58-julia feet , there was no choice left to [her]58-julia but to acquiesce ; from [her]58-julia heart [she]58-julia wished [he]75-rawson - clew would leave the basket and go alone ; [she]58-julia wished even that [he]75-rawson - clew would be rude to [her]58-julia , [she]58-julia felt that then [he]75-rawson - clew would have been nearer [her]58-julia level and [[her]58-julia father]210-her father 's . [She]58-julia resented alike [his]75-rawson - clew presence and [his]75-rawson - clew courtesy , and [she]58-julia could not show either feeling , only accept what [he]75-rawson - clew offered and walk by [his]75-rawson - clew side , just as if no money was owed , and no letter , condescendingly cancelling the debt , had been written . [She]58-julia grew hot as [she]58-julia thought of that carefully worded letter , and hot when [she]58-julia thought of [[her]58-julia father]210-her father 's relief thereat . And here , here was [the man who must have dictated the letter , and probably paid the debt , behaving just as if such things never existed]911-the man who must have dictated the letter , and probably paid the debt , behaving just as if such things never existed . [He]75-rawson - clew was walking with [her]58-julia — [she]58-julia could not give [him]75-rawson - clew ten yards start and follow [him]75-rawson - clew into [the village]908-the village — and making polite conversations about the weather , and [the road]3464-the road , and the quantity of soup that had been spilled . [She]58-julia pulled [herself]58-julia together , and , feeling the situation to be beyond remedy , determined to bear [herself]58-julia bravely , and carry it off with what credit [she]58-julia could . [She]58-julia glanced at the more than half - empty soup can . " [I]58-julia am afraid [you]75-rawson - clew are right , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " there is a great deal of it gone ; still , that is not without advantage — [I]58-julia shall be sent to take some more in a day or two . "[58-julia] " [You]75-rawson - clew wish that ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew inquired . " Yes , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered , " [I]58-julia find the exercise beneficial ; [I]58-julia have had too much pudding lately . "[58-julia] [He]75-rawson - clew looked politely surprised , and [she]58-julia went on to explain . " It is very wholesome , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " but a bit stodgy ; [I]58-julia think it is too really good to be taken in such large quantities by [any one like [me]58-julia]3602-any one like me . It is unbelievably good , it makes [one]3325-one perfectly ashamed of [oneself]3325-one ; and unbelievably narrow , it makes one long for bed - time . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia broke off to smile at [his]75-rawson - clew more genuine surprise , and [her]58-julia smile , like that of [some other people of little real beauty]914-some other people of little real beauty , was one of singular charm . " Did [you]75-rawson - clew think [I]58-julia meant actual pudding ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked . " [I]58-julia did n't ; [I]58-julia meant just the whole life here ; if [you]75-rawson - clew knew [the people]3500-the people well , [the real middle class ones]3605-the real middle class ones , [you]75-rawson - clew would understand . "[58-julia] " [I]75-rawson - clew think [I]75-rawson - clew can understand without knowing [them]3500-the people well , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said ; " [I]75-rawson - clew fancy there is a good deal of pudding about ; in fact , [I]75-rawson - clew [myself]75-rawson - clew am feeling its rather oppressive influence . "[75-rawson - clew] " [The town]569-the town is paved with it , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia declared . " [I]58-julia thought so this afternoon . [I]58-julia also thought , though it is Tuesday , it was just like a spring Sunday ; every day is like that . "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew suggested that [many people]915-many people appreciated spring Sundays . " So do [I]58-julia , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia agreed , " but in moderation ; [you]75-rawson - clew ca n't do [your]75-rawson - clew washing on Sunday , nor [your]75-rawson - clew harvesting in spring . "[58-julia] [He]75-rawson - clew wondered a little what week - day work [she]58-julia had in [her]58-julia mind , but [he]75-rawson - clew did not ask . " Are [you]58-julia living with [a Dutch family]477-a dutch family ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew inquired . [She]58-julia nodded . " As [companion]428-companion , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " sort of [superior general servant]3609-superior general servant . "[58-julia] " Indeed ? Then it must have been [you]75-rawson - clew [I]75-rawson - clew saw yesterday ; [I]75-rawson - clew thought so at the time ; [you]75-rawson - clew were driving with [some Dutch ladies]3610-some dutch ladies . "[75-rawson - clew] [Julia]58-julia was surprised that [he]75-rawson - clew had seen and recognised [her]58-julia . " [We]3611-we went for an excursion yesterday , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [they]3612-they called it a picnic . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia told [him]75-rawson - clew about it , not omitting any of the points which had amused [her]58-julia . Could [Joost]90-joost have heard [her]58-julia , [he]75-rawson - clew would have felt that [his]75-rawson - clew suspicion that [she]58-julia sometimes laughed at [them]916-them more than justified ; but [she]58-julia did not give a thought to [Joost]90-joost , and probably would not have paused if [she]58-julia had . [She]58-julia wanted to pass the present time , and [she]58-julia was rather reckless how , so long as [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew either talked [himself]75-rawson - clew , or seemed interested in what [she]58-julia said ; also , it must be admitted , though it was to [this man]402-this man , it was something of a treat to talk freely again . So [she]58-julia gave [him]75-rawson - clew the best account [she]58-julia could , not only of the excursion , but of other things too . And if it was [his]75-rawson - clew attention [she]58-julia wanted , [she]58-julia should have been satisfied , for [she]58-julia apparently had it , at first only the interest of courtesy , afterwards something more ; it even seemed , before the end , as if [she]58-julia puzzled [him]75-rawson - clew a little , in spite of [his]75-rawson - clew years and experience . [He]75-rawson - clew found [himself]75-rawson - clew mentally contrasting the life at [the Van Heigens ']78-the van heigens , as [she]58-julia described it , with that which [he]75-rawson - clew had imagined [her]58-julia to have led at [Marbridge]61-denah , and , now that [he]75-rawson - clew talked to [her]58-julia , [he]75-rawson - clew could not find [her]58-julia exact place in either . " [You]58-julia must find Dutch conventionality rather trying , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said at last . " [I]58-julia am not used to it yet , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered ; " when [I]58-julia am it will be no worse than the conventionality at [home]249-home . "[58-julia] [He]75-rawson - clew felt [he]75-rawson - clew was wrong in one of [his]75-rawson - clew surmises ; clearly [she]58-julia was not really [Bohemian]102-bohemian . " Surely , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , " [you]58-julia have not found these absurd rules and restrictions in [England]8-england ? "[75-rawson - clew] " Not the same ones ; [we]3614-we study appearances one way , and [they]3615-they do another ; but it comes to the same thing , so far as [I]102-bohemian am concerned . One day [I]102-bohemian hope to be able to give it up and retire ; when [I]102-bohemian do [I]102-bohemian shall wear corduroy breeches and if [I]102-bohemian happen to be in [the kitchen]220-the kitchen eating onions when [people]3334-people come to see [me]102-bohemian , [I]102-bohemian shall call [them]3334-people in and offer [them]3334-people a share . "[102-bohemian] " Rather an uncomfortable ambition , is n't that ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew inquired . " [I]75-rawson - clew am afraid [you]58-julia will have to wait some time for its fulfilment , especially the corduroy . "[58-julia] " [I]75-rawson - clew do n't think [you]75-rawson - clew could afford it even for that ; do [you]75-rawson - clew think [women]3573-women ever can afford that kind of disregard for appearances ? "[75-rawson - clew] " [Plain ones]3622-plain ones can , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " it is the only compensation [they]3622-plain ones have for being plain ; not much , certainly , seeing what [they]3622-plain ones lose , but [they]3622-plain ones have it . "[58-julia] " That is a rather unusual idea , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]918-i remarked ; " it appears sound in theory , but in practice — "[75-rawson - clew] " Sounder still , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered [him]918-i . [He]918-i laughed . "[918-i] " [They]3622-plain ones do do that , "[75-rawson - clew] [she]58-julia admitted ; " [they]3622-plain ones just worship propriety and the correct , and have the greatest notion of the importance of [[their]3622-plain ones neighbours]3627-their neighbours ' eyes . It is a perfect treat to be out alone , and not have to regard [them]3622-plain ones — this is the first time [I]918-i have been out alone since [I]918-i have been [here]371-here . "[918-i] " Rather hard ; [I]918-i thought [every one]582-every one had — er — time off . "[918-i] " An evening out ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia suggested . " [I]58-julia believe the number of evenings out is regulated by the number of applications for the post when vacant ; [cooks]3630-cooks could get more evenings than [housemaids]3631-housemaids , and [nursery governesses]3632-nursery governesses might naturally expect a minus number , if that were possible . There would be lots of applications for [my]58-julia post , so [I]58-julia ca n't expect many evenings ; however , [I]58-julia have thought of a plan by which [I]58-julia can get out again and again ! "[58-julia] " What will [you]58-julia do ? "[919-he] [he]919-he inquired . " [I]919-he shall get [Denah]61-denah — [she]61-denah is one of [the girls who went for the excursion]3633-the girls who went for the excursion — to come and teach [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw a new crochet pattern after dinner of a day . It will take ages , [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw learns very slowly , and [Denah]61-denah will know better than to hurry matters ; [she]61-denah admires [Mijnheer Joost]90-joost , [[the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ' son]3634-the van heigens ' son , and [she]61-denah will be only too delighted to have an excuse to come to [the house]175-the house . "[919-he] " And if [she]61-denah is [there]180-there [you]919-he will have a little leisure ? [Some one]3318-some one always has to be on duty ? Is that it ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia laughed softly . " If [she]61-denah is [there]180-there , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " [she]61-denah will want [me]58-julia out of the way , and [I]58-julia am not satisfactorily out of the way when [I]58-julia am anywhere on [the premises]3639-the premises . Not that [Mijnheer Joost]90-joost talks to [me]58-julia when [I]58-julia am [there]180-there , or would talk to [her]61-denah if [I]58-julia were not ; [she]61-denah just mistrusts [every unmarried female]3641-every unmarried female by instinct . "[58-julia] " [A girl]201-a girl 's instinct in such matters is not always wrong , "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew observed . " [I]58-julia should not think of interfering in such an affair , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " why , it would be the most suitable thing in [the world]208-the world , as suitable as it is for [[my]58-julia handsome and able sister]3644-my handsome and able sister to marry [the ambitious and able nephew of [a bishop]3646-a bishop]3645-the ambitious and able nephew of a bishop ; [they]3647-they are [the two halves that make one whole]3648-the two halves that make one whole . [Denah]61-denah and [Joost]90-joost would live a perfectly ideal pudding life ; [he]90-joost with [his]90-joost flowers — that is [his]90-joost work , [you]3649-you know ; [he]90-joost cares for nothing besides , really — and [she]58-julia with [[her]58-julia housekeeping]3650-her housekeeping . [He]90-joost with a little music for relaxation , [she]58-julia with [[her]58-julia neighbours]3651-her neighbours and accomplishments ; it would be as neat and complete and suitable as anything could be . "[58-julia] " And that commends it to [you]921-you ? [I]75-rawson - clew should have imagined that what was incongruous and odd pleased [you]921-you better . "[75-rawson - clew] " [I]58-julia like that too , "[58-julia] [she]920-she was obliged to admit , " though best when [the people concerned]3652-the people concerned do n't see the incongruity ; but [I]920-she do n't really care either way , whether things are incongruous or suitable , [I]920-she enjoy both , and should never interfere so long as [they]3652-the people concerned do n't upset [my]920-she concerns and the end in view . "[920-she] [He]921-you looked at [her]920-she curiously ; again it seemed [he]921-you was at fault ; [she]920-she was not merely [a wayward girl in revolt against convention , saying what [she]920-she deemed daring for the sake of saying it , and in the effort to be original]922-a wayward girl in revolt against convention , saying what she deemed daring for the sake of saying it , and in the effort to be original . [She]920-she was not posing as [a Bohemian]923-a bohemian any more than [she]920-she was truly one . " Have [you]920-she usually an end in view ? "[921-you] [he]921-you asked . " Have not [you]921-you ? "[920-she] [she]920-she answered , turning on [him]921-you for a moment eyes that [Joost]90-joost had described as " eating up what [they]3652-the people concerned looked at . "[920-she] " Of course , "[920-she] [she]920-she said , looking away again , " it is quite natural , and very possible , that [you]921-you are here for no purpose , and [I]920-she am here for no purpose too ; [you]921-you might quite well have come to [this little town]3653-this little town for amusement , and [I]920-she have come for the money [I]920-she might earn as [a companion]453-a companion . Or [you]921-you might have drifted [here]371-here by accident , as [I]920-she might , without any special reason — "[920-she] [She]920-she stopped as [she]920-she spoke ; [they]924-they were fast approaching [the first house of [the village]908-the village]925-the first house of the village now , and [she]920-she held out [her]920-she hand for the basket . " [I]920-she will take it , "[920-she] [she]920-she said ; " [I]920-she have a very short distance to go ; thank [you]927-he so much . "[920-she] " Let [me]927-he carry it the rest of the way , "[927-he] [he]927-he insisted ; " [I]927-he am going through [the village]908-the village ; [we]924-they may as well go the rest of the way together , [I]927-he want [you]58-julia to tell [me]927-he — "[927-he] But [Julia]58-julia did not tell [him]927-he anything , except that [her]58-julia way was by the footpath which turned off to the right . " [I]920-she could not think of troubling [you]927-he further , "[920-she] [she]920-she said . " Thank [you]927-he . "[920-she] [She]920-she put [her]920-she hand on the basket , so that [he]927-he was obliged to yield it ; then , with another word of thanks , [she]920-she said " good - evening , "[920-she] and started by [the path]566-the path . For a moment [he]927-he looked after [her]920-she , annoyed and interested against [his]927-he will ; of course , [she]920-she meant nothing by [her]920-she words about [his]927-he purpose and [her]920-she own , still it gave [him]927-he food for reflection about [her]920-she , and the apparent incongruity of [her]920-she present surroundings . On the whole , [he]927-he was glad [he]927-he had met [her]920-she , partly for the entertainment [she]920-she had given , and partly for the opportunity [he]927-he had had to apologise . An apology was due to [her]920-she for the affair of last winter , [he]927-he felt it ; though , at the same time , [he]927-he could not hold [himself]927-he much to blame in the matter . [He]927-he had gone to [Marbridge]61-denah to see into [[his]927-he young cousin]929-his young cousin 's affairs at the request of [[the boy]930-the boy 's widowed mother]931-the boy 's widowed mother . The affairs , as might have been expected , were in muddle enough , and [the boy]930-the boy [himself]930-the boy was incorrigibly silly and extravagant . The whole business needed tact and patience , and in the end had not been very satisfactorily arranged ; during the process [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington 's name had been mentioned more than once ; [he]927-he figured , among other ways , of spending much and getting little in return . Somehow or [other Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew had got the impression that [the Captain]172-the captain was — well , perhaps pretty much what [he]172-the captain really had come to be ; and if that was not quite what [[his]927-he wife]168-his wife had persuaded [herself]168-his wife and half [Marbridge]61-denah to think [him]172-the captain , surely [no one]181-no one was to blame . The mistake made was about [[the Captain]172-the captain 's wife]937-the captain 's wife and [daughters]868-daughters and position in [the town]569-the town ; [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew , in the first instance , never gave [them]940-them a thought ; [the Captain]172-the captain was [a detached person in [his]172-the captain mind , and , as such , a possible danger to [[his]172-the captain cousin]3389-his cousin 's loose cash]942-a detached person in his mind , and , as such , a possible danger to his cousin 's loose cash . [He]172-the captain went to [No . 27]373-no . 27 to talk plainly to [the man]820-the man , not to tell [him]820-the man [he]820-the man was [a shark]946-a shark and [an adventurer]3379-an adventurer ; it was [the Captain [himself]172-the captain who translated and exaggerated thus ; not even to tell [him]820-the man what [he]820-the man thought , that [he]820-the man was [a worthless old sponge]949-a worthless old sponge , but to make it plain that things would not go on as [they]940-them had been doing]948-the captain himself who translated and exaggerated thus ; not even to tell him what he thought , that he was a worthless old sponge , but to make it plain that things would not go on as they had been doing . [The girl]415-the girl 's interruption had been annoying , so ill - timed and out of place ; [she]415-the girl ought to have gone at once when [he]172-the captain suggested it ; [she]415-the girl had placed [him]172-the captain and [herself]415-the girl , too , in an embarrassing position ; yet , at the same time — [he]172-the captain saw it now , though [he]172-the captain did not earlier — there was something quaint in the way [she]415-the girl had both metaphorically and actually stood between [him]172-the captain and [[her]415-the girl miserable old father]951-her miserable old father . [He]172-the captain had dictated the subsequent letter to [the Captain]172-the captain more on [her]415-the girl account than anything else . [He]172-the captain considered that by it [he]172-the captain was making [her]415-the girl the amend honourable for the unfortunate interview of the afternoon , as well as closing the incident . Of course , nothing real was forfeited by the letter , for under no circumstances would the money have been repaid ; [he]172-the captain never had any delusion about that . From which it appears that [his]172-the captain opinion of [the Captain]172-the captain had not changed . As for [his]172-the captain opinion of [Julia]58-julia , [he]172-the captain had not one when [he]172-the captain first saw [her]58-julia , except that [she]58-julia had no business to be [there]180-there ; now , however , [he]172-the captain felt some little interest in [her]58-julia . There was very little that was interesting in [this small Dutch town]955-this small dutch town ; it was a refreshing change , [he]172-the captain admitted it to [himself]172-the captain , to see [a girl here who put [her]956-a girl here who put her clothes on properly clothes on properly]956-a girl here who put her clothes on properly ; something of a change to meet [one anywhere who did not at once fall into one of the well - defined categories]957-one anywhere who did not at once fall into one of the well - defined categories . Much in [this world]958-this world has to be lain at the door of opportunity , and idleness in youth , and ennui and boredom in middle ages . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew was in [the borderland between [the two]960-the two]959-the borderland between the two , and did not consider [himself]172-the captain open to the temptations of either . [He]172-the captain was not idle , [he]172-the captain had things to do ; and [he]172-the captain was not bored , [he]172-the captain had things to think about ; but not enough of either to prevent [him]172-the captain from having a wide margin . When [he]172-the captain met [Julia]58-julia again there was no reason for dropping the acquaintance renewed through necessity . But also there was no opportunity , on that occasion , for pushing it further , even if there had been inclination , for [she]58-julia was not alone . It was on Saturday evening ; [she]58-julia was walking down [the same road]961-the same road , much about the same time , but there was with [her]58-julia [a tall , fair young man , with a long face and loose limbs]962-a tall , fair young man , with a long face and loose limbs . [He]962-a tall , fair young man , with a long face and loose limbs carried , of course , an umbrella — that was part of [his]962-a tall , fair young man , with a long face and loose limbs full dress — and the basket — [he]962-a tall , fair young man , with a long face and loose limbs walked between [her]58-julia and [the cart track]963-the cart track . [She]58-julia bowed sedately to [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew , and [the young man]191-the young man , becoming tardily aware of it , took off [his]962-a tall , fair young man , with a long face and loose limbs hat , rather late , and with a sweeping foreign flourish . [She]58-julia wore a pair of cotton gloves , and lifted [her]58-julia dress a few inches , and glanced shyly up at [[her]58-julia escort]965-her escort now and then as [he]172-the captain talked . [They]966-they were speaking Dutch , and [she]58-julia was behaving Dutch , as plain and demure [a person]967-a person as it was possible to imagine , until [she]58-julia looked back , then [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew saw a very devil of mockery and mischief flash up in [her]58-julia eyes . Only for a second ; the expression was gone before [her]58-julia head was turned again , and that was decorously soon . But it had been there ; it was like the momentary parting of the clouds on a grey day ; it illumined [her]58-julia whole face — [her]58-julia mind , too , perhaps — as the eerie , tricky gleam , which is gone before [a man]406-a man knows it , lights up the level landscape , and transforms it to something new and strange . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew walked on ahead of [the pair]969-the pair ; [he]75-rawson - clew had to outpace [them]969-the pair , since [he]75-rawson - clew was bound the same way , and could not walk with [them]969-the pair . [He]75-rawson - clew was not sure that [he]75-rawson - clew was not rather sorry for [Denah]61-denah , [the Dutch girl]970-the dutch girl ; one who can laugh at [herself]61-denah as well as another , and all alone , too , is [he]75-rawson - clew thought , rather apt to enjoy the incongruous more than the suitable .

[Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen was learning a new crochet pattern ; [one]3325-one did it in thread of a Sèvres blue shade ; when several long strips were made , one sewed them together with pieces of black satin between each two , and there was an antimacassar of severe but rich beauty . [Denah]61-denah explained all this as [she]61-denah set [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw to work on the pattern ; it was very intricate , quite exciting , because it was so difficult ; the more excited [the old lady]553-the old lady became the more mistakes [she]553-the old lady made , but it did not matter ; [Denah]61-denah was patience itself , and did not seem to mind how much time [she]61-denah gave . [She]61-denah came every day after dinner ( that is to say , about six o'clock ) , and when [she]61-denah came it was frequently found necessary that [Julia]58-julia should go to inquire after [the invalid cousin]973-the invalid cousin . [Denah]61-denah thought [herself]61-denah [the deepest and most diplomatic young woman in [Holland]7-holland]974-the deepest and most diplomatic young woman in holland ; [she]61-denah even found it in [her]61-denah heart to pity [Julia]58-julia , [the poor companion , who [she]61-denah used as a pawn in [her]61-denah romance]975-the poor companion , who she used as a pawn in her romance . The which , since it was transparently obvious to [the pawn]976-the pawn , gave [her]61-denah vast , though private , delight . So [Julia]58-julia went almost daily down [the long flat road]977-the long flat road to [the village]908-the village , and very often [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew had to go that way too ; and when [he]75-rawson - clew did , [his]75-rawson - clew time of going being of necessity much the same time as [hers]58-julia , [he]75-rawson - clew was almost bound to walk with [her]58-julia . There was but one way to [the place]241-the place ; [they]980-they must either walk together in the middle of [the road]3464-the road , or else separately , one side of [it]3464-the road ; and seeing that [they]980-they were of the same nationality , in [a foreign land]982-a foreign land , and had some previous acquaintance , it would have been nothing short of absurd to have done the latter . So as often as [they]980-they met [they]980-they walked together and talked of many things , and in the course of time [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew came to find [Julia]58-julia 's company a good deal more entertaining than [his]75-rawson - clew own ; although [she]58-julia had read nothing [she]58-julia ought to have read , seen nothing [she]58-julia ought to have seen , and occasionally both thought and said things [she]58-julia certainly ought not , and was not even conventionally unconventional . [They]980-they usually parted at the footpath , which shortened [her]58-julia way a little , [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew giving [her]58-julia the basket there , and going down [the road]3464-the road alone ; in consequence of this it was some time before [she]58-julia knew for certain where it was [he]75-rawson - clew went , although [she]58-julia had early guessed . But one damp evening [she]58-julia departed from [her]58-julia usual custom . It had been raining heavily all day , and although it had cleared now , a thick mist lay over [the wet fields]984-the wet fields . " [I]58-julia shall have to go round by [the road]3464-the road , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , as [she]58-julia looked at [the track]985-the track . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew agreed with [her]58-julia . " [I]75-rawson - clew am rather surprised that [you]58-julia came out at all this evening , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew remarked . " [I]75-rawson - clew should have thought [[your]58-julia careful friends]3658-your careful friends would have been afraid of colds and wet feet . "[75-rawson - clew] " [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen was , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered , " but [Denah]61-denah and [I]58-julia were not . It is the last opportunity [we]3659-we shall have for a little while ; [Joost]90-joost goes to [Germany]10-germany on business to - morrow . "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew laughed . " Which means , [I]75-rawson - clew suppose , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , " that [she]58-julia will neglect the crochet work , and [you]58-julia will have to superintend it ? Not very congenial to [you]58-julia , is it ? "[75-rawson - clew] " Good discipline , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia told [him]75-rawson - clew . " And for that reason to be welcomed ? Really [you]58-julia deserve to succeed in whatever it is [you]58-julia are attempting ; [you]58-julia do not neglect details . "[58-julia] " Details are often important , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " stopping at [home]249-home and doing crochet work while [Joost]90-joost is in [Germany]10-germany , for instance , may help [me]58-julia a good deal . "[58-julia] The tone struck [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew as implying more than the words said , but [he]75-rawson - clew did not ask for an interpretation , and before long [she]58-julia had put a question to [him]75-rawson - clew . [They]986-they were nearing [a large house that stood far back from [the road]3464-the road on the left hand side]987-a large house that stood far back from the road on the left hand side . [It]987-a large house that stood far back from the road on the left hand side was [a big block of [a place]990-a place]989-a big block of a place , greyish - white in colour , and with more than half of [its]987-a large house that stood far back from the road on the left hand side windows bricked up , indescribably gloomy . A long , straight piece of water lay before [it]987-a large house that stood far back from the road on the left hand side , stretching almost from the walls to [the road]3464-the road , from which [it]987-a large house that stood far back from the road on the left hand side was separated by a low fence . Tall , thick trees grew in a close row on either side , narrowing the prospect ; a path ran up beside [them]986-they on the one hand , the only way to [the house]175-the house , but in the steamy mist which lay thick over everything this evening one could hardly see it , and it looked as if [the place]241-the place were unapproachable from the front . [Julia]58-julia glanced curiously towards [the house]175-the house ; [it]175-the house was [the only one of any size or possible interest in [the village]908-the village]995-the only one of any size or possible interest in the village ; the only one , [she]58-julia had decided some time ago , that [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew could have any reason to visit . " [He]88-herr van de greutz is , "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew agreed , " and one much absorbed in [his]88-herr van de greutz work ; it is impossible to see [him]88-herr van de greutz even on business except in the evening . "[75-rawson - clew] [He]75-rawson - clew paused by the gate as [he]75-rawson - clew spoke . " [You]58-julia have not much further to go , have [you]58-julia ? " [You]75-rawson - clew are afraid of what will be said next , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia thought as [she]58-julia looked back at [the man]820-the man , who was already vanishing among the mists by [the lake]998-the lake . And the thought pleased [her]58-julia somewhat , for it suggested that [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew had a respect for [her]58-julia acumen , and also that [her]58-julia private fancy — that the business which brought [him]820-the man [here]371-here was not of a kind for public discussion — was correct . [The cousin]3661-the cousin was better that evening ; [she]3661-the cousin even expressed hopes of living through the summer , a thing [she]3661-the cousin had not done for more than three days . [Julia]58-julia cheered and encouraged [her]3661-the cousin in this belief ( which , indeed , there was every reason to think well founded ) and gave [her]3661-the cousin the messages and dainties [she]3661-the cousin had brought . After that [they]1001-they talked of the weather , which was bad ; and [the neighbours , who , on the whole , were good]1002-the neighbours , who , on the whole , were good . [Julia]58-julia knew most of [them]1002-the neighbours , who , on the whole , were good by name by this time — [the kind old Padre]1003-the kind old padre and [[his]1003-the kind old padre wife]168-his wife ; [the captain of [the little cargo - boat]1006-the little cargo - boat]1005-the captain of the little cargo - boat , who drank a little , and [[his]1003-the kind old padre generous wife]1007-his generous wife , who talked a great deal ; [the fat woman who kept fowls]1008-the fat woman who kept fowls , and the thin one who sometimes stole the eggs . [Julia]58-julia had heard all about them before , but [she]58-julia heard over again , and a little about [the great chemist]1009-the great chemist , [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz , too . [This great man]1010-this great man was naturally only a name to [the invalid]1011-the invalid and [[her]1011-the invalid friends]414-her friends , but [they]1001-they had always plenty to say about [him]1010-this great man . [He]1010-this great man was so distinguished that all [the village]908-the village felt proud to have [him]1010-this great man live on [their]908-the village borders , and so disagreeable that [they]908-the village were decidedly in awe of [him]1010-this great man . Of [his]1010-this great man domestic arrangements there was always talk ; [he]1010-this great man lived in [[his]1010-this great man great gloomy house]1014-his great gloomy house with [an old housekeeper]1015-an old housekeeper , whom [Julia]58-julia knew by sight , and [a young cook , whom [she]58-julia did not]1016-a young cook , whom she did not ; the former was a permanency , [the latter very much the reverse]1017-the latter very much the reverse , it being difficult to find [a cook equal to [his]1010-this great man demands who would for any length of time endure the shortness of [the housekeeper]1019-the housekeeper 's temper , and the worse one of [[her]1019-the housekeeper master]1020-her master]1018-a cook equal to his demands who would for any length of time endure the shortness of the housekeeper 's temper , and the worse one of her master . The domestic affairs of [the chemist]1021-the chemist were a favourite subject of gossip , but sometimes [his]1010-this great man attainments came in for mention too ; they did to - night , [the cousin]3661-the cousin being in a garrulous mood . According to [her]58-julia , [the great man]1023-the great man had done everything in science worth mentioning , and was not only [the first chemist in [Holland]7-holland]1024-the first chemist in holland , but in all [the world]208-the world ; [he]1010-this great man looked down on all others , [she]58-julia said , regarding [two Germans]1026-two germans only as anything approaching [[his]1010-this great man peers]1027-his peers , all the English and French being nothing to [him]1010-this great man . [He]1010-this great man had discovered a great many things , dyes , poisons , and explosives ; of the last [he]1010-this great man had recently perfected one which was twenty - two times stronger than anything before known . Its nature was , of course , a secret , but it would eventually raise [the little army of [Holland]7-holland]1028-the little army of holland far above those of [all other nations]1029-all other nations . [Julia]58-julia listened , but especially to the last piece of information , which struck [her]58-julia as being the one most likely to prove interesting . Soon after hearing it , however , [she]58-julia was obliged to go . [She]58-julia made [her]58-julia farewells , and received messages of affection for [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , condolence for [Mijnheer]90-joost — who had a cold — and good wishes for [Joost]90-joost 's journey . Then [she]58-julia started homewards , with a light basket and a busy mind . It did not take [her]58-julia very long to decide that if there was any truth in this talk of [Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's achievements , it must be the last mentioned — the explosive — which brought [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew [here]371-here . [Her]58-julia judgment of [men]3625-men , for working purposes at least , was quick and fairly accurate , necessity and experience had helped [Nature]93-nature to make it so . There were one or two things in connection with [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew which were very clear to [her]58-julia , [he]75-rawson - clew was not [a scientist]1032-a scientist pure and simple ; [she]58-julia had never met one , but [she]58-julia knew [he]75-rawson - clew was not one , and so was not likely to be interested in [the great chemist for chemistry]1033-the great chemist for chemistry only . Nor was [he]75-rawson - clew [a commercial man]1034-a commercial man ; neither [his]75-rawson - clew instincts nor [his]75-rawson - clew abilities lay in that direction ; it was not a new process , not a trade secret which brought [him]75-rawson - clew [here]371-here . Indeed , even though [he]75-rawson - clew might appreciate the value of such things , [he]75-rawson - clew would never dream of trying to possess [himself]75-rawson - clew of them . [Julia]58-julia understood perfectly the scale in which such acts stood to [men like [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew]1036-men like rawson - clew . To attempt to master [a man]406-a man 's discovery for [one]3325-one 's own ends ( as in a way [she]58-julia was doing ) was impossible , rank dishonesty , never even contemplated ; to do it for business purposes — well , [he]75-rawson - clew might admit it was sometimes necessary in business — commerce had its morality as law , and [the army]435-the army had [theirs]435-the army — but it was not a thing [he]75-rawson - clew would ever do [himself]75-rawson - clew , [he]75-rawson - clew would not feel it exactly honourable . But to attempt to gain a secret for national use was quite another thing , not only justifiable but right , more especially if , as was probably the case , the attempt was in fulfilment of a direct order . If after [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz had a secret worth anything to [England]8-england , it was that which had brought [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew to [the little town]1040-the little town . [She]58-julia was as sure of it as [she]58-julia was that it was the blue daffodil which had brought [her]58-julia . The hateful blue daffodil ! Daily , to possess it grew more imperative . The intercourse with [this man]402-this man , the curious seeming equality that was being established between [them]1042-them , cried aloud for the paying of the debt , and the establishing of the reality of equality . [She]58-julia longed almost passionately to be able to regard [herself]58-julia , to know that [the man]820-the man had reason to regard [her]58-julia , as [[his]820-the man equal]1044-his equal . And yet to possess the thing seemed daily more difficult ; more and more plainly did [she]58-julia see that bribery , persuasion , cajolery were alike useless . The precious bulb could be got in one way , and one only ; it would never fall into [her]58-julia hands by skilful accident , or nicely stimulated generosity ; [she]58-julia must take it , or [she]58-julia must do without it . [She]58-julia must get it for [herself]58-julia as deliberately as , in all probability , [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew meant to get [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's secret . [She]58-julia raised [her]58-julia head and looked at the flat , wet landscape with unseeing eyes that were contemptuous . How different two not dissimilar acts could be made to look ! If [she]58-julia took the daffodil — and [she]58-julia would have unique opportunity to try during the next two days — [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew would regard [her]58-julia as little better than [a common thief]1045-a common thief ; that is , if [he]820-the man happened to know about it . [She]58-julia winced a little as [she]58-julia thought of the faint expression of surprise the knowledge would call up in [his]820-the man impassive face and cold grey eyes . [She]58-julia could well imagine the slight difference in [his]820-the man manner to [her]58-julia afterwards , scarcely noticeable to [the casual observer]1046-the casual observer , impossible to be overlooked by [her]58-julia . [She]58-julia told [herself]58-julia [she]58-julia did not care what [he]820-the man thought ; but [she]58-julia did . Pride was grasping at a desired , but impossible , equality with [this man]402-this man , and here , were the means used only known , was the nearest way to lose it . At times [he]820-the man had forgotten the gap of age and circumstances between [them]1048-them — really forgotten it , [she]58-julia knew , not only ignored it in [his]820-the man well - bred way . [He]820-the man had for a moment really regarded [her]58-julia as [an equal]1049-an equal ; not , perhaps , as [he]820-the man might [the women of [his]820-the man class]1050-the women of his class , rather [the men of like experience]1051-the men of like experience and attainments with [himself]820-the man . That was not what [she]58-julia wanted , but [she]58-julia recognised plainly that in grasping at a shadowy social feminine equality by paying the debt , [she]58-julia might well lose this small substance of masculine equality , for there is no gulf so unbridgeable between [man]1052-man and [man]1052-man as a different standard of honour . But after all , [she]58-julia asked [herself]58-julia , what did it matter ? [He]820-the man need not know ; [she]58-julia would pay , fulfilling [her]58-julia word , and proving [[her]58-julia father]210-her father [an honest man]1055-an honest man ( which [he]820-the man was not ) ; [the debtor]1056-the debtor could not know how it was done . And if [he]820-the man did , what then ? If [she]58-julia told [him]820-the man [herself]58-julia — [he]820-the man would know no other way — [she]58-julia would do it deliberately with the set purpose of tarring [him]820-the man with the same brush ; [she]58-julia would show [him]820-the man how [his]820-the man attempt on [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz might also be made to look . [He]820-the man would not be convinced , of course , but at bottom the two things were so related that it would be surprising if [she]58-julia did not get a few shafts [home]249-home . [He]820-the man would not show the wounds then , but they would be there ; they would rankle ; there would be some humiliation for [him]820-the man , too . A curious light crept into [her]58-julia eyes at the thought ; [she]58-julia was surer of being able to reduce [him]820-the man than of exalting [herself]58-julia , and it is good , when circumstances prevent [one]3325-one from mounting , to drag a superior to the level of [one]3325-one 's humiliation . For a moment [she]58-julia understood something of the feelings of the brute mob that throws mud . By this time [she]58-julia had reached [the town]569-the town , though almost without knowing it ; so deep was [she]58-julia in [her]58-julia thoughts that [she]58-julia did not see [Joost]90-joost coming towards [her]58-julia . [He]90-joost had been to escort [Denah]61-denah , who had thoughtfully forgotten to provide [herself]61-denah with a cloak ; [he]90-joost was now coming back , carrying the wrap [[his]90-joost mother]3412-his mother had lent [her]61-denah . [Julia]58-julia started when [she]58-julia became aware of [him]90-joost just in front of [her]58-julia . [She]58-julia was not pleased to see [him]90-joost ; [she]58-julia had no room for [him]90-joost in [her]58-julia mind just then ; [he]90-joost seemed incongruous and out of place . [She]58-julia even looked at [him]90-joost a little suspiciously , as if [she]58-julia were afraid the fermenting thoughts in [her]58-julia brain might make themselves felt by [him]90-joost . [He]90-joost turned and walked beside [her]58-julia . " [I]90-joost have been to take [home]249-home [Miss Denah]103-denah , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost explained . " [I]90-joost saw [you]58-julia a long way off , and thought perhaps [I]90-joost might escort [you]58-julia ; but [you]58-julia are angry ; [I]90-joost am sorry . "[90-joost] [Julia]58-julia could not forbear smiling at [him]90-joost . " [I]58-julia am not angry , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , as [she]58-julia would to [a child]824-a child ; " [I]58-julia was only thinking . "[58-julia] " Of something unpleasant , then , that makes [you]90-joost angry ? "[58-julia] " No ; of something that must have been enjoyable . [I]58-julia was thinking how , in the French Revolution , [the women of [the people]3500-the people]3664-the women of the people must have enjoyed throwing mud at [the women of [the aristocrats]3667-the aristocrats]3666-the women of the aristocrats ; how [they]3664-the women of the people must have liked scratching the paint and the skin from [their]3664-the women of the people faces , and tearing [their]3664-the women of the people hair down , and [their]3664-the women of the people clothes off . "[58-julia] [Joost]90-joost stared in amazement . " Do [you]58-julia call that not unpleasant ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said . " It is the most grievous , the most pitiable thing in all [the world]208-the world . "[90-joost] " For [the aristocrats]3667-the aristocrats , yes , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia agreed ; " but for [the others]312-the others ? Can [you]90-joost not imagine how [they]312-the others must have revelled in it ? "[58-julia] [Joost]90-joost could not ; [he]90-joost could not imagine anything violent or terrible , and [Julia]58-julia went on to ask [him]90-joost another question , which , however , [she]58-julia answered [herself]58-julia . " Do [you]90-joost know why [the women of [the people]3500-the people]3664-the women of the people did it ? It was not only because [the others]312-the others had food and [they]312-the others had not ; [I]58-julia think it was more because [the aristocrats]3667-the aristocrats had a thousand other things that [they]3667-the aristocrats had not , and could never have — feelings , instincts , pleasures , traditions — which [they]3667-the aristocrats could not have had or enjoyed even if [they]3667-the aristocrats had been put in [palaces]3675-palaces and dressed like [queens]3676-queens . It was the fact that [they]3667-the aristocrats could never , never rise to [them]3667-the aristocrats , that helped to make [them]3667-the aristocrats so furious to pull all down . "[58-julia] There was a sincerity of conviction in [her]58-julia tone , but [Joost]90-joost only said , " [You]58-julia can not enjoy to think of such things ; it is horrible and pitiable to remember that [human creatures]3677-human creatures became so like beasts . "[90-joost] [Julia]58-julia 's mood altered . " Pitiable , yes ; perhaps [you]90-joost are right . After all , [we]3678-we are pitiful creatures , and , under the thin veneer , like enough to the beasts . "[58-julia] Then [she]58-julia changed the subject abruptly , and began to talk of [his]90-joost flowers . But [he]90-joost was not satisfied with the change ; instinctively [he]90-joost felt [she]58-julia was talking to [his]90-joost level . " Why do [you]58-julia always speak to [me]90-joost of bulbs and plants ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said . " Do [you]58-julia think [I]58-julia am interested in nothing else ? "[58-julia] " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia speak of them because [I]58-julia am interested . Do [you]90-joost not believe [me]58-julia ? It is quite true ; [you]90-joost [yourself]90-joost have said that [I]58-julia should make [a good florist]3679-a good florist ; already [I]58-julia have learnt a great deal , although [I]58-julia have not been [here]371-here long , and knew nothing before [I]58-julia came . "[58-julia] " That is so , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost admitted ; " [you]58-julia are very clever . Nevertheless , [I]90-joost do not think , if [you]58-julia were alone now , [you]58-julia would be thinking of plants . [You]58-julia were not when [I]90-joost met [you]58-julia ; it was the Revolution , or , perhaps , human nature — [you]58-julia called it the Revolution in a parable , as [you]58-julia often do when [you]58-julia speak [your]58-julia thoughts . "[90-joost] " Why do [you]90-joost trouble about [my]58-julia thoughts ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said , impatiently . " How do [you]90-joost know what [I]58-julia think ? "[58-julia] " Perhaps [I]90-joost do n't , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost answered ; " only sometimes it seems to [me]90-joost [your]58-julia voice tells [me]90-joost though [your]58-julia words do not . "[90-joost] " [My]58-julia voice ? "[58-julia] " Yes ; it is full of notes like a violin , and speaks more than words . [I]58-julia suppose all voices have many notes really , but [people]3334-people do not often use them ; [they]3334-people use only a few . [You]58-julia use many ; that is why [I]58-julia like to listen to [you]58-julia when [you]58-julia talk to [[my]58-julia parents]3682-my parents , or [any one]187-any one . It is like [a master playing on an instrument]3684-a master playing on an instrument ; [you]58-julia make simple words mean much , more than [I]58-julia understand sometimes ; [you]58-julia can caress and [you]58-julia can laugh with [your]58-julia voice ; [I]58-julia have heard [you]58-julia do it when [I]58-julia have not been able to understand what [you]58-julia caress , or at what [you]58-julia laugh , any more than [an ignorant person]3685-an ignorant person can understand what the violin says , although [he]3685-an ignorant person may enjoy to hear it . To - night [you]58-julia do not caress or laugh ; there is something black in [your]58-julia thoughts . "[58-julia] " That is human nature , as [you]90-joost say , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said shortly , ignoring the comment on [her]58-julia voice . " Human nature is a hateful , ugly thing ; there is no use in thinking about it . "[58-julia] " It has certainly fallen , "[90-joost] [Joost]90-joost allowed ; " but [I]90-joost have sometimes thought perhaps , if it were not so , it would be a little — a very little — monotonous . "[90-joost] " [You]90-joost would not find it dull , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia told [him]90-joost . " [I]58-julia believe [you]90-joost would not have got on very well in [the Garden of Eden]3686-the garden of eden , except that , since all the herbs grew after [their]3686-the garden of eden own kind , there would be no opportunity to hybridise them . "[58-julia] But the mystery of production and generation , even in [the vegetable world]1063-the vegetable world , was not a subject that modesty permitted [Joost]90-joost to discuss with [a girl]201-a girl . [His]90-joost manner showed it , to [her]58-julia impatient annoyance , as [he]90-joost hastily introduced another aspect of [man]1052-man 's first estate . " If [we]3687-we were not fallen , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost added , " [we]3687-we should have no opportunity to rise . That , indeed , would be a loss ; is it not the struggle which makes the grand and fine characters which [we]3687-we admire ? "[90-joost] " [I]58-julia do n't admire [them]3688-them , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia returned ; " [I]90-joost admire [the people who are born good]3689-the people who are born good , because [they]3689-the people who are born good are a miracle . "[90-joost] [He]90-joost stopped to unfasten the gate ; it did not occur to [him]90-joost that [she]58-julia was thinking of [himself]90-joost . " [I]90-joost can not agree with [you]58-julia , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said , as [they]1066-they went up [the drive]787-the drive together . " Rather , [I]90-joost admire [those who have fought temptation , who are strong , who know and understand and have conquered]3690-those who have fought temptation , who are strong , who know and understand and have conquered ; [they]3690-those who have fought temptation , who are strong , who know and understand and have conquered inspire [me]90-joost to try and follow . What inspiration is there in the other ? Consider [Miss Denah]103-denah , for an example ; [she]103-denah has perhaps never wanted to do more wrong than to take [[her]103-denah mother]195-her mother 's prunes , but is there inspiration in [her]103-denah ? [She]103-denah is as soft and as kind as a feather pillow , and as inspiring . But [you]58-julia — [you]58-julia told [me]90-joost once [you]58-julia were bad ; [I]90-joost did not believe [you]58-julia ; [I]90-joost did not understand , but now [I]90-joost know [your]58-julia meaning . [You]58-julia have it in [your]58-julia power to be bad or to be good ; [you]58-julia know which is which , for [you]58-julia have seen badness , and know it as [men who live see it]3692-men who live see it . [You]58-julia have fought with it and conquered ; [you]58-julia have struggled , [you]58-julia do struggle , [you]58-julia have strength in [you]58-julia . That is why [you]58-julia are like a lantern that is sometimes bright and sometimes dim , but always a beacon . "[90-joost] " [I]58-julia am nothing of the sort , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said sharply . [They]1068-they were in the dense shadow of the trees , so [he]1069-you could not see [her]58-julia face , but [her]58-julia voice sounded strange to [him]1069-you . " [You]1069-you do not know what [you]1069-you are talking about , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " hardly in [my]58-julia life have [I]58-julia asked [myself]58-julia if a thing is right or wrong — do [you]1069-you understand [me]58-julia ? Right and wrong are not things [I]58-julia think about . "[58-julia] " It is quite likely , "[1069-you] [he]1069-you said , serenely ; " [different persons]3693-different persons have different names for the same things , as [you]58-julia have once said ; [one]3325-one calls it ' honourable ' and ' dishonourable , ' and another ' right ' and ' wrong , ' and another ' wise ' and ' unwise . ' But it is always the same thing ; it means to choose the more difficult path that leads to the greater end , and leave the other way to [the lesser and smaller souls]3695-the lesser and smaller souls . "[1069-you] [Julia]58-julia caught [her]58-julia breath with a little gasping choke . [Joost]90-joost turned and looked at [her]58-julia , puzzled at last ; but though [they]1070-they had now reached [the house]175-the house , and the lamplight shone on [her]58-julia , [he]90-joost could make out nothing ; [she]58-julia brushed past [him]90-joost and went in quickly . The next day [Joost]90-joost started for [Germany]10-germany . It rained more or less all day , and [Julia]58-julia did not go out , except for half - an - hour during the morning , when [she]58-julia was obliged to go marketing . [She]58-julia met [Denah]103-denah bound on the same errand , and heard from [her]103-denah , what [she]58-julia knew already , that [she]58-julia would not be able to come and superintend the crochet that day . And being in a black and reckless mood , [she]58-julia had the effrontery to laugh a silent , comprehending little laugh in the face of [the Dutch girl]970-the dutch girl 's elaborate explanations . [Denah]103-denah was a good deal annoyed , and , though [her]103-denah self - esteem did not allow [her]103-denah to realise the full meaning of the offence , [she]103-denah did not forget it . [Julia]58-julia went [home]249-home with [her]58-julia purchases , and spent the rest of the day in the usual small occupations . It was an interminably long day [she]58-julia found . [She]58-julia contrived to hide [her]58-julia feelings , however , and behaved beautifully , giving the suitable attention and suitable answers to all [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw 's little remarks about the weather , and [Joost]90-joost 's wet journey ( though , since [he]90-joost was in [the train]497-the train , [Julia]58-julia could not see that the wet mattered to [him]90-joost ) , and about [Mijnheer]90-joost 's cold , which was very bad indeed . The day wore on . [Julia]58-julia missed [Joost]90-joost 's presence at meals ; [they]1075-they were not in the habit of talking much to each other at such times , it is true , but [she]58-julia always knew when [she]58-julia talked to [[his]90-joost parents]1076-his parents that [he]90-joost was listening , and putting another and fuller interpretation on [her]58-julia words . That was stimulating and pleasant too ; it was a new form of intercourse , and [she]58-julia did not pretend [she]58-julia did not enjoy it for itself , as well as for the opportunity it gave [her]58-julia of probing [his]90-joost mind and trying different ideas on [him]90-joost . At last dinner was over , and tea ; the tea things were washed , and the long - neglected fancy work brought out . A clock in [the passage]1077-the passage struck the hour when , of late , after an exhilirating verbal skirmish with [the anxious Denah]1078-the anxious denah , [she]58-julia had set out for [the village]908-the village and [Rawson - Clew]74-rawson - clew . [She]58-julia did not pretend to [herself]58-julia that [she]58-julia did not enjoy that too , [she]58-julia did immensely ; there was a breath from the outside world in it ; there was sometimes the inspiring clash of wits , of steel on steel , always the charm of educated intercourse and quick comprehension . To - night there was nothing ; no exercise to stir the blood , no solitude to stimulate the imagination , no effort of talk or understanding to rouse the mind . Nothing but to sit at work , giving one - eighth of attention to talk with [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw — more was not needed , and the rest to the blue daffodils that lay securely locked up in a place only too well known . Evening darkened , grey and dripping , to - night , supper - getting time came , and the hour for locking up [the barns]647-the barns . [Mijnheer]90-joost , snuffling and wheezing a good deal , put on a coat , a mackintosh , a comforter , a pair of boots and a pair of galoshes ; took an umbrella , the lantern , a great bunch of keys , and went out . [Julia]58-julia watched [him]90-joost go , and said nothing ; [she]58-julia had been [the rounds]1081-the rounds a good many times with [Joost]90-joost now ; [the family]193-the family had talked about it more than once , and about [her]58-julia bravery with regard to rats and [robbers]1083-robbers . [Neither of [the old people]1085-the old people]1084-neither of the old people would have been surprised if [she]58-julia had volunteered to go in place of [Mijnheer]90-joost , even if [his]90-joost cold had not offered a reason for such a thing . But [she]58-julia did not do it ; [he]90-joost went alone , and the blue daffodil bulbs lay snug in [their]1086-their locked place . The next day it still rained , but a good deal harder . There was a sudden drop in the temperature , too , such as one often finds in an English summer . [The Van Heigens]78-the van heigens did not have a fire on that account , [[their]78-the van heigens stoves]1087-their stoves always kept a four months ' sabbath ; the advent of a snow - storm in July would not have been allowed to break it . [Mijnheer]90-joost 's cold was decidedly worse ; towards evening it grew very bad . [He]90-joost came in early from [the office]603-the office , and sat and shivered in [the sitting - room]579-the sitting - room with [Julia]58-julia and [[his]90-joost wife]168-his wife , who was continuing the crochet unaided , and so laying up much future work for [Denah]103-denah . At last it was considered dark enough for the lamp to be lighted . [Julia]58-julia got up and lit it , and drew the blind , shutting out the grey sheet of the canal and the slanting rain . " Dear [me]85-mevrouw , "[85-mevrouw] [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw said once again , " how bad the rain must be for [Joost]90-joost ! "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia agreed , but reminded [her]85-mevrouw — also once again — that it was possibly not raining in [Germany]10-germany . [Mijnheer]90-joost looked up from [his]90-joost paper to remark that the weather was very bad for the crops . " It is bad for [every one]582-every one , "[168-his wife] [[his]90-joost wife]168-his wife rejoined ; " but worse of all for [you]90-joost . [You]90-joost should be in bed . Indeed , it is not fit that [you]90-joost should be up ; [the house]175-the house is like [a cellar]3698-a cellar this evening . "[168-his wife] [Mijnheer]90-joost did not suggest the remedy of a fire ; [he]90-joost , too , shared the belief that stoves should not be lighted before the appointed time ; [he]90-joost only protested at the idea of bed . " Pooh ! "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said . " Make [myself]90-joost [an invalid]3699-an invalid with [Joost]90-joost away ! Will [you]58-julia go and nurse [my]90-joost nose , and put plasters on [my]90-joost chest ? Go to bed now , do [you]58-julia say ? No , no , [[my]90-joost dear]3700-my dear , [I]90-joost will sit here ; [I]90-joost am comfortable enough ; [I]90-joost read [my]90-joost paper , [I]90-joost smoke [my]90-joost cigar ; by and by , [I]90-joost go out to see that [[my]90-joost barns]3701-my barns are all safe for the night . "[90-joost] But at this [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw gave an exclamation ; the idea of [his]90-joost going out in such weather was terrible , [she]85-mevrouw said , and [she]85-mevrouw said it a good many times . [Julia]58-julia bent over [her]58-julia work ; [she]58-julia heard the swish of the rain on the window , the uneven sob of the fitful wind ; [she]58-julia heard [the old people]1085-the old people talk , [the husband]1093-the husband persist , [the wife]1094-the wife protest . [She]58-julia did not look up ; [her]58-julia eyes were fixed on [her]58-julia needle , but [she]58-julia hardly saw it ; more plainly [she]58-julia saw [the dark barns]1095-the dark barns , the crowded shelves , the place where the blue daffodils were . [She]58-julia could find [them]1095-the dark barns with perfect ease ; could choose one in the dark as easily as [Mijnheer]90-joost [himself]90-joost ; [she]58-julia could substitute for it another , one of the common sort of the same shape and size ; [no one]181-no one would be the wiser ; even when it bloomed , with the simple yellow flower that has beautified spring woods so long , [no one]181-no one would know it was not a sport of nature , a throw back to [the original parent]1098-the original parent . It was the simplest thing in all [the world]208-the world ; the safest . Not that that recommended it ; [she]58-julia would rather it had been difficult or dangerous , it would have savoured more of a fair fight and less of trickery . Besides , such safety was nothing ; anything can be made safe with care and forethought . [She]58-julia caught [her]58-julia own name in the talk now ; [husband]1100-husband and [wife]1101-wife were speaking lower , evidently arguing as to the propriety of asking [her]58-julia to go the rounds ; for a moment [she]58-julia pretended not to hear , then [she]58-julia raised [her]58-julia head , contempt for [her]58-julia own weakness in [her]58-julia mind . It is not opportunity that makes [thieves of thinking folk]1102-thieves of thinking folk , and [she]58-julia knew it ; rather it is the thief that makes opportunity , if [he]90-joost is up to [his]90-joost work . Why should [she]58-julia be afraid to go to [the barns]647-the barns ? [She]58-julia would not take the daffodil the more for going ; if [she]58-julia meant to do it , and , through cowardice , let this opportunity slip , [she]58-julia would soon find another . And if [she]58-julia did not mean to , the proximity of the thing would not make [her]58-julia take it . [She]58-julia put down [her]58-julia work . " [I]1104-his will lock up for [you]1104-his , [Mijnheer]90-joost ; give [me]1104-his the keys . "[1104-his] [He]1104-his protested , and [[his]1104-his wife]168-his wife protested , much more feebly , and thanked [her]58-julia for going the while . [They]1106-they gave [her]58-julia many directions , and told [her]58-julia [she]58-julia must put on this , that , and the other , and must be careful not to get [her]58-julia feet wet , and really need not to be too particular in examining all the doors . [She]58-julia answered [them]1106-they with impatient politeness , as [one does who is waiting for the advent of a greater matter]1107-one does who is waiting for the advent of a greater matter ; [she]58-julia was not irritated by the trivial interruptions which came between [her]58-julia and the decision which was yet to be made ; it was somehow so great to [her]58-julia that it seemed as if it could wait . At last [she]58-julia was off , [Mijnheer]90-joost 's galoshes wallowing about [her]58-julia feet , [his]1104-his black - caped mackintosh thrown round [her]58-julia shoulders . [She]58-julia had neither hat nor umbrella . [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw literally wailed when [she]58-julia started ; but it made no impression , [she]58-julia came of the nation most indifferent to getting wet , and most - susceptible to death by consumption of [any in [Europe]20-europe]1108-any in europe . [She]58-julia slopped along in the great galoshes , [her]58-julia back to [the lighted house]1109-the lighted house now , [her]58-julia face to [the dark barns]1095-the dark barns . [There]180-there [they]180-there were , easily accessible , waiting for [her]58-julia . Was [she]58-julia to take one , or was [she]58-julia not ? [She]58-julia did not give [herself]58-julia any excuse for taking it , or tell [herself]58-julia that one out of six was not much ; or that [Joost]90-joost , could [he]90-joost know the case , would not have grudged [her]58-julia one of [his]90-joost precious bulbs . There was only one thing [she]58-julia admitted — it was there , and [her]58-julia need for it was great . With it [she]58-julia could pay a debt that was due , show [[her]58-julia father]210-her father [an honourable man]1113-an honourable man , and , seeing that the affair could always remain secret , raise [herself]58-julia nearer to [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew 's level . Without it [she]58-julia could not . [She]58-julia had come to [the first barn]1114-the first barn now , and , unbarring the door , went in . Almost oppressive came the dry smell of the bulbs to [her]58-julia ; very familiar , too , as familiar as the distorted shadows that [her]58-julia lantern made . Together they brought vividly to [her]58-julia mind the first time [she]58-julia went the rounds with [Joost]90-joost — the night when [she]58-julia told [him]90-joost [she]58-julia was bad , [the worst person [he]90-joost knew]1115-the worst person he knew . [Poor Joost]90-joost , [he]90-joost had interpreted [her]58-julia words [his]90-joost own way ; [she]58-julia remembered very plainly what [he]90-joost said but two nights ago — right and wrong , honourable and dishonourable , wise and unwise , they meant the same thing to [different people]1116-different people , the choosing of the higher , the leaving of [the lower]1117-the lower — and [he]90-joost believed no less of [her]58-julia . That belief , surely , was a thing that fought on the side of [the angels]1118-the angels ? And then there was [that other man]1119-that other man , able , well - bred , intellectual , [[her]58-julia superior]1120-her superior , who had treated [her]58-julia as [an equal]1049-an equal , and so tacitly demanded that [she]58-julia should conform to [his]90-joost code of honour . And there was [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny , [poor , old round - faced [Johnny]57-johnny , who , under [his]90-joost silly , shabby exterior , had somewhere , quite understood , the same code , and standard of [a gentleman]3384-a gentleman]1122-poor , old round - faced johnny , who , under his silly , shabby exterior , had somewhere , quite understood , the same code , and standard of a gentleman , and never doubted but that [she]58-julia had it too — surely [these two]1124-these two , also , were on the side of [the angels]1118-the angels ? But it was not a matter of angels , neither was it a matter of [this man]402-this man 's thought , or that . At bottom , it seemed all questions could be brought to plain terms — What do [I]0-i think ? [I]0-i , alone in [the big , black , contradictory world]1127-the big , black , contradictory world . [Julia]58-julia realised it , and asked [herself]58-julia what it mattered if [he]90-joost , if [they]1128-they , if all [the world]208-the world called it wrong ? What — pitiless , logical question — was wrong ? Why should to take in one case be so called , and in another not ? By whose word , and by what law was a thing thus , and why was [she]58-julia to submit to it ? [She]58-julia faced the darkness , the lantern at [her]58-julia feet , [her]58-julia back against the shelves , and asked [herself]58-julia the world - old question ; and , like many before [her]58-julia , found no answer , because logic , merciless solvent of faith and hope and law , never answers its own riddles . Only , as [she]58-julia stood there , there rose up before [her]58-julia mind 's eye the face of [Joost]90-joost , with its simple gravity , [its]90-joost earnest , trusting blue eyes . [She]58-julia saw it , and [she]58-julia saw the humble dignity with which [he]90-joost had shown [her]58-julia [his]90-joost six bulbs . Not as [a proud possessor]1130-a proud possessor shows a treasure , rather as an adept shares some secret of [his]90-joost faith or art ; so had [he]90-joost placed them in [her]58-julia power , given [her]58-julia a chance to so use this trust . [She]58-julia almost groaned aloud as [she]58-julia recalled [him]90-joost , and recalled , sorely against [her]58-julia will , a horrible tale [she]58-julia had once read , of [a Brahmin who murdered [a little child]1132-a little child for [her]1131-a brahmin who murdered a little child for her worthless silver anklets worthless silver anklets]1131-a brahmin who murdered a little child for her worthless silver anklets . [Joost]90-joost was [a veritable child to [her]58-julia]1133-a veritable child to her , powerless before [her]58-julia ability , trusting in [her]58-julia good faith , [a child]824-a child indeed , even if [he]90-joost had not placed [his]90-joost secret in [her]58-julia grasp . And it was [he]90-joost — [this child]1135-this child — that [she]58-julia , with [her]58-julia superior strength , was going to rob ! [She]58-julia shivered . Why was [he]90-joost not [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew ? Why could not [he]90-joost take better care of [himself]90-joost and [his]90-joost possessions ? [She]58-julia could have done it with a light heart then ; there would have been a semblance of fight in it ; but now — now it could not be done . Logic , [the pitiless solvent]1136-the pitiless solvent , has no action on those old long - transmitted instincts ; it may argue with , but it can not destroy , those vague yearnings of [the natural man]1137-the natural man towards righteousness . [Julia]58-julia did not argue , [she]58-julia only obeyed ; [she]58-julia did not know why . [She]58-julia picked up the lantern , and moved to go ; as [she]58-julia did so , the barn door , lightly fastened , blew open . A rush of rain and wind swept in , the smell of the wet earth , and the sight of the tossing trees , and massed clouds that fled across the sky . For a moment [she]58-julia stood and looked , hearing the wild night voices , the sob of the wet wind , the rustle and mutter of the trees — those primitive inarticulate things that do not lie . And in [her]58-julia heart [she]58-julia felt very weary of shams and pretences , very hungry for the rest of reality and truth . [She]58-julia turned away , and made the round of [the barns]647-the barns systematically , and without haste ; [she]58-julia did not hurry past the resting - place of the blue daffodils , they were safe from [her]58-julia now and always . It was not till some weeks later that [she]58-julia saw , and not then without also seeing it was quite impossible to disprove the proposition , that there was something grimly absurd in the idea which had possessed [her]58-julia that night — the thought of stealing to prove a lie , and acting dis honourably to pay a debt of honour . At the time [she]58-julia did not think at all , [she]58-julia acted on instinct only . Thank [God]104-god for those dumb instincts , making for righteousness , which , in spite of theologians , are implanted somewhere in the heart of [man]1052-man . So [she]58-julia went the rounds , fastened [the barns]647-the barns , and came out of [the last one]1141-the last one , locking the door after [her]58-julia . Outside , [she]58-julia stood a second , the rain falling upon [her]58-julia bare head , the wind blowing [her]58-julia cloak about [her]58-julia . And [she]58-julia did not feel triumphant or victorious , nor reluctant and contemptuous of [her]58-julia weakness ; only somehow apart and alone , and very , very tired .

[The Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons were launching out ; not ostentatiously with expensive entertainments or anything striking , but in all small ways , scarcely noticeable except in general effect , but none the less expensive . [They]56-the polkingtons could not afford it ; the past nine months had been very difficult , first [the Captain]172-the captain 's unfortunate misuse of the cheque , then [Violet]101-violet 's engagement and the necessary entertainment that it involved , and then [her]101-violet wedding . Financially [they]56-the polkingtons were in a very bad way , but that did not prevent [them]56-the polkingtons spending — or owing — in a rather lordly fashion . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington with [one daughter]1143-one daughter married , and another safely out of the way , seemed determined to take [the field]1144-the field well with [the remaining one]1145-the remaining one . [Chèrie]64-chèrie was quite ready to second the effort , indeed , [she]64-chèrie was [the instigator]1146-the instigator ; [she]64-chèrie was not only [the prettiest of [the sisters]189-the sisters]1147-the prettiest of the sisters , but also the most ease loving , and though ambitious , less clever than the others , and a great deal more short - sighted . [She]64-chèrie had for some time ceased to be content with the position at [Marbridge]61-denah and [the society there]1149-the society there ; [she]64-chèrie wanted to be recognised by [the " county]3702-the " county . "[1150-a very eligible and attractive bachelor addition to that charmed circle] This desire had been growing of late , for there had been [a very eligible and attractive bachelor addition to that charmed circle]1150-a very eligible and attractive bachelor addition to that charmed circle , and [he]1150-a very eligible and attractive bachelor addition to that charmed circle had more than once looked admiration [her]64-chèrie way . [She]64-chèrie and [[her]64-chèrie mother]195-her mother went to work well and spared neither time nor trouble ; not much result could be expected during the summer months , little done then except get ready — an expensive proceeding . It was when [September]105-september brought [people]3334-people [home]249-home for the partridge shooting and [October]106-october 's pheasants kept [them]3334-people [there]180-there till hunting began , that [they]3334-people expected [their]3334-people success and the return for [their]3334-people outlay , and [they]3334-people were quite content to wait for it . [Their]3334-people plans and doings were naturally not confided to [any one]187-any one , not even [Julia]58-julia ; [she]58-julia heard seldom from [Marbridge]61-denah ; [the family]193-the family feelings were of a somewhat utilitarian order , based largely on mutual benefit .
