[She]58-julia wrote now and then ; [she]58-julia happened to do so on the day after the one on which [she]58-julia did not take the blue daffodil ; and [she]58-julia mentioned in this letter that it was possible [she]58-julia should be [home]249-home again soon . Seeing that [she]58-julia had decided the daffodil was unobtainable [she]58-julia saw little reason for staying longer ; this of course [she]58-julia did not mention when [she]58-julia wrote . Somewhat to [her]58-julia surprise [she]58-julia got an almost immediate reply to [her]58-julia letter . It would not suit [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington and [Chèrie]64-chèrie to have [Julia]58-julia back soon at all ; it is always easier to swim socially with [one daughter]1143-one daughter than two , especially if the second is not good - looking . Also , [Julia]58-julia , cautious , long - headed and capable , was certain to criticise [their]1159-they proceedings and do [her]58-julia best to interfere with [them]1159-they . [She]58-julia would be wrong in [her]58-julia judgments , of course , and [they]1159-they right ; [they]1159-they were sure of that , but [they]1159-they did not want the trouble of attempting to convert [her]58-julia , and anyhow , [they]1159-they felt [they]1159-they could do much better without [her]58-julia , and [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington wrote and intimated as much politely . [She]60-mrs. polkington gave several excellent reasons , all of which were perfectly transparent to [Julia]58-julia , though that did not matter , seeing that [she]58-julia was sufficiently hurt in [her]58-julia feelings , or [her]58-julia pride , to at once determine to fulfil [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother 's wishes and do anything rather than go where [she]58-julia was not wanted . There was not much said of the plans and doings in [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington 's letter , but a little crept in almost without [the writer]1161-the writer 's knowledge , enough to rouse [Julia]58-julia 's suspicions . Why , [she]58-julia asked [herself]58-julia , was [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother suddenly enamoured with the beauty of [Chippendale]21-chippendale furniture ? How did [she]195-her mother know that [Sturt]107-sturt 's ( [the tailor]1163-the tailor 's ) prices were lower for costumes this season ? And in what way had [she]195-her mother become aware what [[the Ashton]108-the ashton 's last parlour - maid]1164-the ashton 's last parlour - maid thought , if [she]1164-the ashton 's last parlour - maid had not engaged [that young woman]1165-that young woman for [her]1164-the ashton 's last parlour - maid own service ? [Julia]58-julia was at once uneasy and disgusted ; the last alike with the proceedings [themselves]1166-themselves and the attempt to deceive [her]58-julia about them . And another letter [she]58-julia received at the same time did not make [her]58-julia any more satisfied ; it was from [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny , about as silly and uninforming a letter as [ever man]1167-ever man wrote , but it contained one piece of information . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat was going to have a great excitement in the early autumn — [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington was coming to [London]9-london , perhaps for as long as three months . [Johnny]57-johnny did not know why ; [he]57-johnny thought perhaps to have some treatment for [his]57-johnny rheumatism ; [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington had arranged it . [Julia]58-julia did know why , and the short - sightedness of the policy roused [her]58-julia contempt . To thus put [the family]193-the family drawback out of the way , and leave [him]57-johnny to [his]57-johnny own devices and [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's care , seemed to [her]58-julia as unwise towards [him]57-johnny as it was unkind to [Johnny]57-johnny . [She]58-julia would have written that minute to expostulate with [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother if [she]58-julia had not just then been called away . These two disturbing letters arrived on the day that [Joost]90-joost came [home]249-home from [Germany]10-germany , after the English mail for the day had gone . [Julia]58-julia comforted [herself]58-julia with this last fact when [she]58-julia was called before [she]58-julia had time to write to [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother ; [she]58-julia could write when [she]58-julia went to bed that night ; the letter would go just as soon as if it was written now ; so [she]58-julia went to answer [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw 's summons to admire the carved crochet hook [[her]195-her mother son]1172-her son had brought [her]58-julia as a present from [Germany]10-germany . [Joost]90-joost had brought several small presents besides the crochet hook , a pipe for [[his]90-joost father]614-his father , and two other trifles — a small vase and a photograph of a plant which was the pride of [the Berlin gardens]1174-the berlin gardens that year — an aloe , no yucca , but one of the true rare blooming sort , in full flower . [Julia]58-julia was asked to take [her]58-julia choice of these two ; [she]58-julia chose the photograph because it seemed to [her]58-julia much more characteristic of [the giver]1175-the giver , and also because it was easier to put away . [She]58-julia had no idea of pleasing [Joost]90-joost by so doing ; to tell the truth [she]58-julia hardly felt desirous of pleasing [him]90-joost , for though [she]58-julia had refrained from taking [his]90-joost blue daffodil and was in a way satisfied that [she]58-julia had done so , [she]58-julia did not feel exactly grateful to [him]90-joost for unconsciously standing between [her]58-julia and it , from which some may conclude that virtue was not an indigenous plant with [Julia]58-julia . When [Denah]103-denah arrived after dinner [she]103-denah was given the vase . Before [Joost]90-joost went away [she]103-denah had expressed in [his]90-joost hearing a wish that [she]103-denah had something from [Berlin]22-berlin ; [she]103-denah had said it rather pronouncedly as one might express a desire for a bear from [the Rocky Mountains]23-the rocky mountains , or a ruby from [Burmah]24-burmah ; [she]103-denah could hardly have received one of those with more enthusiasm than [she]103-denah did the vase . [She]103-denah admired it from every point of view and thanked [Joost]90-joost delightedly ; the delight , however , was a little modified when [Mijnheer]90-joost let slip the fact that [Julia]58-julia also had a present from [Berlin]22-berlin . " Have [you]58-julia ? "[103-denah] [she]103-denah asked suspiciously . " What is it ? Show [me]103-denah . "[103-denah] [Julia]58-julia fetched the photograph and exhibited it with as little elation as possible . [Denah]103-denah did not admire it greatly , [she]103-denah said [she]103-denah much preferred [her]103-denah own present . At this [Joost]90-joost smiled a little ; it was only what [he]90-joost ex pected , and [Julia]58-julia began tactfully to talk about the beauties of the vase ; but [Denah]103-denah was not to be put off [her]103-denah main point . " Do [you]58-julia not prefer [mine]103-denah ; really and truly , would [you]58-julia not rather it had been [yours]58-julia ? "[103-denah] [she]103-denah asked . [Julia]58-julia could have slipped out of the answer quite easily ; [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons were all good at saying things to be interpreted according to taste ; but [Joost]90-joost , with signal idiocy , stepped in and prevented . " No , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said , " [she]103-denah preferred the photograph ; [she]103-denah chose it of the two . "[90-joost] At this intelligence [Denah]103-denah 's face was a study ; [Julia]58-julia could not but be amused by it although [she]58-julia was sorry . [She]58-julia did not want to make [the girl]415-the girl jealous , it was absurd that [she]58-julia should be ; but absurdity never prevents such things , and would not now , nor would it make [her]58-julia pleasanter if [she]58-julia were once fairly roused . [Julia]58-julia smoothed matters over as well as [she]58-julia could , which was very well considering , though [she]58-julia failed to entirely allay [Denah]103-denah 's suspicions . As soon after as [she]58-julia could [she]58-julia set out for [the village]908-the village , leaving [the field]1144-the field to [the Dutch girl]970-the dutch girl , and carrying with [her]58-julia enough unpleasant thoughts on other things to prevent [her]58-julia from giving any more consideration to the silly spasm of jealousy . [She]58-julia had thrust [her]58-julia two letters from [England]8-england into [her]58-julia pocket , and as [she]58-julia went [she]58-julia kept turning and turning [their]1180-their news in [her]58-julia mind though without much result . There seemed very little [she]58-julia could do except prevent the banishing of [[her]58-julia father]210-her father to [London]9-london . [She]58-julia would write to [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother about that , and , what might be rather more effective , to [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat . [She]58-julia could tell [him]66-mr. gillat it must not happen , and instruct [him]66-mr. gillat how to place obstacles in the way ; [he]66-mr. gillat would do [his]66-mr. gillat best to fulfil [her]58-julia requests , [she]58-julia was sure , even to going down to [Marbridge]61-denah and establish ing [himself]66-mr. gillat [there]180-there about the time of [[her]58-julia father]210-her father 's intended departure . But with regard to the rest of [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother 's plans , or [Chèrie]64-chèrie 's , whichever it might be , there seemed nothing to be done . To write would be useless ; to go [home]249-home , even if [she]58-julia swallowed [her]58-julia pride and did so , very little better ; of course [she]58-julia had not anything very definite to go upon , only a hint here and there , yet [she]58-julia guessed pretty well what [they]1187-they were doing , what spending , and what [they]1187-they thought to get by it . [The old , long - headed Julia]1188-the old , long - headed julia feared for the result ; [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington , clever though [she]60-mrs. polkington undoubtedly was , had never succeeded in big ventures ; [she]60-mrs. polkington had not the sort of mind for it ; [she]60-mrs. polkington had never made a wholly successful big stride ; [her]60-mrs. polkington real climbing had been done very slowly , so [the old Julia]58-julia feared for [her]60-mrs. polkington . And [the new one , who had grown up during the past months]1189-the new one , who had grown up during the past months , revolted against the whole thing , finding it sordid , despicable , dishonourable even , somehow all wrong . And perhaps because [the old cautious Julia]58-julia could do nothing to avert the consequences , the newer nature was in the ascendant that evening , and consequences were in time forgotten , and disgust and weariness and shame — which included self and all things connected with it — took possession of [the girl]415-the girl . By and by [she]58-julia heard a step behind [her]58-julia — [Rawson]75-rawson - clew - Clew . [She]58-julia had forgotten [his]75-rawson - clew existence ; [she]58-julia was almost sorry to be reminded of it ; [she]58-julia felt so ashamed of [herself]58-julia and [[her]58-julia people]1191-her people , so conscious of the gulf between [them]1191-her people and [him]75-rawson - clew . So very conscious of this last that [she]58-julia suddenly felt disinclined for the effort of struggling to hide or bridge it . [He]75-rawson - clew caught up with [her]58-julia . " How has the crochet progressed this week under [your]58-julia care ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew asked [her]58-julia lightly . " It has not progressed , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered ; " there are enough mistakes in it now to occupy [Denah]61-denah for a long time . "[58-julia] [He]75-rawson - clew took [her]58-julia basket from [her]58-julia , and [she]58-julia looked at [him]75-rawson - clew thoughtfully . [He]75-rawson - clew was just the same as usual , quiet , drawling voice , eyeglass , everything — [she]58-julia wondered if [he]75-rawson - clew were ever different ; how [he]75-rawson - clew would act , say , in [her]58-julia circumstances . If [they]1192-they could change bodies , now , and [he]75-rawson - clew be [Julia Polkington]58-julia , with [her]58-julia relations , needs and opportunities , what would [he]75-rawson - clew do ? Would [he]75-rawson - clew still be impassive , deliberate , equal to all occasions ? Would [he]75-rawson - clew find it easy to keep [his]75-rawson - clew inviolable laws of good - breeding and honour , and so forth ? " There is something [I]58-julia should like to ask [you]75-rawson - clew , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said suddenly . " Yes ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew inquired . " Is it much trouble to [you]58-julia to be honest ? "[75-rawson - clew] [He]75-rawson - clew was a little surprised , though not so much as [he]75-rawson - clew would have been earlier in [their]1192-they acquaintance . " That , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , " [I]75-rawson - clew expect rather depends on what [you]58-julia mean by honest . [I]75-rawson - clew imagine [you]58-julia do n't refer to lying and stealing , and that sort of thing , since [nobody]3448-nobody finds it difficult to avoid [them]3704-them . "[75-rawson - clew] " [They]3704-them are not gentlemanly ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia suggested . " [I]75-rawson - clew do n't know that [I]75-rawson - clew ever looked at it in that way , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said ; " or , indeed , any way . [One]3325-one does not think about those sort of things ; [one]3325-one does not do them , that 's all . "[75-rawson - clew] [She]58-julia nodded . The careless change of pronoun , which in a way included [her]58-julia with [himself]75-rawson - clew , was not lost upon [her]58-julia . " In the matter of half - truths , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia inquired ; " how about them ? "[58-julia] " [I]75-rawson - clew do n't think [I]75-rawson - clew have given that subject consideration either , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew answered , rather amused ; " there does not seem any need at [my]75-rawson - clew age . [One]3325-one does things , or [one]3325-one does not ; abstractions do n't appeal to [most men]3709-most men after thirty . "[75-rawson - clew] Again [Julia]58-julia nodded . " It looks to [me]58-julia , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " as if [you]75-rawson - clew take [your]75-rawson - clew morality , like [your]75-rawson - clew dinner , as a matter of course ; it 's always there ; [you]75-rawson - clew do n't have to bother after it ; [you]75-rawson - clew do n't really know how it comes , or what it is worth . "[58-julia] Now and then [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew had observed in [his]75-rawson - clew acquaintance with [Julia]58-julia , [she]58-julia said things which had a way of lighting [him]75-rawson - clew up to [himself]75-rawson - clew ; this was one of the occasions . " Possibly [you]58-julia are right , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , with faint amusement . " How do [you]58-julia take [yours]58-julia ? Let [us]3710-us consider [yours]58-julia ; [I]75-rawson - clew am sure it would be a great deal more interesting . "[75-rawson - clew] " There would be more variety in it , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said significantly . " What is [your]58-julia opinion about half - truths ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew inquired , with grave mimicry of [her]58-julia . " ' Half a truth , however small , Is better than no truth at all , ' "[58-julia] [she]58-julia quoted . " That is so ; it is better , safer to deal with — to explain away if it is found out , to deceive with if it is not . But it is not half so easy as the whole truth ; that is the easiest thing in [the world]208-the world ; it takes no ingenuity , no brains , no courage , no acting , no feeling the pulse of [[your]3712-your people]3713-your people , no bolstering up or watching or remembering . If [I]58-julia wanted to teach the beauty of truth , [I]58-julia would set [[my]58-julia pupils]3714-my pupils to do a little artistic white lying on [their]3714-my pupils own account , to make things look four times as good as they really were , and not to forget to make them square together , that would teach [them]3714-my pupils the advantage of truth . "[58-julia] " Do [you]58-julia think so ? "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew said . " It is not the usual opinion ; [fools]3715-fools and [cowards]3716-cowards are generally supposed to be the great dealers in deceit and subterfuge . "[75-rawson - clew] " May be , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia allowed ; " but [I]58-julia do n't happen to have come across that sort much ; the other [I]58-julia have , and [I]58-julia am just about sick of it — [I]58-julia am sick of pretending and shamming and double - dealing , of saying one thing and implying another , and meaning another still — [you]3717-you do n't know what it feels like , [you]3717-you have never had to do it ; [you]3717-you would n't , of course ; very likely [you]3717-you could n't , even . [I]58-julia am weary of it ; [I]58-julia am weary of the whole thing . "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew screwed the glass into [his]75-rawson - clew eye carefully but did not look at [her]58-julia ; [he]75-rawson - clew had an idea [she]58-julia would rather not . " What is it ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew asked kindly . " What has gone wrong to - night ? Too much pudding again ? "[75-rawson - clew] " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered , with a quick , if partial , recovery ; " too much humbug , too much self . [I]58-julia have seen a great deal of [myself]58-julia lately , and it 's hateful . "[58-julia] " [I]75-rawson - clew can not agree with [you]75-rawson - clew . "[75-rawson - clew] " Do [you]75-rawson - clew like having a lot of [yourself]75-rawson - clew ? "[75-rawson - clew] " No ; [I]58-julia like [yourself]75-rawson - clew . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia laughed a little ; in [her]58-julia heart [she]58-julia was pleased , but [she]58-julia only said , " [I]58-julia do n't ; [I]58-julia know what it really is . "[58-julia] " And [I]75-rawson - clew do not ? "[75-rawson - clew] " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered ; then , with a sudden determination to tell [him]75-rawson - clew the worst , and to deal in this newly admired honesty , [she]58-julia said , " [I]58-julia will tell [you]75-rawson - clew , though . [You]75-rawson - clew remember [[my]58-julia father]3392-my father ? [You]75-rawson - clew may have politely forgotten [him]3392-my father , or smoothed out [your]75-rawson - clew recollections of [him]3392-my father — remember [him]3392-my father now ; [he]3392-my father is just about what [you]75-rawson - clew thought [him]3392-my father . "[58-julia] " Indeed ? "[58-julia] the tone was that one of polite interest , which [she]58-julia had come to know so well . " [Your]58-julia shoe is unfastened ; may [I]75-rawson - clew tie it for [you]58-julia ? The question is , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew went on , as [he]75-rawson - clew stooped to [her]58-julia shoe , " what did [I]75-rawson - clew think of [[your]58-julia father]3306-your father ? [I]75-rawson - clew 'm sure [I]75-rawson - clew do n't know , and [I]75-rawson - clew hardly think [you]58-julia are in a position to , either . "[75-rawson - clew] [She]58-julia moved impatiently , so that the shoelace slipped out of [his]75-rawson - clew hand , and [he]75-rawson - clew had to begin all over again . It was a very shabby shoe ; at another time [she]58-julia might have minded about it , and even refused to have it fastened on that account ; to - night [she]58-julia did not care , which was perhaps as well , for [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew knew long ago all about the shabbiness — the only thing [he]75-rawson - clew did not know before was the good shape of the foot inside . " [I]58-julia know perfectly well what [you]75-rawson - clew thought [[my]58-julia father]3392-my father , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " if [you]75-rawson - clew have forgotten , [I]58-julia will remind [you]75-rawson - clew . [You]75-rawson - clew did not think [him]3392-my father [an adventurer]3379-an adventurer , [I]58-julia know ; of course , [you]75-rawson - clew saw [he]3392-my father had not brains enough . "[58-julia] But here the shoe tying was finished , and [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew intimated politely that [he]75-rawson - clew was not anxious to be reminded of things [he]75-rawson - clew had forgotten . " [You]1193-you began by saying [you]1193-you would tell [me]75-rawson - clew about [yourself]1193-you , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said ; " will [you]1193-you not go on ? "[75-rawson - clew] " [I]1193-you have more brains than [[my]1193-you father]3392-my father , "[1193-you] [she]1193-you said , " and no more principles . "[1193-you] " Ergo — [you]1193-you succeed where [he]3392-my father falls short ; in fact , [you]1193-you are an adventuress — is that it ? [[My]75-rawson - clew dear child]3723-my dear child , [you]1193-you neither are , nor ever could be ; believe [me]75-rawson - clew , [I]75-rawson - clew really do know , though , as [you]1193-you have indicated , [my]75-rawson - clew morality is rather mechanical and [my]75-rawson - clew experience much as [other men]3724-other men 's . [You]1193-you see , [I]75-rawson - clew , too , have graduated in the study of humanity in [the university of [cosmopolis]25-cosmopolis]3725-the university of cosmopolis ; [I]75-rawson - clew do n't think [my]75-rawson - clew degree is as high as [yours]1193-you , and [I]75-rawson - clew certainly did not take it so young , but [I]75-rawson - clew believe [I]75-rawson - clew know an adventuress when [I]75-rawson - clew see one . [You]1193-you will never do in that walk of life ; [I]75-rawson - clew do n't mean to insinuate that [you]1193-you have n't brains enough , or that [you]1193-you would ever lose [your]1193-you head ; it is n't that [you]1193-you would lose , it 's [your]1193-you heart . "[75-rawson - clew] " [I]58-julia have n't ; "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia cried hotly . " [I]58-julia have not lost [my]58-julia heart ; that has nothing to do with it . "[58-julia] " [I]75-rawson - clew did not say that [you]58-julia had , "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew reminded [her]58-julia ; " of course not , [you]58-julia have not lost it , and could not easily . [I]75-rawson - clew did not mean that ; [I]75-rawson - clew only meant that it would interfere with [your]58-julia success as an adventuress . "[75-rawson - clew] " It would not , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia persisted ; " [I]75-rawson - clew do n't care about [people]3334-people a bit ; it is n't that , it is simply that [I]75-rawson - clew am sick of deception , that is why [I]75-rawson - clew am telling [you]58-julia the truth . And as for the other thing — the daffodil"—she[75-rawson - clew] forgot that [he]75-rawson - clew did not know about it—"I could n't take it from [any one]187-any one so silly , so childish , so trusting . "[75-rawson - clew] " Of course not , "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew said . " [I]75-rawson - clew do n't know what the daffodil thing is , nor from whom [you]58-julia could not take it — please do n't tell [me]75-rawson - clew ; [I]75-rawson - clew never take the slightest interest in [other people]3728-other people 's business , it bores [me]75-rawson - clew . But , [you]58-julia see , [you]58-julia bear out what [I]75-rawson - clew say ; [you]58-julia are of [those strong who are merciful]3729-those strong who are merciful ; [you]58-julia would make no success as an adventuress . Besides , [your]58-julia tastes are too simple ; [I]75-rawson - clew have some recollections of [your]58-julia mentioning corduroy — er — trousers and a diet of onions as the height of [your]58-julia ambition . "[75-rawson - clew] [Julia]58-julia laughed in spite of [herself]58-julia . " That is only when [I]58-julia retire , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . " [I]58-julia have n't retired yet ; until [I]58-julia do [I]58-julia am — "[58-julia] " The incarnation of the seven deadly sins ? "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew finished for [her]58-julia , with a smile in [his]75-rawson - clew eyes . " No doubt of it ; [I]75-rawson - clew expect that is what makes [you]58-julia good company . "[75-rawson - clew] So , after all , it came about that [she]58-julia did not get [her]58-julia confession made in full . But , then , there hardly seemed need for it ; it appeared that [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew already knew a great deal about [her]58-julia , and did not think the worse of [her]58-julia for it . Rather it seemed [he]75-rawson - clew thought better than [she]58-julia had even believed ; [he]75-rawson - clew , [himself]75-rawson - clew , too , was rather different — there had crept a note of warmth and personality into [their]1194-their acquaintance which had not been there before . [Julia]58-julia had pleasant thoughts for company on [her]58-julia homeward walk , in spite of the worry of the letters [she]58-julia carried with [her]58-julia ; [she]58-julia even for a moment had an idea of putting the matter [they]1194-their contained before [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew and asking [his]75-rawson - clew advice ; that is , if the friendship which had begun to dawn on [their]1194-their acquaintance that evening grew yet further . It did grow , but [she]58-julia did not ask [him]75-rawson - clew , loyalty to [[her]58-julia family]1195-her family prevented ; there were , however , plenty of other things to talk about , and the friendship got on well until the end came . The end came about the time of the annual fair . This fair was a great event in [the little town]1040-the little town ; it only lasted three days , and only the middle one of the three was important , or in the least provocative of disorder ; but — so [Mijnheer]90-joost said — it upset business very much . After inquiry as to how this came about , [Julia]58-julia learnt that it was found necessary to give [the workmen]644-the workmen a holiday on the principal day . [They]644-the workmen got so drunk the night before , that most of [them]644-the workmen were unfit for work , and [a few]1198-a few even had the hardihood to stop away entirely , so as to devote the whole day to getting drunk again . Under these circumstances , [Mijnheer]90-joost made a virtue of necessity , and gave a whole holiday to [the entire staff]1199-the entire staff . " Does [the office]603-the office have a holiday too ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked . [Mijnheer]90-joost nodded . " [These young fellows]3731-these young fellows , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said , " are all for holidays ; [they]3731-these young fellows are not like [[their]3731-these young fellows fathers]3732-their fathers . Now it is always ' [I]90-joost must ride on [my]90-joost wheel ; [I]90-joost must row in [[my]90-joost boat]3733-my boat ; [I]90-joost must play [my]90-joost piano ; let [us]3734-we put the work away as soon as [we]3734-we can , and forget it . ' It was not so in [my]90-joost young days ; then [we]3734-we worked , or [we]3734-we slept ; playing was for [children]703-children . There were [some great men of business]3736-some great men of business in those days . "[90-joost] [Julia]58-julia was not in a position to contradict this ; [she]58-julia only said , " It is a real holiday , then , like a bank holiday in [England]8-england ? "[58-julia] " A real holiday , yes , "[1200-he] [he]1200-he answered [her]58-julia ; " a holiday for [you]58-julia too , if [you]58-julia like . Would [you]58-julia like a real English bank holiday ? "[1200-he] [He]1200-he called to [[his]1200-he wife]168-his wife : " See here , "[1200-he] [he]1200-he said , " here is [an English miss who would like an English holiday]3737-an english miss who would like an english holiday ; when [the workmen]644-the workmen have theirs [she]3737-an english miss who would like an english holiday shall have [hers]3737-an english miss who would like an english holiday too , is it not so ? "[1200-he] [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw nodded , laughing . " But what will [you]1200-he do with it ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked . " [I]58-julia should go out , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ; " if it is fine [I]58-julia should go out all day . "[58-julia] " To the fair ? "[90-joost] [Mijnheer]90-joost asked . " [You]58-julia would not like that alone ; it would be very rough . "[90-joost] " [I]58-julia should go out into [the country]760-the country , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said . " [I]58-julia should make an excursion all by [myself]58-julia . "[58-julia] [They]1202-they seemed a good deal amused by [her]58-julia taste , but the idea suggested in fun was really determined upon ; [Julia]58-julia , so [Mijnheer]90-joost promised , should have a holiday when [every one else]1203-every one else did , and do just what [she]58-julia pleased . " [You]58-julia shall do as [you]58-julia like , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said ; " even though it is not to go to the fair and eat pooferchjes . It is only once in a year [one]3325-one can eat pooferchjes , or three times rather ; they are to be had on each of the three days . "[90-joost] " What are [they]1202-they ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked . " [I]90-joost have never heard of them . "[90-joost] " Never heard of them , "[441-the old man] [the old man]441-the old man exclaimed . " [They]1202-they do not have them , [I]441-the old man suppose , on an English bank holiday ? Then certainly [you]58-julia must have them here ; [we]3741-we will go and eat them on the first day of the fair , when everything is nice and clean , and there are [not too many people]3742-not too many people about . [I]441-the old man will find [a nice quiet place]3743-a nice quiet place , and [we]3741-we will go and eat them together , after tea , before there are [great crowds]3744-great crowds . Will [you]58-julia come with [me]441-the old man ? [I]441-the old man shall be taking [[my]441-the old man young lady]3745-my young lady to the fair like a gay dog . "[441-the old man] [He]90-joost chuckled at the idea , and [Julia]58-julia readily agreed . " [I]58-julia shall be delighted , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . When [Denah]103-denah came , a little later , it seemed [she]103-denah would be delighted too , although [she]103-denah was not specially asked . But when [she]103-denah heard of the plan , [she]103-denah announced that [[her]103-denah father]210-her father had promised to take [Anna]61-denah and [herself]103-denah , and what could be better than that [the parties]828-the parties should join ? [Mijnheer]90-joost quite approved of this , so did [Julia]58-julia ; and [she]58-julia , on hearing [Denah]61-denah 's proposal , at once saw that [Joost]90-joost was included as [he]90-joost had not been before . [Joost]90-joost did not like fairs ; [he]90-joost objected to noise , and glare , and crowds , and all such things ; neither did [he]90-joost care for pooferchjes ; they were too bilious for [him]90-joost . Nevertheless [he]90-joost agreed to join [the party]806-the party ; [Denah]61-denah was quite sure it was entirely on [her]61-denah account . On the morning of the first day of the fair , [Julia]58-julia went into [the town]569-the town to buy cakes to take with [her]58-julia on to - morrow 's excursion . [She]58-julia had not changed [her]58-julia mind about that ; [she]58-julia was still fully determined to go and spend a long day in [the Dunes]13-the dunes . [She]58-julia had not told [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens of [the place chosen]1209-the place chosen ; [she]58-julia and [Mijnheer]90-joost had much fun and mystery about it , [he]90-joost declaring [she]58-julia was going to [the wood]591-the wood to ride donkeys with [[the head gardener]1211-the head gardener 's fat wife]1212-the head gardener 's fat wife . There was another thing [she]58-julia also had not told [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens — a slight alteration there had been in [her]58-julia plans ; [she]58-julia was not , as [she]58-julia had first intended , going alone . It had somehow come about that [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew was going with [her]58-julia ; [he]75-rawson - clew had never seen [the Dunes]13-the dunes , and [he]75-rawson - clew had nothing to do that day , and [he]75-rawson - clew was not going to [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz in the evening , it seemed rather a good idea that [he]75-rawson - clew should go for a holiday too ; [Julia]58-julia saw no objection to it , but also [she]58-julia saw that it would not do to tell [[her]58-julia Dutch employers]1213-her dutch employers . [She]58-julia had never mentioned [Rawson Clew]75-rawson - clew to [them]1213-her dutch employers — there had not seemed any need ; [she]58-julia never met [him]75-rawson - clew till [she]58-julia was clear of [the town]569-the town and the range of reporting tongues [there]180-there , and [she]58-julia usually parted from [him]75-rawson - clew before [she]58-julia reached [the village]908-the village and [the observers there]1217-the observers there , so nothing was known of the evening walks . Which was rather a pity , for , as [Julia]58-julia afterwards found out , it is often wisest to tell something of [your]1218-your doings , especially if [you]1218-your can not tell all , and [they]1219-they are likely to come in for public notice . [Julia]58-julia bought [her]58-julia cakes , and went about [the town]569-the town feeling as holiday - like as [the gayest peasant [there]180-there]1221-the gayest peasant there , although [she]58-julia had no wonderful holiday head - dress of starched lace and gold plates . [She]58-julia did not see [any one [she]58-julia knew]1223-any one she knew , except [old Marthe]89-marthe , [[Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's housekeeper]1224-herr van de greutz 's housekeeper . [She]58-julia had met [the old woman]1225-the old woman several times when [she]58-julia was marketing , and was on speaking terms with [her]1225-the old woman now , so [she]58-julia had to stop and listen to [her]58-julia troubles . [They]1226-they were only the same old tale ; [[her]58-julia newest young cook]1227-her newest young cook had left suddenly , and [she]58-julia had come to [the town]569-the town to see if [she]58-julia could get another from among [the girls who had come in for the fair]1229-the girls who had come in for the fair . [She]58-julia had no success at all , and was setting out for [home]249-home , despondent , and not at all comforted to think that [she]58-julia would have to trudge in and try all over again the day after to - morrow . To - morrow , itself , the great day , it was no good trying ; [no girl]1231-no girl would pay attention to business then . In the evening [Julia]58-julia went again into [the town]569-the town , but this time with [Mijnheer]90-joost and [Joost]90-joost , and dressed in [her]58-julia best dress . It was not at all a new dress , nor at all a grand one , but it was well chosen , well made and well fitted , and certainly very well put on ; the gloves and hat , too , accorded with it , and [she]58-julia [herself]58-julia was in a humour of gaiety that bordered on brilliancy . Was [she]58-julia not going to have a holiday to - morrow , and was [she]58-julia not going to spend it in company with [a man [she]58-julia liked]1233-a man she liked , and in despite of Dutch propriety , which would certainly have been thoroughly and outrageously shocked thereby ? [Denah]61-denah knew nothing of the causes at work , but [she]61-denah was not slow to discern the result when [she]61-denah and [[her]61-denah father]210-her father and [sister]1235-sister met [the Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen party that evening . [She]61-denah smoothed the bow at the neck of [her]61-denah best dress , and looked at [her]61-denah gloves discontentedly ; [she]61-denah did not altogether admire [Julia]58-julia 's clothes , they were not at all Dutch ; but [she]61-denah had an intuitive idea that they came nearer to [Paris]26-paris , the sartorial ideal of [the nations]1236-the nations , than [her]61-denah own did . [She]61-denah looked suspiciously at [the English girl]559-the english girl , [her]61-denah eyes were shining and sparkling like stars ; they were full of alert interest and half - suppressed mischief . [She]61-denah looked at everything , and overlooked nothing , though [she]61-denah was talking to [Mijnheer]90-joost in a soft , purring voice , that was full of fun and wickedness . Now [she]61-denah turned to [Joost]90-joost , and [her]61-denah voice took another tone ; [she]61-denah was teasing [him]90-joost , making fun of [him]90-joost in a way that [Denah]61-denah decided was scandalous , although [[his]90-joost father]614-his father was there , aiding and abetting [her]61-denah . [Joost]90-joost did not seem to resent it a bit ; [he]90-joost listened quite serenely , and even turned a look on [her]61-denah as one who has [another and private interpretation of the words]1239-another and private interpretation of the words . [Anna]61-denah saw nothing of this ; [she]61-denah only thought [Julia]58-julia very nice , and [her]58-julia dress pretty , and [her]58-julia talk gay . But [Denah]61-denah , though not always so acute , was in love , and [she]61-denah saw a good deal , and treasured it up for use when the occasion should offer . [They]1240-they ate pooferchjes , sitting in a funny little covered stall ; at least , the top and three sides were covered , the fourth was open to [the street]366-the street . A long , narrow table , with clean white calico spread on it , ran down the centre of [the place]241-the place , and narrow forms stood on either side of [it]241-the place . [It]241-the place was lighted by a Chinese lantern hung from the roof , and also , and more especially , by a flare outside of the charcoal fire , where the pooferchjes were cooked . [A powerful brown - armed peasant woman]1243-a powerful brown - armed peasant woman made them , beating the batter till it frothed , and dropping it by the spoonful into the little hollows in the great sheet of iron that glowed on the stove without . The glow of the fire was on [her]1243-a powerful brown - armed peasant woman too , on [her]1243-a powerful brown - armed peasant woman short skirt and [her]1243-a powerful brown - armed peasant woman fine arms , and the flaring light , that flickered in the breeze , danced on [her]1243-a powerful brown - armed peasant woman strong , brown face , with its resolute lines , and splendid gold - ringed head - dress . [People]3334-people kept passing to and fro all the time , or stopping sometimes to look in ; [solemnly - gay holiday people]1245-solemnly - gay holiday people , enjoying [themselves]1245-solemnly - gay holiday people after [their]1245-solemnly - gay holiday people own fashion . The light flickered on [them]3334-people , too , and on [the brick pavement]1246-the brick pavement , and on the trees , plentiful almost as canals in [the town]569-the town . [Julia]58-julia leaned forward and looked , and listened to the guttural Dutch voices , and the curious patois to be heard now and then , and the distant notes of music that blended with it . And the flickering lights and shadows danced across [her]58-julia mind , and the simple holiday feeling of it all got to [her]58-julia head . Then the pooferchjes were done and brought in , little round , crisp things , smoking hot , and very greasy ; something like tiny English pancakes — at least one might say so if [one]3325-one had not tasted them . And then [more people]1249-more people came in and sat at the opposite side of the table , [a gardener of [another bulb grower]1251-another bulb grower]1250-a gardener of another bulb grower , and [[his]1250-a gardener of another bulb grower two daughters]1252-his two daughters . [He]1250-a gardener of another bulb grower raised [his]1250-a gardener of another bulb grower hat to [the Van Heigen party]1253-the van heigen party , and received a similar salutation in return , though [he]1250-a gardener of another bulb grower and [they]3334-people were careful to put [their]3334-people hats on again , a draught being a thing much feared . [Mijnheer]90-joost shook hands with [the father]608-the father , and [they]3334-people entered into conversation about the weather ; [the girls]3439-the girls looked across at [Denah]61-denah and [Anna]61-denah , and more still at [Julia]58-julia , whose small , slim hands [they]3334-people evidently admired . But at last the pooferchjes were all eaten and paid for . To do the latter [the notary]543-the notary , [Mijnheer]90-joost and [Joost]90-joost all brought out large purses and counted out small coins with care , and [the party]806-the party came out , making way for [new - comers]1258-new - comers . [They]3334-people did not go straight [home]249-home again , as was first intended , [Julia]58-julia 's interest and gaiety seemed to have infected [the others]312-the others — all except [Denah]61-denah , and [they]3334-people walked for a little while among the booths of toys , and sweets , and peepshows , and entertainments . And as [they]3334-people went , [Denah]61-denah grew more and more silent , watching [Julia]58-julia , who was walking with [Joost]90-joost ; the arrangement was not of [the English girl]559-the english girl 's seeking , but [Denah]61-denah took no account of that . The thing of which [she]58-julia did take account was that [they]1262-they two talked as [they]1262-they walked together , [he]1263-he as well as [she]58-julia , but both with the ease and quick comprehension of [people who have talked together]1264-people who have talked together often . [Mijnheer]90-joost stopped to look at the merry - go - round ; [he]90-joost admired the cheerful tune that it played . [He]90-joost was not [a connoisseur of music]1265-a connoisseur of music ; a barrel - organ was as good to [him]90-joost as the organ in [the Groote Kerk]27-the groote kerk . [The others]312-the others stopped too ; [Anna]61-denah exclaimed on the life - like and clever appearance of the bobbing horses , whereupon [[her]58-julia father]210-her father suggested that perhaps [the girls]3439-the girls would like to try a ride on the machine , and then befel the crowning mischief of the evening . [Julia]58-julia and [Anna]61-denah accepted the proposal readily . [Denah]61-denah declined ; [she]58-julia felt in no humour for it ; also [she]58-julia thought a refusal showed a superior mind — one likely to appeal to [a serious young man , who had no taste for the gaudy , gay , or fast , and who also had a tendency towards seasickness]1269-a serious young man , who had no taste for the gaudy , gay , or fast , and who also had a tendency towards seasickness . But , alas , for the fickleness of [man]1052-man ! While [Denah]61-denah stood with [[her]61-denah father]210-her father and [Mijnheer]90-joost , [Julia]58-julia rode round [the centre of lighted mirrors]1272-the centre of lighted mirrors on a prancing wooden horse , and [Joost]90-joost — [the serious , the sometimes seasick]1273-the serious , the sometimes seasick — rode beside [her]58-julia on a dappled grey , to the familiar old English tune , " Ta - ra - ra - boom - de - a. "[90-joost]

[The Dunes]13-the dunes lay some little distance from [the town]569-the town , [a low , but suddenly - rising hill boundary , that shut in [the basin of flat land]1276-the basin of flat land]1275-a low , but suddenly - rising hill boundary , that shut in the basin of flat land . [They]13-the dunes were all of pure sand , though in many places so matted with vegetation that it was hardly recognisable as such . Trees grew in places , especially on the side that fronted towards [the town]569-the town ; the way up lay through a dense young wood of beech and larch , and a short , broad - leafed variety of poplar . There was no undergrowth , but between the dead leaves one could see that a dark green , short - piled moss had managed to find a hold here and there , though so smooth was it that it looked more like old enamel than a natural growth . The trees had the appearance of high summer , deeply , intensely green , so that they seemed almost blackish in mass . There was no breeze among [them]13-the dunes ; even the dapples of sunlight which found their way through the roof of leaves hardly stirred , but lay in light patches , like scattered gold upon the ground . Flies and gnats moved and shimmered , a busy life , whose small voices were the only sound to be heard ; all else was very still , with the glorious reposeful stillness of full summer ; not oppressive , without weariness or exhaustion , rather as if the whole creation paused at this zenith to look round on its works , and beheld and saw that they were all very good . There were no clear paths , apparently [few people]1278-few people went that way ; certainly there was [no one]181-no one about when [Julia]58-julia and [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew came . It is true [they]1280-we saw [a kind of little beer - garden at]1281-a kind of little beer - garden at [the foot of [the slope]1283-the slope]1282-the foot of the slope , but there was [no one idling about it]1284-no one idling about it . " [We]1280-we shall have to come back here for lunch , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said . And when [he]75-rawson - clew suggested that it was rather a pity to have to retrace [their]1280-we steps , [she]58-julia answered , " It does n't matter , [we]1280-we are not going anywhere particular ; [we]1280-we may just as well wander one way as another . When [we]1280-we get to the top this time [we]1280-we will explore to the right , and when [we]1280-we get there again after lunch , [we]1280-we will go to the left ; do n't [you]75-rawson - clew think that is the best way ? This is to be a holiday , [you]75-rawson - clew know . "[58-julia] " Is a real holiday like a dog 's wanderings ? "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew inquired ; " bounded by no purpose except dinner when hungry ? "[75-rawson - clew] [Julia]58-julia thought it must be something of the kind . " Though , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " dogs always seem to have some end in view , or perhaps a dozen ends , for though [they]3746-they tear off after an imaginary interest as if there was nothing else in [the world]208-the world , [they]3746-they get tired of it , or else start another , and forget all about the first . "[58-julia] " That must also be part of the essence of a holiday , "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew said ; " at least , one would judge it to be so ; [boys]3748-boys and dogs , the only things in nature who really understand the art of holiday - making , chase wild geese , and otherwise do nothing of any account , with an inexhaustible energy , and a purposeful determination wonderful to behold . Also , [they]3746-they forget that there is such a thing as to - morrow , so that must be important too . "[75-rawson - clew] " [I]58-julia ca n't do that , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said . " [You]58-julia might try when [you]58-julia get to the top , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew suggested . " [I]75-rawson - clew will try then ; [I]75-rawson - clew do n't think [I]75-rawson - clew could do anything requiring an effort just now . "[75-rawson - clew] [Julia]58-julia agreed that [she]58-julia could not either , and [they]1285-they went on up straight before [them]1285-they . It is as easy to climb [a sand - hill]1286-a sand - hill in one place as in another , provided [you]1287-your stick [your]1287-your feet in the right way , and do not mind getting a good deal of sand in [your]1287-your boots . So [they]1285-they went straight , and at last got clear of the taller trees , and were struggling in thickets of young poplars , and other sinewy things . The sand was firmer , but honeycombed with rabbit holes , and tangled with brambles , and the direction was still upwards , though the growth was so thick , and the ground so bad , that it was often necessary to go a long way round . But in time [they]1285-they were through this too , and really out on the top . Here there was nothing but [the Dunes , wide , curving land]1288-the dunes , wide , curving land , that stretched away and away , [a tableland of little hollows and hills]1289-a tableland of little hollows and hills , like [some sea whose waves have been consolidated]1290-some sea whose waves have been consolidated ; near at hand [its]1289-a tableland of little hollows and hills colours were warm , if not vivid , but in the far distance it grew paler as the vegetation became less and less , till , far away , almost beyond sight , it failed to grey helm grass , and then altogether ceased , leaving [the sand]1291-the sand bare . Behind lay the trees through which [they]1285-they had come , sloping downwards in banks of cool shadows to the map - like land and [the distant town below]1292-the distant town below ; away on right and left were other groups of trees , on sides of hills and in rounded hollows , looking small enough from here , but in reality woods of some size . Here there was nothing ; but , above , a great blue sky , which seemed very close ; and , underfoot , low - growing Dune roses and wild thyme which filled the warm , still air with its matchless scent ; nothing but these , and space , and sunshine , and silence . [Julia]58-julia stopped and looked round , drawing in [her]58-julia breath ; [she]58-julia had found what [she]58-julia had come to see — what , perhaps , [she]58-julia had been vaguely wanting to find for a long time . " Is n't it good ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said at last . " Did [you]75-rawson - clew know there was so much room — so much room anywhere ? "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew looked in the direction [she]58-julia did ; [he]75-rawson - clew had seen so much of [the world]208-the world , and [she]58-julia had seen so little of [it]208-the world — that is , of the part which is solitary and beautiful . Yet [he]75-rawson - clew felt something of [her]58-julia enthusiasm for [this sunny , empty place — than which [he]75-rawson - clew had seen many finer things every year of [his]75-rawson - clew life]1294-this sunny , empty place — than which he had seen many finer things every year of his life . Perhaps this thought occurred to [her]58-julia , for [she]58-julia turned to [him]75-rawson - clew rather wistfully : " [I]58-julia expect it does not seem very much to [you]75-rawson - clew , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [you]75-rawson - clew have seen such a great deal . "[58-julia] " [I]75-rawson - clew do not remember to have seen anything quite like this , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew answered ; " and if [I]75-rawson - clew had , what then ? [One]3325-one does not get tired of things . "[75-rawson - clew] [Julia]58-julia looked at [him]75-rawson - clew thoughtfully . " [I]58-julia wonder , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " if one would ? If one would get weary of it , and want to go back to the other kind of life ? "[58-julia] [She]58-julia was not thinking of [Dune country]1295-dune country , rather of the simple life it represented to [her]58-julia just then . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew caught the note of seriousness in [her]58-julia tone and reminded [her]58-julia that thought for the past or future was no part of a holiday . " Remember , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , " [you]58-julia are to - day to emulate dogs and [boys]3748-boys . "[75-rawson - clew] [She]58-julia laughed . " How am [I]58-julia to begin ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked . " How will [you]75-rawson - clew ? "[58-julia] " [I]75-rawson - clew shall sit down , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said ; " [I]75-rawson - clew feel [I]75-rawson - clew could be inconsequent much better if [I]75-rawson - clew sat down to it ; that is no doubt because [I]75-rawson - clew am past [my]75-rawson - clew first youth . "[75-rawson - clew] " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , sitting down and putting [her]58-julia hat beside [her]58-julia ; " it is because [your]75-rawson - clew folly - muscles are stiff from want of use ; [you]75-rawson - clew have played lots of things , [I]58-julia expect — it is part of [your]75-rawson - clew necessary equipment to be able to do so , but [I]58-julia doubt if [you]75-rawson - clew have ever played [the fool]3751-the fool systematically . [I]58-julia do n't believe [you]75-rawson - clew have ever done , and certainly never enjoyed anything inconsequent or foolish in [your]75-rawson - clew life . "[58-julia] " If [you]58-julia were to ask [me]75-rawson - clew , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]1296-he returned , " [I]1296-he should hardly say [you]58-julia excelled in that direction either . How many inconsequent and foolish things have [you]58-julia done in [your]58-julia life ? "[1296-he] " Some , and [I]58-julia should like to do some more . If [I]58-julia were alone now , do [you]58-julia know what [I]58-julia should do ? [You]58-julia see [that deep hollow of sparkling white sand]3752-that deep hollow of sparkling white sand ? [I]58-julia should take off [my]58-julia clothes and lie there in the sun . "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew turned so that [his]1296-he back was that way . " Do not let [me]1296-he prevent [you]58-julia , "[1296-he] [he]1296-he said . [Julia]58-julia made use of the opportunity to empty the sand out of [her]58-julia boots . [He]1296-he looked round as [she]58-julia was finishing fastening them . " But why put them on again ? "[1296-he] [he]1296-he asked . " Because [I]58-julia have n't retired from [the world]208-the world , yet , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered , " and so [I]58-julia ca n't do quite all [I]58-julia like . "[58-julia] " When [you]1296-he do retire , will this ideal summer costume also be included in the programme ? [Your]1296-he taste in dress grows simpler ; quite ancient British , in fact . "[1296-he] " [The ancient Britons]3754-the ancient britons wore paint , and probably had fashions in it ; [I]58-julia do n't think of imitating [them]3754-the ancient britons . Tell [me]58-julia , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , turning now to gather the sweet - scented wild thyme , " did [you]1296-he ever really do anything foolish in [your]1296-he life ? [I]58-julia should like to know . "[58-julia] [He]1296-he answered [her]58-julia that [he]1296-he had , but without convincing [her]58-julia . Afterwards , [he]1296-he came to the conclusion that , whatever might have been the case before , [he]1296-he that day qualified to take rank with [any one in the matter]1297-any one in the matter . All the same , it was a very pleasant day , and [they]1298-they both enjoyed it much ; it is doubtful if any one in [the town]569-the town or [its]569-the town environs enjoyed that holiday more than [these two , who , from different reasons , had probably never had so real a holiday before]1300-these two , who , from different reasons , had probably never had so real a holiday before . [They]1298-they wandered over [the great open tract of land]1301-the great open tract of land , meeting [no one]181-no one ; once [they]1298-they came near enough to [the seaward edge]1303-the seaward edge to see the distant shimmer of water ; once [they]1298-they found [themselves]1298-they in the part where there has been some little attempt at cultivation , and small patches of potatoes struggle for life , and a little railway crosses [the sandhills]1304-the sandhills . Twice [they]1298-they came upon [the road along which , on working days , [the peasant women]890-the peasant women bring [their]890-the peasant women fish to market in [the town]569-the town]1305-the road along which , on working days , the peasant women bring their fish to market in the town . But chiefly [they]1298-they kept to [the small , dense woods , where the sunlight only splashed the ground]1308-the small , dense woods , where the sunlight only splashed the ground ; or to the open solitary spaces where the bees hummed in the wild thyme , and the butterflies chased each other over the low rose bushes . A good deal after mid - day , at a time dictated entirely by choice , and not custom , [they]1298-they made [their]1298-they way back to [the beer garden]1309-the beer garden . [It]1310-it was [a very little place , scarcely worthy of the name]1311-a very little place , scarcely worthy of the name ; [the smallest possible house]1312-the smallest possible house , more like [a barn]1313-a barn than anything else , right in the shadow of [the wood]591-the wood . The fare to be obtained was bad beer , excellent coffee , new bread , and old cheese ; but it was enough , supplemented by the cakes bought yesterday in [the town]569-the town ; [Julia]58-julia knew enough of the ways of [the place]241-the place to know one can bring [one]3325-one 's own food to [such places]1318-such places without giving offence . As in the morning , when [they]1298-they first passed [it]1310-it , there was [no one]181-no one about , [every one]582-every one had gone to the fair , except [one taciturn old woman who brought the required things and then shut [herself]1321-one taciturn old woman who brought the required things and then shut herself in the house in [the house]175-the house]1321-one taciturn old woman who brought the required things and then shut herself in the house . The meal was spread under the trees on a little green - painted table , with legs buried deep in sand ; there were two high , straight chairs set up to the table , and a wooden footstool put by one for [Julia]58-julia , who , seeing it , said this was certainly a picnic , and it was really necessary to eat the broodje in the correct picnic way . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew tried , with much gravity , but [she]58-julia laughed till [the taciturn old woman]1323-the taciturn old woman looked out of window , and wondered who [they]1298-they were , and how [they]1298-they came to be [here]371-here . When the meal was done , [they]1298-they went back again up [the steep slope]1325-the steep slope , and then away on the left . [The country on this side]1326-the country on this side was less open , and more hilly , deeper hollows and [larger woods]1327-larger woods , still there was not much difficulty in finding the way . The latter part of the day was not so fine as the earlier , the sky clouded over , and , though there was still no wind , the air grew more chilly . [They]1298-they hardly noticed the change , being in a dense young wood where there was little light , but [Julia]58-julia lost something of the holiday spirit , and [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew became grave , talking more seriously of serious things than had ever before happened in [their]1298-they curious acquaintanceship . [They]1298-they sat down to rest in [a green hollow]1328-a green hollow , and [Julia]58-julia began to arrange neatly the bunch of short - stemmed thyme flowers that [she]58-julia carried . [They]1298-they had been quiet for some little time , [she]58-julia thinking about [their]1298-they curious acquaintance , and wondering when it would end . Of course it would end — [she]58-julia knew that ; it was a thing of mind only ; there was very little feeling about it — a certain mutual interest and a liking that had grown of late , kindness on [his]75-rawson - clew part , gratitude on [hers]58-julia , nothing more . But of its sort it had grown to be intimate ; [she]58-julia had told [him]75-rawson - clew things of [her]58-julia thoughts , and of [herself]58-julia , and [[her]58-julia people]1191-her people too , that [she]58-julia had told to [no one else]3400-no one else ; and [he]75-rawson - clew , which was perhaps more remarkable , had sometimes returned the compliment . And yet by and by — soon , perhaps — [he]75-rawson - clew would go away , and it would be as if [they]1298-they had never met ; it was like [people]3334-people on [a steamer]532-a steamer together , [she]58-julia thought , for the space of the voyage [they]1298-they saw [each other]3407-each other daily , saw more intimately into [each other]3407-each other than [many blood relations]1335-many blood relations did , and then , when port was reached , [they]1298-they separated , the whole thing finished . [She]58-julia wondered when this would finish , and just then [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew spoke , and unconsciously answered [her]58-julia thought . " [I]75-rawson - clew am going back to [England]8-england soon , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said . [She]58-julia looked up . " Is [your]75-rawson - clew work [here]371-here finished ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked . " It is at an end , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew answered ; " that is the same thing . "[75-rawson - clew] Then [she]58-julia , [her]58-julia intuition enlightened by a like experience suddenly knew that [he]75-rawson - clew , too , had failed . " [You]75-rawson - clew mean it can not be done , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . [He]75-rawson - clew opened [his]75-rawson - clew cigarette case , and selected a cigarette carefully . " May [I]75-rawson - clew smoke ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew asked ; " there are a good many gnats and mosquitoes about here . "[75-rawson - clew] [He]75-rawson - clew felt for a match , and , when [he]75-rawson - clew had struck it , asked impersonally , " Do [you]58-julia believe things can not be done ? "[75-rawson - clew] " Yes , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered ; " [I]58-julia know that sometimes [they]3756-they can not ; [I]58-julia have proved it to [myself]58-julia . "[58-julia] " [You]75-rawson - clew have not , then , much opinion of [the people who do not know when [they]3757-the people who do not know when they are beaten are beaten]3757-the people who do not know when they are beaten ? "[75-rawson - clew] " [I]58-julia do n't think [I]58-julia have , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered ; " [you]75-rawson - clew can not help knowing when [you]75-rawson - clew are beaten if [you]75-rawson - clew really are — that is , unless [you]75-rawson - clew are [a fool]3758-a fool . Of course , if [you]75-rawson - clew are only beaten in one round , or one effort , that is another thing ; [you]75-rawson - clew can get up and try again . But if [you]75-rawson - clew are really and truly beaten , by [yourself]75-rawson - clew , or circumstances , or something — well , there 's an end ; there is nothing but to get up and go on . "[58-julia] " Just so ; in that case , as [you]1336-you say , there is not much going to be done , except going [home]249-home . "[110-sug gested] [Julia]58-julia nodded . " But [I]58-julia ca n't even do that , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . " [I]58-julia am beaten , but [I]58-julia have got to stay [here]371-here all the same , having nowhere exactly to go . "[58-julia] This was the first time [she]58-julia had spoken even indirectly of [her]58-julia own future movements . " But , perhaps , "[1336-you] [he]1336-you [sug gested]110-sug gested , " if [you]58-julia stay , [you]58-julia may find a back way to [your]58-julia object after all . "[1336-you] [She]58-julia shook [her]58-julia head . " It is the back way [I]58-julia tried . No , there is no way ; it is blocked . [I]58-julia know , because it is [myself]58-julia that blocks it . "[58-julia] " In that case , "[1336-you] [he]1336-you said , " [I]1336-you 'm afraid [I]1336-you must agree with [you]58-julia ; there is no way ; oneself is about the most insurmountable block of all . [I]1336-you might have known that [you]58-julia were hardly likely to make any mistake as to whether [you]58-julia were really beaten or not . "[1336-you] " [I]58-julia should not think it was a mistake [you]1336-you were likely to make either , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia observed . " [You]1336-you think not ? Well , [I]58-julia had no chance this time ; the fact has been made pretty obvious to [me]58-julia . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia did not say [she]58-julia was sorry ; in [her]58-julia opinion it was an impertinence to offer condolence to failure . " [I]58-julia suppose , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , after a pause , " there is not a back way — a door , or window , even , to [your]1336-you object ? "[58-julia] " Unfortunately , no . There are no windows at the back ; and as to the door — like [you]1336-you , it was that which [I]58-julia tried , with the result that recently — yesterday , in fact — [I]58-julia was metaphorically shown out . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia had learnt enough by this time , though [she]58-julia had not been told for certain , that [her]58-julia first suspicions were right ; to be sure , it was the explosive which took [Rawson]75-rawson - clew - Clew to [the little village]1337-the little village evening after evening . [She]58-julia had gathered as much from various things which had been said , though [she]58-julia did not know at all how [he]75-rawson - clew was trying to get it , nor in what way [he]75-rawson - clew had introduced [himself]75-rawson - clew to [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz . Whatever method [he]75-rawson - clew had tried it was now clear [he]75-rawson - clew had failed ; no doubt been found out , for [the chemist]1021-the chemist , unlike [Joost Van Heigen]77-joost , was the very reverse of unsuspecting , and thoroughly on the look - out for [other nations who wanted to share [his]75-rawson - clew discovery]1339-other nations who wanted to share his discovery . For a moment [Julia]58-julia wished [she]58-julia had been in [[Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew 's place]1340-rawson - clew 's place ; of course [she]58-julia , too , might have failed — probably would ; [she]58-julia had no reason to think [she]58-julia would succeed where [he]75-rawson - clew could not ; but [she]58-julia certainly would not have failed in this for the reason [she]58-julia had failed with the blue daffodil . The attempt would have been so thoroughly well worth making ; there would have been some sport in it , and [a foe worthy of [her]58-julia steel]1341-a foe worthy of her steel . In spite of [her]58-julia desire for the simple life , [she]58-julia had too much real ability for this sort of intrigue , and too much past practice in subterfuge , not to experience lapses of inclination for it when [she]58-julia saw such work being done , and perhaps not done well . Of this , however , [she]58-julia naturally did not speak to [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew ; [she]58-julia rearranged [her]58-julia flowers in silence for a little while , at last [she]58-julia said — " It is hateful to fail . "[58-julia] " It is ignominious , certainly ; [one]3325-one does not wish to blazon it from the housetops ; still , doubtless like [your]75-rawson - clew crochet work , it is good discipline . "[58-julia] " Maybe , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia allowed , but without conviction . " [Yours]75-rawson - clew seems a simple failure , [mine]3762-mine is a compound one . If it is ignominious , as [you]75-rawson - clew say , to fail , it would have been equally ignominious in another way if [I]58-julia had succeeded . [I]58-julia could not have been satisfied either way . "[58-julia] " That sounds very complicated , "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew said ; " but then , [I]75-rawson - clew imagine [you]75-rawson - clew are [a complicated young person]3763-a complicated young person . "[75-rawson - clew] " And [you]75-rawson - clew are not . "[58-julia] " Not young , certainly , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , lighting another cigarette . " Nor complicated , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia insisted ; " [you]75-rawson - clew are built on straight lines ; there are given things [you]75-rawson - clew can do and ca n't do , would do and would not do , and might do in an emer gency . It is [a fine kind of person to be]3764-a fine kind of person to be , but it is not the kind which surprises itself . "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew blew a smoke - ring into the air ; [he]75-rawson - clew was smiling a little . " How old are [you]75-rawson - clew ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said . " Twenty ? Almost twenty - one , is it ? And until [you]75-rawson - clew were sixteen [you]75-rawson - clew knocked about a bit ? [Sixteen]111-sixteen is too young to come much across [the natural man]1137-the natural man — not [the artful dodging man]3766-the artful dodging man , or [the man of civilisation]3767-the man of civilisation , but [the natural , primitive man]3768-the natural , primitive man , own blood relation to [Adam]112-adam and [the king of the Cannibal Islands]3769-the king of the cannibal islands . [You]75-rawson - clew may meet [him]1137-the natural man by and by , and if [you]75-rawson - clew do [he]1137-the natural man may surprise [you]75-rawson - clew ; [he]1137-the natural man is full of surprises — [he]1137-the natural man rather surprises [himself]1137-the natural man , that is , if [[his]1137-the natural man local habitat]3770-his local habitat is ordinarily [an educated , decent person]3771-an educated , decent person . "[75-rawson - clew] " [You]1342-you have not got [a natural man]3772-a natural man , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said shortly ; [she]58-julia was annoyed , without quite knowing why , by [his]1342-you manner . " Have [I]58-julia not ? Quite likely ; certainly , [he]1137-the natural man has never bothered [me]58-julia , but [I]58-julia should not like to count on [him]1137-the natural man . Since [we]3773-we have got to personalities , may [I]58-julia say that [you]75-rawson - clew have got [a natural woman]3774-a natural woman , and plenty of [her]3774-a natural woman ; also a marked taste for the works of the machine , in preference to the face usually presented to [the company]3775-the company ? "[58-julia] " The works are the only interesting part ; [I]1344-i do n't care for the drawing - room side of things ; they are cultivated , but they are too much on the skin . [I]1344-i would much rather be [a stoker]3776-a stoker , or [an engineer]3777-an engineer , than sit on [deck]3778-deck all day and talk about Florentine art , and the Handel Festival , and Egyptology , and the gospel of [Tolstoy]113-tolstoy , and play cricket and quoits , and dance a little , and sing a little , and flirt a little , ever so nicely . Oh , there are lots of [girls who can do all those things , and do them equally well]3779-girls who can do all those things , and do them equally well ; [I]1344-i know [a few who can , well off , well - bred girls]3780-a few who can , well off , well - bred girls — [you]75-rawson - clew must know [a great many]3781-a great many . [They]3781-a great many are clever to begin with , and [they]3781-a great many are taught that way ; it is a perfect treat to meet [them]3781-a great many and watch [them]3781-a great many , but [I]1344-i never want to imitate [them]3781-a great many , even if [I]1344-i could — and there is no danger of that . [I]1344-i would rather be in [the engine - room]3782-the engine - room , with [my]1344-i coat off , a bit greasy and very profane , and doing something . There would be more flesh and blood there , even if it were a bit grubby ; [I]1344-i believe [I]1344-i 'm more at [home]249-home with [people who can do — well , what 's necessary , even if it is not exactly nice]3784-people who can do — well , what 's necessary , even if it is not exactly nice . "[1344-i] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew knew exactly [the kind of woman [she]1344-i had described for [the deck]1345-the deck]1343-the kind of woman she had described for the deck — [he]75-rawson - clew met [them]1343-the kind of woman she had described for the deck often ; charming creatures , far as the poles asunder from [the girl who spoke of them]1346-the girl who spoke of them ; [he]75-rawson - clew liked [them]1343-the kind of woman she had described for the deck — in moderation , and in [their]1343-the kind of woman she had described for the deck place , much as [[his]75-rawson - clew forebears]1347-his forebears of fifty years ago had liked [theirs]1343-the kind of woman she had described for the deck , [the delicate , sensitive creatures of that era]1348-the delicate , sensitive creatures of that era . [He]75-rawson - clew had never regarded [Julia]58-julia in that light ; [he]75-rawson - clew found [her]58-julia certainly more entertaining as [a companion]453-a companion , though also very far short of the standard as [a woman]3574-a woman and [an ornament]1351-an ornament . " [The people in [the engine - room]3782-the engine - room]3785-the people in the engine - room , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew observed , " would certainly be more useful in an emergency ; still , life is not made up entirely of emergencies . "[75-rawson - clew] " No , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ; " and in between times [such people]3787-such people are better not on show — [I]58-julia know that ; that is why [I]58-julia do not care for the drawing - room side of things , [I]58-julia do n't know enough to shine in them . "[58-julia] " Do [you]58-julia think it is a matter of knowledge ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew asked , " or inclination ? If it comes to knowledge [I]75-rawson - clew should say [you]58-julia had a rather remarkable stock of an unusual sort , and at first hand . That may not be what is required for a complete drawing - room success , though [I]75-rawson - clew am not sure that it is not more interesting — say for an excursion — than a flitting glance at the subjects [you]58-julia mention , and about eighteen or twenty more that [you]58-julia did not . "[75-rawson - clew] [Julia]58-julia looked up , half pleased , doubtful as to whether or not to interpret this as a compliment ; [she]58-julia never knew quite how much [he]75-rawson - clew meant of what [he]75-rawson - clew said ; [his]75-rawson - clew manner was exactly the same , whether [he]75-rawson - clew was in fun or in earnest . But if [she]58-julia thought of asking [him]75-rawson - clew now [she]58-julia was prevented , for at that moment [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's watch slipped out of [her]58-julia belt into [her]58-julia lap , and [she]58-julia saw the time . " How late is it ! "[58-julia] [she]58-julia exclaimed . " [We]3788-we ought to have started half - an - hour ago ; it will take [me]58-julia two hours , and more , to get [home]249-home from here , even if [I]58-julia go by [the tram in [the town]569-the town]3790-the tram in the town . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia rose as [she]58-julia spoke , and [he]75-rawson - clew rose more slowly . " Shall [I]75-rawson - clew take [your]58-julia flowers for [you]58-julia ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew asked . " They seem rather inclined to tumble about ; do n't [you]58-julia think they would be safer in [my]75-rawson - clew pocket ? As [you]58-julia say [you]58-julia are going to dry them , it wo n't matter crushing them . "[75-rawson - clew] [She]58-julia gave them to [him]75-rawson - clew , and [he]75-rawson - clew put the sweet - smelling bunch into [his]75-rawson - clew pocket , then [they]1352-they started for the edge of [the wood]591-the wood . " It is much colder , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; " and the sun is all gone ; [I]58-julia suppose the clouds have been coming gradually , but [I]58-julia did not notice before . If it is going to rain , [we]1352-they shall get decidedly wet before [we]1352-they get back . "[58-julia] " [I]75-rawson - clew am afraid so , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew agreed ; " [you]58-julia have no coat . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia told [him]75-rawson - clew that did not matter , [she]58-julia did not mind getting wet , and [she]58-julia spoke with a cheerful buoyancy that carried conviction . When [they]1352-they reached [the outskirts of [the wood]591-the wood]1354-the outskirts of the wood , however , [they]1352-they saw there was not much chance of rain , but a much worse evil threatened . All the distance on [the seaward side]1356-the seaward side was blotted out , a fine white mist shut out [the curving land]1357-the curving land in that direction . It was blowing up towards [them]1352-they , rolling down [the little hills]1358-the little hills in billowy puffs , and lying filmy , yet dense , in the hollows , moved by a wind unfelt here . " A sea fog , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia wonder how far it is coming . "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew wondered too ; [he]75-rawson - clew thought , as [she]58-julia did , that there was every chance of its coming far and fast , but it did not seem necessary to either of [them]1352-they to say anything so unpleasantly and obviously probable . [They]1352-they set out homewards as fast as [they]1352-they could ; it was a long way to the place where [they]1352-they had climbed up , unfortunately all across [open country]1359-open country , entirely without [roads or definite paths]1360-roads or definite paths , and the drifting sea fog was coming up fast , bound , it would seem , the same way . Soon it was upon [them]1352-they ; [they]1352-they felt its advance in the chill that , like cold fingers , laid hold on everything ; it came quite silently up from behind , without noticeable wind , eerily creeping up and enfolding everything , putting a white winding - sheet not about [the earth]1361-the earth only , but the very air also . The cotton blouse that [Julia]58-julia wore became limp and wet as if it had been dipped in water ; [she]58-julia could see the fog condensing in beads on [[her]58-julia companion]684-her companion 's coat almost like hoar frost ; it lay on every low - growing rose bush and bramble that [they]1352-they stepped upon , [a curious transformer of all near objects]1363-a curious transformer of all near objects , [a complete obliterator of all more distant ones]1364-a complete obliterator of all more distant ones . [They]1352-they pushed on as quickly as might be , climbing [little hills]1365-little hills , descending into hollows ; stumbling among rabbit holes , threading [their]1352-they way through thickets ; apparently finding something amusing in the patriarchal colonies of rabbit burrows that tripped [them]1352-they up , and stopping to argue , though hardly in earnest , as to whether [they]1352-they had passed that way or not , when some white - barked tree , or other landmark , loomed suddenly out of the thickening mist . Once it seemed the fog was going to lift ; [Julia]58-julia thought [she]58-julia saw the outline of [a distant hill]1366-a distant hill , but either it was closed in again directly , or else [she]58-julia mistook a thicker fold of cloud for a more solid object , for it was lost almost before [she]58-julia pointed it out . For something over two hours [they]1352-they walked and stumbled , and went up small ascents and came down small declines ; then suddenly [they]1352-they came upon the white - barked tree again . It was the same one that [they]1352-they had seen more than an hour and a half ago ; [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew recognised [it]1367-it by a peculiar warty growth where the branches forked ; [they]1352-they had now approached it from the other side , but clearly it was the same one , and [they]1352-they had come round in a circle . [He]75-rawson - clew stopped and pointed it out to [her]58-julia .
