" [I]75-rawson - clew am afraid , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , " [we]1352-they had better do what is recommended when the clouds come down on [the mountains]3792-the mountains . "[75-rawson - clew] " And that is ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked . " Sit down and wait till [they]1352-they shift . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia could not but see the advisability of this , also [she]58-julia was very tired , the going for these two hours had not been easy , and it had come at the end of a long day . [She]58-julia would not admit , even to [herself]58-julia , that [she]58-julia was tired , but [she]58-julia was , so [she]58-julia agreed to the waiting ; after all , it was impossible to pretend longer that [they]1352-they were going to get [home]249-home easily , and were not really hopelessly astray . " [We]1352-they will go a little way in among the trees , "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew said ; " [it]3793-it is more sheltered , and [we]1352-they shall be able to find the way quite as easily from one place as another when the fog lifts . "[75-rawson - clew] [They]1352-they found as sheltered a spot as [they]1352-they could , and sat down under a big tree ; as [they]1352-they did so [his]75-rawson - clew hand came in contact with [Julia]58-julia 's wet sleeve and cold arm . " How cold [you]58-julia are ! "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said . " [You]58-julia have nothing on . "[75-rawson - clew] " Oh , yes , [I]58-julia have , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia assured [him]75-rawson - clew . " [I]75-rawson - clew did not avail [myself]75-rawson - clew of [your]75-rawson - clew permission this morning . "[75-rawson - clew] [He]75-rawson - clew took off [his]75-rawson - clew coat and put it round [her]58-julia . But [she]58-julia threw it off again . " That wo n't do at all , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " now [you]75-rawson - clew have nothing on , and that is much more improper ; [women]3573-women may sit in [their]3573-women shirt sleeves , [men]3625-men may not . "[58-julia] " Do n't be absurd ! "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said authoritatively ; " [you]58-julia are to keep that on , "[75-rawson - clew] and [he]75-rawson - clew wrapped it about [her]58-julia with a decision that brought home to [her]58-julia [her]58-julia youth and smallness . " [You]75-rawson - clew are shutting all the damp in , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia protested , shifting [her]58-julia point of attack , " and that is very unwholesome . [I]58-julia sha n't get warm ; [I]58-julia have n't any warmth to start with ; [you]75-rawson - clew are wasting what [you]75-rawson - clew have got to no purpose . "[58-julia] But [he]75-rawson - clew did not waste it , for eventually it was arranged that [they]1369-they sat close together under the tree , with the coat put as far as it would go over [both of [them]1369-they]1370-both of them . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew was not given to thinking how things looked , [he]75-rawson - clew did what [he]75-rawson - clew thought necessary , or advisable , without taking any thought of that kind ; so it did not occur to [him]75-rawson - clew how this arrangement might look to [an unprejudiced observer]1371-an unprejudiced observer , had there been any such . But [Julia]58-julia , with [her]58-julia faculty for seeing [herself]58-julia as [others]239-others saw [her]58-julia , was much , though silently , amused as [she]58-julia thought of [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens . [Poor , kind folks]1373-poor , kind folks , [they]1373-poor , kind folks were doubtless already wondering what could have become of [her]58-julia ; if [they]1373-poor , kind folks could only have seen [her]58-julia sitting thus , with [an unknown man]1374-an unknown man , what would [their]1373-poor , kind folks Dutch propriety have said ? " Do [you]58-julia suppose this fog will be in [the town]569-the town ? "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew said , after a time . " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered , " [I]58-julia should think not ; from what [I]58-julia have heard , [I]58-julia think it is very unlikely . "[58-julia] " Then [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens wo n't know what has become of [you]75-rawson - clew ? "[75-rawson - clew] " Not a bit in [the world]208-the world ; [they]1373-poor , kind folks do n't even know where [I]75-rawson - clew was going to - day . [I]75-rawson - clew did not tell [them]1373-poor , kind folks ; [I]75-rawson - clew am afraid [they]1373-poor , kind folks will be rather uneasy about [me]75-rawson - clew , but perhaps not so very much , [they]1373-poor , kind folks know by this time [I]75-rawson - clew can take care of [myself]75-rawson - clew ; besides , [I]75-rawson - clew shall be [home]249-home before bed - time , if the fog lifts . "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew agreed , and [they]1375-they talked of other things . [Julia]58-julia held the opinion that when an evil has to be endured , not cured , there is no good in discussing it over and over again ; [she]58-julia had a considerable gift for making the best of other things besides opportunities . But the fog did not lift soon ; it did not grow denser , but it did not grow less ; it just lay soft and chilly , casting a white pall of silence on all things , closing day before its time , and making it impossible to say when evening ended and night began . Gradually [the two who waited for its lifting]1376-the two who waited for its lifting fell into silence , and [Julia]58-julia , tired out , at last dropped asleep , [her]58-julia head tilted back against the tree - trunk , [her]58-julia shoulder pressed close against [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew under the shelter of [his]75-rawson - clew coat . [He]75-rawson - clew did not move , [he]75-rawson - clew was afraid of waking [her]58-julia ; [he]75-rawson - clew sat watching , waiting in the eerie white stillness , until at last the space before [him]75-rawson - clew altered , and gradually between the trees [he]75-rawson - clew saw the faint outline of [a hill]1377-a hill , dark against the dark sky . Slowly the white mist rolled from it , a billowy , ghostly thing , that left [a black , vague world]1378-a black , vague world , only dimly seen . [He]75-rawson - clew looked at [the sleeping girl]1379-the sleeping girl , then at [the hill]1380-the hill ; the fog was clearing , there was no doubt about that ; soon it would be quite gone , but it would be a very dark night , the stars would hardly show , and the moon was now long down . [He]75-rawson - clew was not at all sure of being able to find [his]75-rawson - clew way across [this undulating country]1381-this undulating country , so entirely devoid of prominent features , in a very dark night . Rather [he]75-rawson - clew was nearly sure that [he]75-rawson - clew could not do it ; and though [he]75-rawson - clew had a by no means low opinion of [Julia]58-julia 's abilities , [he]75-rawson - clew did not think that [she]58-julia could either . Also , with a sense of dramatic fitness equal to that of [the girl]415-the girl 's [he]75-rawson - clew thought [their]1383-their arrival in [the town]569-the town would be rather ill - timed if [they]1383-their started now . It would be wiser to wait till after it was light , though dawn was not so very early now , the summer being far advanced . So [he]75-rawson - clew decided , and [Julia]58-julia slept peacefully on , [her]58-julia head dropping lower and lower , till finally it reached [his]75-rawson - clew shoulder . But [he]75-rawson - clew did not move ; [he]75-rawson - clew left [it]1385-it resting there , and waited , thinking of nothing perhaps , or anything ; or perhaps of that unknown quantity , [the natural man]1137-the natural man , which has a way of stirring sometimes even in the most civilised , at night time . So [he]75-rawson - clew sat and watched for the dawn .

It was a bright sunny morning , and , though the third and last day of the fair , [people]3334-people went to [their]3334-people business as usual . [The Dutch]1388-the dutch are [early risers]1389-early risers , and set about [their]1388-the dutch day 's work in good time ; but even had [they]1388-the dutch been [the reverse]1390-the reverse , the latest of [them]1388-the dutch would have been about before [Julia]58-julia and [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew reached [the outskirts of [the town]569-the town]568-the outskirts of the town . [They]1388-the dutch had stopped for breakfast at [the first village [they]1388-the dutch came to after leaving [the Dunes]13-the dunes]1393-the first village they came to after leaving the dunes , this on the principle of being hung for a sheep rather than a lamb . It did not seem to matter being a little later considering the necessarily unreasonable hour of [their]1388-the dutch return ; also [Julia]58-julia , with the instinct of [[her]58-julia family]1195-her family for detail ; preferred to set [herself]58-julia to rights so as to present the best appearance possible when [she]58-julia arrived at [the Van Heigens ']1395-the van heigens ' . It was not natural , of course , that [a person]967-a person should appear too neat and orderly after a night of adventure , lost on [the Dunes]13-the dunes ; but the reverse was not becoming . [Julia]58-julia hit the medium between the two with a nicety which might have cost one not a [Polkington]58-julia some thought , but to one of [them]1388-the dutch was merely the natural thing . Together [Julia]58-julia and [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew walked to [the outskirts of [the town]569-the town]568-the outskirts of the town . [Their]1388-the dutch ways parted there — [his]1399-he to the left , [hers]58-julia to the right ; it was [the port of which [she]58-julia had thought yesterday , [the place of final separation]1401-the place of final separation]1400-the port of which she had thought yesterday , the place of final separation . [He]1399-he had proposed to go with [her]58-julia to [the Van Heigens]1402-the van heigens , so as to bear testimony to what had befallen , and to assure [them]1388-the dutch that [she]58-julia was quite safe ; but [she]58-julia would not have this , [she]58-julia felt [she]58-julia could manage very much better without [him]1399-he , [his]1399-he presence would only require a good deal of extra explanation , none too easy to give . [He]1399-he guessed the reason of [her]58-julia refusal and saw the wisdom of it , although [he]1399-he felt annoyed that [she]58-julia had , as [he]1399-he now perceived [she]58-julia must , concealed [their]1403-their earlier acquaintance . It might have been advisable , seeing [Dutch]83-dutch notions of propriety ; but it placed the matter in a rather invidious light , and also began to bring home to [him]1399-he the fact , which grew very much more evident before the day was over , that [he]1399-he had distinguished [himself]1399-he by an act of really remarkable folly . [They]1403-their had almost reached [the town]569-the town , in fact had passed [some small houses]1405-some small houses , [the dwelling - places of [carriage proprietors]1407-carriage proprietors and [washerwomen]1408-washerwomen]1406-the dwelling - places of carriage proprietors and washerwomen , when [a girl]201-a girl stepped out of a doorway some distance ahead of [them]1403-their . [She]201-a girl glanced in [their]1403-their direction , then stared . " There 's [Denah]61-denah , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; [she]58-julia did not speak with consternation though [Denah]61-denah was about [the last person [she]58-julia wanted to see]1410-the last person she wanted to see just then . Consternation is a waste of time and energy when [you]1411-you are found out , a bold face and immediate actions are usually best . [Julia]58-julia waved [her]58-julia hand in cheerful greeting to [the Dutch girl]970-the dutch girl . But [Denah]61-denah did not return the greeting ; instead , after [her]61-denah stare of astonished recognition , [she]61-denah turned and set off up [the road]3464-the road towards where [it]3464-the road joined [a more important street with trams]1414-a more important street with trams , which ran into [the town]569-the town . " [Hulloah]114-hulloah ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said softly , and quick as thought [she]58-julia turned too , and the hand that had waved to [Denah]61-denah was signaling to [a carriage]1416-a carriage which at that moment drove out of [a stable - yard near]1417-a stable - yard near . A light had come into [her]61-denah eyes , a dancing light like the gleam on a sword - blade . There was a little wee smile about [her]61-denah lips , too , which somehow brought to [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew 's mind [a man [he]75-rawson - clew once knew who had sung softly to [himself]1418-a man he once knew who had sung softly to himself]1418-a man he once knew who had sung softly to himself all the time [he]1418-a man he once knew who had sung softly to himself prepared for [the brigands who were known to be about to rush [[his]1418-a man he once knew who had sung softly to himself camp]1420-his camp]1419-the brigands who were known to be about to rush his camp . " [She]61-denah 'll take [a tram]3799-a tram , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said gaily , looking towards [the speeding figure]1421-the speeding figure ; " [she]61-denah is too careful to waste [her]61-denah money even to spite [any one of whom [she]61-denah is jealous]3800-any one of whom she is jealous . "[58-julia] [The cab]1422-the cab drew up , and [Julia]58-julia , not failing to see [Denah]61-denah fulfil [her]61-denah words at [the junction of [the street]366-the street]1423-the junction of the street , got in . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew followed [her]58-julia . [She]58-julia would have prevented [him]75-rawson - clew . " Do n't come , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia do n't want [you]75-rawson - clew . Good - bye . "[58-julia] But [he]75-rawson - clew insisted . " [I]75-rawson - clew certainly am coming , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , and ordered [the man]820-the man to drive on into [the town]569-the town , telling [Julia]58-julia to give the address . [She]58-julia did so , weighing in [her]58-julia mind the while the chances of [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew 's knowledge of [Dutch]83-dutch being equal to following all that was said when [three people]1427-three people spoke at once , all of [them]1427-three people in a great state of excitement . [She]58-julia thought it was possible [he]75-rawson - clew would not master every detail , but at the same time [she]58-julia did not wish [him]75-rawson - clew to try ; it would be insupportable to have [him]75-rawson - clew dragged into this , and in return for [his]75-rawson - clew kindness to [her]58-julia have a dozen vulgar and ridiculous things said and insinuated . " Look here , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " there is not any need for [you]75-rawson - clew to come , [I]58-julia can do better without [you]75-rawson - clew , [I]58-julia can indeed . "[58-julia] " [You]58-julia can not explain [me]75-rawson - clew away , "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew answered . "[75-rawson - clew] [Julia]58-julia laughed , but without much mirth . " [I]58-julia do wish [you]75-rawson - clew would not come , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . [Julia]58-julia listened to the exclamations , and apparently to congratulations on [her]58-julia safe return , said in a friendly manner that [she]58-julia had a terrible adventure , and then asked where [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw was . [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw was out , and [Mijnheer]90-joost was out too ; a torrent more information followed , but [Julia]58-julia did not pay much attention to it , [she]58-julia turned to [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew with the smile on [her]58-julia lips with which [she]58-julia laughed at [herself]58-julia . "[58-julia] And before [he]75-rawson - clew realised what [she]58-julia was doing , [she]58-julia had run off , down [the path]566-the path , across an empty flower - bed and among some brushes behind . In considerable anger [he]75-rawson - clew turned to follow [her]58-julia , but [he]75-rawson - clew pulled [himself]75-rawson - clew up ; there was very little use in that and no need for it either ; [he]75-rawson - clew was sure [she]58-julia was far too skilful [a tactician]1440-a tactician to imperil an affair by unwise flight ; this was a blind merely — unless , of course , [she]58-julia thought of setting out to find [these Dutch people]1441-these dutch people , wherever [they]1441-these dutch people might be . [Mijnheer]90-joost was at [a place ( or [house]1446-house ) with a name [he]75-rawson - clew had never before heard]1445-a place ( or house ) with a name he had never before heard , and would have been puzzled to say now from this one hearing . These details [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew did not know ; the name only was given to [him]75-rawson - clew , and that conveyed nothing . [Joost]90-joost , [he]75-rawson - clew was told , was somewhere in [the bulb gardens]1430-the bulb gardens , where , seemed unknown ; [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw was at [the house of [the notary]543-the notary]1453-the house of the notary . Who [the notary]543-the notary was , and where [he]543-the notary lived , and why [she]58-julia had gone there were alike as obscure to [this inquirer]1456-this inquirer as was [Julia]58-julia 's probable destination . [He]75-rawson - clew felt that [she]58-julia might have set out to find [any one of [these three people]1458-these three people]1457-any one of these three people , or [she]58-julia might be lying in wait , like [a foolish child]1459-a foolish child , till [he]75-rawson - clew had gone . [He]75-rawson - clew went down [the drive]787-the drive ; outside the gate [he]75-rawson - clew saw [some idlers who had been [there]180-there when [he]75-rawson - clew drove in a little while back]1461-some idlers who had been there when he drove in a little while back ; [he]75-rawson - clew asked [them]1461-some idlers who had been there when he drove in a little while back if [any one answering to the girl]1463-any one answering to the girl 's description had come out .
