[He]75-rawson - clew was no better off for this information ; there seemed nothing to be done . It would have been little short of absurd , if , indeed , it had not been seriously compromising to [Julia]58-julia , for [him]75-rawson - clew to present [himself]75-rawson - clew at [the house of [the notary]543-the notary]1453-the house of the notary — when [he]75-rawson - clew could find it — and tell [Vrouw Van]86-vrouw van heigen [Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen [he]75-rawson - clew had brought [Julia]58-julia [home]249-home and [she]58-julia was afraid to appear with [him]75-rawson - clew . Either [he]75-rawson - clew and [she]58-julia must act together and appear together , or else [he]75-rawson - clew must , as [she]58-julia desired and now made necessary , keep out of it alto gether . Considerably annoyed with [the girl]415-the girl , but at the same time uneasy about [her]415-the girl , [he]75-rawson - clew went to [[his]75-rawson - clew hotel]1471-his hotel . As the morning wore on , the annoyance lessened and the uneasiness grew . After all [he]75-rawson - clew was not sure that [Julia]58-julia had thrown away much by refusing to have the support of [[his]75-rawson - clew company]1472-his company ; had [they]1473-they two been there waiting for [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ' return , or had [they]1473-they set out together to find [them]1473-they , [he]75-rawson - clew was not sure [his]75-rawson - clew presence would have been any help in the face of [the jealous Dutch girl]1474-the jealous dutch girl 's accusations . [A jealous woman]182-a jealous woman , even [an ordinarily foolish one]1476-an ordinarily foolish one , is a very dangerous thing when [she]182-a jealous woman is attacking [a fancied rival]1477-a fancied rival with a chance of encompassing [her]182-a jealous woman overthrow . [Denah]61-denah would have got [her]61-denah tale told , [her]61-denah case proven , indignation aroused and sympathy with [her]61-denah before [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens even saw [Julia]58-julia . [He]75-rawson - clew wondered what [she]61-denah would do alone and wished [he]75-rawson - clew knew how [she]61-denah fared ; [he]75-rawson - clew thought over the explanations possible and the various ways out that might suggest themselves to a fertile brain . [They]1478-they were not many , and [they]1478-they were not good ; the simple truth would probably be best , and that would be so exceedingly compromising under the circumstances that [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens were hardly likely to find it palatable . Indeed , [he]75-rawson - clew began to see that , even if [they]1479-they two could have presented [themselves]1479-they , as [they]1479-they had first intended , to [the anxious family]1480-the anxious family before [Denah]61-denah arrived , it was very doubtful if the matter could have been satisfactorily cleared up to [a suspicious and prudish Dutch mind]1481-a suspicious and prudish dutch mind . [The girl]415-the girl was only [a companion]453-a companion , [a person of no importance , easy to replace]1484-a person of no importance , easy to replace ; and , no matter how the fact might be explained , it still remained that [she]415-the girl had been out all night with [an unknown man]1374-an unknown man ; one , who , if [he]1374-an unknown man were known , would show to be of a position to make the proceeding more compromising still . At this point [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew got up and walked to the window . It was then that it struck [him]75-rawson - clew that [he]75-rawson - clew had , in these [his]75-rawson - clew mature years , committed an act of stupendous folly , the like of which [his]75-rawson - clew youth had never known . But [the girl]415-the girl , what would become of [the girl]415-the girl ? In [England]8-england , in ninety - nine cases out of a hundred , [she]415-the girl would have been dismissed ; in [Holland]7-holland that one last hope did not exist . [She]415-the girl would be dismissed with [her]415-the girl character considerably damaged and [her]415-the girl chance of getting another situation entirely gone . What would [she]415-the girl do ? [She]415-the girl had told [him]75-rawson - clew yesterday [she]415-the girl could not leave , but was obliged to stay on at [the Van Heigens ']78-the van heigens ; although [she]415-the girl had failed in the first object of [her]415-the girl coming , and so had no motive for remaining , [she]415-the girl had nowhere else to go . Perhaps [she]415-the girl had quarrelled with [[her]415-the girl relatives]1488-her relatives ; perhaps [they]1488-her relatives could not afford to keep [her]415-the girl — [they]1488-her relatives were poor enough [he]75-rawson - clew knew . [She]415-the girl had once said [[her]415-the girl eldest sister]1489-her eldest sister had lately married [the nephew of [a bishop]3646-a bishop]1490-the nephew of a bishop ; [he]75-rawson - clew remembered that , and [he]75-rawson - clew also remembered that , after [his]75-rawson - clew unfortunate visit to [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington , [he]75-rawson - clew had heard [they]1492-they were [people with some good connections]1493-people with some good connections . But that did not mean that [they]1492-they could afford to help [this girl]1494-this girl , or would be delighted to receive [her]1494-this girl [home]249-home under the present conditions . Rather it indicated that [their]1492-they position was too precarious for [them]1492-they to be able to do it . [They]1492-they would be bitterly hard on [her]1494-this girl — [these aspiring people of gentle birth and doubtful shifts , clinging to society by the skin of [their]1496-these aspiring people of gentle birth and doubtful shifts , clinging to society by the skin of their teeth teeth]1496-these aspiring people of gentle birth and doubtful shifts , clinging to society by the skin of their teeth , were the hardest of all . [The girl]415-the girl could not go back to [them]1492-they ; [she]415-the girl could not get anything to do in [Holland]7-holland , or elsewhere — in [Heaven]28-heaven 's name what could [she]415-the girl do ? [He]75-rawson - clew asked [himself]75-rawson - clew the question with [his]75-rawson - clew hands in [his]75-rawson - clew pockets and [his]75-rawson - clew eyes on [the street]366-the street . But the answer did not seem forthcoming . There was no good blinking the matter ; the fact was obvious ; [the girl]415-the girl was hopelessly and utterly compromised ; and [he]75-rawson - clew , aided certainly by untoward circumstances — for the sardonic interference of which , in such circumstances , [a man of sense]1500-a man of sense usually allows — [he]75-rawson - clew had done it . [They]1492-they had had [their]1492-they " holiday , "[75-rawson - clew] without taking thought for the morrow , in the way approved by [boys]3748-boys and dogs and [creatures without experience]1502-creatures without experience . And here was to - morrow , knocking at the door and demanding the price — as experience showed that it usually did . The question was , who was going to pay , [he]1503-he or [she]1504-she ? [She]415-the girl had taken it upon [herself]415-the girl as a matter of course ; it seemed natural to [her]415-the girl that the burden should be [the woman]1505-the woman 's , but it did not seem so to [him]75-rawson - clew ; among [[his]75-rawson - clew people]1506-his people it was [the man who was expected , and who [himself]75-rawson - clew expected , to pay]1507-the man who was expected , and who himself expected , to pay . When [he]75-rawson - clew had grasped the situation fully and saw how [she]415-the girl must inevitably stand [he]75-rawson - clew also saw at the same time and equally plainly , that [he]75-rawson - clew must marry [her]415-the girl ; nothing else was possible . [He]75-rawson - clew walked away from the window and began to search for writing materials . [He]75-rawson - clew could not go and see [her]415-the girl , it was out of the question under the circumstances ; [he]75-rawson - clew would have to write , and , on the whole , perhaps , it was easier that way . [He]75-rawson - clew sat down to the table , but [he]75-rawson - clew did not at once begin , for between [him]75-rawson - clew and the paper there rose up the vision of [a stately old Norfolk house]1508-a stately old norfolk house . It was [his]75-rawson - clew ; [he]75-rawson - clew had not lived [there]180-there for years , but [he]75-rawson - clew supposed [he]75-rawson - clew would some day ; all [[his]75-rawson - clew people]1506-his people had ; [he]75-rawson - clew remembered [[his]75-rawson - clew grandfather]615-his grandfather there and [[his]75-rawson - clew grandmother]1512-his grandmother — [a tall , stately woman]1513-a tall , stately woman , [a woman of parts]1514-a woman of parts . [He]75-rawson - clew thought of [her]1513-a tall , stately woman , and [[his]75-rawson - clew mother]3412-his mother , [a graceful , gracious woman]1516-a graceful , gracious woman — [he]75-rawson - clew thought of [her]1513-a tall , stately woman standing in [the drawing - room between the long windows]1517-the drawing - room between the long windows , receiving [company]1518-company . And then [he]75-rawson - clew thought of [Julia]58-julia . [He]75-rawson - clew turned away from the vision abruptly , and dated [his]75-rawson - clew letter . But soon [he]75-rawson - clew had lain down [his]75-rawson - clew pen again . [He]75-rawson - clew was conservative , and [Julia]58-julia was not of the breed of [the women [he]75-rawson - clew had recalled]1519-the women he had recalled ; [she]58-julia had no kinship with [them]1519-the women he had recalled or [[their]1519-the women he had recalled modern prototypes]1520-their modern prototypes , one of whom [he]75-rawson - clew vaguely supposed [he]75-rawson - clew should marry some day — when [he]75-rawson - clew went to live in [the old Norfolk house]1521-the old norfolk house . [Hers]58-julia was not a stately or a gracious or an all pervading feminine presence ; [she]58-julia demanded no court , no care , no carpet for [her]58-julia way ; [she]58-julia could come and go unnoticed and unattended ; [you]1522-you could overlook [her]58-julia — though [she]58-julia never overlooked [you]1522-you or anything else . [She]58-julia had [her]58-julia points certainly , [she]58-julia was loyal to the core — [she]58-julia would be loyal to [him]75-rawson - clew , [he]75-rawson - clew was sure , in this scrape , with a silly wrong - headed loyalty , more like [a man]406-a man 's to [a woman]3574-a woman than [a woman]3574-a woman 's to [a man]406-a man . [She]58-julia was loyal to [[her]58-julia none too reputable family]1527-her none too reputable family — that family was a bitter thing to [his]75-rawson - clew pride of race . [She]58-julia was courageous , too , cheerfully enduring , laughing in the face of disaster , patient when action was impossible and when it was possible — [he]75-rawson - clew found [himself]75-rawson - clew smiling when [he]75-rawson - clew recalled [her]58-julia — surely there was never [one more gay , more ready , more steady , more quietly alert]1528-one more gay , more ready , more steady , more quietly alert than [she]58-julia when there was a struggle with [men or matters in the wind]1529-men or matters in the wind . [She]58-julia had brains of a sort , there was no doubt of that ; it was possible to imagine [one]3325-one would not grow tired of [her]58-julia undiluted company as [one]3325-one would of [the other sort of woman]1532-the other sort of woman . Only of course [a man]406-a man did not have the undiluted company of [[his]406-a man wife]168-his wife — perhaps if [he]406-a man were [a small shop - keeper]1535-a small shop - keeper or [an itinerant organ - grinder]1536-an itinerant organ - grinder — if night and day [they]1537-they lived together and worked together and looked out on [the world]208-the world together — if it was the simple life of which [she]58-julia dreamed — [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew picked up [his]75-rawson - clew pen and began to write ; it was not a case of whether [he]75-rawson - clew would or would not , liked or disliked ; [he]75-rawson - clew had simply to make [a girl]201-a girl [he]75-rawson - clew had compromised the only restitution in [his]75-rawson - clew power . In the meantime [Julia]58-julia had set out for [the market - place]1540-the market - place as [the idlers]1541-the idlers had said . But [her]58-julia business there did not take long and [she]58-julia was [home]249-home again , as [she]58-julia intended , before [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw got back from [the Snieders]97-the snieders . But [she]58-julia had not been in much more than five minutes before [the old lady]553-the old lady , supported by [Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder and [Denah]61-denah , arrived . [Mijnheer]90-joost came [home]249-home not long after , and , hearing news of the return of [the truant]1545-the truant , went to [the house]175-the house to join [the others]312-the others . [Julia]58-julia waited to receive the attack in [the dim sitting - room]1548-the dim sitting - room . [She]58-julia knew as well as [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew , or better , that [she]58-julia had not a ghost of a chance of clearing [herself]58-julia ; dismissal was inevitable ; that was why [she]58-julia went to [the market - place]1540-the market - place . [She]58-julia had not largely assisted [[her]58-julia family]1195-her family in living by [their]1195-her family wits without having those faculties in exceeding good working order ; [she]58-julia had already seen and seized the only thing open to [her]58-julia when the end should come . But the fact that [she]58-julia knew how it would end did not prevent [her]58-julia from giving battle ; the knowledge only made [her]58-julia change [her]58-julia tactics , and , as there was no use in defending [her]58-julia position ( and [companion]428-companion ) [she]58-julia was able to concentrate [her]58-julia forces in harassing [the enemy]3804-the enemy . In these circumstances it is not wonderful that [Denah]61-denah did not derive the satisfaction [she]61-denah expected from the affair . [Julia]58-julia , unrepentant and reckless because of [her]58-julia known fate , unhampered by [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew 's presence , and flatly declining to give any particulars about [him]75-rawson - clew , would have been an awkward antagonist for [one cleverer than [the Dutch girl]970-the dutch girl]1553-one cleverer than the dutch girl . [Poor Denah]115-denah lost [her]115-denah temper , and lost [her]115-denah head , and lost control of [her]115-denah tongue and [her]115-denah tears . [Julia]58-julia did not lose anything , but again and again winged shafts that went unerringly [home]249-home . [She]58-julia was genuinely sorry to have upset and disappointed [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , but for [Denah]115-denah [she]58-julia did not care in the least , and [the old lady]553-the old lady soon contrived to soften some of the regret , for [she]553-the old lady was far too angry and shocked at the impropriety to have any gentler feelings of sorrow or to believe what [she]553-the old lady was told . [Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder acted principally as chorus of horror ; [she]84-vrouw snieder was shocked and angry too , on [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw 's account and on [her]84-vrouw snieder own and [[her]84-vrouw snieder daughter]408-her daughter 's ; [she]84-vrouw snieder seemed to think [they]1558-they had all been outraged together . When [Mijnheer]90-joost came in [they]1558-they were all talking at once and [Denah]115-denah was weeping copiously . [Julia]58-julia 's part in the conversation was small ; [she]58-julia just shot a word in here and there , but apparently never without effect , for [her]58-julia utterances , like drops of water on hot metal , were always followed by fresh bursts of excitement . [The good man]1451-the good man tried in vain to make out what was the matter and what had happened . At last , after [his]1451-the good man fifth effort elsewhere , [he]1451-the good man turned to [Julia]58-julia , and [she]58-julia told [him]1451-the good man briefly . [She]58-julia told the truth , only suppressing [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew 's name and all details concerning [him]1451-the good man , saying merely that [he]1451-the good man was [a man [she]58-julia had met before [she]58-julia left [England]8-england]1560-a man she had met before she left england . [The two elder sisters]1561-the two elder sisters gradually became silent to listen ; [Denah]115-denah listened too , only sniffing occasionally . " [You]1451-the good man pretended [you]1451-the good man did not know [him]1451-the good man the day [we]3807-we went the excursion , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said vindictively ; " [I]58-julia saw [you]1451-the good man ; [I]58-julia knew [you]1451-the good man were not to be trusted then . Why did [you]1451-the good man pretend , and how do [you]1451-the good man know [him]1451-the good man ? [He]1451-the good man is [a man of family]3808-a man of family ; [he]1451-the good man has the air of it , very distinguished , and [you]1451-the good man are nothing at all , [nobody]3448-nobody — "[58-julia] " Hush ! "[90-joost] said [Mijnheer]90-joost ; " that is not the point ; it is of no importance who [the man]820-the man may be , [he]1451-the good man is [a man]406-a man , that is enough ; and [she]58-julia was out with [him]1451-the good man — alone — a whole day and night ; it is certainly very bad indeed ; shocking , if it is true — is it true ? "[90-joost] [He]90-joost looked at [Julia]58-julia , and [she]58-julia answered , " Yes . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia was sorry , very sorry , but more on [his]90-joost account than [her]58-julia own ; [she]58-julia could see how heinous [he]90-joost thought it , how [she]58-julia had fallen in [his]90-joost esteem , and [she]58-julia was sorry for it . But at the same time [she]58-julia knew [her]58-julia conduct really had been no more than indiscreet ; and [she]58-julia did not repent ; [she]58-julia regretted nothing but being found out , and that not so much as [she]58-julia ought now that the joy of battle was upon [her]58-julia . As for [the women]1562-the women , [they]1562-the women suspected far worse than [Mijnheer]90-joost believed ; but even if [they]1562-the women had not , if [they]1562-the women had believed no more than the truth , that would have been enough for condemnation ; [her]58-julia offence — the real one — was past forgiveness ; [she]58-julia must go . [She]58-julia received the sentence meekly ; [she]58-julia knew [she]58-julia deserved no less from [these kind if narrow - minded people]1563-these kind if narrow - minded people . [Denah]115-denah smiled triumphantly ; [Julia]58-julia felt [she]58-julia deserved that too ; moreover , [Denah]115-denah 's nose was so pink and [her]115-denah face so swelled with tears , that the smile was more amusing than exasperating . " [I]58-julia am sorry , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia am sorry [you]1562-the women should all have to think so ill of [me]58-julia , and that [I]58-julia should deserve it . [You]1562-the women have been very kind to [me]58-julia while [I]58-julia have been [here]371-here , and made [my]58-julia service easy ; [I]58-julia am ashamed to have deceived [you]1562-the women and behaved in such a way as [you]1562-the women must condemn . "[58-julia] Unfortunately [Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder snorted here ; [she]84-vrouw snieder did not believe in these protestations and [she]84-vrouw snieder said so , inducing [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen to do the same . [Mijnheer]90-joost looked doubtfully at [Julia]58-julia for a moment , then [he]90-joost came to the conclusion that if [she]58-julia was not too abandoned [a person]967-a person to be really repentant , it would be as well to take advantage of [her]58-julia professed state of mind and drive home some moral lessons . Accordingly [he]90-joost and [the two elder ladies]759-the two elder ladies drove [them]1566-them [home]249-home , with the result that [Julia]58-julia 's regret dwindled to nothing . " [Mijnheer]90-joost , "[84-vrouw snieder] [she]84-vrouw snieder said at last , quietly yet effectually breaking in upon [his]90-joost words ; " [Mijnheer]90-joost , [you]90-joost are [a very good man]3813-a very good man , [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw is [a virtuous woman]3814-a virtuous woman , and [Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder also , all of [you]90-joost . [I]1568-me have often admired [your]90-joost goodness ; when [you]90-joost were least conscious of it it preached to [me]1568-me , making [me]1568-me ashamed of [my]1568-me wickedness . But now that [you]90-joost , in [your]90-joost goodness , have taken to preaching to [me]1568-me [yourselves]90-joost , [I]1568-me am no longer ashamed , for it is clear that [your]90-joost goodness dares to do a thing that [no man]3815-no man 's wickedness would ; it turns [the foolish and indiscreet]3816-the foolish and indiscreet into [sinners]3817-sinners and [sinners]3817-sinners into devils ; it makes the way of wrong - doing very easy . [You]90-joost are so good , "[1568-me] [she]1568-me went on , putting aside an interruption ; " perhaps [you]90-joost do not know wickedness when [you]90-joost see it ; [you]90-joost can not distinguish between sin and sin ; [you]90-joost are like [those who would hang [a man]406-a man for stealing bread as soon as for killing [a child]824-a child]3819-those who would hang a man for stealing bread as soon as for killing a child . What ! Are [you]90-joost indignant , [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , at such a charge ? Are [you]90-joost not turning out , with no character and no chance — a good enough imitation of hanging — [a girl who has been no more than foolish , just the same as if [she]3822-a girl who has been no more than foolish , just the same as if she had committed the greatest sin had committed the greatest sin]3822-a girl who has been no more than foolish , just the same as if she had committed the greatest sin ? "[1568-me] [Vrouw Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen broke in angrily , and [Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder and [Denah]115-denah , inexpressibly shocked ; [Mijnheer]90-joost was also shocked , but [he]90-joost , and [they]1569-they too , were vaguely uneasy under the reproach . [Julia]58-julia was satisfied ; more especially as [her]58-julia experience of [them]1569-they led [her]58-julia to expect [they]1569-they would , though never persuaded [they]1569-they had made a mistake , yet feel more uneasy by and by . [She]58-julia rose from [her]58-julia chair . " Yes , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " it is a shame to speak of such things , as [you]90-joost observe ; do not let [us]3823-us speak of them any more . Perhaps [Mijnheer]90-joost [you]90-joost would like to pay [me]58-julia , then [I]58-julia can go . "[58-julia] [Mijnheer]90-joost agreed rather hastily ; then , realising the suddenness of the step , [he]90-joost paused with [his]90-joost purse in [his]90-joost hand . " But can [you]58-julia go now ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost asked . " Nothing is arranged ; [you]58-julia had better wait a day or two . "[90-joost] " No , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered , " [I]58-julia think not ; it would be well to get the thing over and done with ; [you]90-joost would rather and so would [I.]58-julia "[58-julia] [No one]181-no one contradicting this , [Mijnheer]90-joost counted the money and gave it to [Julia]58-julia . " Thank [you]90-joost , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " now [I]58-julia will set the table for coffee drinking . [You]90-joost will stay , of course , [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia went on , turning to [Vrouw Snieder—"and Miss Denah]103-denah , that will be two extra — [Mijnheer Joost]90-joost will be in , [Denah]103-denah ; [you]90-joost can tell [him]90-joost about it . "[58-julia] [Denah]103-denah flushed indignantly , and [Vrouw Snieder]84-vrouw snieder could only say " [You]58-julia — [You]58-julia — "[84-vrouw snieder] " Oh , [I]58-julia will not sit down with [you]84-vrouw snieder , of course , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered sweetly ; " [I]58-julia will take [my]58-julia coffee in [the little room]324-the little room ; is it not so , [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw ? "[58-julia] [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen nodded ; [she]86-vrouw van heigen did not know what else to do , and [Julia]58-julia went away , leaving [them]1571-they as awkward and at a loss for words as if [they]1571-they were [the delinquents]1572-the delinquents , not [she]58-julia . [Denah]103-denah felt this and resented it ; [the elders]1573-the elders felt it too , and for a moment or two looked at [one another]1574-one another ill at ease . However , in a little [they]1571-they recovered and began to talk over [Julia]58-julia and [her]58-julia wrong doings till [they]1571-they felt quite comfortable again . [Denah]103-denah did not join very much in the discussion ; after [she]103-denah had once again , by request , repeated what [she]103-denah had seen and what deduced therefrom , [she]103-denah was left rather to [herself]103-denah . [She]103-denah went to the window and sat there looking out for [Joost]90-joost ; [he]90-joost was certain to come in soon , and [she]103-denah found consolation in the thought . [Joost]90-joost , [the model of modesty and decorous serious propriety]1575-the model of modesty and decorous serious propriety , would know [the English girl]559-the english girl in [her]559-the english girl true colours now , and be justly disgusted and shocked to think that [he]90-joost had ever ridden beside [her]103-denah on a merry - go - round . Just then [Julia]58-julia passed carrying a tray of cups . " [Denah]103-denah , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , pitching [her]58-julia voice soft and low in the tone [the Dutch girl]970-the dutch girl hated most , " [I]58-julia will give [you]103-denah a piece of advice ; take care how [you]103-denah tell [Joost]90-joost about [my]58-julia wickedness ; [you]103-denah want to be ever so clever to abuse [another girl]3825-another girl to [a man]406-a man ; it is one of the most difficult things in [the world]208-the world — and [you]103-denah are not very clever , [you]103-denah know , not even clever enough to take [my]58-julia advice . "[58-julia] [Denah]103-denah was not clever enough to take the advice nor in any humour to do so ; [she]103-denah stared angrily at [Julia]58-julia , who unconcernedly put the cups on the table and vanished into [the kitchen]220-the kitchen . [Joost]90-joost came in for coffee drinking , and the whole party with one accord told [him]90-joost the tale ; [Julia]58-julia heard [them]1579-them through the closed door as [she]58-julia sat sipping [her]58-julia coffee in [the little room]324-the little room . [She]58-julia did not hear [him]90-joost say anything at all except just at first , " [I]90-joost wo n't believe it ! "[90-joost] in a tone which roused again , and with added strength , the regret [she]58-julia had felt before for repaying belief and kindness by such disillusioning . Afterwards [he]90-joost seemed to say nothing more ; presumably [they]1581-they had convinced [him]90-joost with overwhelming evidence . [She]58-julia wondered how [he]90-joost looked ; [she]58-julia could picture [his]90-joost serious blue eyes uncomfortable well ; [poor [Joost]90-joost , who had such high opinions of [her]58-julia , who thought [she]58-julia , seeing the low]90-joost , chose the high path always in the greatness of [her]58-julia knowledge and strength ; who had called [her]58-julia a lantern , sometimes dimmed , but always a beacon ! The lantern was obscured just now , very badly obscured . [She]58-julia rose and went up to [[her]58-julia room]400-her room ; [she]58-julia would clear the table after [Joost]90-joost had gone back to work . [She]58-julia did so , coming down when [he]90-joost and [Mijnheer]90-joost were safely in [the office]603-the office . When [she]58-julia had done [she]58-julia went to [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , who had betaken [herself]85-mevrouw to [[her]58-julia room]400-her room worn out by the morning 's excitement . " Would [you]85-mevrouw prefer that [I]58-julia went at once ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia inquired , " or that [I]58-julia waited till after dinner ? [I]58-julia will stay till six if [you]85-mevrouw wish it , or [I]58-julia will go now without waiting to attend to the dinner . "[58-julia] [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen preferred the waiting ; it would be so very much better for the dinner , and really it hardly seemed as if propriety could suffer much ; accordingly [she]86-vrouw van heigen said with what dignity [she]86-vrouw van heigen could that [the girl]415-the girl had better stay till the evening . [Julia]58-julia went down - stairs again and set to work preparing the dinner , and it was perhaps only natural that [she]58-julia took pains to make that dinner a memorably good one . It was while [she]58-julia was busy in [the kitchen]220-the kitchen that a note was brought to [her]58-julia . " Put it on the table , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said to [the servant girl]1587-the servant girl ; [her]58-julia hands just then were too floury to take it , but [she]58-julia looked at it as it lay on the table beside [her]58-julia . [She]58-julia did not recognise the writing , though [she]58-julia saw at once that it was not that of [a Dutchman]1588-a dutchman . " Who brought it ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked , beginning to clean [her]58-julia hands . [The servant]729-the servant could not say , but from [her]729-the servant description [Julia]58-julia gathered that it must have been a special messenger of some sort . On hearing this , [she]58-julia did not trouble to clean [her]58-julia hands any more , but opened the letter at once , making floury finger - prints upon it . " [Dear Miss Polkington]116-dear miss polkington , ( it ran ) , "[58-julia] There is one subject [I]0-i did not mention to [you]58-julia yesterday ; [you]58-julia might perhaps have thought it too serious for holiday consideration ; nevertheless , it is a question that [I]0-i feel [I]0-i must ask before [I]0-i leave [Holland]7-holland . Will [you]58-julia do [me]0-i the honour of becoming [[my]0-i wife]1590-my wife ? [I]0-i know there is rather a difference in years between [us]1591-us , but if [you]58-julia can overlook the discrepancy , and consent , [you]58-julia will give [me]0-i the utmost satisfaction . [I]0-i honestly believe it will make for the happiness of [[us]1591-us both]1592-us both ; [I]0-i have a feeling that [we]1591-us were meant to continue [our]1591-us ' excursion ' together . " Very sincerely [yours]58-julia , "[74-rawson - clew] [H. F. Rawson - Clew]74-rawson - clew . " So [Julia]58-julia read , and sat down suddenly on the flour barrel . [She]58-julia turned to the beginning of the letter and read it through again , and when [she]58-julia looked up [her]58-julia eyes were shining with admiration . "[74-rawson - clew] [I]0-i am glad ! " [she]58-julia said aloud , but in English , "[0-i] [I]0-i am glad [he]1593-he has done it ! It 's splendid , splendid ! [I]0-i never thought of it — but then [I]0-i do n't believe [I]0-i knew what [a real gentleman]1594-a real gentleman was before ! " [The maidservant]630-the maidservant started at [her]58-julia curiously ; [she]630-the maidservant could not understand a word , but [she]630-the maidservant saw that the letter gave pleasure , for which [she]630-the maidservant was glad ; [she]630-the maidservant liked [Julia]58-julia , and was very sorry [she]630-the maidservant was going in disgrace ; [she]630-the maidservant [herself]630-the maidservant had occasional lapses from rectitude and so consequently had a fellow feeling . "[1595-you] [You]1595-you have a good letter ? " [she]630-the maidservant asked . "[1595-you] Very good , " [Julia]58-julia said ; "[1595-you] but [we]1596-we must get on with the cooking ; [I]0-i will answer it by and by . " [Julia]58-julia put it in [her]58-julia pocket after another glance , purring to [herself]58-julia in English , "[0-i] It is so well done , too , " [she]58-julia said ; "[0-i] never a word of to - day , only of yesterday — yesterday ! " and [she]58-julia laughed softly . There is no doubt about it , if [Julia]58-julia had got to receive a death sentence [she]58-julia would have liked it to be well given ; it is quite possible , had [she]58-julia lived at the time , [she]58-julia would have been one of [those who objected to the indignity of riding in the tumbrils quite as much as to the guillotine at the end of the ride]3829-those who objected to the indignity of riding in the tumbrils quite as much as to the guillotine at the end of the ride . [She]58-julia finished the preparations for dinner , got [her]58-julia pots and pans all nicely simmering and [her]58-julia oven at the right heat ; then , giving some necessary directions , [she]58-julia left [the servant]729-the servant to watch the cooking and went up to [[her]58-julia own room]3831-her own room . There [she]58-julia at once proceeded to answer the letter — "[1597-she] [Dear Mr. Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew , ( [she]1597-she wrote ) , " [I]1597-she am as glad as anything that [you]75-rawson - clew have done it ; [I]1597-she never for a moment thought of it [myself]1597-she , though [I]1597-she ought , for it is just like [you]75-rawson - clew ; thank [you]75-rawson - clew ever so much . "[1597-she] Please do n't bother about [me]0-i , [I]0-i am all right and have arranged capitally . " Here [she]1597-she turned over [his]75-rawson - clew letter to see how [he]75-rawson - clew had signed [himself]75-rawson - clew and , seeing , signed in imitation — "[75-rawson - clew] [Yours]75-rawson - clew very sincerely , " [Julia Polkington]58-julia . "[75-rawson - clew] " [I]1597-she wonder what [his]75-rawson - clew name is ? "[1597-she] [she]1597-she speculated ; " [H. F.—H.—Henry]117-h. f.—h.—henry , [Horace]118-horace — [I]1597-she should n't think [he]75-rawson - clew had a name [people]3334-people called [him]75-rawson - clew by . "[1597-she] [She]1597-she read [her]1597-she own letter through , and as [she]1597-she was folding it stopped ; it occurred to [her]1597-she that [he]1598-he might think courtesy demanded a formal refusal of [his]1598-he proposal . It was , of course , quite unnecessary ; the refusal went without saying ; [she]1597-she would no more have dreamed of accepting [his]1598-he quixotic offer than [he]1598-he would have dreamed of avoiding the necessity of making it ; the one was as much a sine quâ non to [her]1597-she as the other was to [him]1598-he . From which it would appear that in some ways at least [their]1599-we notions of honour were not so many miles apart . [She]1597-she flattened [her]1597-she letter again ; perhaps [he]1598-he would think the definite word more polite , so [she]1597-she added a postscript — " Of course this means no . [I]1597-she am sorry [we]1599-we ca n't go on with the excursion , but [we]1599-we ca n't , [you]1598-he know . The holiday is over ; this is ' to - morrow , ' so good - bye . "[1597-she] After that [she]1597-she fastened the envelope , and a while later went out to post it . As [she]1597-she went up [the drive]787-the drive [she]1597-she caught sight of [Joost]90-joost some distance away in [the gardens]1601-the gardens ; [his]90-joost face was not towards [her]1597-she , and [she]1597-she congratulated [herself]1597-she that [he]90-joost had not seen [her]1597-she . However , the congratulations were premature ; when [she]1597-she came back from the post [she]1597-she found [him]90-joost standing just inside the gate waiting for [her]1597-she , obviously waiting . At least it was obvious to [her]1597-she ; [she]1597-she had caught [people]3334-people [herself]1597-she before now , and so recognised that [she]1597-she was caught too plainly to uselessly attempt getting away . " Do [you]90-joost want to hear what happened yesterday ? "[1597-she] [she]1597-she asked , with an effrontery [she]1597-she did not feel . " [I]1597-she expect [Denah]103-denah has told [you]90-joost all , perhaps a little more than all , still , enough of it was true . "[1597-she] " [I]90-joost want to speak to [you]58-julia , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said , and parted the high bushes that bordered the left of [the drive]787-the drive . [Julia]58-julia reluctantly enough , but feeling that [she]58-julia owed [him]90-joost what explanation was possible , went through . Behind the bushes there was [a small enclosed space used for growing choice bulbs]1604-a small enclosed space used for growing choice bulbs ; [it]1604-a small enclosed space used for growing choice bulbs was empty now , the sandy soil quite bare and dry ; but [it]1604-a small enclosed space used for growing choice bulbs was very retired , being surrounded by an eight foot hedge with only one opening besides the way by which [they]1605-they had come in through the looser - growing bushes . [Julia]58-julia made [her]58-julia way down to the opening ; with [her]58-julia practical eye for such things , [she]58-julia recognised that it would be the best way of escape , just as the loose - growing bushes offered the likeliest point of attack . This , of course , did not matter to [her]58-julia , [she]58-julia being in the case of " [he]90-joost who is down , "[58-julia] but it might matter a good deal to [Joost]90-joost if [[his]90-joost father]614-his father looked through the bushes , and [he]614-his father would never know how to take care of [himself]614-his father . " Well ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , when [she]58-julia had taken up this discreet position . But as [he]90-joost did not seem ready [she]58-julia went on , " [I]58-julia really do n't think there is anything to say ; [I]58-julia did wrong yesterday , not quite as much wrong as [[your]90-joost mother]3323-your mother and [Denah]103-denah think , still wrong — what [[my]58-julia own people]3834-my own people would have disapproved , at least if it were found out ; that 's the biggest crime on [their]3834-my own people list — and what [I]58-julia knew [your]90-joost peo ple would condemn utterly . [I]58-julia am afraid [I]58-julia have no excuse to offer ; [I]58-julia knew what [I]58-julia was doing , and [I]58-julia did it with [my]58-julia eyes open . [I]58-julia did not see any harm in it [myself]58-julia but [I]58-julia knew [other people]3728-other people would , so [I]58-julia meant to say nothing . [I]58-julia had deceived [[your]90-joost parents]3578-your parents before , and [I]58-julia meant to keep on doing it . [You]90-joost know [I]58-julia had walked with [that man]3837-that man lots of times before yesterday ; all the time [[your]90-joost mother]3323-your mother thought [me]58-julia so good to visit [[your]90-joost cousin]3377-your cousin [I]58-julia really enjoyed doing it because [I]58-julia walked with [him]3837-that man . "[58-julia] " Do [you]58-julia love [him]3837-that man ? "[58-julia] The question was asked low and almost jerkily . " Love [him]3837-that man ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said in surprise ; " no , of course not . That is where the difference comes in , [I]58-julia believe ; [you]90-joost all seem to think there is nothing but love and love - making and kissing and cuddling . [I]58-julia have just liked talking to [him]3837-that man and [I]58-julia suppose [he]3837-that man liked talking to [me]58-julia , as [you]90-joost might [some friend]3840-some friend , or [[Denah]103-denah some girl [she]103-denah knew]3841-denah some girl she knew . [We]3842-we never thought about love and all that ; [we]3842-we could n't , [you]90-joost know ; [he]3837-that man belongs to a different lot from what [I]58-julia do . Do [you]90-joost understand ? "[58-julia] " Yes , [I]1607-you understand , "[1607-you] [he]1607-you answered , and there was a vibrant note in [his]1607-you voice which was new to [her]1608-her . " [I]1607-you understand that it is [you]90-joost who are right and [we]3842-we who are wrong — [you]90-joost who know good and evil and can choose , [we]3842-we who suspect and think and hint , believing ill when there is none . Rather than send [you]90-joost away , [we]3842-we should ask [your]90-joost forgiveness ! "[1607-you] " [You]1607-you should do nothing of the kind , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said decidedly , beginning to take alarm . " [I]58-julia may not have been wrong in quite the way [[your]1607-you parents]3578-your parents think , but [I]58-julia was wrong all the same . [I]58-julia am not good , believe [me]58-julia ; [I]58-julia am not as [you]1607-you are . Look at [me]58-julia , [I]58-julia am bad inwardly , and really [I]58-julia am what [you]1607-you would condemn and despise . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia was standing in the afternoon sunlight , dark , slim , alert , intensely alive , full of a twisty varied knowledge , a creature of [another world]1609-another world . [She]58-julia felt that [he]1610-you must know and recognise the gulf between if only [he]1610-you would look fairly at [her]58-julia . [He]1610-you did look fairly , but [he]1610-you recognised only what was in [his]1610-you own mind . " [You]58-julia are to [me]1610-you a beacon — "[1610-you] [he]1610-you began . But [she]58-julia , realising at last that [Denah]103-denah 's jealousy was not after all without foundations , cut [him]1610-you short . " [I]58-julia am not a beacon , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " before [you]1610-you take [me]58-julia for a guiding light [you]1610-you had better hear something about [me]58-julia . Do [you]1610-you know why [I]58-julia came [here]371-here ? [I]58-julia will tell [you]1610-you — it was to get [your]1610-you blue daffodil ! "[58-julia] [He]1610-you stared at [her]58-julia speechless , and [she]58-julia found it bad to see the surprise and almost uncomprehending pain which came into [his]1610-you face , as into the face of [a child unjustly smitten]1611-a child unjustly smitten . But [she]58-julia went on resolutely : " [I]58-julia heard of it in [England]8-england , that it was worth a lot of money — and [I]58-julia wanted money — so [I]58-julia came [here]371-here ; [I]58-julia meant to get a bulb and sell it . "[58-julia] " [You]58-julia meant to ? "[1610-you] [he]1610-you said slowly ; " but [you]58-julia haven't — [you]58-julia could n't ? "[1610-you] " [I]58-julia could , six times over if [I]58-julia liked . "[58-julia] " But [you]58-julia have not . "[58-julia] " No . [I]1610-you was [a fool]3758-a fool , and [you]58-julia were — Oh , [I]1610-you ca n't explain ; [you]58-julia would never understand , and it does not matter . The thing that matters is that [I]1610-you came here to get [your]58-julia blue daffodil . "[1610-you] " [You]58-julia must have needed money very greatly , "[1610-you] [he]1610-you said in a puzzled , pitying voice . " [I]1610-you did , [I]1610-you wanted it desperately , but that does not matter either — [I]1610-you came here to steal ; [I]1610-you go away because [I]1610-you am found out to have deceived and to have behaved improperly — [I]1610-you want [you]58-julia to understand that . "[1610-you] " [I]1610-you do not understand , "[1610-you] [he]1610-you answered ; " [I]1610-you understand nothing but that [you]58-julia are [you]58-julia , and — and [I]1610-you love [you]58-julia . "[1610-you] " [You]1610-you do n't ! "[1610-you] [she]1610-you cried in sharp protest . " [You]1610-you do not , and [you]1610-you can not ! [You]1610-you think [you]1610-you love what [you]1610-you think [I]1610-you am . But [I]1610-you am not that ; it is all quite different ; when [you]1610-you , know , when [you]1610-you realise , [you]1610-you will see it . "[1610-you] " [I]1610-you realise now , "[1610-you] [he]1610-you answered ; " it is still the light , only sometimes dim . "[1610-you] " Dim ! "[1610-you] [she]1610-you repeated , " it has gone out ! "[1610-you] " And if it has , what then ? If [you]1610-you are all [you]1610-you say [you]1610-you are , and all [they]3847-they say [you]1610-you are , and many worse things besides , what then ? It makes no difference . "[1610-you] [He]1610-you spoke with the curious quietness with which [he]1610-you always spoke of what [he]1610-you was quite sure . But [she]1610-you drew back against the hedge , clasping [her]1610-you hands together , [her]1610-you calmness all gone . " Oh , what have [I]1610-you done ! What have [I]1610-you done ! "[1610-you] [she]1610-you said , overcome with pity and remorse . [He]1610-you drew a step nearer , misinterpreting the emotion . " [I]1610-you will take care of [you]1610-you , "[1610-you] [he]1610-you said . " Will [you]1610-you not let [me]1610-you take care of [you]1610-you ? "[1610-you] [She]1610-you looked up , and though [her]1610-you eyes were full of tears [he]1610-you might have read [his]1610-you answer there , in [her]1610-you recovered calmness , in the very gentleness of [her]1610-you manner . " [You]1610-you can not , "[1610-you] [she]1610-you said sadly ; " [you]1610-you could n't possibly do it . Do n't [you]1610-you see that it is impossible ? [[Your]1610-you parents]3578-your parents , [the people]3500-the people — "[1610-you] " That is of no importance , "[1610-you] [he]1610-you answered ; " [[my]1610-you parents]3682-my parents would very soon see [you]1610-you in [your]1610-you true light , and for the rest — what does it matter ? If [you]1610-you will marry [me]1610-you [I]1610-you — "[1610-you] " But [Joost]90-joost , [I]1610-you ca n't ! Do n't [you]1610-you feel [yourself]1610-you that [I]1610-you ca n't ? [We]3851-we are not only of [two nations]3852-two nations — that is nothing — but [we]3851-we are almost of two races ; [we]3851-we are night and day , oil and water , black and white . It would never do ; [we]3851-we should be on the outskirts of [each other]3407-each other 's lives , [you]1610-you would never know [mine]1610-you , and though [I]1610-you might know [yours]1610-you , [I]1610-you could never really enter in . "[1610-you] " That is nothing , "[1612-he] [he]1612-he said , " if [you]1613-she love . "[1612-he] " It is everything , "[1613-she] [she]1613-she answered , " if [two people]3854-two people do not talk the same language , soul language , [I]1613-she mean . "[1613-she] " [They]3854-two people will learn it if [they]3854-two people love — but [you]1612-he do not ? Is it that , tell [me]1612-he . Ah , yes , [you]1612-he do , a little , little bit ! Only a little , so that [you]1612-he hardly know it , but it is enough — if [you]1612-he have the least to give that would do ; [I]1612-he would do all the rest ; [I]1612-he would love [you]1612-he ; [I]1612-he would stand between [you]1612-he and [the whole world]3855-the whole world ; in time it would come , in time [you]1612-he would care ! "[1612-he] [He]1612-he had come close to [her]1613-she now ; in [his]1612-he eagerness [he]1612-he pressed against [her]1613-she , and , earnestness overcoming diffidence , [he]1612-he almost ventured to take [her]1613-she hand in [his]1612-he . [She]1613-she felt [herself]1613-she inwardly shrink from [him]1612-he with the repulsion that young wild animals feel at times for mere contact . But outwardly [she]1613-she did not betray it ; pity for [him]1612-he kept nature under control . " [I]1613-she can not , "[1613-she] [she]1613-she said very gently ; " [I]1613-she can never care . "[1613-she] Then [he]1612-he knew that [he]1612-he had [his]1612-he answer , and there was no appeal ; [he]1612-he drew back a pace , and because [he]1612-he never said one word of regret , or reproach , or pleading , [her]1613-she heart smote [her]1613-she . " [I]1613-she am so sorry ! "[1613-she] [she]1613-she said ; " [I]1613-she am so sorry . Oh , why is everything so hard ! [Joost]90-joost , dear [Joost]90-joost , [you]90-joost must not mind ; [I]1613-she am not half good enough for [you]90-joost ; [I]1613-she 'm not , indeed . Please forget [me]1613-she and — let [me]1613-she go . "[1613-she] And with that [she]1613-she turned and fled into [the house]175-the house . [The maidservant in]1615-the maidservant in [the kitchen]220-the kitchen was minding the pots ; it still wanted some while to dinner time ; [she]1613-she did not expect [the English miss]3467-the english miss would come yet , probably not till it was necessary to dish up . The letter , of course , would have occupied [her]1613-she some time ; [she]1613-she had gone out probably to meet [the writer]1161-the writer — [the maid]1619-the maid never for a moment doubted [him]1161-the writer to be [the sharer of yesterday 's escapade]1620-the sharer of yesterday 's escapade . [She]1613-she heard [Julia]58-julia come in , and judged the meeting to have been a pleasant one , as it had taken time . [She]1613-she had gone up - [stairs]300-stairs now , doubtless to pack [her]1613-she things ; that would occupy [her]1613-she till almost dinner time . It did , for [she]1613-she did not begin directly , but sat on [her]1613-she bed instead , doing nothing for a time . But when [she]1613-she did begin , [she]1613-she went to work methodically , folding garments with care and packing them neatly ; [her]1613-she heart ached for [Joost]90-joost and for the tangle things were in , but that did not prevent [her]1613-she attending to details when [she]1613-she once set to work . At last [she]1613-she had everything done , even [her]1613-she hat and coat ready to put on when dinner should be over . Then , after a final glance round to see that [she]1613-she had left nothing but the charred fragments of [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew 's letter , [she]1613-she went down - [stairs]300-stairs and got the dinner ready . [She]1613-she did not take [her]1613-she meal with [the family]193-the family , but again had it in [the little room]324-the little room . [She]1613-she brought the dishes to and fro from [the kitchen]220-the kitchen , however , so [she]1613-she passed close to [Joost]90-joost once or twice and saw [his]90-joost grave face and serious blue eyes , as [she]1613-she had seen them every day since [her]1613-she first coming . And when [she]1613-she looked at [him]90-joost , and saw [him]90-joost , [his]90-joost appearance , [his]90-joost small mannerisms , [himself]90-joost in fact , a voice inside [her]1613-she cried down the aching pity , saying , " [I]90-joost could not do it , [I]90-joost could not do it ! "[90-joost] But when [she]1613-she was alone in [the little room]324-the little room with the door shut between , the pity grew strong again till it almost welled up in tears . [Poor Joost]119-poor joost ! [Poor humble , earnest , unselfish Joost]119-poor joost ! That [he]90-joost should care so , that [he]90-joost should have set [his]90-joost hopes on [her]1613-she , [[his]90-joost star]1627-his star — a will - o'-wisp of devious ways ! That [he]90-joost should ache for this unworthy cause , and for it shut [his]90-joost eyes to the homely happiness which might have been [his]90-joost ! [She]1613-she rose quickly and went up - stairs to get [her]1613-she hat and jacket . Soon after , [the carriage]711-the carriage , which [she]1613-she had extravagantly ordered , came , and [she]1613-she called [the servant]729-the servant to help [her]1613-she down with [her]1613-she luggage . [They]1630-they got it down [the narrow staircase between [them]1630-they]1631-the narrow staircase between them and into [the hall]343-the hall ; [Julia]58-julia glanced back at [the white marble kitchen]619-the white marble kitchen for the last time , and at [the dim little sitting - room]1634-the dim little sitting - room . [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen was [there]180-there , very much absorbed in crochet ; but [she]86-vrouw van heigen had left the door ajar so that [she]86-vrouw van heigen might know when [Julia]58-julia went , and that must have occupied a prominent place in [her]86-vrouw van heigen mind , for [she]1613-she made a mistake at every other stitch . " Good - bye , [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said . [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen grunted ; [she]1613-she remembered what was due to [herself]1613-she and propriety . " And , oh , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia looked back to say as [she]58-julia remembered it , " do n't forget that last lot of peach - brandy [we]3856-we made , it was not properly tied down ; [you]85-mevrouw ought to look at the covers some time this week . "[58-julia] " Ah , yes , "[553-the old lady] said [the old lady]553-the old lady , forgetting propriety , " thank [you]58-julia , thank [you]58-julia , [I]553-the old lady 'll see to it ; it will never do to have that go ; such fine peaches too . "[553-the old lady] Then [Julia]58-julia went out and got into [the carriage]711-the carriage . [Mijnheer]90-joost was in [[his]90-joost office]1638-his office ; [he]90-joost did not think it quite right to come to see [her]58-julia start either ; all the same [he]90-joost came to the door to tell [the driver]883-the driver to be careful not to go on the grass . [Joost]90-joost came also and looked over [[his]90-joost father]614-his father 's shoulder , and [Julia]58-julia , who had been amused at [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen , suddenly forgot this little amusement again . [Joost]90-joost left [[his]90-joost father]614-his father . " [I]90-joost will tell [the man]820-the man , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said . " [I]90-joost will go after [him]820-the man too and shut the gate ; it grows late for it to be open . "[90-joost] [The carriage]711-the carriage had already started , and [he]90-joost had to hurry after [it]711-the carriage ; even then [he]90-joost did not catch [it]711-the carriage up till it was past the bend of [the drive]787-the drive . Then [the man]820-the man saw [him]90-joost and pulled up , though it is doubtful if [he]90-joost got any order or , indeed , any word . [Julia]58-julia had been looking back , but from the other side ; and because [she]58-julia had been looking back and remembering much happiness and simplicity here , [she]58-julia was so grieved for one at least who dwelt [here]371-here that [her]58-julia eyes were full of tears . [Joost]90-joost saw [them]1646-them when , on the stopping of [the carriage]711-the carriage , [she]58-julia turned . " Do not weep , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said ; " [you]58-julia must not weep for [me]90-joost . "[90-joost] " [I]58-julia am so sorry , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " so dreadfully sorry ! "[58-julia] " But [you]58-julia must not be , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost told [her]58-julia ; " there is no need . "[90-joost] " There is every need ; [you]58-julia have been so kind to [me]90-joost , so good ; [you]58-julia have almost taught [me]90-joost — though [you]58-julia do n't know it — some goodness too , and in return [I]90-joost have brought [you]58-julia nothing but sadness . "[90-joost] " Ah , yes , sadness , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said ; " but gladness too , and the gladness is more than the sadness . Would [you]58-julia not sooner know the fine even though [you]58-julia can not attain to it , than be content with the little all [your]58-julia life ? [I]90-joost would , and it is that which [you]58-julia have given [me]90-joost . It is [I]90-joost who give nothing — "[90-joost] [He]90-joost hesitated as if for a moment at a loss , and [she]58-julia had no words to fill in the pause . " Will [you]58-julia take this ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said , half thrusting something forward . " It is , perhaps , not much to some , but [I]90-joost would like [you]58-julia to have it ; it seems fitting ; [I]90-joost think [I]90-joost owe it to [you]58-julia , and [you]58-julia to it . "[90-joost] " Oh , yes , yes , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia murmured , hardly hearing and not grasping the last words ; there was something choking in [her]58-julia throat ; it was this strange , humble , disinterested love , so new to [her]58-julia , which brought it there and prevented [her]58-julia from understanding . [She]58-julia stretched out [her]58-julia hands , and [he]90-joost put something into them ; then [he]90-joost stepped back , and [the carriage]711-the carriage drove on . It was not till the gateway was passed that [she]58-julia realised what it was [she]58-julia held — a small bag made of the greyish - brown paper used on [a bulb farm]1649-a bulb farm ; inside , a single bulb ; and outside , written , according to the invariable custom of [growers]3416-growers — " Narcissus Triandrus Azureum Vrouw [Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen . "[58-julia]

[Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew was reading a letter . It was breakfast time ; the letter had missed the afternoon post yesterday , which was what [the writer]1161-the writer would have wished , and so was not delivered at [the hotel]1652-the hotel till the morning . It was short , from the beginning—"I am so glad [you]90-joost have done it , "[58-julia] to the end of the postscript—"this is to - morrow , so good - bye . "[58-julia] There was not much to read ; yet [he]90-joost looked at it for some time . Did [ever man]1167-ever man receive such a refusal to an offer of marriage ? It was almost absurd , and perhaps hardly flattering , yet somehow characteristic of [the writer]1161-the writer ; [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew recognised that now , though it had surprised [him]90-joost none the less . What was to be done next ? See [the girl]415-the girl , [he]90-joost supposed , and hear what [she]415-the girl proposed to do ; [she]415-the girl wrote that [she]415-the girl had arranged " capitally , "[415-the girl] but [she]415-the girl did not say what . [He]90-joost was quite certain [she]415-the girl was not going to remain with [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ; if by some extraordinary accident [she]415-the girl had been able to bring that about , [she]415-the girl would certainly have told [him]90-joost so triumphantly . [He]90-joost could not think of anything " capital "[415-the girl] [she]415-the girl could have arranged ; [he]90-joost was persuaded , either that [she]415-the girl only said it to reassure [him]90-joost , or else , if [she]415-the girl believed it , it was in [her]415-the girl ignorance of the extent of the damage done yesterday . [He]90-joost must go and see [her]415-the girl , hear what [she]415-the girl had planned , and what further trouble [she]415-the girl was thinking to get [herself]415-the girl into , and prevent it in the only way possible ; and there was only one way , there was absolutely no other solution of the difficulty ; [she]415-the girl must marry [him]90-joost , and there was an end of it . [He]90-joost glanced at [her]415-the girl refusal again , and liked it in spite of its absurdity ; after all , perhaps it would have been better if [he]90-joost had been frank too ; [one]3325-one could afford to dispense with the delicate conventions that [he]90-joost associated with [women]3573-women in dealing with [this girl]1494-this girl . [He]90-joost wished [he]90-joost had gone to [her]415-the girl and spoken freely , as [man]1052-man to [man]1052-man , saying plainly that since [they]1661-they had together been indiscreet , [they]1661-they must together take the consequence , and make the best of it — and really the best might be very good . Soon after [he]90-joost had finished breakfast [he]90-joost set out for [[the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ' house]564-the van heigens ' house . But as yet , though [he]90-joost had some comprehension of [Julia]58-julia , [he]90-joost had not fully realised the promptness of action which necessity had taught [her]58-julia . When [he]90-joost reached the [Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ' [she]415-the girl had been gone some sixteen hours . It was [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen who told [him]90-joost ; [she]415-the girl was in [the veranda]618-the veranda when [he]90-joost arrived , and so , perforce , saw [him]90-joost and answered [his]90-joost inquiries . It was evident , at the outset , that neither [his]90-joost appearance nor name conveyed anything to [her]415-the girl ; [she]415-the girl had not seen [him]90-joost the day of the excursion , and [Denah]103-denah 's description , purposely complicated by a cross description of [Julia]58-julia 's , had conveyed nothing , and [his]90-joost name had never transpired . [He]90-joost saw [he]90-joost was unknown , and recognised [Julia]58-julia 's loyal screening of [him]90-joost , not with any satisfaction ; evidently it was part of [her]58-julia creed to stand between [a man]406-a man ( [father or otherwise]1665-father or otherwise ) and the consequence of [his]90-joost acts . That was an additional reason for finding [her]58-julia and explaining that [he]90-joost , unlike [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington , was not used to anything of the sort . " [She]58-julia has gone ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said , in answer to [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen 's brief information . [The old lady]553-the old lady was decidedly nervous of [the impressive Englishman who had come asking after [[her]553-the old lady disgraced companion]1668-her disgraced companion]1667-the impressive englishman who had come asking after her disgraced companion ; [she]553-the old lady moved [her]553-the old lady fat hands uneasily even before [he]90-joost asked , " Where has [she]58-julia gone ? Perhaps [you]90-joost would be kind enough to give [me]553-the old lady [her]58-julia address ? "[553-the old lady] " [I]58-julia can not , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia was obliged to say ; " [I]58-julia have not it . [I]58-julia do not know where [she]58-julia is . "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew stared . " But surely , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said , " [you]58-julia are mistaken ? [She]58-julia was here yesterday . "[90-joost] " Yes , yes ; [I]58-julia know . But [she]58-julia is not here now ; [she]58-julia went last night in haste . [I]58-julia will tell [you]90-joost about it . [You]90-joost are [a friend]430-a friend ? Come in . "[58-julia] Without waiting , [she]58-julia led [him]90-joost into [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room , and there left [him]90-joost in some haste . [The room]205-the room struck [him]90-joost as familiar ; [he]90-joost wondered why , until [he]90-joost remembered that it must have been [Julia]58-julia 's description which made [him]90-joost so well acquainted with it . It was all just as [she]58-julia described ; the thick , dark - coloured carpet , with the little carefully - bound strips of the same material laid over it to make paths to the piano , the stove , and [other frequented spots]1671-other frequented spots . The highly - polished furniture , upholstered in black and yellow Utrecht velvet , the priceless Chinese porcelain brought home by [old Dutch merchants]1672-old dutch merchants , and handed down from [mother]3346-mother to [daughter]336-daughter for generations ; [the antimacassars of crochet work]1675-the antimacassars of crochet work , the snuff - coloured wall - paper , the wonderful painted tiles framed in ebony that hung upon it . It was all just as [she]58-julia had said ; the very light and smell seemed familiar , [she]58-julia must somehow have given [him]90-joost an idea of them too . Just then [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen came back , and [[her]86-vrouw van heigen husband]230-her husband with [her]86-vrouw van heigen ; [she]58-julia had been to fetch [him]230-her husband , not feeling equal to dealing with [the visitor]374-the visitor alone . [Mijnheer]90-joost , by [her]58-julia request , had put on [his]90-joost best coat , but [he]90-joost still had [his]90-joost spectacles pushed upon [his]90-joost forehead , as they always were when [he]90-joost was disturbed in [the office]603-the office . There was a formal greeting — one never dispensed with that in [Holland]7-holland , then [Mijnheer]90-joost said , " [You]90-joost are , [I]90-joost suppose , [a friend of [[Miss Polkington]58-julia 's father]3860-miss polkington 's father]3859-a friend of miss polkington 's father ? "[90-joost] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew , remembering the winter day at [Marbridge]61-denah , answered , " [I]90-joost am acquainted with [him]3860-miss polkington 's father . "[90-joost] [Mijnheer]90-joost nodded . " Yes , yes , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said ; then , " it is very sad , and much to be regretted . [I]75-rawson - clew can not but give to [you]90-joost , and through [you]90-joost to [[her]58-julia father]210-her father , very bad news of [Miss Polkington]58-julia . [She]58-julia is not what [we]3862-we thought [her]58-julia ; [she]58-julia has disgraced — "[75-rawson - clew] But here [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew interrupted , but in the quiet , leisurely way which was so incomprehensible to [the Hollanders]120-the hollanders . " [[My]75-rawson - clew dear [sir]3376-sir]3863-my dear sir , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , " please spare [yourself]3376-sir the trouble of these details ; [I]75-rawson - clew am [the man with whom [Miss Polkington]58-julia]3865-the man with whom miss polkington had the misfortune to be lost on [the Dunes]13-the dunes . "[75-rawson - clew] [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen gasped ; the gentle , drawling voice , the manner , the whole air of [the speaker]1679-the speaker overwhelmed [her]86-vrouw van heigen , and shattered all [her]86-vrouw van heigen previous thoughts of the affair . With [Mijnheer]90-joost it was different ; right was right , and wrong wrong to [him]90-joost , no matter who [the persons concerned]1680-the persons concerned might be . " Then , [sir]3376-sir , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , growing somewhat red , " [I]75-rawson - clew am glad indeed that [I]75-rawson - clew can not tell [you]3376-sir where [she]58-julia is . "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew looked up with faint admiration , righteous indignation , or at all events the open expression of it , was a discourtesy practically extinct with [the people among whom [he]75-rawson - clew usually lived]1681-the people among whom he usually lived . [He]75-rawson - clew felt respect for [the old bulb grower who would be guilty of it]1682-the old bulb grower who would be guilty of it . "[75-rawson - clew] " [She]58-julia will , [I]90-joost should think , come to less harm without [you]75-rawson - clew than with [you]75-rawson - clew , "[90-joost] [Mijnheer]90-joost retorted ; and [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew , seeing as plainly as [Julia]58-julia had yesterday , the impossibility of making the position clear , did not attempt it . " [I]75-rawson - clew hope [you]3376-sir may be right , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said , " but [I]75-rawson - clew am afraid [she]58-julia will be in difficulties . [She]58-julia had little money , and [no friends]3867-no friends in [Holland]7-holland , and was , [I]75-rawson - clew have reason to believe , on such terms with [[her]58-julia family]1195-her family that it would not suit [her]58-julia to return to [England]8-england . "[75-rawson - clew] " Ah , but [she]58-julia must have gone to [England]8-england ! "[75-rawson - clew] [Vrouw Van Heigen]86-vrouw van heigen cried . " [She]58-julia went away in [a carriage]1416-a carriage as [one]3325-one does when one goes to [the station]496-the station to start on a journey . "[86-vrouw van heigen] " [She]58-julia received letters from [[her]58-julia family]1195-her family , "[90-joost] [Mijnheer]90-joost said sturdily , " not frequently , but occasionally ; there was not , [I]90-joost think , any quarrel or disagreement . [She]58-julia must certainly have set out to return [home]249-home last night . If not , and if [she]58-julia had nowhere to go , why should [she]58-julia leave as [she]58-julia did yesterday ? [We]1195-her family did not say ' go ! ' [we]1195-her family were content that [she]58-julia should remain several days , until [her]58-julia arrangements could be made . "[90-joost] " [She]58-julia might not have cared for that , "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew suggested ; " if [you]90-joost insinuated to [her]58-julia the sort of things [you]90-joost did to [me]75-rawson - clew ; [women]3573-women do not like that , as a rule , [you]90-joost know . "[75-rawson - clew] All the same , as [he]90-joost said this , [he]90-joost could not help thinking [Mijnheer]90-joost right ; [Julia]58-julia must have had somewhere to go . [Her]58-julia dignity and feelings were not of the order to lose sight of essentials in details , or to demand unreasonable sacrifice of common sense . [She]58-julia must have had some destination in view when [she]58-julia left [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens yesterday , and , as far as [he]90-joost could see , there was no destination open to [her]58-julia but [home]249-home . [Mijnheer]90-joost was firmly of this opinion , although , now that a question about it had been suggested to [him]90-joost , [he]90-joost wished [he]90-joost had made sure before [the girl]415-the girl left . Of course , [her]58-julia plans and destination were no business of [his]90-joost — [she]58-julia might even have refused to give information about them on that account ; [he]90-joost had dismissed [her]58-julia in disgrace , what [she]58-julia did next was not [his]90-joost concern . But in spite of [her]58-julia bad behaviour [he]90-joost had liked [her]58-julia ; and though [his]90-joost notions of propriety , and consequent condemnation of [her]58-julia , had undergone no change , [he]90-joost was kind - heartedly anxious [she]58-julia should come to no harm . [Her]58-julia words about [some good people]1685-some good people making the merely indiscreet into [sinners]3817-sinners came back to [him]90-joost , but [he]90-joost would not apply [them]1687-them ; [Julia]58-julia had gone [home]249-home , [he]90-joost was sure of it , and a good thing too ; [the Englishman with the quiet voice and the grand manner]1689-the englishman with the quiet voice and the grand manner could not follow [her]58-julia there to [her]58-julia detriment . Though , to be sure , it was strange that [such a man as [he]90-joost should want to]1690-such a man as he should want to ; [he]90-joost was not [the kind of person [Mijnheer]90-joost had expected [the partner in the escapade]1692-the partner in the escapade to be ; truly [the English]87-the english were [a strange people]1693-a strange people , very strange . [[His]90-joost wife]168-his wife]1691-the kind of person mijnheer had expected the partner in the escapade to be ; truly the english were a strange people , very strange . his wife agreed with [him]90-joost on that point ; [they]168-his wife often said so afterwards — in fact , whenever [they]168-his wife thought of the disgraced companion , who was such [an excellent cook]1695-an excellent cook . As for [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew , [he]75-rawson - clew returned to [England]8-england ; there was nothing to keep [him]75-rawson - clew longer in [Holland]7-holland . But as [he]75-rawson - clew was still not sure how [Julia]58-julia 's " capital arrangement "[58-julia] was going to be worked out , and was determined to bear [his]75-rawson - clew share of the burden , [he]75-rawson - clew decided to go to [Marbridge]61-denah on an early opportunity . The opportunity did not occur quite so soon as [he]75-rawson - clew expected ; several things intervened , so that [he]75-rawson - clew had been [home]249-home more than a week before [he]75-rawson - clew was able to fulfil [his]75-rawson - clew intention . [Marbridge]61-denah lies in [the west country]1697-the west country , some considerable distance from [London]9-london ; [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew did not reach [it]61-denah till the afternoon , at an hour devoted by [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons most exclusively to things social . "[1701-a smart - looking girl she was , with her answers quite ready] Then , it seemed , [his]75-rawson - clew first suspicion was correct ; [Julia]58-julia had not gone [home]249-home ; for some reason or another [she]58-julia was not able to return . " Is [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington in ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew asked . "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew asked for [his]75-rawson - clew address ; it occurred to [him]75-rawson - clew that [Julia]58-julia might have gone to [[her]58-julia father]210-her father ; it really seemed very probable . [He]75-rawson - clew got the address in full , and went away , but without leaving any name to puzzle and tantalise [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington . Of course [she]60-mrs. polkington was puzzled and tantalised when [the maid]1619-the maid told [her]60-mrs. polkington of [the visitor]374-the visitor . From past experience , [she]60-mrs. polkington expected something unpleasant of [his]75-rawson - clew coming , even though the description sounded favourable ; but , as [she]60-mrs. polkington heard no more of it , [she]60-mrs. polkington forgot all about [him]75-rawson - clew in the course of time . It was on the next afternoon that [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew drove to [31 Berwick Street]38-berwick street . There are [several [Berwick Streets]32-berwick streets in [London]9-london]1720-several berwick streets in london , and , though the address given was full enough for [the postal authorities]1721-the postal authorities , [the cabman]1722-the cabman had some difficulty in finding it , and went wrong before [he]75-rawson - clew went right . It was [a dingy street]1723-a dingy street , and not very long ; [it]1723-a dingy street had an unimportant , apologetic sort of air , as if [it]1723-a dingy street were quite used to being overlooked . [The houses]1724-the houses were oldish , and very narrow , so that a good many were packed into the short length ; the pavement was narrow , too , and so were the windows ; they , for the most part , were carefully draped with curtains of doubtful hue . Some were further guarded from prying eyes by sort of gridirons , politely called balconies , though , since the platform had been forgotten , and only the protecting railings were there hard up against the glass , the name was deceptive . The hansom came slowly down [the street]366-the street , [the driver]883-the driver scanning the frequent doors for 31 . [He]883-the driver overlooked it by reason of the fact that the number had been rubbed off , but finally located it by discovering most of the numbers above and below . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew got out and rang . In course of time — rather a long time — the door was opened to [him]75-rawson - clew by [the landlady]1727-the landlady — [that same landlady who had confided to [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat the desirability of having a good standing with [the butcher]3357-the butcher]1728-that same landlady who had confided to mr. gillat the desirability of having a good standing with the butcher . " [Cap'ain Polkington]121-cap'ain polkington ? "[1727-the landlady] [she]1727-the landlady said , in answer to [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew 's inquiry . " [I]1727-the landlady do n't know whether [he]75-rawson - clew 's in or not ; [you]75-rawson - clew 'd better go up and see ; one of 'em 's there , anyhow . "[1727-the landlady] [She]1727-the landlady stood back against the wall , and [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew came in . " [Up - stairs]3882-up - stairs , "[1727-the landlady] [she]1727-the landlady said ; " second door [you]75-rawson - clew come to . "[1727-the landlady] With that [she]1727-the landlady went down to [the kitchen regions]1730-the kitchen regions ; [she]1727-the landlady was [no respecter of [persons]1732-persons]1731-no respecter of persons , and [she]1727-the landlady thanked God [she]1727-the landlady had plenty of [her]1727-the landlady own business to mind , and never troubled [herself]1727-the landlady poking into [other people]3728-other people 's . Consequently , though [she]1727-the landlady might wonder what [a man of [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew]1734-a man of rawson - clew 's appearance should want with [[her]1727-the landlady lodgers]1735-her lodgers , [she]1727-the landlady did not let it interfere with [her]1727-the landlady work , or take the edge off [her]1727-the landlady tongue in the heated argument [she]1727-the landlady held with [the milkman , who came directly after]1736-the milkman , who came directly after . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew found [his]75-rawson - clew way up the stairs ; [they]1737-them were steep , and had rather the appearance of having been omitted in the original plan of [the house]175-the house , and squeezed in as an afterthought , when it was found really impossible to do without . There was no window to give light to [them]1737-them , or air either ; hence , no doubt , the antiquity of the flavour of cabbage and fried bacon with hung about them . But [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew , when [he]75-rawson - clew ascended , found the second door without trouble ; there was not room to get lost . [He]75-rawson - clew knocked ; [he]75-rawson - clew half expected to hear [Julia]58-julia 's voice ; it seemed to [him]75-rawson - clew probable that [she]58-julia was [the person referred to as " [one of [them]1737-them]3884-one of them]3883-the person referred to as " one of them . "[58-julia] But it was [a man who bade [him]75-rawson - clew enter]1739-a man who bade him enter , and , unless [his]75-rawson - clew memory played [him]75-rawson - clew false , not [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington . [He]57-johnny was reading the newspaper — [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had it in the morning , [he]57-johnny in the afternoon ; [he]57-johnny wore , or attempted to ( they fell off rather often ) , very old slippers indeed , and a coat of surprising shabbiness which [he]57-johnny reserved for [home]249-home use . " There , [you]75-rawson - clew read that , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew read , and at the end was little wiser . [Julia]58-julia said [she]58-julia had left one situation ( reason not even suggested ) , and had got another . That [she]58-julia did not wish to give [her]58-julia new address , or to hear from [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , or [[her]58-julia family]1195-her family , at [this new place]1747-this new place , as it might spoil [her]58-julia arrangements . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew recognised the last word as a favourite of [Julia]58-julia 's ; with [her]58-julia it was elastic , and could mean anything , from a piece of lace arranged to fill up the neck of a dress , to a complex and far - reaching scheme arranged to bring about some desired end . What it meant in the present instance was not indicated , but clearly [she]58-julia did not wish for interference , and , with some wisdom , took the surest way to prevent it by making it well - nigh impossible . [She]58-julia had left one means of communication , however , though apparently that was for [Johnny]57-johnny only . " If [you]57-johnny and [father]3307-father get into any very great muddle , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia wrote , " [you]57-johnny must let [me]58-julia know .
