"[58-julia] A paper was suggested ; it was a cheap weekly . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew remembered to have seen it once in [the small Dutch town]1748-the small dutch town that summer , so it was to be got [there]180-there . Unfortunately , as [he]75-rawson - clew also remembered , it was to be got in [Amsterdam]33-amsterdam and [Rotterdam]34-rotterdam , and [Paris]26-paris and [Berlin]22-berlin too . [He]75-rawson - clew folded the letter , and returned it to [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat . " Thank [you]66-mr. gillat , "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said ; " evidently , as [you]66-mr. gillat say , [she]58-julia does not wish to be found , and it would seem [she]58-julia has got some sort of employment , although [I]75-rawson - clew am afraid it can not be of an easy or pleasant sort . "[75-rawson - clew] [He]75-rawson - clew did not explain the reason [he]75-rawson - clew had for thinking so , and [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat never thought of asking . Soon after [he]75-rawson - clew went away . Clearly there was nothing to be done . [Julia]58-julia did not mean to have [his]75-rawson - clew help and protection ; and , with a decision and completeness which , now [he]75-rawson - clew came to think of it , did not altogether surprise [him]75-rawson - clew , [she]58-julia has taken care to avoid [them]1750-them . That absurd refusal of [hers]58-julia was , after all , a reprieve , although until now [he]75-rawson - clew had not looked upon it in that light . No doubt it was a good thing affairs had turned out as [they]1750-them had ; the marriage would have been in many ways disadvantageous . Yet [he]75-rawson - clew certainly would have insisted on it , and taken trouble to do so , if [she]58-julia had not put it altogether out of [his]75-rawson - clew power . All the same , [he]75-rawson - clew did not feel as gratified as [he]75-rawson - clew ought , perhaps because the arrogance of [man]1052-man is not pleased to have [woman arbitrator]1752-woman arbitrator of [his]75-rawson - clew fate , and the instinct of [gentleman]1753-gentleman is not satisfied to have [her]58-julia bear [his]75-rawson - clew burden , perhaps for some other less clear reason . [He]75-rawson - clew really did not know [himself]75-rawson - clew , and did not try to think ; there seemed little object in doing so , seeing that incident was closed . The next day [he]75-rawson - clew went north , and by accident travelled part of the way with [a lady of [his]75-rawson - clew acquaintance]1754-a lady of his acquaintance . [She]58-julia was young , not more than five or six and twenty , nice looking too , and very well dressed . [She]58-julia had a lot of small impediments with [her]58-julia — a cloak , a dressing - bag , sunshade , umbrella , golf clubs — some one , no doubt , would come and clear [her]58-julia when the destination was reached ; in the mean time , [she]58-julia and [her]58-julia belongings were [an eminently feminine presence]1755-an eminently feminine presence . [She]58-julia talked pleasantly of what had happened since [they]1756-they last met ; [she]58-julia had been to [Baireuth]35-baireuth that summer , [she]58-julia told [him]75-rawson - clew , and spoke intelligently of the music , the technique and the beauty of it , and what it stood for . [She]58-julia was surprised to hear [he]75-rawson - clew had got no further than [Holland]7-holland , and more surprised still that [he]75-rawson - clew had not even seen [Rembrandt]122-rembrandt 's masterpiece while [he]75-rawson - clew was [there]180-there . [Her]58-julia voice was smooth and even , a little loud , perhaps , from [her]58-julia spending much time out of doors , not in the least given to those subtle changes of tone which express what is not said ; but as [she]58-julia never wanted to express any such things , that did not matter . [She]58-julia did not bore [him]75-rawson - clew with too much conversation ; [she]58-julia had papers with [her]58-julia — some three or four , and [she]58-julia glanced at them between whiles . Afterwards [she]58-julia commented on their contents — the political situation , the war ( there is always a war somewhere ) , the cricket news , the new books ; touching lightly , but intelligently , on each topic in turn . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew listened and answered , polite and mildly interested . It was some time since [he]75-rawson - clew had heard this agreeable kind of conversation , and since [he]75-rawson - clew had come in contact with [this agreeable kind of person]1758-this agreeable kind of person . [He]75-rawson - clew ought to have appreciated it more , as [men]3625-men appreciate the charm of drawing - rooms who have long been banished from [them]3625-men . [He]75-rawson - clew came to the conclusion that [he]75-rawson - clew must be growing old , not to prefer the society of [a pretty , agreeable and well - dressed woman]1760-a pretty , agreeable and well - dressed woman to [an empty railway carriage]1761-an empty railway carriage . [The girl]415-the girl had two fine carnations in [her]415-the girl coat ; the stalks were rather long , and so had got bruised . [She]415-the girl regretted this , and [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew offered to cut them for [her]415-the girl . [He]75-rawson - clew began to feel for a knife in likely and unlikely pockets , and it was then that [he]75-rawson - clew first noticed a faint , sweet smell ; dry , not strong at all , more a memory than a scent . [He]75-rawson - clew did not recognise what it was , nor from where it came , but it reminded [him]75-rawson - clew of something , [he]75-rawson - clew could not think what . [He]75-rawson - clew puzzled over it as [he]75-rawson - clew cut the flower stalks , then all at once [he]75-rawson - clew laid hold on the edge of a recollection — a pair of dark eyes , in which mirthful , mocking lights flickered , as the sun splashes flicker on the ground under trees — a voice , [many - noted as a violin , that grew softest when it was going to strike hardest]1763-many - noted as a violin , that grew softest when it was going to strike hardest , that expressed a hundred things unsaid . [He]75-rawson - clew looked across at [the owner of the carnations]1764-the owner of the carnations , and wondered by what perversity of fate it was decreed that [any one who could buy such good boots]1765-any one who could buy such good boots , should have such ill - shaped feet to put into them ; and why , if fate so handicapped [her]415-the girl , why [she]415-the girl should exhibit them by crossing [her]415-the girl knees . [He]75-rawson - clew also wondered what possessed [her]415-the girl to wear that hat ; [every other well - dressed girl]1766-every other well - dressed girl had a variation of the style that year , it was the correctest of the correct for fashion , but [he]75-rawson - clew did not take note of that . [Men]3625-men are rather blockheaded on the subject of fashion , and seldom see the charm in the innately unbecoming and unsuitable , no matter what decrees it . [He]75-rawson - clew looked back to the empty opposite corner , and , though until that moment [he]75-rawson - clew had not really thought of [Julia]58-julia since [he]75-rawson - clew left [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat yesterday , [he]75-rawson - clew put [her]58-julia there in imagination now . [He]75-rawson - clew did not want [her]58-julia there , [he]75-rawson - clew did not want [her]58-julia anywhere ( there are some wines which [a man]406-a man does not want , that still rather spoil [his]406-a man taste for others ) . [She]58-julia would not have made the mistake of wearing such a hat ; [her]58-julia clothes were not new , they were distinctly shabby sometimes , but they were well assorted . As to the boots — [he]75-rawson - clew remembered the day [he]75-rawson - clew tied [her]58-julia shoe — [he]75-rawson - clew could imagine [the man [she]58-julia married]1769-the man she married , if [he]1769-the man she married were very young and very foolish , of course , finding a certain pleasure in taking [her]58-julia arched foot , when it was pink and bare , in the hollow of [his]1769-the man she married hand . If [she]58-julia were in that corner now , the quiet , twinkling smile would certainly be on [her]58-julia face as [she]58-julia listened to the talk of books , and [men]3625-men , and places , and things . [He]75-rawson - clew did not picture [her]58-julia joining even when [they]1771-they spoke of things [she]58-julia knew , and places [she]58-julia had been to — [he]75-rawson - clew remembered [he]75-rawson - clew had once heard [her]58-julia speak of [a town]1772-a town which had been spoken of this afternoon . [She]58-julia had somehow grasped the whole life of [the place]241-the place , and laid it bare to [him]75-rawson - clew in a few words — the light - hearted gaiety and the sordid misery , the black superstition and the towering history which overhung it , and the cheerful commonplace which , like the street cries and [the gutter streams]1774-the gutter streams , ran through it all — the whole flavour of the thing . [The girl opposite]1775-the girl opposite had been to [the place]241-the place too ; [she]58-julia told [him]75-rawson - clew of [the historic spots [she]58-julia had visited]1777-the historic spots she had visited ; [she]58-julia knew a deal more about them than [Julia]58-julia did . [She]58-julia spoke of the quaint pottery to be bought [there]180-there — it had not struck [Julia]58-julia as quaint , any more than it did [its buyers]1779-its buyers and [sellers]1780-sellers . And [she]58-julia referred to the sayings and opinions of [a great pose writer , who had expressed all [he]1781-a great pose writer , who had expressed all he knew and felt and thought about it , and more besides knew and felt and thought about it , and more besides]1781-a great pose writer , who had expressed all he knew and felt and thought about it , and more besides . [Julia]58-julia , apparently , had not read [him]75-rawson - clew — what reading [she]58-julia had done seemed to be more in the direction of [Gil Blas]82-gil blas , and [Dean Swift]123-dean swift , and other kindred things in different languages . [The owner of the carnations]1764-the owner of the carnations glanced out of window , and commented on the scenery , which was here rather fine — [Julia]58-julia would not have done that ; all the same , [she]58-julia would have known just [what sort of country [they]1784-they had passed through all the way]1783-what sort of country they had passed through all the way , not only when it was fine ; [she]58-julia would have noticed the lie of [the land]1785-the land , the style of work done [there]180-there , the kind of lives lived [there]180-there , even , possibly , the likely difficulties in the way of railway - making and bridge building . [She]58-julia would certainly have taken account of the faces on the platforms at which [they]1784-they drew up , so that without effort [she]58-julia could have picked out [the porter who would give the best service]1788-the porter who would give the best service ; [the stranger in need of help]1789-the stranger in need of help , and [he]75-rawson - clew who would offer it ; and the guard most likely to be useful if it were necessary to cheat [the company]3775-the company — it was conceivable that [cheating companies]1791-cheating companies might sometimes be necessary in [her]58-julia scheme of things . [He]75-rawson - clew cut another piece off the carnation stalks , they were still too long . [He]75-rawson - clew did not wish [Julia]58-julia there ; [he]75-rawson - clew fancied that it was likely [she]58-julia would not easily find [her]58-julia place among [the people [he]75-rawson - clew would meet at [his]75-rawson - clew journey 's end]1792-the people he would meet at his journey 's end . But if there were no end — if [he]75-rawson - clew were going somewhere else , east or west , north or south — say [a certain old oriental town]1793-a certain old oriental town , old and wicked as time itself , and full of the mystery and indefinable charm of age , and iniquity , and transcendent beauty — [she]58-julia would like that ; [she]58-julia would grasp the whole , without attempting to express or judge it . Or [a little far - off [Tyrolean village]1795-tyrolean village , remote as [the mountains from the life of the world]1796-the mountains from the life of the world]1794-a little far - off tyrolean village , remote as the mountains from the life of the world — [she]58-julia would like that ; the discomfort would be nothing to [her]58-julia , the primitiveness , the simplicity , everything . If [he]75-rawson - clew were going to [some such place]1797-some such place — why , then , there were worse things than having to take [the companion of the holiday]1798-the companion of the holiday too . [He]75-rawson - clew handed back the carnations , and then unthinkingly put [his]75-rawson - clew hand into [his]75-rawson - clew coat - pocket . [His]75-rawson - clew fingers came in contact with some dry rubbish , little more than stalks and dust , but still exhaling something of the fragrance which had been sun distilled on [the Dunes]1799-the dunes . [He]75-rawson - clew recognised it now — [Julia]58-julia 's flowers , put there in the wood , and forgotten until now . " Thanks so much for cutting them , "[1800-the girl with the carnations] said [the girl with the carnations]1800-the girl with the carnations , smelling them before [she]1800-the girl with the carnations fastened them on again . " [I]1800-the girl with the carnations really think they are [my]1800-the girl with the carnations favourite flower ; the scent is so delicious — quite the nicest flower of all , do n't [you]75-rawson - clew think so ? "[1800-the girl with the carnations] " [I]75-rawson - clew 'm not sure , "[75-rawson - clew] [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew said thoughtfully , and when [he]75-rawson - clew spoke thoughtfully [he]75-rawson - clew drawled very much , " [I]75-rawson - clew 'm not sure [I]75-rawson - clew do n't sometimes prefer wild thyme . "[75-rawson - clew]

It was about ten o'clock on an October night ; everything was intensely quiet in [the big kitchen where [Julia]58-julia stood]1801-the big kitchen where julia stood . It was not a cheerful place even in the day time , the windows looked north , and were very high up ; the walls and floor were alike of grey stone , which gave [it]1801-the big kitchen where julia stood a prison - like aspect , and also took much scrubbing , as [she]58-julia had reason to know . It was far too large a place to be warmed by the small stove now used ; [Julia]58-julia sometimes wondered if [the big one that stood empty in [its]1802-the big one that stood empty in its place place]1802-the big one that stood empty in its place would have been sufficient to warm it . [She]58-julia glanced at it now , but without interest ; [she]58-julia was very tired , it was almost bed - time , and [she]58-julia had done , as [she]58-julia had every day since [she]58-julia first joined [[Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's household]1803-herr van de greutz 's household , a very good day 's work . [She]58-julia had scarcely been outside the four walls since [she]58-julia first came [there]180-there on the day after the holiday on [the Dunes]1799-the dunes . This had been [her]58-julia own choice , for , unlike [all the cooks who had been before [her]58-julia]1806-all the cooks who had been before her , [she]58-julia had asked for no evenings out . [Marthe]89-marthe , [the short - tempered housekeeper]1807-the short - tempered housekeeper , had not troubled [herself]89-marthe to wonder why , [she]89-marthe had been only too pleased to accept the arrangement without comment . Apart from the self - chosen confinement , the life had been hard enough ; the work was hard , the service hard and ill - paid , and both [the other inmates of [the house]175-the house]1808-the other inmates of the house cross - grained , and difficult to please . These things , however , [Julia]58-julia did not mind ; discomfort never mat tered much to [her]58-julia when [she]58-julia had an end in view ; in this case , too , the end should more than repay the worst of [[her]58-julia two task - masters]1810-her two task - masters . Which was agreeable , and almost made [his]1810-her two task - masters unpleasantness desirable , as providing [her]58-julia intended act with a justification . [She]58-julia drew the coffee pot further on to the stove , and with a splinter of wood stirred the fire . [She]58-julia had [the kitchen]220-the kitchen to [herself]58-julia , [old Marthe]89-marthe had gone to bed ; [she]58-julia liked going to bed early , with a glass of something hot , and [she]58-julia had soon found that [the young cook]1812-the young cook could be trusted to finish the work down - [stairs]300-stairs . It was [her]58-julia opinion that it is as well to be comfortable when [you]1814-you can , as blessings are fleeting and fickle , especially when [they]1815-they are [cooks]3630-cooks ; so [she]58-julia indulged often both in bed and the glass , notably the glass . [She]58-julia had not been able to go to bed quite as early as [she]58-julia liked that day , for [[her]58-julia master]1020-her master had [a visitor]1818-a visitor , and there had been some trouble after the dinner . It was intended to be an hour later than usual to accommodate [the visitor]374-the visitor , but [the chemist]1021-the chemist had not mentioned the fact — [he]1021-the chemist seldom troubled about such trifles , expecting [[his]1021-the chemist household]1821-his household to divine [his]1021-the chemist wishes instinctively , and resenting [their]1821-his household failure to do so with indignation and some abuse . [He]1021-the chemist did so to - day , and [Marthe]89-marthe was consequently kept up later than [she]58-julia had intended , though it was [Julia]58-julia who came in for most of the reproof , and the trouble too ; it was [she]58-julia who took away the dinner and kept it hot , and presented it afresh when the time came in as good condition as [she]58-julia could manage . There had to be a second omelet made ; the first would not stand an hour , and so was wasted , to the indignation of [Marthe]89-marthe . The chicken was a trifle dried by waiting , which called down the wrath of [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz . [Julia]58-julia had listened to both of [them]1822-them with a meekness which was beautiful to see , albeit perhaps a little suspicious in one of [her]58-julia nature . [She]58-julia glanced up at the clock now , then rose and fetched two thick white coffee cups , and set them ready on a tray , and sat down again . [She]58-julia wondered drowsily how long [[Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's visitor]1823-herr van de greutz 's visitor would stay . [He]88-herr van de greutz was [a German]1824-a german , [a very great scientist]1825-a very great scientist ; [the chemist]1021-the chemist looked upon [him]88-herr van de greutz as [a friend]430-a friend and [an equal]1049-an equal , [a brother in arms]1829-a brother in arms ; [they]1822-them talked together freely in the cryptic language of science , and in German , which is the tongue best fitted to help out the other . [Julia]58-julia heard [them]1822-them when [she]58-julia went to and from with the dishes at dinner time . [She]58-julia did not understand chemistry , a fact [she]58-julia much regretted ; had [she]58-julia known even half as much as [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew , the desired end would have been much sooner within reach . It is a very great disadvantage to have only a very vague idea what it is [you]1830-you want . But [she]58-julia did understand German very well , consequently part of [the chemists]1831-the chemists ' conversation was quite intelligible to [her]58-julia , though [they]1831-the chemists did not know it . [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz knew and cared nothing about [her]58-julia ; [he]88-herr van de greutz was not even aware that [she]58-julia was English , though , of course , [old Marthe]89-marthe was . If the conversation had touched on the famous explosive at dinner time , [Julia]58-julia would have known it ; [she]58-julia was always on the watch for some such occurrence . Unfortunately it had not , although , as [she]58-julia saw plainly , [the German]1832-the german was [the sort of man with whom [Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz]1833-the sort of man with whom van de greutz would discuss such things . [She]58-julia had still another chance of hearing something ; [she]58-julia would soon have to take the coffee into [the laboratory]1834-the laboratory ; [they]1831-the chemists might be speaking of it then . [She]58-julia remembered once before [Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz had spoken of it to [a scientific guest]1835-a scientific guest at such a time ; [she]58-julia had then heard some unenlightening technical details , which might have been of some value to [a chemist]1836-a chemist , but were of no use at all to [her]58-julia ignorance . It was hard to come thus near , and yet be as far off as ever , but such things are likely to occur when [one]3325-one is in pursuit of anything , [Julia]58-julia knew that ; [she]58-julia was prepared to wait , by and by [she]58-julia would find out what it was [she]58-julia wanted , and then — A bell rang peremptorily ; [she]58-julia hastily poured the strong black coffee into the two cups , and put a bottle of Schiedam on the tray . As [she]58-julia did so [she]58-julia noticed that it was nearly empty , so [she]58-julia fetched another full one , and added that to the tray . The bell did not ring again , although getting the second bottle had hindered [her]58-julia , for by this time [the chemists]1831-the chemists had forgotten [they]1831-the chemists wanted coffee . When [she]58-julia entered [the laboratory]1834-the laboratory , [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz had just taken a bottle from the lower part of a cupboard near the door . Second shelf from the floor , five bottles from the left - hand corner . [Julia]58-julia observed [the place]241-the place with self - trained accuracy as [she]58-julia passed [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz with the tray , which [she]58-julia carried to the table far down [the room]205-the room . " This is it , "[88-herr van de greutz] [Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz said ; " a small quantity only , [you]58-julia see , but [the authorities]3912-the authorities have a ridiculous objection to one 's keeping any large one of explosive . Of course , [I]88-herr van de greutz have more , in [a stone house in [my]88-herr van de greutz garden]3913-a stone house in my garden ; it is perhaps safer so , seeing its nature , and the fact that one is always liable to small accidents in [a laboratory]3914-a laboratory . "[88-herr van de greutz] [Julia]58-julia put down the tray , but upset some of the coffee . Seeing that excitement had not usually the effect of making [her]58-julia hand unsteady , it is possible accident had not much to do with it . However , it happened ; [she]58-julia carefully wiped it up , and [the two chemists]1842-the two chemists , paying no more attention to [her]58-julia than if [she]58-julia had been a cat , went on speaking of the explosive . It was the explosive ; [their]1842-the two chemists talk told [her]58-julia that before [she]58-julia had finished the wiping . " The formula [I]88-herr van de greutz would give for it ? "[88-herr van de greutz] [Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz was saying ; as [she]58-julia sopped up the last drops , [he]88-herr van de greutz gave the formula . [She]58-julia lifted the full bottle of Schiedam from the tray , and carried it away with [her]58-julia — in the hand farthest from [the chemist]1021-the chemist 's , certainly , but with as little concealment as ostentation . Near the door [she]58-julia glanced at the German , or rather , at what [he]88-herr van de greutz held , the sample of the explosive . It was a white powder in a wide - necked , stoppered bottle of the size [Julia]58-julia [herself]58-julia called " quarter pint . "[58-julia] The bottle was not more than two - thirds full , and had no mark on it at all , except a small piece of paper stuck to the side , and inscribed with the single letter " A. "[58-julia] This may have been done in accordance with some private system of [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's , or it may have been for the sake of secrecy . The reason did not matter ; the most accurate name would have been no more informing to [Julia]58-julia , but decidedly more inconvenient . [She]58-julia went out and shut the door quietly ; then [she]58-julia literally fled back to [the kitchen]220-the kitchen with the Schiedam . Scarcely waiting to set it down , [she]58-julia seized a slip of kitchen paper , and scribbled on it the string of letters and figures that [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz had given as the formula of [his]88-herr van de greutz explosive . [She]58-julia did not know what a formula was , nor in what relation it stood to the chemical body , but from the talks [she]58-julia had heard between [the chemist]1021-the chemist and [[his]88-herr van de greutz friends]1846-his friends , [she]58-julia guessed it to be something important . Accordingly , when [he]88-herr van de greutz said the formula , [she]58-julia was as careful to remember it accurately as [she]58-julia was to remember the place of the bottle on the shelf . Now [she]58-julia wrote it down just as [he]88-herr van de greutz spoke it , and , though perhaps not exactly as [he]88-herr van de greutz would have written it , still comprehensible . [She]58-julia pinned the piece of paper in the cuff of [her]58-julia dress ; it would not be found there if , by ill luck , [she]58-julia was caught and searched later on . Next [she]58-julia went to the kitchen cupboard ; there were several wide - necked stoppered bottles there , doubtless without [the chemist]1021-the chemist 's knowledge , but [Marthe]89-marthe found them convenient for holding spices , and ginger , and such things . [She]58-julia took the one nearest in shape and size to the one which [she]58-julia had seen in [the German]124-the german 's hand ; emptied out the contents , dusted it and put in ground rice till it was two - thirds full . Then , with the lap - scissors , [she]58-julia trimmed a piece of paper to the right size , wrote " A "[58-julia] upon it , and stuck it to the side of the bottle with a dab of treacle — [she]58-julia had nothing else . [She]58-julia was hastily wiping off the surplus stickiness when the bell rang again . [She]58-julia finished what [she]58-julia was doing , and shrouded the bottle in a duster , so that there was another summons before [she]58-julia could set out . [She]58-julia took the Schiedam with [her]58-julia — of course it was that which was rung for , but also the bottle in the duster . [She]58-julia did not hurry . " [I]58-julia 'll give [him]88-herr van de greutz time to put the explosive back , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia thought . It was just possible that it would be set on a bench , perhaps in an awkward place , but from [her]58-julia knowledge of [Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's ways [she]58-julia guessed not . It was also , of course , possible that the cupboard where it was kept would be locked ; in that case , nothing could be done just now — annoying , but not desperate ; ground rice will keep , and , apparently , explosives too , so [she]58-julia reflected as [she]58-julia opened the laboratory door . But [the cupboard]1848-the cupboard was not locked , and the bottle was back in its place . Another from the shelf above had been taken out ; [the chemists]1831-the chemists were discussing that as [they]1831-the chemists sat smoking cigars at the table far down [the room]205-the room , where the coffee cups stood . " More Schiedam ! "[1831-the chemists] [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz said , throwing the words at [Julia]58-julia over [his]88-herr van de greutz shoulder . " Why did [you]58-julia bring an empty bottle ? "[88-herr van de greutz] " [I]58-julia am sorry , [Mijnheer]90-joost , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ; " there was not much , [I]58-julia know ; [I]58-julia have brought more . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia pushed the door to with [her]58-julia foot as [she]58-julia spoke , and with the hand not carrying the spirit set down the duster and the bottle [it]1851-it held on a chair . [The German]1832-the german had put [his]1832-the german coat over the chair earlier ; it stood in front of the cupboard , a little way from it . With [the true rogue]1853-the true rogue 's eye for cover , [Julia]58-julia noted the value of its position , and even improved it by moving it a little to the left as [she]58-julia knocked against it in passing . [She]58-julia brought the Schiedam to the table . " Shall [I]58-julia take the cups , [Mijnheer]90-joost ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked . " Yes , "[58-julia] [Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz answered shortly , resenting the interruption , " and go to the devil . As [I]88-herr van de greutz was saying , it is very unstable . "[88-herr van de greutz] This was to [the German]1832-the german , and did not concern [Julia]58-julia ; [she]58-julia took the tray of cups and went . But near the door there was an iron tripod lying on the floor ; [she]58-julia caught [her]58-julia foot in it , stumbled and fell headlong , dropping tray and cups with a great clatter . There was a general exclamation of annoyance and anger from [Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz , of surprise and commiseration from [the German]124-the german , and of something that might have been fright or pain from [Julia]58-julia . " [[You]58-julia clumsy fool]3915-you clumsy fool ! "[88-herr van de greutz] [Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz cried . " Get out of here , and do n't let [me]88-herr van de greutz see [your]58-julia face , or hear [your]58-julia trampling ass - hoofs again ! Do [you]58-julia hear [me]88-herr van de greutz , [I]88-herr van de greutz wo n't have [you]58-julia in here again ! "[88-herr van de greutz] [The German]1832-the german was more sympathetic . " Have [you]58-julia hurt [yourself]58-julia ? "[1832-the german] [he]1832-the german asked . " No , [Mijnheer]90-joost , nothing , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ; " only a little — [my]58-julia knees and elbows . "[58-julia] Had [she]58-julia been playing [Othello]125-othello , though [she]58-julia might not have blacked [herself]58-julia all over , it is certain [she]58-julia would have carried the black a long way below high water mark . This was no painless stage stumble , but one with real bruises and a real thud . [The German]1832-the german had half risen ; perhaps [he]1832-the german thought of coming to help pick up the pieces of broken cups that were scattered between the cupboard and the chair . But [he]1832-the german did not do so , for [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz went on to speak of [[his]88-herr van de greutz unstable compound]1857-his unstable compound . " [I]1832-the german treated [it]1857-his unstable compound with — "[1832-the german] [he]1832-the german said , and , seeing this was something very daring , [the other]338-the other 's attention was caught . [Julia]58-julia picked up the pieces alone , and carried them out on the tray , and on the tray also [she]58-julia carried a bottle wrapped into a duster . It was a wide - necked stoppered bottle , two - thirds full of white powder ; very much like the one [she]58-julia had brought in , but also very much like the one that stood five from the end on the second shelf of the cupboard . Soon after that [she]58-julia went up to [[her]58-julia room]400-her room , and took the bottle with [her]58-julia . Then , when [she]58-julia had set it in a place of safety , and securely locked the door , [she]58-julia broke into a silent laugh of delighted amusement . [She]58-julia pictured to [herself]58-julia [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's face when , in company with [some other chemist]1860-some other chemist , [he]1832-the german found the ground rice , while [[his]1832-the german cook]1861-his cook with the " ass - hoofs "[58-julia] carried the explosive to [[her]58-julia native land]1862-her native land . " What [a thief]3916-a thief [I]58-julia should make , "[58-julia] was [her]58-julia own opinion of [herself]58-julia . " [I]58-julia believe [I]58-julia could do as well as [Grimm]126-grimm 's ' Master Thief , ' who stole [the parson and clerk]3917-the parson and clerk . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia took up the bottle and shook a little of the contents into [her]58-julia hand ; [she]58-julia had not the least idea how it was set off , whether a blow , a fall , or heat would reveal its dangerous characteristics . For a little [she]58-julia looked at it with curiosity and satisfaction . But gradually the satisfaction faded ; the excitement of the chase was over , and the prize , now it was won , did not seem a great thing . [She]58-julia set the bottle down rather distastefully , and turned away . " [He]75-rawson - clew could not have got the stuff , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia told [herself]58-julia defiantly—"he "[75-rawson - clew] was [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew — but the next moment , with the justice [she]58-julia dealt [herself]58-julia , [she]58-julia admitted , " Because [he]75-rawson - clew would not get it this way ; [he]75-rawson - clew is not rogue enough ; while as for [me]58-julia — [I]58-julia am [a born rogue]3918-a born rogue . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia pushed open the window and looked out , although it was quite dark , and the air pervaded with a cold , rank smell of wet vegetation . [She]58-julia was thinking of the other piece of roguery which [she]58-julia had meant to commit , and yet had not . [She]58-julia had the bulb , in spite of that ; it was safe among [her]58-julia clothes — [hers]58-julia by a free gift , [hers]58-julia absolutely , yet as unable to be sold as the lock of [a dead mother]1863-a dead mother 's hair . The debt of honour could not be paid by that . From [her]58-julia heart [she]58-julia wished [she]58-julia had not got the daffodil ; [she]58-julia put it in the same category with [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's watch , as one of the things which made [her]58-julia ashamed of [herself]58-julia and of [her]58-julia life , even of this last act , and the very skill that had made it easy . [She]58-julia took up the bottle again , and for a moment considered whether [she]58-julia should give it back to [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz — not personally , that would hardly be safe ; but [she]58-julia could post it from [England]8-england after [she]58-julia left [his]88-herr van de greutz service . But [she]58-julia did not do so ; [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew stood in the way ; it was for [him]88-herr van de greutz [she]58-julia had taken it , and [her]58-julia purpose in [him]88-herr van de greutz still stood . [He]88-herr van de greutz wanted the explosive , it would be to [his]88-herr van de greutz credit and honour to have it ; [the government service to which [he]88-herr van de greutz belonged]1864-the government service to which he belonged would think highly of [him]88-herr van de greutz if [he]88-herr van de greutz had it — if [he]88-herr van de greutz received it anonymously , so that [he]88-herr van de greutz could not tell from whence it came , and [they]1865-they could not divide the credit of getting it between [him]88-herr van de greutz and [another]1866-another . [He]88-herr van de greutz wanted it , and [he]88-herr van de greutz had been good to [her]58-julia . [He]88-herr van de greutz had been kind when [she]58-julia was in trouble ; [he]88-herr van de greutz had not believed [her]58-julia when [she]58-julia had called [herself]58-julia dishonest ; [he]88-herr van de greutz had treated [her]58-julia as [an equal]1049-an equal , in spite of the affair at [Marbridge]61-denah , and [he]88-herr van de greutz had asked [her]58-julia to marry [him]88-herr van de greutz when [he]88-herr van de greutz thought [she]58-julia was compromised by the holiday in [the Dunes]13-the dunes . For a moment [her]58-julia mind strayed from the point at issue , to that offer of marriage . [She]58-julia remembered the exact wording of the letter as if [she]58-julia had but just received it , and it pleased [her]58-julia afresh . [She]58-julia did not regret that [she]58-julia had refused [him]88-herr van de greutz ; nothing else had been possible . [She]58-julia did not want to marry [him]88-herr van de greutz ; albeit , when [they]1868-they had sat together under [his]88-herr van de greutz coat , [she]58-julia had not shrunk from contact with [him]88-herr van de greutz as [she]58-julia had shrunk from [Joost]90-joost when [he]88-herr van de greutz had tried to take [her]58-julia hand — that was certainly strange . But [she]58-julia was quite sure [she]58-julia did not want to marry [him]88-herr van de greutz ; now [she]58-julia came to think about it , [she]58-julia could imagine that , were [she]58-julia [a girl of [his]88-herr van de greutz own class]1869-a girl of his own class , with the looks , training and knowledge that belonged , [she]58-julia might have found [him]88-herr van de greutz precisely [the man [she]58-julia would have wanted to marry]1870-the man she would have wanted to marry . [She]58-julia went to a drawer and took out an old handkerchief . [She]58-julia was not [a girl of that sort]1871-a girl of that sort — deep down [she]58-julia felt inarticulately the old primitive consciousness of inferiority and superiority , at once jealous and contemptuous ; marrying [him]88-herr van de greutz and living always on [his]88-herr van de greutz plane were alike impossible to [her]58-julia , but [she]58-julia could give [him]88-herr van de greutz the explosive . There was [not one girl among all those others who could have got it and given it to [him]88-herr van de greutz]1872-not one girl among all those others who could have got it and given it to him ! [She]58-julia tore a piece from the handkerchief , and fastened it over the stopper of the bottle ; then [she]58-julia got out a hat trimmed with bows of wide ribbon , and sewed the bottle into the centre bow . It presented rather a bulgy appearance , but by a little pulling of the other trimming it was hardly noticeable , and really nothing is too peculiar to be worn on the head . After that [she]58-julia went to bed . There was trouble in [[Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's kitchen]1873-herr van de greutz 's kitchen the next day ; [the young cook , who had behaved so admirably before]1874-the young cook , who had behaved so admirably before , did what [old Marthe]89-marthe called " showing the cloven hoof . "[89-marthe] [She]1874-the young cook , who had behaved so admirably before was impertinent , [she]1874-the young cook , who had behaved so admirably before was idle ; [she]1874-the young cook , who had behaved so admirably before broke dishes , [she]1874-the young cook , who had behaved so admirably before wasted eggs , and [she]1874-the young cook , who had behaved so admirably before lighted a roaring fire in the big stove , in spite of the strict economy of fuel which was one of the first rules of [the household]248-the household . Finally [she]1874-the young cook , who had behaved so admirably before announced that [she]1874-the young cook , who had behaved so admirably before must have a day 's holiday . [Marthe]89-marthe refused point blank , whereupon [the cook]440-the cook said [she]1874-the young cook , who had behaved so admirably before should take it , and a dispute ensued ; [Marthe]89-marthe called [her]58-julia several names , and reminded [her]58-julia of the fact that [she]58-julia had no character , and that [she]58-julia had confessed to being obliged to leave [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens in haste . [Julia]58-julia retorted that that fact was known to [the housekeeper]1019-the housekeeper when [she]440-the cook engaged [her]1019-the housekeeper , and was the reason of the starvation wage offered . [Marthe]89-marthe then inquired what enormity it was that [she]58-julia had committed at [the Van Heigens ']1395-the van heigens ' , and intimated that it must be disgraceful indeed for [a person]967-a person , pretending to be [a lady]3390-a lady - help , to be thankful to accept the situation of [cook]1881-cook . [Julia]58-julia 's answer was scarcely polite , and very well calculated to rouse [the old woman]1225-the old woman further , and , at the same time , [she]58-julia opened the door and skilfully worked [herself]58-julia and [her]58-julia antagonist into [the passage]1077-the passage , and some way up it , raising [her]58-julia voice so as to incite the other to raise [hers]58-julia . The result was that soon the noise reached [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz . Out [he]88-herr van de greutz came in a great rage , ordering [them]1884-them about [their]1884-them business , and abusing [them]1884-them roundly . [Marthe]89-marthe hurried back to [the kitchen]220-the kitchen , effectually silenced , but [Julia]58-julia remained ; [she]58-julia had not got [her]58-julia dismissal yet , and it was imperative [she]58-julia should get it , for there was no telling when the ground rice would be discovered . But [she]58-julia soon got what [she]58-julia wanted ; after a very little more inciting , [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz ordered [her]58-julia out of [[his]88-herr van de greutz house]1886-his house a great deal more peremptorily than [she]58-julia had been ordered out of [the Van Heigens ']1395-the van heigens ' . [She]58-julia was to go at once ; [she]58-julia was to pack [her]58-julia things and go , and [Marthe]89-marthe was to see that [she]58-julia took nothing but what was [her]58-julia own ; [she]58-julia was [the most un trustworthy and incompetent pig that [the devil]1889-the devil ever sent to spoil good food]1888-the most un trustworthy and incompetent pig that the devil ever sent to spoil good food , and steal silver spoons . To this [Julia]58-julia replied by asking for [her]58-julia wages . At first [Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz refused ; but [Julia]58-julia , with some effrontery , considering the circumstances , declined to go without them , so eventually [he]88-herr van de greutz thought better of it and paid [her]58-julia . After that [she]58-julia and [Marthe]89-marthe went up - stairs , and [she]58-julia packed and [Marthe]89-marthe looked on , closely scrutinising everything . When all was done , and [she]58-julia [herself]58-julia dressed , [she]58-julia walked out of [the house]175-the house , with the formula fastened inside [her]58-julia cuff , and the explosive balanced on [her]58-julia head . And [the old man who did the rough work about [the place]241-the place]1891-the old man who did the rough work about the place came with [her]58-julia , wheeling [her]58-julia luggage on a barrow as far as the gate . Here [he]88-herr van de greutz shot it out , and left [her]58-julia to wait till [she]58-julia might hail [some passing cart]1893-some passing cart , and so get [herself]58-julia conveyed to [the town]569-the town .

There was a fog on [the river]517-the river and while the tide was low [no craft]1896-no craft moved ; but with its rising there came a stir of life , the mist that crept low on [the brown water]1897-the brown water became articulate with syren voices and the thud of screws and the wash of water churned by [belated boats]1898-belated boats . [The steamers]1899-the steamers called eerily , out of the distance a heart - broken cry like no other thing on [earth]1900-earth , suddenly near at hand a hoot terrific ; but nothing was to be seen except rarely when out of the yellow impenetrableness a hull rose abruptly , a vague dark mass almost within touching distance . [Julia]58-julia stood on deck and listened while [the little Dutch boat]1901-the little dutch boat crept up ; [she]58-julia found something fascinating in [this strange , shrouded river]1902-this strange , shrouded river , haunted , like a stream of [the nether world]1903-the nether world , with lamentable bodiless voices . The fog had delayed [them]1904-they , of course ; the afternoon was now far advanced ; [they]1904-they had been compelled to wait some long time while the tide was down , and even now that it was coming up , [they]1904-they could go but slowly . [The last through train to [Marbridge]61-denah]1905-the last through train to marbridge would have left [Paddington]37-paddington before [the Tower Stairs]12-the tower stairs were reached ; but [Julia]58-julia did not mind that ; [she]58-julia would go to [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat ; [she]58-julia could get [a room at [the house where [he]66-mr. gillat lodged for one night]1907-the house where he lodged for one night]1906-a room at the house where he lodged for one night ; [she]58-julia was glad at the thought of seeing [Johnny]57-johnny again . [Johnny]57-johnny , who knew the worst and loved and trusted still . Gradually the fog lifted , not clearing right away , but enough for the last of the sunset to show smoky , rose in a wonderful tawny sky . All the russet - brown water kindled , each ripple edge catching a gleam of yellow , except to the eastward , where , by some trick of light , [the main stream]1908-the main stream looked like a pool of dull silver , all pale and cold and holy . The wharves and [factories]1909-factories on [the banks]1910-the banks revealed [themselves]1911-themselves , heavy black outlines , pinnacled with chimneys like some far - off [spired city]1912-spired city . All the craft that filled [the river]517-the river became clear too , [those that lay still waiting repairs or cargo]1914-those that lay still waiting repairs or cargo or the flood of the incoming tide , and those that moved — [the black Norwegian timber boats]1915-the black norwegian timber boats , [the dirty tramp steamers from [far - off seas]1917-far - off seas]1916-the dirty tramp steamers from far - off seas , [the smooth grey - hulled liners]1918-the smooth grey - hulled liners , the long strings of [loaded barges]1919-loaded barges , that followed one another up [the great waterway]1920-the great waterway like camels in [a desert caravan]1921-a desert caravan . [Julia]58-julia stood on deck and watched it all , and to [her]58-julia there seemed a certain sombre beauty and a something that moved [her]58-julia , though [she]58-julia could not tell why , with a curious baseless pride of race . And while [she]58-julia watched , the twilight fell , and the colours turned to purple and grey , and the lights twinkled out in [the shipping]1922-the shipping and along [the shore]1923-the shore — hundreds and hundreds of lights ; and gradually , like the murmur of [the sea]542-the sea in a shell , the roar of [the city]1925-the city grew on the ear , till at last [the little boat]1926-the little boat reached [the Stairs]1927-the stairs , where [the old grey fortress]1928-the old grey fortress looks down on [the new grey bridge]1929-the new grey bridge , and [the restless river below]1930-the restless river below . [A waterman]520-a waterman put [Julia]58-julia ashore , after courtesies from [the Custom House officers]1932-the custom house officers , and [a porter]1933-a porter took [her]58-julia and [her]58-julia belongings to [[Mark Lane]11-mark lane station]1934-mark lane station , from whence it was not difficult to get approximately near [Berwick Street]38-berwick street . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat was not expecting [visitors]179-visitors ; [he]66-mr. gillat had no reason to imagine [any one]187-any one would come to see [him]66-mr. gillat ; [he]66-mr. gillat did not imagine that the rings at the front bell could concern [him]66-mr. gillat ; even when [he]66-mr. gillat heard steps coming up - [stairs]300-stairs [he]66-mr. gillat only thought it was [another lodger]1938-another lodger . It was not till [Julia]58-julia opened the door of [the back room]1939-the back room [he]66-mr. gillat now occupied that [he]66-mr. gillat had the least idea [any one]187-any one had come to see [him]66-mr. gillat . " [Julia]58-julia ! "[66-mr. gillat] [he]66-mr. gillat exclaimed , when [he]66-mr. gillat saw [her]58-julia standing on the threshold . " [Dear]3320-dear , [dear]3320-dear , dear [me]66-mr. gillat ! "[66-mr. gillat] " Yes , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said , " it really is [I.]58-julia [I]58-julia 'm back again , [you]57-johnny see ; "[58-julia] and [she]58-julia came in and shut the door . " Bless [my]57-johnny soul ! "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny said ; " bless [my]57-johnny soul ! [You]58-julia 're [home]249-home again ! "[57-johnny] " On [my]66-mr. gillat way [home]249-home ; [I]66-mr. gillat ca n't get to [Marbridge]61-denah to - night very comfortably , and [I]66-mr. gillat wanted to see [you]57-johnny , so here [I]66-mr. gillat am . [I]66-mr. gillat have arranged with [[your]57-johnny landlady]3923-your landlady to let [me]66-mr. gillat have [a room]3924-a room . "[66-mr. gillat] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat appeared quite overcome with joy and surprise , and it seemed to [Julia]58-julia , nervousness too . [He]66-mr. gillat led [her]58-julia to a chair ; " Wo n't [you]58-julia sit down ? "[66-mr. gillat] [he]66-mr. gillat said , placing it so that it commanded a view of the window and nothing else . [Julia]58-julia sat down ; [she]58-julia did not need to look at [the room]205-the room ; [she]58-julia had already mastered most of [its]205-the room details . When [she]58-julia first came in [she]58-julia had seen that [it]205-the room was small and poor — [a back bedroom]1942-a back bedroom , nothing more ; an iron bed , not too tidy , stood in one corner , a washstand , with dirty water in the basin , in another . There was a painted chest of drawers opposite the window ; one leg was missing , its place being supplied by a pile of old school - books ; the top was adorned with a piece of newspaper in lieu of a cover , and one of the drawers stood partly open ; no human efforts could get it shut , so [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's wardrobe was exposed to the public gaze — if [the public]1943-the public happened to look that way . [Julia]58-julia did not ; nor did [she]58-julia look towards [the fire - place]224-the fire - place , where a very large towel - horse with a very small towel upon it acted as a stove ornament — plain proof that fires were unknown there . [She]58-julia looked across [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's cheap lamp to the window and the vista of chimney pots , which were very well in view , for [the blind]1945-the blind refused to come down and only draped the upper half of the window in a drooping fashion . [Johnny]57-johnny stood against the chest of drawers , striving vainly to push the refractory drawer shut , although [he]57-johnny knew by experience it was quite impossible . [She]58-julia could see [him]57-johnny without turning [her]58-julia head ; [he]57-johnny was shabbier than ever ; even [his]57-johnny tie — [his]57-johnny one extravagance used to be gay ties — was shabby , and [his]57-johnny shoes would hardly keep on [his]57-johnny feet . [His]57-johnny round pink face was still round and pink ; [he]57-johnny did not look exactly older , though [his]57-johnny grizzled little moustache was greyer , only somehow more puzzled and hurt by the ways of fate . [Julia]58-julia knew that that was the way [he]57-johnny would age ; experience would never teach [him]57-johnny anything , although , as [she]58-julia suddenly realised , it had been trying lately . [She]58-julia turned away from the window ; " [I]58-julia have left [my]58-julia luggage at [the station]496-the station , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia got out what [I]58-julia wanted in [the waiting - room]3926-the waiting - room and brought it along in a parcel . [I]58-julia think [I]58-julia 'll take it to [[my]58-julia room]3519-my room now , if [you]57-johnny do n't mind , and wash [my]58-julia face and get rid of [my]58-julia hat — it is very heavy . [I]58-julia sha n't be long . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia rose as [she]58-julia spoke , and [Johnny]57-johnny bustled to open the door for [her]58-julia , too much [a gentleman]3384-a gentleman , in spite of all , to show [he]57-johnny was glad to have [her]58-julia go and give [him]57-johnny a chance to clear up . At the door [she]58-julia paused . " [You]57-johnny need not order supper , [Johnny]57-johnny , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia 've seen about that . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny stopped , [his]57-johnny face a shade pinker . " Oh , but , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny protested , " [you]58-julia should n't do that ; [you]58-julia must n't do that . [I]57-johnny 'll tell [Mrs. Horn]127-mrs. horn [we]3928-we wo n't have it ; [I]57-johnny 'll make it all right with [her]127-mrs. horn ; [I]57-johnny was just going out to get a — a pork pie for [myself]57-johnny . "[57-johnny] It is to be feared this statement was no more veracious than [Julia]58-julia 's , and certainly it was not nearly so well made ; it would not have deceived [a far less astute person]1947-a far less astute person than [she]58-julia , while [hers]58-julia would have deceived [a far more astute person]1948-a far more astute person than [he]57-johnny . " A pork pie ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said . " [You]57-johnny have no business to eat such things in the evening at [your]57-johnny time of life . [I]58-julia tell [you]57-johnny [I]58-julia have settled supper ; [we]3928-we had much better have what [I]58-julia have got . [I]58-julia could not bring [you]57-johnny a present [home]249-home from [Holland]7-holland ; [I]58-julia left in a hurry , so [I]58-julia have bought supper instead . It is [my]58-julia present to [you]57-johnny — and [myself]58-julia — [I]58-julia have selected just what [I]58-julia thought [I]58-julia could eat best ; one has fancies , [you]57-johnny know , after one has been seasick . "[58-julia] It would require [an ingeniously bad sailor]1949-an ingeniously bad sailor to be seasick while [a Dutch cargo boat]1950-a dutch cargo boat crept up [the Thames]39-the thames in a fog , but [Julia]58-julia never spared the trimmings when [she]58-julia did do any lying . [Johnny]57-johnny was quite satisfied and let [her]58-julia go to take off [her]58-julia hat — and the precious explosive which [she]58-julia still carried in it . While [she]58-julia was gone [he]57-johnny tidied [the room]205-the room to the best of [his]57-johnny ability . [He]57-johnny regretted that [he]57-johnny had nowhere better to ask [her]58-julia ; if [he]57-johnny had [the sitting - room [he]57-johnny occupied when [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew came in September]1952-the sitting - room he occupied when rawson - clew came in september , [he]57-johnny would have felt quite grand . But that was a thing of the past , so [he]57-johnny made the best of circumstances and went to the reckless extravagance of sixpenny worth of fire . When [Julia]58-julia came in , the towel - horse had been removed from the fender , and a fire was sputtering awkwardly in the grate , while [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , proud as [a school - boy who has planned a surprise treat]1953-a school - boy who has planned a surprise treat , was trying to coax the smoke up the damp chimney . " [Johnny]57-johnny ! "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia exclaimed , " what extravagance ! It 's quite a warm night , too ! "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny smiled delightedly . " [I]57-johnny thought [you]58-julia 'd be cold after [your]58-julia journey ; [you]58-julia look quite pale and pinched , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said ; " seasickness does leave [one]3325-one feeling chilly . "[57-johnny] [Julia]58-julia repented of that unnecessary trimming of [hers]58-julia . " It is nice to have a fire , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , striving not to cough at the choking smoke ; " [I]58-julia do n't need it a bit , but [I]58-julia do n't know anything [I]58-julia should have enjoyed more ; why , [I]58-julia have n't seen a real fire since [I]58-julia left [England]8-england ! "[58-julia] [She]58-julia broke off to take the tongs from [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , who , in [his]66-mr. gillat efforts to improve the draught , had managed to shut the register . [She]58-julia opened it again , and in a little had the fire burning nicely . [Johnny]57-johnny looked on and admired , and at [her]58-julia suggestion opened the window to let out the smoke . After that [she]58-julia managed to persuade the blind down , and , what is more , mended it so that it would go up again ; then [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat cleared the dressing - table and pulled it out into the middle of [the room]205-the room , and by that time supper was ready — fried steak and onions and bottled beer , with jam puffs and strong black coffee to follow — not exactly the things for one lately suffering from seasickness , but [Julia]58-julia tried them all except the bottled beer and seemed none the worse for it . And as for [Johnny]57-johnny , if [you]1955-you had searched [London]9-london over [you]1955-you could have found nothing more to [his]57-johnny taste . [He]57-johnny was a little troubled at the thought of what [Julia]58-julia must have spent , but [she]58-julia assured [him]57-johnny [she]58-julia had [her]58-julia wages , so [he]57-johnny was content . Seldom was one happier than [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat at that supper , or afterwards , when the table was cleared and [they]1956-they drew up to the fire . [They]1956-they sat one each side of the fender on cane - seated chairs , the coffee on the hob , and [Johnny]57-johnny smoking a Dutch cigar of [Julia]58-julia 's providing . [One]3325-one can buy them at [the railway stations in [Holland]7-holland]1958-the railway stations in holland , and [she]58-julia had scarcely more pleasure in giving them to [Johnny]57-johnny than [she]58-julia had in smuggling [home]249-home more than the permitted quantity . " Now tell [me]58-julia about things , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said . [Johnny]57-johnny 's face fell a little . During supper [they]1956-they had talked about [her]58-julia affairs and experiences , none of the unpleasant ones ; [she]58-julia was determined not to have the supper spoiled by anything . Now , however , [she]58-julia felt that the time had come to hear the other side of things . " [I]58-julia suppose [father]3307-father has been to [town]238-town ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia remarked ; [she]58-julia knew only too well that nothing else could account for [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's reduced circumstances . " When did [he]3307-father go ? " Well , well , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said , " [[your]58-julia mother]3323-your mother wished it ; [she]3323-your mother knows what [she]3323-your mother is about ; [she]3323-your mother is [a wonderful woman]3322-a wonderful woman , [a wonderful woman]3322-a wonderful woman . " [I]58-julia went down to [Marbridge]61-denah a week before [[your]58-julia father]3306-your father was supposed to be coming to [town]238-town ; [I]58-julia warned [him]3306-your father very likely [I]58-julia should have to go away , just as [you]58-julia said — and the very day [I]58-julia went to [Marbridge]61-denah [he]3306-your father came to [town]238-town , the very day — a week earlier than was talked of . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia could not repress an inclination to smile , not only at the neat way in which [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother had checkmated [her]58-julia , but also at the thought of [that lady]1962-that lady 's face when [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat presented [himself]66-mr. gillat at [Marbridge]61-denah , just as [she]58-julia was congratulating [herself]58-julia on being rid of [the Captain]172-the captain . " What happened ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked . " Did [mother]3346-mother send [you]66-mr. gillat back to [town]238-town again ? "[58-julia] " Not paid [my]66-mr. gillat fare , "[66-mr. gillat] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat corrected ; " [a lady]3390-a lady could not offer to do such a thing ; do [you]58-julia think [I]66-mr. gillat would ever have allowed it ? [I]66-mr. gillat could n't [you]58-julia know . "[66-mr. gillat] [Julia]58-julia 's lips set straight ; [she]58-julia had something of [a man]406-a man 's contempt for small meannesses , and it is possible [her]58-julia judgment on this economy of [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother 's was harder than any [she]58-julia had for the unjustifiable extravagances at which [she]58-julia guessed . [She]58-julia did not say anything of it to [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , [she]58-julia was too ashamed ; not that [he]66-mr. gillat saw it in that light ; [he]66-mr. gillat did n't think [he]66-mr. gillat had been in any way badly used , [he]66-mr. gillat never did . " Well , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " then [you]57-johnny came back to [town]238-town and looked after [father]3307-father to the best of [your]57-johnny abilities ? "[57-johnny] " And of course [he]3307-father had it , though [he]3307-father could not afford it , and [you]58-julia paid ? "[58-julia] " Not to any great extent ; oh , dear no , not to any great extent . " [[Your]1966-your father]3306-your father , "[66-mr. gillat] [he]66-mr. gillat said , rather uneasily , looking at [her]1966-your and then away again , " [[your]1966-your father]3306-your father never had a very strong head , [he]3307-father — [you]1966-your know — [he]3307-father — "[66-mr. gillat] " Has taken to drink ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked baldly . " As well as gambling [he]3307-father drinks now ? "[58-julia] " Oh , no , "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny said quickly , " not exactly , that is — [he]3307-father does take more than [he]3307-father used , more than is good for [him]3307-father sometimes ; not much is good for [him]3307-father , [you]1966-your know — [he]3307-father does take more , it is no good pretending [he]3307-father does not . But it was very dull for [him]3307-father ; it did not suit [him]3307-father being [here]371-here , [I]57-johnny think ; [he]3307-father used to get so low in spirits , what with [his]3307-father losses and feeling [he]3307-father was not wanted at [home]249-home . [He]3307-father thinks a great deal of [[your]1966-your mother]3323-your mother , and [he]3307-father could not but feel that [she]3323-your mother does not think much of [him]3307-father to send [him]3307-father away like that ; it hurt [him]3307-father , although , as [he]3307-father said to [me]57-johnny more than once , no doubt [he]3307-father deserved it . It preyed on [his]3307-father mind ; [he]3307-father seemed to want something to cheer [him]3307-father . "[57-johnny] [Julia]58-julia nodded ; [she]58-julia could understand the effect well enough , though the causes at work might not be quite clear . "[168-his wife] But so it evidently was , and after all [she]58-julia could believe it ; like [some others]1970-some others [he]210-her father had " made such a sinner of [his]210-her father conscience , "[210-her father] that [he]210-her father could believe , not only [his]210-her father own lie , but the legends woven about [him]210-her father . [They]1971-they had all pretended things , [he]210-her father and [they]1971-they also ; [his]210-her father position , too , had come gradually , [he]210-her father had got to accept it without thinking before it was an established fact . But now the truth had been brought [home]249-home to [him]210-her father — more or less — and [he]210-her father was miserable , and , according to the custom of [his]210-her father sort , set to making bad worse as soon as ever [he]210-her father discovered it . " Why did [he]210-her father go [home]249-home last week ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia aroused [herself]58-julia to ask . "[66-mr. gillat] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat rambled on vaguely , but [Julia]58-julia was not slow to guess that the principal reason was to be found in the state of [Johnny]57-johnny 's finances . Thank [you]75-rawson - clew ; "[58-julia] and [she]58-julia put the card away . Soon after [she]58-julia went to [[her]58-julia room]400-her room , for it was growing late . [He]75-rawson - clew had come to [Berwick Street]38-berwick street and nearly seen [[her]58-julia father]210-her father — drunk ; quite seen [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , in [the first floor sitting - room]1994-the first floor sitting - room certainly , but no doubt shabby and not very wise as usual . [She]58-julia was not ashamed ; though for a moment [she]58-julia had been glad [he]75-rawson - clew had missed [[her]58-julia father]210-her father ; now [she]58-julia told [herself]58-julia it did not matter either way . [He]75-rawson - clew knew what [she]58-julia was and what [[her]58-julia people]1191-her people were ; what did it matter if [he]75-rawson - clew realised it a little more ? [They]1997-they were not of [his]75-rawson - clew sort , it was no good pretending for a moment that [they]1997-they were . [[His]75-rawson - clew sort]1998-his sort ! [She]58-julia laughed silently at the thought . [The girls of [his]75-rawson - clew sort]1999-the girls of his sort eating steak and onions in [a back bedroom]1942-a back bedroom with [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny ! Caring for [Johnny]57-johnny as [she]58-julia cared , liking to sit with [him]57-johnny in [the pokey little room]2001-the pokey little room while [he]57-johnny smoked Dutch cigars ; not doing it out of kindness of heart and charity , but finding personal pleasure in it and a sense of [home]249-home - coming ! If [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew had come that evening while [they]2003-they were at supper , or while [she]58-julia cured the smoky fire or mended the blind , or while [they]2003-they sipped black coffee out of earthenware breakfast - cups and talked of [[her]58-julia father]210-her father 's delinquencies ! It would not have mattered ; [he]75-rawson - clew knew [she]58-julia was of the stoke - hole — [she]58-julia had told [him]75-rawson - clew so — and not like [the accomplished girls whom [he]75-rawson - clew usually met]2005-the accomplished girls whom he usually met — who could not have got [him]75-rawson - clew the explosive ! [She]58-julia dropped [her]58-julia stocking to take the wide - necked bottle in [her]58-julia hands , deciding now how best to send it . It must go by post , in a good - sized wooden box , tightly packed , with a great deal of damp straw and wool ; it ought to be safe that way . [She]58-julia would send it to [the club address]2006-the club address , it was fortunate [she]58-julia had it ; but not yet , not until [her]58-julia own plans were clearer . It was just possible [he]75-rawson - clew might suspect [her]58-julia ; it was hardly likely , but it was always as well to provide against remote contingencies , for if [he]75-rawson - clew tried and succeeded in verifying the suspicion everything would be spoiled . [He]75-rawson - clew had made sensible efforts to find [her]58-julia before , [he]75-rawson - clew might make equally sensible and more successful ones again , unless [she]58-julia left a way of escape clear for [herself]58-julia . Accordingly , so [she]58-julia determined , the explosive should not go yet , thought it had better be packed ready . [She]58-julia would get a box and packing to - morrow ; to - night [she]58-julia could only copy the formula . [She]58-julia did this , printing it carefully on a strip of paper which [she]58-julia put on the bottle and coated with wax from [her]58-julia candle . [She]58-julia knew [Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz waxed labels sometimes to preserve them from the damp , so [she]58-julia felt sure the formula would be safe however wet [she]58-julia might make the packing . The next day [she]58-julia went to [[the lawyer]1987-the lawyer 's office]2008-the lawyer 's office and heard all about the legacy and what [she]58-julia must do to prove [her]58-julia own identity and claim it . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat waited outside , pacing up and down [the street]366-the street , striving so hard to look casual that [he]66-mr. gillat aroused the suspicions of [a not too acute policeman]2010-a not too acute policeman . [The official]2011-the official was reassured , however , when [Julia]58-julia came out of [the office]603-the office and carried [Johnny]57-johnny away to hear about the legacy . " It is more than [I]58-julia thought , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , before [they]2013-they were half down [the street]366-the street . " Fifty pounds a year , [a small house]3970-a small house — not much more than [a cottage]3971-a cottage — and [a garden and field]3972-a garden and field ; that 's about what it comes to . [The house]175-the house is not worth much ; [it]175-the house is in [an unget - at - able part of [Norfolk]40-norfolk]3974-an unget - at - able part of norfolk , in [the sandy district towards [the sea]542-the sea]3975-the sandy district towards the sea — [the man]820-the man spoke as if [I]58-julia knew where that was , but [I]58-julia don't — and [the garden and field]3978-the garden and field are not fertile . [I]58-julia do n't suppose [one]3325-one could let [the place]241-the place , but [one]3325-one could live in [it]241-the place , if [one]3325-one wanted to . "[58-julia] " Yes , yes , "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny said , " of course ; [you]58-julia will have [[your]58-julia own estate to retire to]3983-your own estate to retire to ; quite [an heiress]3984-an heiress — [[your]58-julia mother]3323-your mother will be pleased . "[57-johnny] [Julia]58-julia could well imagine what skilful use [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother could make of the legacy ; it would figure beautifully in conversation ; no doubt [Johnny]57-johnny was really thinking of this also , though [he]57-johnny did not know it , for actually the thing would not commend itself to [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington so highly as a lump sum of money would have done . " Why do [you]57-johnny think [Great - aunt]3986-great - aunt [Jane]128-jane let it to [me]58-julia ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked . " Because [I]58-julia went out to work ! It seems that [father]3307-father and [[we]3988-we three girls]3989-we three girls are [the nearest relations [she]128-jane had]3990-the nearest relations she had , and though [we]3988-we knew nothing about [her]128-jane , [she]128-jane made inquiries about [us]3988-we from time to time . When [she]128-jane heard [I]58-julia had gone abroad as [companion]428-companion or [lady - help]3992-lady - help , [she]128-jane said [she]128-jane should leave all [she]128-jane had to [me]58-julia because [I]58-julia was the only one who even tried to do any honest work . [You]3993-you know that is not really strictly fair , because [I]58-julia did not altogether go with the idea of doing honest work ; although , certainly , when [I]58-julia got [there]180-there [I]58-julia did it . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny did not quite follow this last , but it did not matter , the only thing that concerned [him]57-johnny — or [Julia]58-julia much , either — was the fact that [she]58-julia was [the possessor of £ 50 a year]2016-the possessor of £ 50 a year , [a cottage]3971-a cottage , [a garden]2018-a garden , and [a field]2019-a field . [Johnny]57-johnny revelled in the idea and talked of what [she]58-julia was going to do right up to the time that [he]57-johnny saw [her]58-julia into [the train]497-the train at [Paddington]37-paddington . The only thing that put an end to [his]57-johnny talking was [the guard]2021-the guard requesting [him]57-johnny to stand away from the carriage door and [Julia]58-julia admonished [him]57-johnny to leave go of the handle before the engine started . [Julia]58-julia [herself]58-julia did not talk so much of what [she]58-julia would do because [she]58-julia did not know ; [she]58-julia felt , until [she]58-julia got [home]249-home and saw how things were there , it was no good even to plan how and when to spend . Five pounds [she]58-julia did spend ; it was really [her]58-julia saving accumulated by economy in [Holland]7-holland , but [she]58-julia reckoned it as drawn from [[her]58-julia estate]2023-her estate . [Johnny]57-johnny found it in an envelope when [he]57-johnny returned to [the back bedroom]2024-the back bedroom , and with it a note to say that it was in part payment of [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington 's debts , for which , of course , [[his]59-captain polkington family]2025-his family were responsible ; " and if [you]57-johnny make a fuss about it , "[0-i] the letter concluded , dropping the business - like style , " [I]0-i shall trim ' [Bouquet]68-bouquet ' to stink next time [you]57-johnny come to [Marbridge]61-denah , and not come and sit with [you]57-johnny . "[0-i] [I]0-i think [Johnny]57-johnny sat down and wept over that letter ; but then [he]57-johnny was rather [a silly old man]2026-a silly old man and [he]57-johnny had not had a good meal , except last night 's steak and onions , for a fortnight .

The great [Polkington]58-julia campaign was over and it had failed . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington and [Chèrie]64-chèrie cheered [each other]3407-each other with assurances of a contrary nature as long as [they]3407-each other could , but for all that it had really failed and [they]3407-each other knew it . There had been some small successes by the way ; [they]3407-each other had received a little recognition in superior places , and a few , a very few , invitations of a superior order at the cost , of course , of refusing and so offending [some old friends]2028-some old friends and [acquaintances]485-acquaintances . It might perhaps have been possible to achieve the position at which [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington aimed in the course of time , or a very long time ; society in [the country]760-the country moves slowly , and [she]60-mrs. polkington could not afford to wait indefinitely ; [her]60-mrs. polkington financial ability was not equal to it . Moreover , there came into [her]60-mrs. polkington affairs , not exactly a crash , but something so unpleasantly like a full stop that [she]60-mrs. polkington and [Chèrie]64-chèrie could not fail to perceive it . This occurred on the day when [they]3407-each other heard of [Mr. Harding]129-mr. harding 's engagement . [Mr. Harding]129-mr. harding was [the eligible bachelor addition to [county society]2032-county society whose advent had materially assisted in giving definite form to [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington 's ambition]2031-the eligible bachelor addition to county society whose advent had materially assisted in giving definite form to mrs. polkington 's ambition . [He]129-mr. harding had helped to feed it , too , during the late summer and early autumn , for [he]129-mr. harding had been friendly , though [Chèrie]64-chèrie was forced to admit that [his]129-mr. harding attentions to [her]60-mrs. polkington had not been very marked . But now the news was abroad that [he]129-mr. harding was engaged to [a girl in [his]129-mr. harding own circle]2033-a girl in his own circle ; [one whose mother had not yet extended any greater recognition to [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington than an invitation to [a Primrose League Fête]2035-a primrose league fête]2034-one whose mother had not yet extended any greater recognition to mrs. polkington than an invitation to a primrose league fête . This news was abroad in the middle of October , and there was a certain amount of unholy satisfaction in [Marbridge]61-denah . But [the Graysons]131-the graysons were right in saying it was quick work ; late one afternoon [Chèrie]64-chèrie heard of [Mr. Harding]129-mr. harding 's engagement ; during the evening [she]64-chèrie and [[her]64-chèrie mother]195-her mother recognised [their]3439-the girls failure ; in the night [she]64-chèrie saw that [Mr. Brendon Smith]130-mr. brendon smith was [her]64-chèrie one chance of dignified withdrawal , and before the next evening [she]64-chèrie had promised to marry [him]130-mr. brendon smith . [He]130-mr. brendon smith was fond of [Chèrie]64-chèrie , and appreciated both [her]64-chèrie beauty and [her]64-chèrie several valuable qualities ; but [he]130-mr. brendon smith had no illusions about [her]64-chèrie or [[her]64-chèrie family]1195-her family , and [he]130-mr. brendon smith knew , when [he]130-mr. brendon smith made it , that [his]130-mr. brendon smith proposal would be accepted to cover a retreat . "[64-chèrie] [She]64-chèrie probably did not know how completely [she]64-chèrie was getting [herself]64-chèrie [a master]2050-a master .
