[Their]2057-they passages are taken already ; [they]2057-they will be married by license almost directly ; there even wo n't be time to get a trousseau , only the merest necessaries before the luggage has to go . "[133-mr. polkington] It must not be thought that the news of [Mr. Harding]129-mr. harding 's engagement was the one and only thing which convinced [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington and [Chèrie]64-chèrie that the great campaign had failed ; it was the finishing touch , no doubt , in that it had made [Chèrie]64-chèrie feel the necessity of being immediately engaged to [some one]3318-some one , but there were other things at work . [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had returned from [London]9-london just five days before [they]2057-they heard the news , and three were quite sufficient to show [[his]59-captain polkington wife]168-his wife and [daughter]336-daughter that [he]59-captain polkington was considerably the worse for [his]59-captain polkington stay in [town]238-town . Bills too , had been coming in of late ; not inoffensive , negligible bills such as they were very well used to , but threatening insistent bills , one even accompanied by [a lawyer]3956-a lawyer 's letter . Then , to crown all , [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had a fit of virtue and repentance on the second day after [his]59-captain polkington return . It was not of long duration , and was , no doubt , partly physical , and not unconnected with the effects of [his]59-captain polkington decline from the paths of temperance . But while it lasted , [he]59-captain polkington read some of the bills and talked about the way [ruin]134-ruin stared [him]59-captain polkington in the face and the need there was for retrenchment , turning over a new leaf , facing facts and kindred things . Also , which was more important , [he]59-captain polkington wrote to [[his]59-captain polkington wife 's banker brother]2062-his wife 's banker brother — [he]2062-his wife 's banker brother who had been instrumental in getting the papers sent in years ago . To [this influential person]2063-this influential person [he]59-captain polkington said a good deal about the state of [the family]193-the family finances , the need there was for clearing matters up and starting on a better basis , and [his]59-captain polkington own determination to face things fairly and set to work in earnest . What kind of work was not mentioned ; apparently that had nothing to do with [the Captain]172-the captain 's resolution ; there was one thing , however , that was mentioned definitely — the need for [the banker brother]2066-the banker brother 's advice — and pecuniary assistance . The answer to this letter was received on the same day as the news of [Mr. Harding]129-mr. harding 's engagement . It came in the evening , later than the news , and it was addressed to [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington , not [the Captain]172-the captain ; it assisted [her]60-mrs. polkington in recognising that the end of the campaign had arrived . It said several unpleasant things , and it said them plainly ; not the most pleasant to [the reader]2068-the reader was the announcement that [the writer]1161-the writer would [himself]1161-the writer come to [Marbridge]61-denah to look into matters one day that week or the next . Under these circumstances it is not perhaps so surprising that [Chèrie]64-chèrie found it advisable to accept [Mr. Brendon Smith]130-mr. brendon smith 's offer of marriage , and [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington found the impossibility of getting a trousseau in time no very great disadvantage . When [Julia]58-julia came [home]249-home it wanted but a short time to [Chèrie]64-chèrie 's wedding . A great deal seemed to have happened since [she]58-julia went away , not only to [[her]58-julia family]1195-her family , but , and that was less obviously correct , to [herself]58-julia . [She]58-julia stood in [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room on the morning after [her]58-julia return and looked round [her]58-julia and felt that somehow [she]58-julia had travelled a long way from [her]58-julia old point of view . [The room]205-the room was very untidy ; [it]205-the room had not been used , and so , in accordance with the [Polkington]58-julia custom , not been set tidy for two days ; dust lay thick on everything ; there were dead leaves in the vases , cigarette ash on the table , no coals on the half - laid fire . In the merciless morning light [Julia]58-julia saw all the deficiencies ; the way things were set best side foremost , though , to [her]58-julia , the worst side contrived still to show ; the display there was everywhere , the trumpery silver ornaments , all tarnished for want of rubbing , and of no more intrinsic value and beauty than the tinfoil off champagne bottles ; the cracked pieces of china — rummage sale relics , [she]58-julia called them — set forth in a glass - doored cabinet , as if they were heirlooms . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington had a romance about several of them that made them seem like heirlooms to [[her]58-julia friends]414-her friends and almost to [herself]58-julia . The whole , as [Julia]58-julia looked around , struck [her]58-julia as shoddy and vulgar in its unreality . " [I]58-julia 'm not coming back to it , no , [I]58-julia 'm not , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , half aloud ; " the corduroy and onions would be a great deal better . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington was in a happy and contented frame of mind ; the quiet wedding had gone off quite as well as [Violet]101-violet 's grander one — really , a quiet wedding is more effective than a smart one in the dull time of year , and always , of course , less expensive . [Chèrie]64-chèrie had looked lovely in simple dress , and the presents , considering the quietness and haste , were surprisingly numerous and handsome . [Mr. Smith]130-mr. brendon smith was liked and respected by a wide circle . " It is of no use for [you]58-julia to get any nonsensical ideas , "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain said , " about what [you]58-julia will do and wo n't do ; this is the only thing [you]58-julia can do ; [you]58-julia have got to make a living , and [you]58-julia have got to pay [your]58-julia debts ; [beggars]4021-beggars ca n't be [choosers]4022-choosers . The fact is , [you]58-julia have all lived on charity so long that [you]58-julia have got demoralised . "[172-the captain] [Violet]101-violet flushed . " Really , "[101-violet] [she]101-violet began to say , " though [you]2097-her brother have helped [us]2104-us once or twice , [I]101-violet do n't think [you]2097-her brother have the right to insult — "[101-violet] but [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington raised a quieting hand ; [she]60-mrs. polkington did not wish to offend [[her]60-mrs. polkington brother]2097-her brother . [He]2097-her brother was not offended ; [he]2097-her brother only spoke [his]2097-her brother mind rather plainly to [them]2104-us all , which , though it did no harm , did little good either ; [they]2104-us were too old in [their]2104-us sins to profit by that now . After some more unpleasant talk all round , the family conclave broke up ; [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer came [home]249-home , and [every one]582-every one went to bed . [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby had [[Julia]58-julia 's tiny room]2107-julia 's tiny room ; there was nowhere else for [him]137-mr. ponsonby , seeing [Violet]101-violet and [[her]101-violet husband]230-her husband had the one [she]101-violet and [[her]101-violet youngest sister]2109-her youngest sister shared in [their]2110-their maiden days . [Julia]58-julia had to content [herself]58-julia with the drawing - room sofa ; it was a very uncomfortable sofa , and the blankets kept slipping off so [she]58-julia did not sleep a great deal ; but that did not matter much ; [she]58-julia had the more time to think things over . [Dawn]139-dawn found [her]58-julia sitting at the table wrapped in [her]58-julia blanket , writing by the light of one of the piano candles ; [she]58-julia glanced up as the first cold light struggled in , and [her]58-julia face was very grave , it looked old , too , and tired , with the weariness which accompanies renunciation , quite as often as does peace or a sense of beatitude . [She]58-julia looked at the paper before [her]58-julia , a completely worked - out table of expenditure , a sort of statement of ways and means — the means being £ 50 a year . It could be done ; [she]58-julia knew that during the night when the plan took shape in [her]58-julia mind ; [she]58-julia had proved it to [herself]58-julia more than half - an - hour ago by figures — but there was no margin . It could only be done by renouncing that upon which [she]58-julia had set [her]58-julia heart ; [she]58-julia could not work out the scheme and pay the debt of honour to [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew . The legacy had at first seemed a heaven - sent gift for that purpose , but now , like the blue daffodil , it seemed that it could not be used to pay the debt . That was not to be paid by a heaven - sent gift any more than by a devil - helped theft ; slow , honest work and patient saving might pay it in years , but nothing else it seemed . [She]58-julia put [her]58-julia elbows on the table and propped [her]58-julia chin on [her]58-julia locked hands looking down at the unanswerable figures , but [they]2111-they still told [her]58-julia the same hard truth . " [I]58-julia might save it in time ; [I]58-julia could do without this — and this , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia told [herself]58-julia . It is so easy to do without [oneself]2112-oneself when [one]3325-one 's mind is set on some purpose , but [one]3325-one has no right to expect [others]239-others to do without , too — the whole thing would be no good if [the others]312-the others had to ; [she]58-julia knew that . No , the debt could not be paid this way ; [she]58-julia had no right to do it ; it was [her]58-julia own fancy , [her]58-julia hobby , perhaps . [No one]181-no one demanded that it should be paid ; law did not compel it ; [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew did not expect it ; [[her]58-julia father]210-her father considered that it no longer existed ; it was to please [herself]58-julia and [herself]58-julia alone that [she]58-julia would pay it , and [her]58-julia pleasure must wait . Possibly [she]58-julia did not reason quite all this ; [she]58-julia only knew that [she]58-julia could not do what [she]58-julia had set [her]58-julia heart on doing with the first of [Aunt Jane]128-jane 's money , and the renunciation cost [her]58-julia much , and gave [her]58-julia no satisfaction at all . But the matter once decided , [she]58-julia put it at the back of [her]58-julia mind , and by breakfast time [she]58-julia was [her]58-julia usual self ; to tell the truth , [she]58-julia was looking forward to a skirmish with [Uncle William]135-uncle william , and that cheered [her]58-julia . After breakfast [she]58-julia led [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby to [the drawing - room]176-the drawing - room , and [he]137-mr. ponsonby came not altogether unprepared for objections ; [he]137-mr. ponsonby had half feared them last night . " [Uncle William]135-uncle william , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . " [I]58-julia have been thinking over [your]135-uncle william plan , and [I]58-julia do n't think [I]58-julia quite like it . "[58-julia] " [I]2085-her uncle dare say not , "[2085-her uncle] [[her]58-julia uncle]2085-her uncle answered ; " [I]2085-her uncle can believe it ; but that 's neither here nor there , as [I]2085-her uncle said last night , [beggars]4021-beggars ca n't be [choosers]4022-choosers . "[2085-her uncle] [Julia]58-julia did not , as [Violet]101-violet had , resent this ; [she]58-julia was [the one member of [the family]193-the family who was not [a beggar]2123-a beggar]2121-the one member of the family who was not a beggar , and [she]58-julia knew perfectly well [she]58-julia could be [a chooser]2124-a chooser . [She]58-julia sat down . " Perhaps [I]58-julia had better say just what [I]58-julia mean , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said pleasantly ; " [I]58-julia am not going to do it . "[58-julia] " Not going to ? "[137-mr. ponsonby] [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby repeated indignantly . " Do n't talk nonsense ; [you]58-julia have got to , there 's nothing else open to [you]58-julia ; [I]137-mr. ponsonby 'm not going to keep [you]58-julia all , feed , clothe and house [you]58-julia , and pay [your]58-julia debts into the bargain ! "[137-mr. ponsonby] " No , "[58-julia] said [Julia]58-julia ; " no , naturally not ; [I]58-julia did not think of that . "[58-julia] " What did [you]58-julia think of , then ? " What do [you]58-julia object to ? [I]58-julia suppose [you]58-julia do n't like the idea of paying debts ; none of [you]58-julia seem to . "[58-julia] " No , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ; " it is n't that ; of course the debts must be paid in the way [you]58-julia say , it is the only way . "[58-julia] " [I]2090-the banker am glad [you]58-julia think so , "[2090-the banker] [the banker]2090-the banker said sarcastically ; " though [I]2090-the banker may as well tell [you]58-julia , [young lady]4025-young lady , that it would still be done even without [your]58-julia approval . " [We]4027-we may as well call it that , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia do n't like [the boarding - house]2086-the boarding - house investment . "[58-julia] " What do [you]58-julia like ? Seeing [[your]58-julia parents]3578-your parents go to [the poorhouse]4030-the poorhouse ? That 's what will happen . "[58-julia] " No , [they]3578-your parents can come and live with [me]58-julia . [I]58-julia have got [a large cottage]4031-a large cottage , [a garden]2018-a garden , [a field]2019-a field , and £ 50 a year . If [we]4027-we keep pigs and poultry , and grow things in [the garden]4034-the garden [we]4027-we can live in [the cottage]4035-the cottage on the £ 50 a year till the debts are all paid off ; after that , of course , [we]4027-we should have enough to be pretty comfortable . [We]4027-we need not keep [a servant there]4036-a servant there , or regard appearances or humbug — it would be very cheap . "[58-julia] " And nasty , "[2085-her uncle] [[her]58-julia uncle]2085-her uncle added . [He]2085-her uncle was not impressed with the wisdom of this scheme ; indeed [he]2085-her uncle did not seriously contemplate it as possible . " [You]58-julia are talking nonsense , "[2085-her uncle] [he]2085-her uncle said ; " absurd , childish nonsense ; [you]58-julia do n't know anything about it ; [you]58-julia have no idea what life in [a cottage]3971-a cottage means ; the drudgery of cooking and scrubbing and so on ; the doing without society and the things [you]58-julia are used to ; as for pigs and gardening , why , [you]58-julia do n't know how to dig a hole or grow a cabbage ! "[2085-her uncle] But [he]2085-her uncle was not quite right ; [Julia]58-julia had learnt something about drudgery in [Holland]7-holland , something about growing things , at least in theory , and so much about doing with out the society to which [she]58-julia was used at [home]249-home that [she]58-julia had absolutely no desire for it left . [She]58-julia made as much of this plan to [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby as was possible and desirable ; enough , at all events , to convince [him]137-mr. ponsonby that [she]58-julia had thought out [her]58-julia plan in every detail and was very bent on it . " [I]2085-her uncle suppose the utter selfishness of this idea of [yours]58-julia has not struck [you]58-julia , "[2085-her uncle] [he]2085-her uncle said at last . " [I]137-mr. ponsonby suppose [you]58-julia think , "[137-mr. ponsonby] [he]137-mr. ponsonby said irritably , " that [you]58-julia have reduced it to this — the sacrifice of [one parent]4046-one parent or the other . [I]58-julia really think [you]137-mr. ponsonby must be right . "[58-julia] Here it must be recorded , [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby very nearly lost [his]137-mr. ponsonby temper , and not without justification . Was [he]137-mr. ponsonby not giving time and consideration and ( probably ) money to help [this hopeless family]2135-this hopeless family on to [its]2135-this hopeless family legs again ? And was it not more than [mortal middle - aged man]2136-mortal middle - aged man could bear , not only to be opposed by [the only member with any means]2137-the only member with any means , but also to be made sly fun of by [her]2137-the only member with any means ? [He]137-mr. ponsonby gave [Julia]58-julia [his]137-mr. ponsonby opinion very sharply , and no doubt [she]58-julia deserved it . [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby lost [the train]497-the train [he]137-mr. ponsonby meant to catch back to [London]9-london ; [he]137-mr. ponsonby did not do it only for the benefit of [[his]137-mr. ponsonby sister]2077-his sister , but also because [Julia]58-julia had given battle and [he]137-mr. ponsonby was not going to retire from [the field]1144-the field . [Violet]101-violet and [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer deliberately postponed the hour of [their]2144-them departure ; [Violet]101-violet was determined not to leave things in this condition ; [Julia]58-julia 's plan , [she]101-violet considered a disgrace to [the whole family]2148-the whole family . [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer was asked not to come to [the family council]2149-the family council ; [Violet]101-violet explained to [him]65-mr. frazer that [they]2144-them were having trouble with [Julia]58-julia ; [she]101-violet would tell [him]65-mr. frazer all about it afterwards , but it distressed [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother so much that it would perhaps be kinder if [he]65-mr. frazer was not there at the time . [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer quite agreed ; [he]65-mr. frazer shared some of [[his]65-mr. frazer wife]168-his wife 's sentiments about appearances ; also [he]65-mr. frazer had no wish to be distressed either in mind or tastes . [Violet]101-violet did tell [him]65-mr. frazer about it afterwards ; a curtailed and selected version , but one eminently suitable to the purpose . On hearing it [he]65-mr. frazer was justly angry with [Julia]58-julia 's heartless selfishness in keeping [her]58-julia legacy to [herself]58-julia . [He]65-mr. frazer was also shocked at [her]58-julia determination to go and live [a farm labourer]2152-a farm labourer 's life in [[a farm labourer]2152-a farm labourer 's cottage]2154-a farm labourer 's cottage . [He]65-mr. frazer was truly sorry for [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington , between whom and [himself]65-mr. frazer there existed a mutual affection and admiration . [He]65-mr. frazer said it was bitterly hard that [[her]60-mrs. polkington one remaining daughter]2155-her one remaining daughter should treat [her]60-mrs. polkington thus ; that it was barbarous , impossible , that [a woman of [her]60-mrs. polkington age , tastes , refinement and gifts]2156-a woman of her age , tastes , refinement and gifts should be compelled to lead such a life as was proposed . In fact [he]65-mr. frazer could not and would not permit it ; [he]65-mr. frazer hoped that [she]58-julia would make [her]58-julia home at [[his]65-mr. frazer rectory]2157-his rectory ; nay , [he]65-mr. frazer insisted upon it ; both [Violet]101-violet and [himself]65-mr. frazer would not take a refusal ; [she]58-julia must and should come to [them]2158-they . [Julia]58-julia smiled [her]58-julia approval ; when things were worked up to this end ; [she]58-julia would have liked to clap [her]58-julia applause , it was so well done . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington and [Violet]101-violet were so admirable , [they]2158-they were already almost convinced of all [they]2158-they said ; in two days [they]2158-they would believe it quite as much as [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby did now . [She]58-julia did not in the least mind having to appear as [the ungrateful daughter]2159-the ungrateful daughter ; it fitted in so beautifully with [Violet]101-violet 's arrangement . And really the arrangement was very good ; the utilitarian feelings of [the family]193-the family did not suffer at wrenches and splits as did [more tender ones]2161-more tender ones ; [no one]181-no one would object much to an advantageous division . And most advantageous it certainly was ; [the cottage household]2163-the cottage household would go better without [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington and [she]60-mrs. polkington would be far happier at [the rectory]2164-the rectory . [She]58-julia would not make any trouble [there]180-there ; rather , [she]58-julia would give [[her]58-julia son - in - law]2051-her son - in - law cause to be glad of [her]58-julia coming ; there would be scope for [her]58-julia there , and [she]58-julia would possibly develop better than [she]58-julia had ever had a chance of doing before . So everything was decided . [The house in [East Street]30-east street]2167-the house in east street was to be given up , and most of [its]2167-the house in east street contents sold ; as [[Julia]58-julia 's cottage]2168-julia 's cottage was furnished already with [Aunt Jane]128-jane 's things , [she]58-julia need only take a few extras from [the home]2169-the home . The debts were to be paid as far as possible now , and the small income was to be divided ; part was to go as pin money to [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington , the main part of the re mainder to go to the debts , and a very small modicum to come with [the Captain]172-the captain to [the cottage]4035-the cottage . [Julia]58-julia was quite satisfied , and let it be apparent . This , with [her]58-julia obvious cheerfulness , rather incensed [Violet]101-violet , who regarded the sale of [their]2172-their effects as rather a disgrace , and [Julia]58-julia 's plans for the future , as a great one . " [You]2173-her younger sister ought to be ashamed of [yourself]2173-her younger sister , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia told [[her]58-julia younger sister]2173-her younger sister , just before [she]58-julia left [Marbridge]61-denah . " [I]58-julia am positively ashamed to think [you]2173-her younger sister belong to [us]2172-their . It will be nice to meet [[Norfolk]40-norfolk people at [the Palace]4077-the palace or somewhere , who have seen [you]2173-her younger sister tending [your]2173-her younger sister pigs and doing [your]2173-her younger sister washing]4076-norfolk people at the palace or somewhere , who have seen you tending your pigs and doing your washing . It is such an unusual name ; [I]58-julia can quite fancy some one being introduced to [mother]3346-mother and thinking it odd that [her]3346-mother name should be the same as [some dirty cottage people]4079-some dirty cottage people . "[58-julia] " Well , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia suggested , " why not change it ? Such a trifle as a name surely need not stand in [our]2172-their way ; [we]2172-their have got over worse things than that . [Mother]140-mother can be something else , or [I]58-julia can ; [mother]3346-mother had better do it ; [father]3307-father will forget who [he]3307-father is if [I]58-julia make a change . "[58-julia] " Do n't be absurd , "[101-violet] [Violet]101-violet said ; " [I]101-violet only wish [you]58-julia could change it though ; [I]101-violet never want to write to [you]58-julia as [Julia Polkington]58-julia in case [some servant]4082-some servant were to notice the address ; [one]3325-one never knows how these things come out . "[101-violet] " Do n't write as that , "[556-her sister] [[her]58-julia sister]556-her sister told [her]58-julia ; " address [me]556-her sister as ' [Julia Snooks]58-julia ' or anything else [you]58-julia like ; [I]556-her sister am not particular . "[556-her sister] [Violet]101-violet did not take this as a serious suggestion ; nevertheless , [Julia]58-julia told [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer on [the platform at [Marbridge]61-denah]2175-the platform at marbridge that [she]58-julia and [Violet]101-violet had been having a christening , and that [she]58-julia was now [Julia Snooks]58-julia . [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby said it was ridiculous , to which [Julia]58-julia replied — " That is what [I]58-julia am [myself]58-julia . "[58-julia] [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington said it was foolish too , but [she]60-mrs. polkington did not say so vehemently ; [she]60-mrs. polkington felt that in [the Frazer circle]2176-the frazer circle , especially at [the Palace]4077-the palace where [she]60-mrs. polkington would meet [people from everywhere]2178-people from everywhere , [she]60-mrs. polkington might possibly come across [some one who had heard of [Julia]58-julia]2179-some one who had heard of julia . "[60-mrs. polkington] [she]60-mrs. polkington suggested . " Because , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered , " that is what [I]58-julia am not . "[58-julia] But fate had one exceedingly bitter pill for [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington . On the day after [Chèrie]64-chèrie and [[her]64-chèrie husband]230-her husband sailed for [South Africa]43-south africa , it was known in [Marbridge]61-denah that the news of [Mr. Harding]129-mr. harding 's engagement was false . [The girl gossip had coupled with [him]129-mr. harding]2182-the girl gossip had coupled with him was engaged , it is true , and to [a Mr. Harding]129-mr. harding , but to [another and entirely different bearer of the name]2183-another and entirely different bearer of the name . The real , [eligible Mr. Harding]129-mr. harding called at [East Street]30-east street to explain to [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington how the mistake had arisen , to tell [her]60-mrs. polkington that [he]129-mr. harding [himself]129-mr. harding had been away in [the north]2184-the north for some weeks and so had heard nothing of it . Also to hear — and [he]129-mr. harding had heard nothing of that either — that [Chèrie]64-chèrie was married and gone . The news of [Mr. Harding]129-mr. harding 's freedom and [his]129-mr. harding call , and what [she]60-mrs. polkington fancied it might have implied , did not reach [Chèrie]64-chèrie till after [her]60-mrs. polkington arrival in [Africa]44-africa . It did not tend to soothe the first weeks of married life , nor to make easier the rigorous , but no doubt wholesome , breaking - in process to which [[her]60-mrs. polkington husband]230-her husband wisely subjected [her]60-mrs. polkington .

[Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew was very busy that autumn , so busy that the events which had taken place in [Holland]7-holland were rather blotted out of [his]129-mr. harding mind ; [he]129-mr. harding had not exactly forgotten them , only among the press of other things [he]129-mr. harding did not often think about them and [they]2186-they soon came to take [their]2186-they proper unimportant place among [his]129-mr. harding recollections . [Julia]58-julia [he]129-mr. harding thought of occasionally , but less and less in connection with the foolish holiday , more in connection with some chance saying or doing . [Things]144-things recalled [her]58-julia , a passage in a book , a sentiment [she]58-julia would have shared , an opinion [she]58-julia would have combated . Or perhaps it was that [some one [he]129-mr. harding met]2187-some one he met set [him]129-mr. harding thinking of [her]58-julia shrewd swift judgments ; some scene in which [he]129-mr. harding played a part that made [him]129-mr. harding imagine [her]58-julia an amused spectator of its unconscious absurdity . [He]129-mr. harding had turned [her]58-julia thyme flowers out of [his]129-mr. harding pocket ; [he]129-mr. harding had no sentiment about them or [her]58-julia , but [he]129-mr. harding did not forget [her]58-julia ; [their]2188-their acquaintance had , to a certain extent , been a thing of mind , and in mind it seemed [he]129-mr. harding occasionally came in contact with [her]58-julia still . Also there is no doubt [she]58-julia must have been one of [those virile people who take hold]2189-those virile people who take hold , for though [one]3325-one could sometimes overlook [her]58-julia presence , in absence [one]3325-one did not forget . Of [herself]58-julia and [her]58-julia doings [he]129-mr. harding never heard ; at first [he]129-mr. harding had half thought [he]129-mr. harding might have some communication from [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , but as the autumn went on and [he]129-mr. harding heard nothing , [he]129-mr. harding came to the conclusion that [she]58-julia really must have arranged something satisfactorily and there was an end to the whole affair . [He]129-mr. harding settled down to [his]129-mr. harding own concerns and became very thoroughly absorbed in them , to the exclusion of nearly everything else . For [women]3573-women [he]129-mr. harding never had much taste , and now , being busy and preoccupied , [he]129-mr. harding got into the way of scanning [them]3573-women more critically than ever when [he]129-mr. harding did happen to come across [them]3573-women . Not comparing [them]3573-women with any ideal standard , but just finding [them]3573-women uninteresting , whether [they]3573-women were [the cultivated , well - bred girls of [the country]760-the country]2193-the cultivated , well - bred girls of the country , or [the smart young matrons and wide - awake maidens of [the town]569-the town]2195-the smart young matrons and wide - awake maidens of the town . That autumn [the young Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew , [[Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington 's acquaintance]2197-captain polkington 's acquaintance , came into a fortune and took [a wife]2198-a wife . The latter was , perhaps , on the whole , a wise proceeding , for , though [the wife in question]2199-the wife in question would undoubtedly help [him]129-mr. harding in the rapid and inevitable spending of the fortune , [she]2199-the wife in question was likely also to enable [him]129-mr. harding to get more for [his]129-mr. harding money than if [he]129-mr. harding were spending alone . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew was not introduced to [this lady]443-this lady till the winter , then , one evening , [he]75-rawson - clew met [her]443-this lady at [[a friend]430-a friend 's " at [home]249-home]4084-a friend 's " at home . "[443-this lady] [She]443-this lady was very pretty , small and fair and plump , with childish blue eyes , and an anything but childish mind behind them . [She]443-this lady had dainty little feet , as well shaped as any [he]75-rawson - clew had ever seen , and [she]443-this lady was perfectly dressed , [her]443-this lady gown a diaphanous creation of melting colours and floating softness , which suggested more than it revealed of [her]443-this lady person , like [a nymph]2202-a nymph 's drapery . [She]443-this lady was the centre of attraction and talked and laughed a great deal , the latter in little tinkles like [a child of five]2203-a child of five , the former from the top of [her]443-this lady throat with the faintest lisp and in the strange jargon that was the slang of the moment . [She]443-this lady knew no more of Florentine art or [Wagner]145-wagner or Egyptology than [Julia]58-julia did , and cared even less . [She]443-this lady set out to be intelligently ignorant — to be anything else was called " middle - class "[443-this lady] in [her]443-this lady set — and [she]443-this lady achieved [her]443-this lady end , although [she]443-this lady could do some things extremely well — play bridge , gamble in stocks and shares and anything else , and arrange lights and colours with the skill of [an artist]2204-an artist when a suitable setting for [her]443-this lady pretty self was concerned . [She]443-this lady had all the charms of womanly weakness without any old - fashioned and grandmotherly narrowness ; [she]443-this lady was quite free and emancipated in mind and manners , [no man]3815-no man had to modify [his]3815-no man language for [her]443-this lady ; [she]443-this lady preferred a double meaning to a single one , and a risque story to a plain one . [She]443-this lady had an excellent taste in dinners , a critical one in liqueurs , and a catholic one in [men]3625-men . [She]443-this lady was most gracious to [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew when [he]75-rawson - clew was introduced , breaking up [[her]443-this lady court]2207-her court and dismissing [[her]443-this lady admirers]2208-her admirers solely to accommodate [him]75-rawson - clew . The instant [she]443-this lady saw [him]75-rawson - clew , before [she]443-this lady heard who [he]75-rawson - clew was , [she]443-this lady picked [him]75-rawson - clew out as the game best worthy of [her]443-this lady prowess , and [she]443-this lady lost no time in addressing [herself]443-this lady to the chase with the skill and determination of [a Diana]2209-a diana — though that perhaps is hardly a good comparison , enthusiasm for the chase being about the only quality [she]443-this lady shared with [the maiden huntress]2210-the maiden huntress . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew did not show signs of succumbing at once to [her]443-this lady charms ; [she]443-this lady hardly expected that [he]75-rawson - clew would , for [she]443-this lady gave [him]75-rawson - clew credit for knowing [his]75-rawson - clew own value and was not displeased thereby ; where is the pleasure of sport if [the quarry]2211-the quarry be captured at the outset ? But if [he]75-rawson - clew did not succumb [he]75-rawson - clew did all that was otherwise expected of [him]75-rawson - clew , standing in attendance on [her]443-this lady and sitting by [her]443-this lady when [he]75-rawson - clew was invited to the settee [she]443-this lady had chosen in a quiet corner . So well , indeed , did [he]75-rawson - clew comport [himself]75-rawson - clew that by the time [they]2212-they parted [she]443-this lady felt fairly satisfied with [her]443-this lady progress . Perhaps [she]443-this lady would have been less satisfied if [she]443-this lady had heard something [he]75-rawson - clew said soon after . [A man [he]75-rawson - clew knew]2213-a man he knew left [the house]175-the house at the same time [he]75-rawson - clew did and persuaded [him]75-rawson - clew to come to [the club]2215-the club . " As [a wife]2198-a wife ? "[393-the other man] [he]393-the other man answered ; " [I]393-the other man should not think of [her]451-the lady . At [the club]2215-the club [he]75-rawson - clew found a box that had come for [him]75-rawson - clew by parcels post . A wooden one with the address printed on a card and nailed to the lid , which was screwed down . It did not look particularly interesting ; [he]75-rawson - clew told [one of [the club servants]2223-the club servants]2222-one of the club servants to unscrew it for [him]75-rawson - clew . When [he]75-rawson - clew came to examine the contents [he]75-rawson - clew found , first a lot of damp packing , and then a wide - necked stoppered bottle , two - thirds full of white powder . It bore a label printed neatly like the address — " [[Herr Van de Greutz]88-herr van de greutz 's Explosive]4088-herr van de greutz 's explosive . "[75-rawson - clew] Formula as [he]75-rawson - clew said it .... " For a moment [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew held the bottle , staring at it in blank astonishment ; so tense was [his]75-rawson - clew attitude that it caught [the other man]393-the other man 's attention . "[146-hullo] [Hullo]146-hullo ! " [he]75-rawson - clew said , "[3318-some one] [some one]3318-some one sent [you]75-rawson - clew an infernal machine ? " [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew roused [himself]75-rawson - clew . "[3318-some one] No , " [he]75-rawson - clew answered shortly . [He]75-rawson - clew put the bottle back in the box after [he]75-rawson - clew had felt in the packing and found nothing , then [he]75-rawson - clew fastened it up with more care than was perhaps necessary . [He]75-rawson - clew looked at the address on the lid , but it told [him]75-rawson - clew nothing more than it had at first ; neither that nor the name of [the post - office from which it was sent]4090-the post - office from which it was sent gave any clue to [the sender]4091-the sender . And yet [he]75-rawson - clew felt as if [Julia]58-julia were at [his]75-rawson - clew elbow with that mute sympathy in [her]58-julia eyes which had been there when [they]4092-they talked of failure in the wood on [the Dunes]13-the dunes . " Then [he]75-rawson - clew went [home]249-home . When [he]75-rawson - clew was alone in [[his]75-rawson - clew chambers]4095-his chambers and secure from interruption , [he]75-rawson - clew opened the box again and took out all the packing , carefully sorting it . But [he]75-rawson - clew found nothing , no scrap of paper , no clue of any sort ; [he]75-rawson - clew took off the linen rag that fastened in the bottle stopper , but that betrayed nothing either ; and yet [he]75-rawson - clew thought of [Julia]58-julia . [She]58-julia was [the only person who could know about the explosive]4096-the only person who could know about the explosive . It had never been actually spoken of last summer , but the chances were [she]58-julia knew . [She]58-julia was [the only person who could have known or who could have got it]4097-the only person who could have known or who could have got it . It was like [her]58-julia , so like that [he]75-rawson - clew was as sure as if [her]58-julia name were in the box that [she]58-julia was [the sender]4091-the sender . How [she]58-julia had got the stuff [he]75-rawson - clew could not think , [he]75-rawson - clew knew the difficulties in the way ; but [she]58-julia had done it somehow , and now [she]58-julia had sent it to [him]75-rawson - clew , without name for fear of embarrassing [him]75-rawson - clew , without clue , with no desire for thanks — [loyal , generous , able little comrade]4099-loyal , generous , able little comrade ! [He]75-rawson - clew looked up again ; [he]75-rawson - clew felt as if [she]58-julia were bodily present ; the whole thing , astounding as [he]75-rawson - clew had found it at first , was somehow so characteristic of [her]58-julia . And because of [her]58-julia presence [he]75-rawson - clew suddenly wished [he]75-rawson - clew had not been to that evening 's entertainment and sat close by [[his]75-rawson - clew cousin]3389-his cousin 's wife and heard the things [she]58-julia said , and answered the things [she]58-julia looked . [He]75-rawson - clew felt as if [he]75-rawson - clew were not clean , as if [he]75-rawson - clew had no right to entertain even the ghost of [the good comrade]4101-the good comrade . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew was not self - conscious ; it never occurred to [him]75-rawson - clew to think if [he]75-rawson - clew appeared ridiculous , whether [he]75-rawson - clew was alone or in company . [He]75-rawson - clew took off [his]75-rawson - clew dress coat and flung it aside with a feeling of disgust ; its sleeve had brushed [that woman]4102-that woman 's bare arm ; [he]75-rawson - clew could almost fancy that a suggestion of the scent [she]4102-that woman used clung to it . [He]75-rawson - clew put it out of sight and fetched some other garment before [he]75-rawson - clew came back to the thing which had recalled [Julia]58-julia . And yet [the girl]415-the girl was [no lily - child with the dew of dawn upon [her]415-the girl]4104-no lily - child with the dew of dawn upon her ; [he]75-rawson - clew did not for one instant think [she]415-the girl was ; probably , had [she]415-the girl been , [she]415-the girl would not have been [the good comrade]4101-the good comrade . The facts of life were not strange to [her]415-the girl , [she]415-the girl knew them , good and bad ; was not above laughing at what was funny even if it was somewhat coarse , but [she]415-the girl had no taste for lascivious wallowing no matter under what name disguised . [A man]406-a man could be at [home]249-home with [her]415-the girl , [he]406-a man could speak the truth to [her]415-the girl ; but [he]406-a man would not make a point of taking [her]415-the girl into [the society of [that woman]4102-that woman]4108-the society of that woman , any more than [he]406-a man would invite [a friend]430-a friend to look at the sink , unless there was some purpose to serve . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew took up the bottle and looked at it , and looked at the address card on the lid , all over again ; and there grew in [his]75-rawson - clew mind the conviction that [he]75-rawson - clew been [a remarkable and particular fool]4111-a remarkable and particular fool . Not because [he]406-a man had taken that holiday on [the Dunes]13-the dunes , nor yet because [he]406-a man had failed to get the explosive and [Julia]58-julia had succeeded — [he]406-a man be lieved that [a man]406-a man might have average intelligence and yet fail there , for [he]406-a man thought [she]58-julia had more than average . But because [he]406-a man had failed to recognise a fact that had been existent all the time — the need [he]406-a man had for [the good comrade]4101-the good comrade . Why had [he]406-a man a better liking for [his]406-a man work than of old ? Because it was such as [she]58-julia would have liked , could have done well , every now and then [he]406-a man fancied [her]58-julia [there]180-there . Why did [he]406-a man find new pleasure in the hours [he]406-a man spent reading Renaissance Italian , old memoirs , the ripe wisdom of [the late Tudors and early Stuarts]4115-the late tudors and early stuarts ? Because [he]406-a man found [her]58-julia in the pages , saw [her]58-julia laugh sometimes , heard [her]58-julia contradict at others ; felt [her]58-julia , invisible and not always recognised , at [his]406-a man elbow . [He]406-a man looked round ; why should not the presence be fact instead of fancy ? [He]406-a man would go to [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat and find [her]58-julia whereabouts ; if [Julia]58-julia was in [England]8-england , as [she]58-julia probably was , seeing that the box was posted in [London]9-london , [the old man]441-the old man would know where [she]58-julia was . [He]406-a man would go to [Berwick Street]38-berwick street — [he]406-a man looked at the clock — no , not now ; it was too late , or rather too early ; [he]406-a man would have to wait till the morning was a good deal older . Unfortunately the carrying out of the plan did not prove very successful . [Berwick Street]38-berwick street [he]406-a man found , and No . 31 [he]406-a man found , but not [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat ; [he]406-a man was gone and had left no address . [Mrs. Horn]127-mrs. horn did not seem troubled by the omission ; [he]406-a man had paid everything before [he]406-a man went away , and [he]406-a man practically never had any letters to be sent on ; why , [she]127-mrs. horn asked , should [she]127-mrs. horn bother after [his]406-a man address ? [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew could not tell [her]127-mrs. horn why [she]127-mrs. horn should , nor did [he]406-a man give any reason why [he]406-a man [himself]406-a man should . [He]406-a man went away and , reversing the order of [his]406-a man previous search , went to [Marbridge]61-denah . But failure awaited [him]406-a man [there]180-there , too . When [he]406-a man came to [[the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons ' house]217-the polkingtons ' house [he]406-a man found [it]217-the polkingtons ' house empty , the blinds down , the steps uncleaned , and bills announcing that it was to let in the windows . [He]406-a man stood and looked at it in the grey afternoon , and for a moment [he]406-a man was conscious of a feeling of desolation and disappointment which was almost absurd . [He]406-a man turned away and began to make inquiries about [the family]193-the family . [He]406-a man soon learnt all that was commonly known . [They]193-the family had been gone from [East Street]30-east street some little time now ; [they]193-the family must have left before the box containing the explosive was posted . [Julia]58-julia had sent it to [[Aunt Jane]128-jane 's lawyer]4120-aunt jane 's lawyer , before [she]58-julia set out for [the cottage]4035-the cottage , asking [him]406-a man to dispatch it at a given date , and [he]406-a man had fulfilled [her]58-julia request , thinking it a wedding present and the date specified one near the impending ceremony . This , of course , [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew did not find out ; [he]406-a man found out several things about [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons though , [their]56-the polkingtons debts and difficulties , [their]56-the polkingtons sale and the break up of [the family]193-the family . [He]406-a man also found out that [the youngest Miss Polkington]58-julia was married and [the second , and now only remaining one]4123-the second , and now only remaining one , had come [home]249-home before the break up . As to where [the family]193-the family were now , that was not quite so clear ; [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington was with [one of [[her]60-mrs. polkington married daughters]4127-her married daughters]4126-one of her married daughters ; [her]60-mrs. polkington address was easily obtainable and apparently considered all that [any one]187-any one could require , and quite sufficient to cover [the rest of [the family]193-the family]4129-the rest of the family . [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington — [nobody]3448-nobody thought much about [him]59-captain polkington — when [they]3448-nobody did , it was generally concluded [he]59-captain polkington was with [[his]59-captain polkington wife]168-his wife . As for [Julia]58-julia , [she]58-julia must have got a situation of some sort — unless , which was unlikely , [she]58-julia was with [[her]58-julia parents]4133-her parents . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew took [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington 's address — it was all [he]75-rawson - clew could get — and determined to write to [her]58-julia . It did occur to [him]75-rawson - clew to write to [Julia]58-julia at [[[her]58-julia sister]556-her sister 's house]4135-her sister 's house and request that [his]75-rawson - clew letter was forwarded ; but [he]75-rawson - clew did not do so ; [he]75-rawson - clew was not at all sure [she]58-julia would answer ; [he]75-rawson - clew wanted to see [her]58-julia face to face this time . [He]75-rawson - clew wrote to [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington and asked [her]60-mrs. polkington for [Julia]58-julia 's address , introducing [himself]75-rawson - clew as [a friend]430-a friend met in [Holland]7-holland , and explaining [his]75-rawson - clew reason , vaguely to be connected with that time . When [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington received the letter [she]60-mrs. polkington thought it over a little ; then [she]60-mrs. polkington showed it to [Violet]101-violet , and [they]4137-they discussed it together . At the outset [they]4137-they made a mistake ; [they]4137-they only knew of [one person of the name of [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew]4138-one person of the name of rawson - clew — [[the Captain]172-the captain 's young acquaintance]4140-the captain 's young acquaintance ; [he]4138-one person of the name of rawson - clew had certainly gone away from [Marbridge]61-denah last spring and so in point of time could have met [Julia]58-julia in [Holland]7-holland , only it was not likely that [he]4138-one person of the name of rawson - clew had , or that [he]4138-one person of the name of rawson - clew had become friendly with [her]58-julia . At least so [Violet]101-violet said ; [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington , who knew what remarkable things [herself]60-mrs. polkington and [family]4141-family could do in the way of getting to know [people]3334-people , was inclined to think differently . On one point , however , [they]2229-they were agreed ; it would be very unpleasant to have to tell one in the position of [Mr. Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew about [Julia]58-julia 's present proceedings . Giving the address would be giving the information , or something like it — [one]3325-one would have to explain—"Miss[2227-a good comrade] [Julia Snooks]58-julia , [[White]147-white 's Cottage]2228-white 's cottage , near [Halgrave]47-halgrave . " "[2227-a good comrade] [We]2229-they ca n't do that , " [Violet]101-violet said with decision . "[2229-they] [I]0-i might say [I]0-i would forward a letter , perhaps ? " [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington suggested . But [Violet]101-violet did not think that would do either . "[0-i] [Julia]58-julia would answer it , " [she]60-mrs. polkington said ; "[58-julia] and that would be quite as bad ; [you]2230-you know , [she]58-julia is not in the least ashamed of [herself]58-julia . " [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington did know it . "[0-i] [I]0-i believe [you]2230-you are right , " [she]60-mrs. polkington said , with the air of one convinced against [her]60-mrs. polkington will ; "[2230-you] [Julia]58-julia has voluntarily cut [herself]58-julia adrift from [her]58-julia own class ; it would be unpleasant and embarrassing for [her]58-julia as well as for [other people]3728-other people to force [her]58-julia into any connection with it again ; [I]0-i do n't think any purpose can be served by reopening an acquaintance with [Mr. Raw son - Clew]148-mr. raw son - clew , [we]2232-we did not know [him]148-mr. raw son - clew at [Marbridge"—she]48-marbridge"—she never forgot that [[his]148-mr. raw son - clew circle]4144-his circle there did not think [her]58-julia good enough to know . "[0-i] [I]0-i can not imagine that it would be advantageous for [Julia]58-julia to write to [him]148-mr. raw son - clew or hear from [him]148-mr. raw son - clew under the present circumstances . [He]148-mr. raw son - clew comes of [a Norfolk family]2233-a norfolk family , too ( [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington always knew about [[people]3334-people 's families]2235-people 's families even when [she]60-mrs. polkington did not know [them]2235-people 's families personally ; it was the sort of information that interested [her]60-mrs. polkington ) ; [I]0-i do n't know what part of [the county]2236-the county [[his]148-mr. raw son - clew people]1506-his people belong to , very likely nowhere near [Julia]58-julia ; but supposing it were near enough for [him]148-mr. raw son - clew to know from the address what kind of [a place [Julia]58-julia was in]2238-a place julia was in , it really might be so awkward ; [we]2239-we ought to be very careful for [dear Richard]63-richard frazer 's sake , especially seeing [his]148-mr. raw son - clew connection with [the Palace]4077-the palace . [I]0-i really think it would be wiser as [you]2241-you say , to be on the safe side . " So [she]60-mrs. polkington kept on that side , which , being , interpreted meant leaving [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew 's information much where it was before . [She]60-mrs. polkington wrote very nicely , somewhat involved , not at all baldly ; but reduced to plain terms [her]60-mrs. polkington letter came to this — [she]60-mrs. polkington was not going to tell [Julia]58-julia 's address or anything about [her]58-julia . So [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew read it , and very angry [he]75-rawson - clew was . And the worst of all was that on the same night that [he]75-rawson - clew received this letter , [he]75-rawson - clew also received orders to go at once to [Constantinople]49-constantinople . [He]75-rawson - clew had no time for anything and no choice but to go and leave the search . But during [his]75-rawson - clew journey across [Europe]20-europe an idea came to [him]75-rawson - clew with the suddenness of an inspiration . [He]75-rawson - clew knew what [Julia]58-julia had done — [she]58-julia had "[2241-you] retired , " even as [she]58-julia had said [she]58-julia hoped to on the first day [they]4145-they walked together . [She]58-julia had retired somewhere from shams and hypocrisy , from society and [[her]58-julia family]1195-her family ; possibly even [she]58-julia had adopted the corduroy and onions part of the ambition ; if so , that would ex plain [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother 's refusal , based on some kind of pride , to give [her]58-julia address . [She]58-julia had retired , and [she]58-julia had taken [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny with [her]58-julia , and [[her]58-julia own people]4148-her own people had washed [their]4148-her own people hands of [her]58-julia ! [He]57-johnny knew now what to look for when [he]57-johnny should come back . [He]57-johnny might not be back for two months or even three , but when [he]57-johnny did come [he]57-johnny would be able to find [Julia]58-julia and talk to [her]58-julia about the explosive — and other things . It may be here said that the wonderful explosive did not do what was expected of it , either in [England]8-england or [Holland]7-holland , for it was found to decompose on keeping . [It]1785-the land did everything else that was boasted of it , but [no one]181-no one succeeded in keeping it more than fifteen months , an irremediate defect in an explosive for military purposes . This , of course , was not discovered at first , and the honour and glory of obtaining the specimen was considerable , if only there had been [some one to take it]4150-some one to take it . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew did not consider [himself]75-rawson - clew [the person]4151-the person .[2241-you]

[Julia]58-julia was collecting fir - cones . All around [her]58-julia [the land]1785-the land lay brown and still ; dead heather , and sometimes dead bracken , a shade paler , and , more rarely , gorse bushes , nearly brown , too , in their sober winter dress . [It]1785-the land was almost flat , [a wonderful illimitable place]2243-a wonderful illimitable place , very remote , very silent , unbroken except for occasional pine - trees . These were not scattered but grew in clumps , miles apart , though looking near in [this place of distances]2244-this place of distances , and also in a belt not more than five or six trees wide , winding mile after mile like a black band over [the plain]2245-the plain . [Julia]58-julia stood on the edge of this belt now , gathering the dropped cones and putting them into a sack . The afternoon was advanced and already it was beginning to grow dark among the trees , but [she]58-julia determined not to go till [she]58-julia had got all [she]58-julia could carry . It was the first time [she]58-julia had been to collect cones ; [she]58-julia had sent [[her]58-julia father]210-her father once and [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat once . [They]2247-they had taken longer and gathered less than [she]58-julia , but it was not on that account that [she]58-julia had gone [herself]58-julia to - day . Rather it was because [she]58-julia wanted to go to the dark belt of trees which [she]58-julia saw every day from [her]58-julia window , and because [she]58-julia wanted to go right out into [the wide open land]2248-the wide open land and see what it looked like and feel what it felt like . And when [she]58-julia got [there]180-there [she]58-julia found it , like the Dunes , all [she]58-julia had expected and more . At last [she]58-julia had [her]58-julia sack full , and , shouldering it , carried it off on [her]58-julia back , which , seeing the comfort of the arrangement , must be the way [Nature]93-nature intended weights to be carried . Clear of the shadow of the trees it was lighter ; the grey sky held the light long ; twilight seemed to creep up from the ground rather than fall from above , as if darkness were [an earth - born thing that gained slowly , and , for a time , only upon the brighter gift of Heaven]2250-an earth - born thing that gained slowly , and , for a time , only upon the brighter gift of heaven . It was quieter , too , out here , for under the pines , though the weather was still , there was a breathing moan as if the trees sighed incessantly in their sleep . But out here in [the brown land]2251-the brown land it was very quiet ; the air light and dry and keen , with the flavour of [the not distant sea]2252-the not distant sea mingled with the smell of the pines and the dead ferns — a thing to stir the pulse and revive the memory of the divine inheritance and the old belief that [man]1052-man is but a little lower than the angels , related to [the infinite and god - like]2254-the infinite and god - like . [[White]147-white 's Cottage]2228-white 's cottage stood where [the heath - land ceased and the sand began]2256-the heath - land ceased and the sand began . There was much sand ; tradition said it had gradually overwhelmed [a village that lay beyond]2257-a village that lay beyond ; indeed , that [White 's Cottage]50-white 's cottage was [the last and most distant house]2258-the last and most distant house of [the lost place]2259-the lost place . Be that as it may , [it]50-white 's cottage certainly was very solitary , rather far from [the village of Halgrave]2260-the village of halgrave , with no road leading to [it]50-white 's cottage except [the track that came from [Halgrave]47-halgrave and stopped at [the cottage]4035-the cottage gate]2261-the track that came from halgrave and stopped at the cottage gate — there was nowhere to go beyond . Dusk had almost deepened to darkness when [Julia]58-julia reached [the house]175-the house ; [it]175-the house gleamed curiously in the half light , for [it]175-the house was built of flints , for the most part grey , but with a paler one here and there catching the light . [She]58-julia put [her]58-julia sack of cones in [one of the several sheds which were built on the sides of [the cottage]4035-the cottage]2264-one of the several sheds which were built on the sides of the cottage , and which , being of the same flint material , made it look larger than it was . Then [she]58-julia went into [the kitchen]220-the kitchen . [Johnny Gillat]57-johnny was there before [her]58-julia ; [he]57-johnny had been busy in [the garden]4034-the garden all the afternoon , but , with the help of the field - glasses which [he]57-johnny had not been allowed to sell , [he]57-johnny had descried [her]58-julia coming across [the open land]2268-the open land . As soon as [he]57-johnny was sure of [her]58-julia , and while [she]58-julia was still a good way off , [he]57-johnny hurried away [his]57-johnny tools into [the house]175-the house to get ready . [He]57-johnny wanted it all to look to [her]58-julia as it had to [him]57-johnny on the day when [he]57-johnny came back from cone - getting — the fire blazing , the tea ready , [the kitchen]220-the kitchen snug and neat ; very unlike [the dining - room at [Marbridge]61-denah]2271-the dining - room at marbridge with the one gas jet burning and " Bouquet "[58-julia] alight . Of course [Johnny]57-johnny did not quite succeed ; [he]57-johnny never did in matters small or great , but [he]57-johnny did [his]57-johnny best . The dinner things , which [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington was to have washed , were not done , and still about . They had to be put in [the back kitchen]2272-the back kitchen , and [Johnny]57-johnny , who had no idea of saving labour , took so long carrying them away , that [he]57-johnny hardly had time to set the tea . [He]57-johnny had meant to make some toast , but there was no time for that ; the first piece of bread had no more than begun to get warm when [he]57-johnny heard [Julia]58-julia 's step outside . But the fire was blazing nicely , and that was the chief thing ; even though the putting on of the kettle had been forgotten . When [Julia]58-julia came in and saw the fire and crooked tablecloth and hastily - arranged cups , and [Johnny]57-johnny 's beaming face , [she]58-julia exclaimed , " How cubby it looks ! Why , [you]57-johnny have got the tea all ready , and"—sniffing[58-julia] the air—"I believe [you]57-johnny are making toast ; that is nice ! "[58-julia] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat beamed ; then [he]66-mr. gillat caught sight of the kettle standing on the hearth , and [his]66-mr. gillat face fell . But [Julia]58-julia put it on the fire . " It will give [you]57-johnny good time to finish the toast while it boils , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " toast ought not to be hurried , [you]57-johnny know ; yours will be just right . "[58-julia] It was not ; it was rather smoky when it came to be eaten , the fire not being very suitable ; but that did not matter ; [Julia]58-julia declared it perfect . This was the only form of hypocrisy [she]58-julia practised in the simple life ; possibly , if [she]58-julia thought of the will more than the deed , it was really not such great hypocrisy . At all events [she]58-julia practised it ; [she]58-julia did not think truth so beautiful that frail daily life must be the better for its undiluted and uncompromising application to all poor little tender efforts . During tea the great subject of conversation was [the hen house]2273-the hen house . [The last occupant of [the cottage]4035-the cottage]2274-the last occupant of the cottage had kept hens and all [the out - buildings]2276-the out - buildings were in good repair ; however , a recent gale had loosened part of the roof of this one , and [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had been mending it . There had not been much to do ; [the Captain]172-the captain could not do a great deal ; [his]172-the captain faculties of work — if [he]172-the captain ever had any — had atrophied for want of use . Still , [he]172-the captain thought [he]172-the captain had done a good day 's work , and , as a consequence , was important and inclined to be exacting . That is the reason why [he]172-the captain had neglected the dinner things ; [he]172-the captain felt that [a man who had done all [he]2278-a man who had done all he had had]2278-a man who had done all he had was entitled to some rest and consideration . [Julia]58-julia did not mind in the least ; if [he]172-the captain was happy and contented , that was all [she]58-julia wished ; [she]58-julia never reckoned [his]172-the captain help as one of the assets of [the household]248-the household . For that matter , [she]58-julia had not reckoned [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's of much value either , but there [she]58-julia found [she]58-julia was a little mistaken . [Johnny]57-johnny was very slow and very laborious and really ingenious in finding a wrong way of doing things even when [she]58-julia thought [she]58-julia had left [him]57-johnny no choice , but [he]57-johnny was very painstaking and persevering . [He]57-johnny would do anything [he]57-johnny was told , and [he]57-johnny took the greatest pleasure in doing it . Whether it was digging in [the garden]4034-the garden , or feeding the pigs , or collecting firewood , or setting the table for meals , [he]57-johnny was certain to do everything to the best of [his]57-johnny ability , and was perfectly happy if [she]58-julia would employ [him]57-johnny . There can be no doubt that the coming to [White 's Cottage]50-white 's cottage began a time of real hap piness to [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat ; possibly the happiest since [his]57-johnny wealthy boyhood when [he]57-johnny spent lavishly and indiscriminately on [anybody]2281-anybody and [everybody]160-everybody . [The Captain]172-the captain was less happy ; [his]172-the captain satisfaction was of an intermittent order . [His]172-the captain discontent did not take the form of wishing to go back to [Marbridge]61-denah or to join [[his]172-the captain wife]168-his wife , only in feeling oppressed and misunderstood , and wishing occasionally that [he]172-the captain had not been born or had been born rich — and of course remained so all [his]172-the captain life . [He]172-the captain was dissatisfied that evening when the contentment begotten of [his]172-the captain work had worn off ; [he]172-the captain wanted to go to [the market town]2285-the market town to - morrow . [Julia]58-julia was going to get several necessaries for [the household]248-the household ; [he]172-the captain considered that [he]172-the captain ought to go too , but [she]58-julia would not take [him]172-the captain . " [You]58-julia will have a great deal to carry , "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain protested . " Yes , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia agreed ; " but [I]58-julia shall manage it . "[58-julia] " It is not fit for [you]58-julia to go about alone , "[210-her father] [[her]58-julia father]210-her father urged . [She]58-julia forebore to smile , though the novelty , not to say tardiness of the idea amused [her]58-julia ; [she]58-julia only said , " It would take [you]210-her father and [Johnny]57-johnny too long to walk into [the town]569-the town ; [we]4153-we ca n't afford to spend too long on the way , and [we]4153-we ca n't afford [a cart]4154-a cart to take [us]4153-we . "[58-julia] [The Captain]172-the captain was not convinced ; [he]172-the captain never was by [any one]187-any one 's logic but [his]172-the captain own ; perhaps because [his]172-the captain own was totally different to all other kinds , including the painful logic of facts . [He]172-the captain sighed deeply . " It is a strange , a humiliating condition of things , "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain observed to [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , " when [a father]522-a father has to ask [[his]522-a father daughter]298-his daughter 's permission to go into [town]238-town . "[172-the captain] [Johnny]57-johnny rubbed the side of [his]57-johnny chair thoughtfully , then a bright idea occurred to [him]57-johnny . " Ah , but , "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain said , " [gentlemen]3378-gentlemen always have to ask [ladies]4159-ladies ' permission before [they]3378-gentlemen can accompany [them]3378-gentlemen anywhere — especially when it is [the lady of the house]4160-the lady of the house . "[172-the captain] [A wise man]2290-a wise man might not perhaps have said this last , but [Johnny]57-johnny did , and as it happened , it did not much matter ; before [the Captain]172-the captain could answer , [Julia]58-julia rose from the table and began to clear away . Sundry household jobs had to be done in the evening ; some were always left till then ; in these short dark days it was advisable to use the light for work out of doors . At last , however , all was done , and [Julia]58-julia began to arrange for to - morrow . [The Captain]172-the captain was sulky and sure that [he]172-the captain would have rheumatism and so not be able to go out . [[His]172-the captain daughter]298-his daughter did not seem to be greatly troubled ; [she]58-julia told [him]172-the captain of some easy work in [the house]175-the house [he]172-the captain could do , or if [he]172-the captain liked and felt able , [he]172-the captain would perhaps go and get more fir - cones ; there were plenty , and they saved other fuel . [The Captain]172-the captain replied that [he]172-the captain was not in the habit of taking orders from [[his]172-the captain children]2296-his children . [Johnny]57-johnny looked unhappy ; [he]57-johnny did not like these ruffles to the tranquil life ; it always pained [him]57-johnny for [any one]187-any one to be dissatisfied , with reason or without it . When [Julia]58-julia turned to [him]172-the captain [he]172-the captain was even more ready than usual to take orders ; [he]172-the captain would have done anything [she]58-julia told [him]172-the captain from sweeping the copper flue to calling upon [the rector]2298-the rector , but secretly [he]172-the captain hoped [she]58-julia would give [him]172-the captain work in [the garden]4034-the garden . [The garden]4034-the garden was of considerable size , and , by some freak of nature , of fairly good soil , though [the field]1144-the field and most of [the surrounding land]2302-the surrounding land was very poor . [They]2303-they had all worked hard in [this plot]2304-this plot ever since [their]2303-they coming ; there was not much more to be done , or at least not much planting , which was what [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat liked . However , there had been no sharp frosts yet and [Julia]58-julia , who knew [his]172-the captain tastes , thought [she]58-julia could find something to please [him]172-the captain . [She]58-julia called [him]172-the captain to [the back kitchen]2272-the back kitchen and between [them]2306-they [they]2306-they brought from there a wooden case , the contents of which [she]58-julia began to sort over to find an occupation suitable to [him]172-the captain . The box was getting rather empty now , but there was still something in it , bulbs and seeds and printed directions , and a strange mixed smell of greyish - brown paper and buckwheat husks and the indescribable smell of [Dutch barns]2307-dutch barns . It had come from [Holland]7-holland , from [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ; it was [Mijnheer]90-joost 's present to [the disgraced companion who had been so summarily dismissed]2308-the disgraced companion who had been so summarily dismissed . When [Julia]58-julia went to [the cottage]4035-the cottage , it occurred to [her]58-julia to write to [Mijnheer]90-joost and tell [him]90-joost where [she]58-julia was , and how [she]58-julia meant to live a harmless horticultural life . [She]58-julia had come to think that perhaps [she]58-julia ought to tell [him]90-joost ; [she]58-julia knew how [her]58-julia own words , about the way [they]2306-they were thrusting [a sinner]2310-a sinner down , would stay with [him]90-joost and [[his]90-joost wife]168-his wife . [They]2306-they would quite likely grow in the slow mind of [the old man]441-the old man until [he]90-joost became uneasy and unhappy about [her]58-julia , and blamed [himself]90-joost for [her]58-julia undoing . At the time that [she]58-julia spoke [she]58-julia wasted the words to so grow and germinate ; but now , looking back , [she]58-julia could think differently ; after all [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens had only done what [they]78-the van heigens thought right , and [she]58-julia had done what [she]58-julia knew to be at least open to doubt . And [they]78-the van heigens had not thrust [her]58-julia down ; it would take considerably more than that to do anything of the sort ; [they]78-the van heigens had allowed [her]58-julia an opportunity which [she]58-julia had used to achieve a great success . And now that it was achieved and [she]58-julia had left it all behind and was settled to the simple life — [her]58-julia vague ambition — [her]58-julia heart went out to [the simple folk who had first shown [her]58-julia that it might be good ; who had been kind to [her]58-julia when there was nothing to gain , who had made [her]58-julia ashamed]2313-the simple folk who had first shown her that it might be good ; who had been kind to her when there was nothing to gain , who had made her ashamed . So [she]58-julia wrote to [Mijnheer]90-joost and told [him]90-joost that [she]58-julia had fared well , and found another situation in [Holland]7-holland after leaving [his]90-joost service . Also that [she]58-julia had now left [it]2314-it and , having inherited [a little property]2315-a little property , had come to live in [a country cottage]2316-a country cottage with [[her]58-julia father]210-her father . [She]58-julia further said that [she]58-julia meant to imitate [the Dutch]83-dutch and do [her]58-julia own house - work and also grow things , vegetables especially , in [[her]58-julia garden]2318-her garden . And [Mijnheer]90-joost , when [he]90-joost got the letter , was delighted ; so , too , was [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw ; [Joost]90-joost said nothing . [They]2319-they read the letter two or three times , showed it to [the Snieders]97-the snieders ( including [Denah]103-denah ) and to [the Dutch girl who now filled [Julia]58-julia 's situation]2320-the dutch girl who now filled julia 's situation — more or less . [They]2319-they talked over it a great deal and over [Julia]58-julia too ; [they]2319-they remembered every detail about [her]58-julia , [her]58-julia good points and [her]58-julia great fall . [They]2319-they were as delighted as [they]2319-they could be to hear that [she]58-julia was well and happy and apparently , good . [Mijnheer]90-joost especially was pleased to hear that [she]58-julia was with [[her]58-julia father]210-her father — [he]90-joost did not know [that gentleman]329-that gentleman — [he]90-joost was sure [she]58-julia would be well looked after with [him]90-joost , and that , so [he]90-joost said , was what [she]58-julia wanted . So , contrary to [their]2319-they theory , but not out of accord with [their]2319-they practice , [they]2319-they forgave the sin for the sake of [the sinner]2323-the sinner , and [Mijnheer]90-joost ordered to be packed , seeds and bulbs and plants for [[Julia]58-julia 's garden]2324-julia 's garden . [He]90-joost selected them [himself]90-joost , flowers as well as vegetables , sorts which [he]90-joost thought most suitable ; and [he]90-joost ordered [Joost]90-joost to stick to the bags strips cut out of catalogues where , in stiff [Dutch - English]51-dutch - english , directions are given as to how to grow everything that can be grown . And if [Joost]90-joost put in some sorts not included in [[his]90-joost father]614-his father 's list , and failed to tell [the good man]1451-the good man about it , it was no doubt all owing to [his]90-joost having at one time associated with [the dishonest Julia]58-julia . The packing and dispatching of the box gave great pleasure to [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ; but the receiving and un packing gave even greater pleasure when at last it reached [Miss Snooks]147-white at [[White]147-white 's Cottage]2228-white 's cottage . [Julia]58-julia had not told [Mijnheer]90-joost why [she]58-julia was [Miss Snooks]147-white now and [he]90-joost , after grave consideration , decided that it must be because of the legacy , and in fulfilment of some obscure English law of property . Having so decided , [he]90-joost addressed the case in good faith , and advised [her]58-julia of its departure . [Julia]58-julia and [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat planted the things that came in the box ; [Julia]58-julia planted most , but [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat enjoyed it even when [he]66-mr. gillat was only looking on . There was one bulb [she]58-julia set when [he]66-mr. gillat was not there to look on , but it did not come with the others . [She]58-julia chose a spot that best fulfilled the conditions described in the directions for growing daffodils and there , late one afternoon , [she]58-julia planted the bulb that [she]58-julia had brought with [her]58-julia from [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens . Afterwards [she]58-julia marked [the place]241-the place round and told [Johnny]57-johnny and [[her]58-julia father]210-her father there was a choice flower there which was not to be touched . [Julia]58-julia went to [the market town]2285-the market town as [she]58-julia had arranged . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat worked in [the garden]4034-the garden ; [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington watched [him]66-mr. gillat for a little and then went out , after spending , as [he]66-mr. gillat always did , some time getting ready . [He]66-mr. gillat took a basket with [him]66-mr. gillat ; [he]66-mr. gillat thought of collecting fir - cones and [he]66-mr. gillat objected to the sack , though it held a vast deal more ; [he]66-mr. gillat felt carrying it to be derogatory to [a soldier]3381-a soldier and [a gentleman]3384-a gentleman . It is true [he]66-mr. gillat did not get fir - cones that day , but [he]66-mr. gillat really meant to when [he]66-mr. gillat started . [Julia]58-julia , in the meantime , did [her]58-julia shopping , and , having loaded [herself]58-julia with as much as [she]58-julia could carry — more than [most people]2334-most people could except [those Continental maids and mistresses who do [their]2335-those continental maids and mistresses who do their own marketing own marketing]2335-those continental maids and mistresses who do their own marketing , [she]58-julia started for [home]249-home . It was a long walk — a long way to [Halgrave]47-halgrave and a good bit beyond that to [the cottage]4035-the cottage . [She]58-julia did not expect to reach [the village]908-the village till dusk , but [she]58-julia thought very probably [she]58-julia would find [[her]58-julia father]210-her father or [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat [there]180-there ; [she]58-julia had suggested that [one or both of [them]2342-them]2341-one or both of them should come to meet [her]58-julia and help carry the parcels the rest of the way . [Johnny]57-johnny fell in with the suggestion ; [she]58-julia saw [him]57-johnny through the twilight before [she]58-julia reached [the village]908-the village . [[Her]58-julia father]210-her father , [she]58-julia concluded , was still sulky at [her]58-julia refusal to have [his]210-her father company earlier and so would not come now . " [I]58-julia suppose [father]3307-father would not come ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , as [she]58-julia and [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat walked on after a readjustment of the burden . " Oh , no , "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny answered ; " it was not that ; [I]57-johnny 'm sure [he]3307-father would have come if [he]3307-father had been in when [I]57-johnny started , but [he]3307-father was not back then . "[57-johnny] " Not back ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia repeated . " Why , where has [he]3307-father gone ? "[58-julia] " Well , "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny replied slowly , " [he]3307-father said [he]3307-father was going to get fir - cones , but [I]57-johnny 'm not sure , [I]57-johnny did n't see [him]3307-father go across [the heath]4162-the heath . Still , [I]57-johnny dare say [he]3307-father went — [he]3307-father took a basket , so [I]57-johnny think [he]3307-father must have gone . "[57-johnny] [Julia]58-julia apparently did not find this very conclusive evidence . " There is not anywhere much about here where [he]3307-father can go , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; much less as if [she]58-julia were stating a fact than as if [she]58-julia were reviewing likely and unlikely places . " There is only [the one road]4163-the one road , and that goes to [Halgrave]47-halgrave , and there is nowhere for [him]3307-father [there]180-there . "[58-julia] " No , oh , no , "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny said ; " there really is nowhere there . "[57-johnny] " There is the ' Dog and Pheasant , ' "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia went on meditatively , " but [he]3307-father would not get anything [he]3307-father cared about [there]180-there . "[58-julia] " No , "[66-mr. gillat] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat said decidedly ; " besides [he]3307-father would not go [there]180-there , [he]3307-father would not sit in [a small country public house]4167-a small country public house and — er — and — sit there — and so on — [he]3307-father would not think of going to [such a place]4168-such a place . It is one thing when [you]4169-you are out in [the country]760-the country for a day 's fishing or something , to have a glass of ale and a piece of bread and cheese at [an inn]4171-an inn , but the other is quite different ; [he]3307-father would n't do that — oh , no . To sit in a little bar and — "[66-mr. gillat] " Booze , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia concluded for [him]57-johnny . " [Johnny]57-johnny , [you]57-johnny are always a wonder to [me]58-julia ; how [you]57-johnny have contrived to live so long and yet to keep [your]57-johnny belief in [man]1052-man unspotted from [the world]208-the world beats [me]58-julia . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny looked uncomfortable and a little puzzled . " Well , but [[your]57-johnny father]3306-your father — "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny began .
