" [[My]58-julia father]3392-my father is [a man]406-a man , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia interrupted , " and [I]58-julia would not undertake to say [a man]406-a man would not do anything — on occasions — or [a woman]3574-a woman either , for the matter of that . There is a beast in [most men]3709-most men , and an archangel in lots , and [a snob]4180-a snob , and [a prig]4181-a prig , and [a dormant hero]4182-a dormant hero , and [an embryo poet]4183-an embryo poet . There are great possibilities in [men]3625-men ; [you]4185-you have to watch and see which is coming out top and back that , and then half the time [you]4185-you are wrong . Of course , at [father]3307-father 's age , possibilities are getting over ; one or two things have come top and stay there . "[58-julia] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat opened [the cottage]4035-the cottage door and , not answering these distressing generalities , fell back on [his]66-mr. gillat one fact . " Look , "[66-mr. gillat] [he]66-mr. gillat said , pointing to an empty peg , " [he]3307-father must have gone after fir - cones ; [you]4185-you see the basket has gone ; [he]3307-father took it with [him]3307-father ; [I]66-mr. gillat am sure [he]3307-father would not have taken it to the ' Dog . ' "[66-mr. gillat] " [I]58-julia believe [their]4187-their whisky is very bad , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said , and seemed to think more of that than the argument of the basket . " [I]58-julia 'll give [him]66-mr. gillat another hour before [I]58-julia set out to look for [him]66-mr. gillat . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia gave [him]66-mr. gillat the hour and then , in spite of [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's entreaties to be allowed to go in [[her]58-julia place]545-her place , set out for [Halgrave]47-halgrave . But [she]58-julia did not have to go all the way , for [she]58-julia met [[her]58-julia father]210-her father coming back . And [she]58-julia early discovered that , if [he]210-her father had not been to the " Dog and Pheasant , "[210-her father] [he]210-her father had been somewhere else where [he]210-her father could get whisky . [They]2348-they walked [home]249-home together , and [she]58-julia made neither comments nor inquiries ; [she]58-julia did not consider that evening a suitable time . [The Captain]172-the captain was only a little muddled and , as has been before said , a very little alcohol was sufficient to do that ; [he]172-the captain was quite clear enough to be a good deal relieved by [[his]172-the captain daughter]298-his daughter 's behaviour , and even thought that [she]58-julia noticed nothing amiss . Indeed , by the morning , [he]172-the captain had [himself]172-the captain almost come to think there was nothing to notice . But alas , for [the Captain]172-the captain ! [He]172-the captain had never learnt to beware of [those deceptive people who bide [their]2353-those deceptive people who bide their time and bring into domestic life time and bring into domestic life]2353-those deceptive people who bide their time and bring into domestic life the diplomatic policy of speaking on suitable occasions only . [He]172-the captain came down - [stairs]300-stairs that morning very well pleased with [himself]172-the captain ; [he]172-the captain felt that [he]172-the captain had vindicated the rights of [man]1052-man yesterday ; this conclusion was arrived at by a rather circuitous route , but it was gratifying ; it was also gratifying to think that [he]172-the captain had been able to enjoy [himself]172-the captain without being found out . But [Julia]58-julia soon set [him]172-the captain right on this last point ; [she]58-julia did not reproach [him]172-the captain or , as [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington would have done , point out the disgrace [he]172-the captain would bring upon [them]2356-them ; [she]58-julia only told [him]172-the captain that it must not occur again . [She]58-julia also explained that , while [he]172-the captain lived in [[her]58-julia house]2357-her house , [she]58-julia had a right to dictate in these matters and , what was more , [she]58-julia was going to do so . At this [the Captain]172-the captain was really hurt ; [his]172-the captain feeling for dignity was very sensitive , though given to manifesting itself in unusual ways . " Am [I]172-the captain to be dependent for the rest of [my]172-the captain days ? "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain asked . [Julia]58-julia did not answer ; [she]58-julia thought it highly probable . " Am [I]172-the captain to be dictated to at every turn ? "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain went on . [Julia]58-julia did answer . " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia do n't think there will be any need for that . "[58-julia] [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington paid no attention to the answer ; [he]59-captain polkington was standing before the [kitchen fire]2359-kitchen fire , apostrophising things in general rather than asking questions . " Are [my]59-captain polkington goings out and comings in to be limited by [[my]59-captain polkington daughter]4188-my daughter ? Am [I]59-captain polkington to ask [her]4188-my daughter permission before [I]59-captain polkington accept hospitality or make [friends]4189-friends ? "[59-captain polkington] " [Friends]4189-friends ? "[58-julia] said [Julia]58-julia . " Then it was not ' The Dog and Pheasant ' [you]59-captain polkington went to , yesterday ? [I]58-julia thought not . "[58-julia] " Then [you]58-julia thought wrong , "[210-her father] [[her]58-julia father]210-her father retorted incautiously ; " [I]210-her father did go [there]180-there . "[210-her father] " To begin with , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia suggested ; " but [you]59-captain polkington came across [some one]3318-some one , and went on — is that it ? "[58-julia] [The Captain]172-the captain denied it , but [he]172-the captain had not [[his]172-the captain wife]168-his wife 's and [daughters]868-daughters ' gifts ; [his]172-the captain lies were always of the cowardly and uninspired kind that seldom serve any purpose . [Julia]58-julia did not believe [him]172-the captain , and set to work cross questioning [him]172-the captain so that soon [she]58-julia knew what [she]58-julia wanted . It seemed that [her]58-julia surmise was correct ; [he]172-the captain had met [some one at the " Dog and Pheasant]4193-some one at the " dog and pheasant "[4193-some one at the " dog and pheasant] ; [a veterinary surgeon who had come [there]180-there to doctor a horse]2364-a veterinary surgeon who had come there to doctor a horse . [They]2366-they had struck up an acquaintance — [the Captain]172-the captain had the family gift for that — and [the surgeon]2368-the surgeon had asked [him]172-the captain to come to [[his]172-the captain house]1886-his house on [the other side of [Halgrave]47-halgrave]2370-the other side of halgrave . When the information reached this point [Julia]58-julia said suavely , but with meaning : " Perhaps [you]59-captain polkington had better not go [there]180-there again . "[58-julia] " [I]59-captain polkington shall certainly go when [I]59-captain polkington choose , "[59-captain polkington] [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington retorted ; " [I]59-captain polkington should like to know what is to prevent [me]59-captain polkington and why [I]59-captain polkington should not ? "[59-captain polkington] [Julia]58-julia remembered [his]59-captain polkington dignity . " Shall [we]4195-we say because it is too far ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia suggested . After that [she]58-julia dismissed the subject ; [she]58-julia did not see any need to pursue it further ; [[her]58-julia father]210-her father knew [her]58-julia wishes — commands , perhaps , [he]210-her father called them — all that was left for [her]58-julia to do was to see that [he]210-her father could not help fulfilling them , and that was not to be done by much talking any more than by little . So [she]58-julia made no further comments on [his]59-captain polkington doings and , to change the subject , told [him]59-captain polkington [she]58-julia had bought some whisky in [the town]569-the town yesterday and [he]59-captain polkington had better open the bottle at dinner time . [The Captain]172-the captain stared for a moment , but quickly recovered from [his]172-the captain astonishment , though not because [he]172-the captain recognised that a little whisky at [home]249-home was part of a judicious system . [He]172-the captain merely thought that [[his]172-the captain daughter]298-his daughter was going to treat [him]59-captain polkington properly after all , and in spite of what had been lately said . This idea was a little modified when [he]172-the captain found that , though [he]172-the captain drank the whisky , [Julia]58-julia kept the bottle under lock and key . It also seemed that [she]58-julia found a way of enforcing [her]58-julia wishes , or at least preventing frequent transgressions of them , although , of course , [she]58-julia was prepared for occasional mishaps . There really was nothing at the " Dog and Pheasant "[58-julia] that [the Captain]172-the captain could put up with even if [he]172-the captain had not been always very short of money — absurdly short even of coppers — and [Julia]58-julia saw that [he]172-the captain was short . There remained nothing for [him]172-the captain but the hospitality of [acquaintances]485-acquaintances , and [they]2378-they did not abound in [Halgrave]47-halgrave , the only place within reach ; also , as [he]172-the captain declared , [they]2378-they were [a stingy lot]2379-a stingy lot . The next time [he]172-the captain called upon [[his]172-the captain new friend]2380-his new friend , [the veterinary surgeon]2381-the veterinary surgeon , [he]172-the captain was at a loss to understand this ; it was unlike [his]172-the captain previous experience of [the man]820-the man and most disagreeably surprising ; [he]172-the captain could not think why it should happen . But then [he]172-the captain had not seen [Julia]58-julia set out for [Halgrave]47-halgrave on the afternoon of the same day that [she]58-julia explained things to [him]172-the captain . [She]58-julia had on all [her]58-julia best clothes , even [her]58-julia best boots , in spite of the bad roads . [She]58-julia looked trim and dainty as [a Frenchwoman]3481-a frenchwoman , but there was something about [her]58-julia which suggested business . There are , no doubt , advantages attached to the simple life . It is decidedly easier to deal with [your]2384-you drawback when [you]2384-you do not have to pretend it has no existence . [You]2384-you can enlist help from outside if [you]2384-you can go boldly to [veterinary surgeons]2385-veterinary surgeons and [others]239-others , and say that whisky is [[your]2384-you father]3306-your father 's weakness , and would [they]2388-they please oblige and gratify [you]2384-you by not offering [him]3306-your father any .

The winter wore away ; a very long winter , and a very cold one to those at [the cottage]4035-the cottage who were used to [the mild west country]2390-the mild west country . But at last spring came ; late and with bitter winds and showers of sleet , but none the less wonderful , especially as [one had to look to see the tentative signs of its coming]2391-one had to look to see the tentative signs of its coming . March in [Marbridge]61-denah used to mean violets and daffodils , tender green shoots and balmy middays . March here means days of pale clean light and great sweeping wind which chased grey clouds across a steely sky , and stirred the lust for fight and freedom in [men]3625-men 's minds and set [them]3625-men longing to be up and away and at battle with [the world]208-the world or the elements . This restlessness , which those who have lost it call divine , took possession of [Julia]58-julia that springtime , and a dissatisfaction with the simple life and its narrow limits beset [her]58-julia . Surely , [she]58-julia found [herself]58-julia asking , this was not the end of all things — [this cottage]2394-this cottage to be the limit of [her]58-julia life and ambitions ; [her]58-julia work to grow cabbages and eat them , to keep [[her]58-julia father]210-her father in the paths of temperance and sobriety , and to make [Johnny]57-johnny 's closing days happy ? The March winds spoke vaguely of other things ; [they]2396-they whispered of the life [she]58-julia had put from [her]58-julia ; the big , wide , moving , thinking , feeling life which would have been living indeed . Worse , [they]2396-they whispered of [the man who had offered it to [her]58-julia]2397-the man who had offered it to her , [the man whom [her]58-julia heart told [her]58-julia [she]58-julia would have made [friend and comrade if only circumstances]2399-friend and comrade if only circumstances had allowed [him]2397-the man who had offered it to her to make [her]58-julia wife]2398-the man whom her heart told her she would have made friend and comrade if only circumstances had allowed him to make her wife . But [she]58-julia thrust these thoughts from [her]58-julia ; [she]58-julia had no choice , [she]58-julia never had a choice ; now less if possible than before , there was no heart - aching decision to make . The work [she]58-julia had taken up could not be put down ; [she]58-julia must go on even if voices stronger and more real than [these wind ones]2400-these wind ones called [her]58-julia out . One day the crocuses which [Mijnheer]90-joost had sent came into flower ; [Julia]58-julia thought [she]58-julia had never seen anything so beautiful as the little purple and golden cups , partly because they had been sent in kindness of heart , partly , no doubt , because [she]58-julia had grown them [herself]58-julia , and [she]58-julia had never grown a flower which had its root in the inarticulate joy of all things at the first flowering of dead brown earth and monotonous lifeless days . The next event in [her]58-julia calendar , and [Johnny]57-johnny 's , was the blooming of the fruit trees . [She]58-julia had seen [hillside orchards in [the west country]1697-the west country]2401-hillside orchards in the west country break into a foam of flower — a sight perhaps as beautiful as any [England]8-england has to show . But , to [her]58-julia mind , it did not compare with the sparse white bloom which lay like a first hoar frost on [her]58-julia crooked trees and showed cold and delicate against the pale blue sky . After that , nearly every day , there was something fresh and interesting for [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat and [Julia]58-julia , so that the March wind was forgotten , except in the ill - effect on [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington with whom it had disagreed a good deal , both in health and temper . That spring , as indeed every spring , there was a flower show in [London]9-london at [the Temple Gardens]2403-the temple gardens . The things exhibited were principally bulb flowers , ixias , iris , narcissus and the like ; the event was interesting to [growers]3416-growers , both professional and amateur . [Joost Van Heigen]77-joost came over from [Holland]7-holland to attend ; [he]77-joost was sent by [[his]77-joost father]614-his father in a purely business capacity , but of course [he]77-joost was expected , and [himself]77-joost expected , to enjoy it , too ; there would be many novelties exhibited and many beautiful flowers in which [he]77-joost would feel the sober appreciative pleasure of [the connoisseur]653-the connoisseur . [He]77-joost came to [England]8-england some days before the show ; [he]77-joost had , besides attending that , to see [some important customers on business]2407-some important customers on business , also [one or two English growers]2408-one or two english growers . Now , [certain districts of [Norfolk]40-norfolk]2409-certain districts of norfolk are very well suited to the cultivation of bulbs , so it is not surprising that [Joost]77-joost 's business took [him]77-joost [there]180-there . And , seeing that [he]77-joost had [a Bradshaw]2411-a bradshaw and a good map , and had , moreover , six months ago addressed [Julia]58-julia 's box of bulbs to [[her]58-julia nearest [railway town]2413-railway town]2412-her nearest railway town , it is not surprising that [he]77-joost found the whereabouts of [the town of Halgrave]2414-the town of halgrave . It was on Saturday night when [he]77-joost found it on the map ; [he]77-joost was sitting in [the coffee - room of [a temperance hotel]2416-a temperance hotel]2415-the coffee - room of a temperance hotel at the time . [He]77-joost had done business for the day , and , seeing that [the English]87-the english do not care about working on Sundays , [he]77-joost would probably have to - morrow as well as to - night free . [[Julia]58-julia 's town]2417-julia 's town was close — a short railway journey , then a walk to [Halgrave]47-halgrave , and then one would be at [[her]58-julia home]2418-her home — it would be a pleasant way of spending the morning of a spring Sunday . [He]77-joost thought about it a little ; [he]77-joost had no invitation to go and see [Julia]58-julia , and [he]77-joost did not like going anywhere without an invitation or an express reason . [She]58-julia might not want to see [him]77-joost , or it might put out [her]58-julia domestic arrangements if [he]77-joost came ; [he]77-joost knew domestic arrangements were subject to such disturbances . [He]77-joost hesitated some time , though it must be admitted that the fact that [he]77-joost had asked [her]58-julia to marry [him]77-joost and been refused did not come much into [his]77-joost consideration . [He]77-joost had not altered [his]77-joost mind about that proposal , and [he]77-joost did not imagine [she]58-julia had altered [hers]58-julia ; [his]77-joost devotion and [her]58-julia indifference were definite settled facts which would remain as long as either of them remained , but there was nothing em barrassing in them to [him]77-joost . At last [he]77-joost decided that [he]77-joost would go , and it was the blue daffodil which decided [him]77-joost . [He]77-joost had never heard what [Julia]58-julia had done with the bulb [he]77-joost had given [her]58-julia . It was only reasonable to think [she]58-julia had sold it , seeing it was for the sake of money [she]58-julia had wanted it , but no whisper of any such thing had reached [him]77-joost or [[his]77-joost father]614-his father . [He]77-joost longed to know about it , to hear the name of [the man who had [his]77-joost treasure]2420-the man who had his treasure ; for whom , in all probability , it was blooming now . It was some connoisseur [he]77-joost was nearly certain ; [Julia]58-julia would not have sold it to [another grower]3424-another grower . [He]77-joost had not lain any such condition on [her]58-julia , but [she]58-julia would not have done that ; [she]58-julia knew too well what it meant to [him]77-joost ; [he]77-joost never doubted [her]58-julia in that matter , [his]77-joost faith was of too simple a kind . Still [he]77-joost determined to go and see [her]58-julia , partly that [he]77-joost might hear the name of [the man who bought the blue daffodil]2422-the man who bought the blue daffodil , partly because [he]77-joost wanted to and remembered that [Julia]58-julia , in the old days , did not seem of the kind to be upset by unexpected visitors and similar small domestic accidents . It was a hot - dinner Sunday at [the cottage]4035-the cottage . These occurred alternately ; on the in between Sundays [Julia]58-julia , supported by [Johnny]57-johnny and [the Captain]172-the captain , went to [church]666-church . On those sacred to hot dinners [she]58-julia stayed at [home]249-home and did the cooking , [the Captain]172-the captain staying with [her]58-julia . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat used to also in the winter , but lately , during the spring , [he]66-mr. gillat had been induced to teach in [the Sunday school]2428-the sunday school , and now went every Sunday to [the village]908-the village , first to teach and afterwards to conduct [his]66-mr. gillat class to [church]666-church . It was [Mr. Stevens]150-mr. stevens , [the Rector of [Halgrave]47-halgrave]2431-the rector of halgrave , who had made this surprising suggestion to [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat . [He]150-mr. stevens , [good man]2432-good man , had in the course of time been to see [[his]150-mr. stevens parishioners]2433-his parishioners at [the remote cottage]2434-the remote cottage , grinding along [the deep sandy road]2435-the deep sandy road on [[his]150-mr. stevens heavy old tricycle]2436-his heavy old tricycle ; but it was not during the visit that [he]150-mr. stevens thought of [Johnny]57-johnny as [a teacher]2437-a teacher ; it was when [he]150-mr. stevens made further acquaintance with [him]57-johnny at [Halgrave]47-halgrave . [Johnny]57-johnny was [the member of [the party who went most often to [the village shop]2440-the village shop]2439-the party who went most often to the village shop]2438-the member of the party who went most often to the village shop ; [he]57-johnny liked the expedition , it gave [him]57-johnny a feeling of importance ; [he]57-johnny also liked gossiping with [the woman who kept [the shop]2442-the shop]2441-the woman who kept the shop , and [he]57-johnny dearly loved meeting [the village children]2443-the village children . On one of these occasions , when [Johnny]57-johnny was engaged in making peace between [two little girls]2444-two little girls — [little girls]2445-little girls were [his]57-johnny specialty — [the rector]2298-the rector met [him]57-johnny and it was then it occurred to [him]57-johnny that [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat might help in [the school]2447-the school . It was not much of an honour , [the school]2447-the school was in rather a bad way just now , and boasted [no other teachers]2449-no other teachers than [the rector]2298-the rector and [a raspy - tempered girl of sixteen]2451-a raspy - tempered girl of sixteen , but [Johnny]57-johnny was much flattered . [He]57-johnny thought [he]57-johnny ought to refuse ; [he]57-johnny was quite sure [he]57-johnny could not teach ; the idea of [his]57-johnny doing so was certainly new and strange ; [he]57-johnny was also sure [he]57-johnny was not virtuous enough . But in the end [he]57-johnny was persuaded to try ; [Julia]58-julia told [him]57-johnny that [he]57-johnny might hear the catechism with an open book , choose the Bible tales [he]57-johnny was surest of , to read and explain , and have [[his]57-johnny class of [little girls]2445-little girls]2452-his class of little girls to tea very often . So it came about that [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat set out Sunday after Sunday to [school]2454-school , and if [his]66-mr. gillat reading and expounding of the Scriptures was less in accord with modern light than the traditions that held in the childhood of [the nation]2455-the nation , [no one]181-no one minded ; [[the children]740-the children at [Halgrave]47-halgrave]2458-the children at halgrave were not painfully sharp , and [they]2458-the children at halgrave soon got to love [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat with a friendly lemon - droppish love which was not critical . [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington did not approve of the Sunday - school teaching , especially on those days when [he]59-captain polkington had to clean the knives . The Sunday when [Joost Van Heigen]77-joost came was one of these . [The Captain]172-the captain watched [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's preparations with a disgusted face ; at last [he]172-the captain remarked , " [I]172-the captain wonder if [you]66-mr. gillat think [you]66-mr. gillat do any good by this nonsense ? "[172-the captain] [Johnny]57-johnny , who had got as far as the doorstep , stopped and considered rather as if the idea had just occurred to [him]57-johnny . " There must be [teachers]4196-teachers , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said at length , looking round at [the open landscape]2460-the open landscape ; " and there are n't many about . "[57-johnny] " [You]66-mr. gillat are [a fine teacher]4197-a fine teacher ! "[172-the captain] [the Captain]172-the captain sneered . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat rubbed [his]66-mr. gillat finger along the edge of the Bible [he]66-mr. gillat carried . " [I]66-mr. gillat was wild , "[66-mr. gillat] [he]66-mr. gillat confessed ; " yes , [I]66-mr. gillat was , [I]66-mr. gillat do n't think — but then [the rector]2298-the rector said — and [Julia]58-julia — "[66-mr. gillat] [His]66-mr. gillat meaning was rather obscure , but possibly [the Captain]172-the captain followed it although [he]172-the captain did cut [him]66-mr. gillat short by saying , " [I]172-the captain should never have expected it of [you]66-mr. gillat ; if [any one]187-any one had told [me]172-the captain that [you]66-mr. gillat , [one of [us]4201-we]4200-one of us , would take to this sort of thing , [I]172-the captain would not have believed it . [I]172-the captain mean , if [they]187-any one had told [me]172-the captain in the old days , before things were changed and broken up , when [we]4201-we were still alive and things moved at a pace — when [a man]406-a man knew if [he]406-a man were alive or dead and whether it was night or morning . "[172-the captain] " Yes , yes , "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny said , but not altogether as if [he]57-johnny regretted the passing of those golden days ; " things were different then ; [we]4201-we did n't think of it then . "[57-johnny] " Teaching in [the Sunday school]2428-the sunday school ? "[172-the captain] [the Captain]172-the captain asked . " Not quite ! And if [we]4201-we had , [we]4201-we should n't have thought of coming to it even when [we]4201-we had got old and foolish . "[172-the captain] [Johnny]57-johnny looked uncomfortable and unhappy ; then a bright idea occurred to [him]57-johnny . " There was n't [a Sunday school]4204-a sunday school [there]180-there , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said . " [You]172-the captain remember [the hill station]4206-the hill station ? "[57-johnny] Just then [Julia]58-julia called from [the house]175-the house , " [Father]73-father , [I]58-julia believe [we]4201-we might have a dish of turnip tops if [you]73-father would get them . [Johnny]57-johnny , [you]57-johnny will be late if [you]57-johnny do n't start soon . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny promptly started , and [the Captain]172-the captain , less promptly , sauntered away to find a basket for the turnip tops , muttering the while something about people whose religion took the form of going out and leaving [others]239-others to do the work . But by the time [Joost Van Heigen]77-joost arrived , [the Captain]172-the captain was quite amiable again . [He]77-joost had had a quiet morning with nothing to do after the turnip tops were brought in and the knives cleaned , and [Johnny]57-johnny had had a long tiring walk [home]249-home from [church]666-church in a hot sun and a high wind , which [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington felt to be a just dispensation of Providence to reward [those who stopped at [home]249-home and cleaned knives]2470-those who stopped at home and cleaned knives . [Joost]77-joost arrived not long after [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat ; [Julia]58-julia heard the gate click as [she]58-julia was taking the meat from before the fire . " Who is that , [Johnny]57-johnny ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked . [Johnny]57-johnny , who had just come down - [stairs]300-stairs after taking off [his]57-johnny Sunday coat , looked out of the window . " [I]77-joost do n't know , "[77-joost] [he]77-joost said ; " [a young man]4207-a young man . "[77-joost] [Julia]58-julia , having deposited the joint on the dish , went to [the kitchen]220-the kitchen door . " Put the meat where it will keep hot , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said to [Johnny]57-johnny ; " [I]58-julia expect it 's [some one who thinks [the last people]4209-the last people live [here]371-here still]4208-some one who thinks the last people live here still ; fortunately there is enough dinner . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia pushed open the unlatched door and saw [the visitor]374-the visitor going round to the front . " [Joost]77-joost ! "[58-julia] [she]58-julia exclaimed . " Why , [Joost]77-joost , is it really [you]77-joost ? "[58-julia] [She]58-julia ran down [the garden path]2475-the garden path after [him]77-joost and [he]77-joost , turning just before [he]77-joost reached the front door , stopped . " Good - morning , [miss]3367-miss , "[77-joost] [he]77-joost said solemnly , removing [his]77-joost hat with a sweep . " [I]77-joost hope [I]77-joost see [you]3367-miss well . [I]77-joost do not inconvenience [you]3367-miss — [you]3367-miss are perhaps engaged ? "[77-joost] " Come in , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ; " [I]58-julia am glad to see [you]77-joost ! "[58-julia] There was no mistaking the sincerity of [her]58-julia tone ; [Joost]77-joost 's solemn face relaxed a little . " [You]3367-miss are not occupied ? "[77-joost] [he]77-joost said ; " [I]77-joost do not disturb [you]3367-miss ? "[77-joost] " Yes , occupied in dishing up the dinner , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said , " which is just the best of all times for [you]77-joost to have come . [Johnny]57-johnny ! "[58-julia] [she]58-julia called ; " [Johnny]57-johnny , [Joost]77-joost is here . "[58-julia] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , who had been carefully placing the dish where the cinders would fall into it , came to the door . " This is [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , [a very old friend of mine]4212-a very old friend of mine , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia explained , and [Joost]77-joost bowed deeply , offering [his]77-joost hand and saying , " [I]77-joost hope that [you]66-mr. gillat are well , [sir]3376-sir . "[77-joost] [Whereupon Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat impressed , imitated [him]77-joost as nearly as [he]77-joost could , and [Julia]58-julia looked away . [They]2476-they had dinner in [the kitchen]220-the kitchen on Sundays as well as week days , [they]2476-they made no difference to - day . [Joost]77-joost looked round [him]77-joost once or twice ; [he]77-joost had never seen [a place like this]2478-a place like this . [It]2479-it was [the front kitchen]2480-the front kitchen ; the cooking and most of [the house]175-the house - work was done in the back one , [a big barn - like place with doors in all corners]2482-a big barn - like place with doors in all corners . [The front one]2483-the front one was half [a kitchen]2484-a kitchen and half [a sitting - room , warm - coloured , with red - tiled floor and low ceiling , heavily cross - beamed and hung with herbs and a couple of hams , in great contrast to the whiteness of the kitchen at [the bulb farm]2486-the bulb farm]2485-a sitting - room , warm - coloured , with red - tiled floor and low ceiling , heavily cross - beamed and hung with herbs and a couple of hams , in great contrast to the whiteness of the kitchen at the bulb farm . There were brass and copper pots and pans such as [he]77-joost knew , but they reflected an open fire , a dirty extravagance unknown to [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw . [Joost]77-joost glanced at the fire , and it is to be feared that [he]77-joost was at heart [a traitor to [his]77-joost native customs]2487-a traitor to his native customs . Then [he]77-joost looked at the open window where the sunshine streamed in — as was never permitted in [Holland]7-holland — and [he]77-joost wondered if it really spoilt things very much , and , being [a florist]2488-a florist , thought it certainly would spoil the tulips in the mug that stood on the wide sill . During dinner [they]2489-they spoke English for the sake of [the Captain]172-the captain and [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat ; [Joost]77-joost spoke well , if slowly , with a careful and accurate precision . [He]77-joost also observed much , both of outside things , as the fact that [Johnny]57-johnny and [the Captain]172-the captain cleared the table while [Julia]58-julia sat still , con trary to Dutch custom . And also of things less on the surface — as that [Julia]58-julia was [head of [the household]248-the household]2492-head of the household and that [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington was not [the impressive and authoritative person]2494-the impressive and authoritative person [Mijnheer]90-joost seemed to think . Concerning this last fact [he]77-joost made no remark when , on [his]77-joost return [home]249-home , [he]77-joost described the ways and customs of [[Julia]58-julia 's cottage]2168-julia 's cottage to [[his]77-joost parents]1076-his parents . The description served [Mevrouw]85-mevrouw at least , as representative of [all English households]2498-all english households ever afterwards . When dinner was done and everything cleared up , or rather [Julia]58-julia 's part , [she]58-julia took [Joost]90-joost into [the garden]4034-the garden . " Now , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said in Dutch , " let [us]2500-us come out and talk and look at things . "[58-julia] [They]2500-us went out and [he]90-joost began to admire [[her]58-julia orderly garden]2501-her orderly garden and to tell [her]58-julia why this plant had done well and that one had failed . [He]90-joost did not speak of the blue daffodil , [he]90-joost thought [he]90-joost could better ask about that a little later . [She]58-julia did not speak of it either by name ; [he]90-joost and it were so inseparably connected in [her]58-julia mind . " Come along , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , when [he]90-joost stopped to look into a tulip to see if its centre was as truly black as it should have been . " Come and see it . "[58-julia] [He]90-joost followed [her]58-julia obediently , but asked what it was [he]90-joost was to see . " The blue daffodil , of course , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . [He]90-joost stopped dead . " [You]58-julia have got it [here]371-here ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost exclaimed . " [You]58-julia have not sold it ? "[90-joost] " Certainly not . "[58-julia] " But why — why ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost stared at [her]58-julia in amazement . " [You]58-julia wanted money , it was for that [you]58-julia wanted the bulb , to sell ; [you]58-julia told [me]90-joost so . Do [you]90-joost not want money now ? "[90-joost] " Oh , yes , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; " but that is an incurable disease hereditary in [[our]4215-our family]4216-our family . "[58-julia] " [You]58-julia do want money ? "[90-joost] [he]90-joost inquired mystified . " This inheritance is small , not enough ? Why , then , did [you]90-joost not sell the bulb ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia shrugged [her]58-julia shoulders . " [I]58-julia could not very well , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . " But why not ? [You]90-joost thought to do so at one time ; [your]90-joost intention was to sell [it]4217-it if [you]90-joost had — "[58-julia] " Stolen [it]4217-it ? Yes , that is quite true , and it would not have mattered then . If [I]90-joost had stolen it [I]90-joost might as well have sold [it]4217-it ; one dishonourable act feels lonely without another ; it generally begets another to keep [itself]4217-it company . "[90-joost] [Joost]90-joost looked at [her]58-julia uncomprehendingly . " But why , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost persisted , clinging to the one thing [he]90-joost did understand , " why did [you]58-julia not sell it ? It was for that [I]58-julia gave it to [you]58-julia , to do with as [you]58-julia pleased ; [I]58-julia knew [you]58-julia would do only what was right and necessary . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia could have smiled a little at this last word ; it seemed as if even [Joost]90-joost had learnt to temper right with necessity to suit [her]58-julia dealings , but [she]58-julia only said , " That was one reason why [I]58-julia could not sell it . [You]90-joost expected [me]58-julia to do right , so [I]58-julia was obliged to do it ; faith begets righteousness as dishonour begets dishonour . "[58-julia] " [I]90-joost do not quite understand , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost began , but [she]58-julia cut [him]90-joost short . " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [we]4218-we always found it difficult to make things quite plain , it is no use trying now . Come and see the daffodil , [you]90-joost will understand that , at all events , and better than [I]58-julia do . It is not quite fully out yet , but very nearly , and — please do n't be disappointed — it is not a real true blue daffodil at all . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia took [him]90-joost to [the chosen spot]2502-the chosen spot and showed [him]90-joost the plant — a bunch of long narrow leaves rising from the brown earth , and in the midst of them a single stalk supporting a partly opened flower . In shape it was single , like the common wild blossom , only much bigger ; but in colour , not blue as was expected , but streaked in irregular unblended stripes of pure yellow and pure blue . The marking was as hard and unshaded as that of the old - fashioned brown and yellow tulips which [children]703-children call bulls'-eyes , and the effect , though bizarre , was not at all pretty . [Julia]58-julia did not think it so , and [she]58-julia did not expect [any one else]3366-any one else to either ; but [Joost]90-joost , when [he]90-joost saw the streaky flower , gave a little inarticulate exclamation and , dropping on [his]90-joost knees on [the path]566-the path , lifted the bell reverently so that [he]90-joost might look into it . " Ah ! "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said softly ; " ah , it is beautiful , wonderful ! "[90-joost] [He]90-joost looked up , and [Julia]58-julia , seeing the rapt and humble admiration of [his]90-joost face , forgot that there was something ludicrous in the sight of [a young man]4207-a young man kneeling on a [garden path]2507-garden path reverently worshipping a striped flower . It was no abstract admiration of the beautiful , and no cultivated admiration for the new and strange ; it was the love of [a man]406-a man for [his]406-a man work and appreciation of success in it , even if the success were another 's ; also , perhaps , in part , the expression of a deep - seated national feeling for flowers . " Is it what [you]90-joost wished ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked gently , conscious that [she]58-julia was , as always , a long way off from [Joost]90-joost . " [I]90-joost did not wish it , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said , " because [I]90-joost did not foresee it . [No one]181-no one could foresee that it would come , though it always might . It is a novelty , an accident of nature perhaps , but beautiful , wonderful ! "[90-joost] " Is it a real novelty ? "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked . " Just as much as [your]90-joost first blue daffodil was ? Oh , [I]90-joost am glad ! Then [you]90-joost have two now . "[90-joost] " [I]90-joost ? "[90-joost] [Joost]90-joost said in surprise . " No , not [I]90-joost ; this is [yours]90-joost , not [mine]90-joost ; [you]90-joost have grown it . "[90-joost] " That 's nothing , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia returned easily ; " [you]90-joost gave [me]58-julia the bulb ; it is really [your]90-joost bulb ; [I]58-julia only just put it into the ground , [I]58-julia have had nothing to do with the novelty . "[58-julia] But if [she]58-julia thought to dispose of the matter in that way [she]58-julia soon found [she]58-julia was mistaken ; there were apparently laws governing bulb growing which were as inviolable as any governing hereditary titles . [The man who bloomed the bulb]2509-the man who bloomed the bulb was the man who had produced the novelty — if novelty it was ; [he]2509-the man who bloomed the bulb could no more make over [his]2509-the man who bloomed the bulb rights to another than [a duke]2510-a duke could [his]2509-the man who bloomed the bulb coronet . In vain [Julia]58-julia protested that it was by the merest chance that [Joost]90-joost had hit on this particular sort to give [her]58-julia , that it was only an accident which had prevented [him]90-joost from blooming it [himself]90-joost . [He]90-joost said that did not matter at all , and when [she]58-julia failed to be convinced , added that possibly , had [he]90-joost kept the bulb , the result might not have proved the same ; [her]58-julia soil and treatment were doubtless both different . [Julia]58-julia laughed at the idea , saying [she]58-julia knew nothing about soil and treatment . But [she]58-julia made no impression on [Joost]90-joost and apparently did not alter the case ; the laws of [the bulb growers]2511-the bulb growers were not only like those of the " Medes and Persians which alter not , "[58-julia] but also refused to be bent or evaded even by [a Polkington]59-captain polkington . " It is [yours]58-julia , "[90-joost] [Joost]90-joost said , as [he]90-joost took a last look at the flower before [he]90-joost rose from [his]90-joost knees ; " the great honour is [yours]58-julia , and [I]90-joost am glad of it . "[90-joost] There was something in [his]90-joost tone which reminded [Julia]58-julia of that talk [they]2512-they had had in the little enclosed place on the last day [she]58-julia was at [the bulb farm]2486-the bulb farm . [She]58-julia hastily submitted so as to avoid the too personal . " What am [I]58-julia to do with the honour ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked . " [I]58-julia do not know , that is one reason why it is absurd for [me]58-julia to have it . "[58-julia] " [You]58-julia must name [your]58-julia flower , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost told [her]58-julia ; " and then [you]58-julia must exhibit it . Fortunately [you]58-julia are in time for the show in [London]9-london . "[90-joost] " But [I]58-julia ca n't go to [London]9-london , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; " it is out of the question for [me]58-julia to leave [home]249-home even if [I]58-julia could afford the fare , which [I]58-julia can not . "[90-joost] " But , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia objected ; " if it is exhibited with [my]58-julia name , and [you]90-joost say [my]58-julia name as [the grower]4221-the grower must appear , [[your]58-julia father]3306-your father will hear of it and then [he]3306-your father will know that [you]90-joost gave [me]58-julia a bulb — it can not be exhibited . "[58-julia] " It must be exhibited , "[90-joost] [Joost]90-joost said ; " as to [[my]90-joost father]3392-my father , [he]3306-your father knows already , [I]90-joost have told [him]3306-your father ; that does not stand in the way . "[90-joost] To this [Julia]58-julia had nothing to say ; perhaps in [her]58-julia heart [she]58-julia was a little ashamed because [she]58-julia had suspected [him]90-joost of the half honesty of only telling what was necessary when it was necessary , that [she]58-julia [herself]58-julia was likely to have practised in [his]90-joost case . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew was back in [London]9-london . [He]75-rawson - clew had not been back long , but already [he]75-rawson - clew had begun the preliminaries of a search for [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat . [He]75-rawson - clew decided that it would be easier to find [him]75-rawson - clew than [Julia]58-julia , who might possibly have changed [her]58-julia name to oblige [[her]58-julia family]1195-her family , and who certainly would be better able to hide [herself]58-julia , if [she]58-julia had a mind to , than [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat . [He]75-rawson - clew had not as yet been able to devote many days to the search , and had got no further than preliminaries ; still [he]75-rawson - clew could already see that it was not going to be easy and might possibly be long . [He]75-rawson - clew did not go to the show of spring flowers ; [he]75-rawson - clew did not feel the least interest in it , but when by chance [he]75-rawson - clew met [Lillian Farham]152-miss farham [she]152-miss farham spoke of it to [him]75-rawson - clew and also of the new daffodil . " What is the name ? "[152-miss farham] Of course , it was only a coincidence and yet , when reason is not helping as much as it ought , one is inclined to take notice of signs and coincidences . What [he]75-rawson - clew discovered did not amount to much , very little in fact , but such as it was , it was enough to bring [him]75-rawson - clew to [Halgrave]47-halgrave .

[Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington , [Johnny]57-johnny and [Julia]58-julia were busy in [the garden]4034-the garden . It was a fine afternoon following after two or three wet days and the ground was in splendid condition for planting , also for sticking to clothes . [The sandy road]2541-the sandy road to [Halgrave]47-halgrave dried quickly , but [the garden]4034-the garden , of heavier soil , did not , as was testified by [Julia]58-julia 's boots — [she]58-julia had bought a small pair of [plough - boy]2543-plough - boy 's boots that spring and was wearing them now , very pleased with the investment . By and by the sound of a motor broke the silence ; [the Captain]172-the captain and [Johnny]57-johnny left off work to listen ; at least , [Johnny]57-johnny did ; [the Captain]172-the captain was hardly in a position to leave off , seeing that [he]172-the captain was off most of [his]172-the captain time . " It sounds like [a motor - car]4252-a motor - car , "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny said , as if [he]57-johnny had made a discovery . " Then it must have lost its way , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered , giving all [her]58-julia attention to [her]58-julia cabbage plants . [Johnny]57-johnny said " Yes . "[57-johnny] It certainly seemed likely enough ; [the ubiquitous motor - car]2546-the ubiquitous motor - car went everywhere certainly ; even , it was possible to imagine , to remote and uninteresting [Halgrave]47-halgrave . But along [the ill - kept sandy road which led to [[White]147-white 's Cottage]2228-white 's cottage]2547-the ill - kept sandy road which led to white 's cottage and nowhere else , none had been yet , nor was it in the least likely that [one]3325-one would ever come except by accident . The sounds drew nearer . " It certainly is coming this way , "[172-the captain] [the Captain]172-the captain said ; " [I]172-the captain will go and explain the mistake to [the people]3500-the people . "[172-the captain] [The Captain]172-the captain went to the gate ; but [he]172-the captain did not stop there , nor did [he]172-the captain explain anything . [His]172-the captain eyesight , never having been subjected to strain or over work , was good , and [the car]2552-the car , owing to the loose nature of [the road]3464-the road , was not coming very fast ; [he]172-the captain saw it had only [one occupant]2554-one occupant , [a man who seemed familiar to [him]172-the captain]2555-a man who seemed familiar to him . For a second [the Captain]172-the captain stared , then [he]172-the captain turned and went into [the house]175-the house in surprising haste . [He]172-the captain had not the least idea what had brought [this man]402-this man [here]371-here ; indeed , when [he]172-the captain came to think about it , [he]172-the captain was sure it must have been some mistake about [the road]3464-the road . But [he]172-the captain had no desire to explain ; [he]172-the captain felt [he]172-the captain was not [the person to do so]2561-the person to do so , seeing that the last ( and first ) time [he]172-the captain had seen [the man]820-the man was in an unpleasant interview at [Marbridge]61-denah . [He]172-the captain connected several painful things , humiliation , undeserved epithets , and so on , with that interview and with the face of [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew . Accordingly , [he]172-the captain went into [the house]175-the house and waited , and [the car]2552-the car came nearer and stopped . [Johnny]57-johnny and [Julia]58-julia went on with [their]2565-they work ; [they]2565-they imagined [the Captain]172-the captain was talking to [the strangers]2567-the strangers ; [they]2565-they had no idea of [his]172-the captain discreet withdrawal until [Julia]58-julia came round the corner of [the house]175-the house to fetch a trowel , and saw [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew coming up [the path]566-the path . [Julia]58-julia 's first feeling was blank amazement , but being [a Polkington]59-captain polkington , and being that before [she]58-julia took to the simple life and its honest ways , [she]58-julia allowed nothing more than polite surprise to appear . " Why ! "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " [I]58-julia had no idea [you]172-the captain were anywhere near [here]371-here . "[58-julia] " [I]172-the captain had no idea that [you]58-julia were until recently , "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain returned . Meanwhile [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington sat in [the kitchen]220-the kitchen listening for the sound of [the departing motor]2573-the departing motor . But it did not come ; everything was still except for the ceaseless singing of larks , to which [he]59-captain polkington was so used now that it had come almost to seem like silence . [He]59-captain polkington began to grow uneasy ; what if , after all , [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew were not [here]371-here by accident and mistake . What if [he]75-rawson - clew had come on some wretched and uncomfortable business ? [The Captain]172-the captain could not think of anything definite , but that , [he]172-the captain felt , did not make it impossible . [The man]820-the man certainly had not gone , [he]75-rawson - clew must be staying talking to [Julia]58-julia . Well , [Julia]58-julia could talk to [him]75-rawson - clew , [she]58-julia was more fit to see the business through than [[her]58-julia father]210-her father was . There was some comfort in this thought , but it did not last long , for just then the silence was broken , there was a sound of steps , not going down the path to the gate , but coming towards the [kitchen]2578-kitchen door ! [The Captain]172-the captain rose hastily — it was too bad of [Julia]58-julia , too bad ! [He]59-captain polkington was not fit for these shocks and efforts ; [he]59-captain polkington was not what [he]59-captain polkington used to be ; the terrible cold of the winter in [this place]2580-this place had told on [his]59-captain polkington rheumatism , on [his]59-captain polkington heart . [He]59-captain polkington crossed [the room]205-the room quickly . The door which shut in the staircase banged as that of [the big kitchen]2582-the big kitchen was pushed open . " [You]59-captain polkington had better take [your]59-captain polkington boots off [here]371-here , [Johnny]57-johnny , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; " [you]59-captain polkington have got lots of mud on them . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia took off [her]58-julia own as [she]58-julia spoke , slipping out of them without having much trouble with the laces . [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew watched [her]58-julia , finding a somewhat absurd satisfaction in seeing [her]58-julia small arched feet free of the clumsy boots . " Are not [your]58-julia stockings wet ? "[75-rawson - clew] [he]75-rawson - clew said . " No , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered ; " not a bit . "[58-julia] " Are [you]75-rawson - clew quite sure ? [I]57-johnny think they must be . "[57-johnny] " No , they are not ; are they , [Johnny]57-johnny ? "[58-julia] [She]58-julia stood on one foot and put the other into [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat 's hand . [Johnny]57-johnny felt it carefully , giving it the same consideration that [a wise housekeeper]2583-a wise housekeeper gives to the airing of sheets , then [he]57-johnny gave judgment in favour of [Julia]58-julia . " [I]58-julia was right , [you]57-johnny see , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " they are quite dry . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia looked up as [she]58-julia spoke , and met [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew 's eyes ; there was something strange there , something new which brought the colour to [her]58-julia face . [She]58-julia went quickly into [the other kitchen]2584-the other kitchen and began to get the tea . [Johnny]57-johnny came to help [her]58-julia , and [the visitor]374-the visitor offered [his]57-johnny assistance , too . [Julia]58-julia at once sent [the latter]2586-the latter to the pump for water , which [she]58-julia did not want . When [he]57-johnny came back [she]58-julia had recovered [herself]58-julia , had even abused [herself]58-julia roundly for imagining this new thing or misinterpreting it . There was no question of [man]1052-man and [woman]2588-woman between [her]58-julia and [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew ; there never had been and never could be ( although [he]57-johnny had asked [her]58-julia to marry [him]57-johnny ) . It was all just impersonal and friendly ; it was absurd or worse to think for an instant that [he]57-johnny had another feeling , had any feeling at all — any more than [she]58-julia . And again [she]58-julia abused [herself]58-julia , perhaps because it is not easy to be sure of feelings , either [your]2589-you own or [other people]3728-other people 's , even if [you]2589-you want to , and it certainly is not easy to always want what [you]2589-you ought . Moreover , there was a difference ; it was impossible to overlook it , [she]58-julia felt in [herself]58-julia or [him]57-johnny , or both . [She]58-julia had altered since [they]2591-they parted at [the Van Heigens ']78-the van heigens , perhaps grown to be [a woman]3574-a woman . After all [she]58-julia was [a woman]3574-a woman , with a great deal of [the natural woman in [her]58-julia]2594-the natural woman in her , too , [he]57-johnny had said — and [he]57-johnny was [a man]406-a man , [a gentleman]3384-a gentleman , first , perhaps , polished and finished , [[her]58-julia senior]2597-her senior , [[her]58-julia superior]1120-her superior — yet [a man , possibly with [his]57-johnny share of [the natural man]1137-the natural man]2599-a man , possibly with his share of the natural man , the thing on which one can not reckon . So [the Captain]172-the captain sat contentedly and listened for the sound of going , but [he]172-the captain did not hear it ; [they]2605-they were a very long time over tea , [he]172-the captain thought . [They]2605-they were ; [two of [them]2605-they]2606-two of them were purposely spinning it out , the third was only a happy chorus . And [he]75-rawson - clew was quite willing to wait too ; [he]75-rawson - clew was enjoying the present moment with a curious light - hearted enjoyment much younger than [his]75-rawson - clew years . "[59-captain polkington] [He]59-captain polkington turned [her]2618-she so that [she]2618-she could look at [him]59-captain polkington , the thing [she]2618-she dared not do . [His]59-captain polkington touch was light , almost momentary , but it was too much , it thrilled through [her]2618-she wildly , irresistibly , and [she]2618-she drew back fearing to do anything else . " Do n't ! "[2618-she] [she]2618-she said , and [her]2618-she voice was sharp with the anger of pain . [He]59-captain polkington stepped back a pace . " Thank [you]2618-she , "[59-captain polkington] [he]59-captain polkington said ; " [I]59-captain polkington am answered . "[59-captain polkington] [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had been dozing ; there really was nothing else to do ; but suddenly [he]59-captain polkington was aroused ; there was a sound below ; the motor moving at last . Yes , it was going , really going ; [he]59-captain polkington went to the window and , taking care not to be seen , watched [the car]2552-the car go down [the sandy road]2541-the sandy road . After that [he]59-captain polkington went down - [stairs]300-stairs , and finding [Johnny]57-johnny , who had finished [his]57-johnny watering , persuaded [him]59-captain polkington to come for a stroll on [the heath]4162-the heath . [They]2627-they took a basket to bring [home]249-home anything [they]2627-they might find , and shouted news of [their]2627-they intention to [Julia]58-julia , who did not answer , then set out . Now , in the present state of [their]2627-they development , motors are not things on which [a man]406-a man can always rely . More especially is this the case when [any one like [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat]2630-any one like mr. gillat has had anything to do with [them]2627-they . [The obliging Johnny]57-johnny , had arranged the inside of [[Rawson - Clew]74-rawson - clew 's car]2631-rawson - clew 's car , covering up what [he]57-johnny thought might be hurt by the sun and blowing sand while [it]2631-rawson - clew 's car stood at the roadside , and taking into [the house]175-the house when [he]57-johnny went in to tea , anything that could be stolen if — as was quite out of the question — one came that way with a mind to steal . [Johnny]57-johnny had brought back most of the things and replaced them before [Rawson - Clew]74-rawson - clew started , but not quite all . When [the car]2552-the car had got a little distance down [the road]3464-the road [it]2552-the car , with a perversity worthy of [a reasonable being]2635-a reasonable being , developed a need for the forgotten item . [Rawson - Clew]74-rawson - clew searched for it , could not find it , discovered that [he]74-rawson - clew could not get on without it , and , thinking if not saying something not very complimentary about [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , walked back to [the cottage]4035-the cottage . [He]74-rawson - clew supposed [he]74-rawson - clew would find [Johnny]57-johnny in [the garden]4034-the garden , but [he]74-rawson - clew did not ; [he]74-rawson - clew and [the Captain]172-the captain were some way out on [the heath]4162-the heath now , and , fortunately for [the latter]2586-the latter 's peace , [neither]2641-neither saw [any one]187-any one approach [the cottage]4035-the cottage . [Rawson - Clew]74-rawson - clew looked round [the garden]4034-the garden and finding [no one]181-no one decided , rather reluctantly , that [he]74-rawson - clew must go to [the house]175-the house . [He]74-rawson - clew did not want to meet [Julia]58-julia again ; [he]74-rawson - clew thought it rather unlikely that [she]58-julia should still be in [the kitchen]220-the kitchen , but there was a chance of it , so [he]74-rawson - clew approached with a view to reconnoitering before presenting [himself]74-rawson - clew . [The outer kitchen]2610-the outer kitchen , which partook rather of the nature of [a wash - house]2649-a wash - house , had a large unglazed window ; when [he]74-rawson - clew drew near to this [he]74-rawson - clew heard a noise from within . It sounded like [some one]3318-some one sobbing , not quiet sobs , but slow deep spasmodic ones like the last remains of a tempest of tears which has not spent itself but only been imperfectly suppressed by sheer will . [Rawson - Clew]74-rawson - clew paused though possibly [he]74-rawson - clew had no business to do so . " Oh , why , "[3325-one] [one]3325-one wailed from within , " why is not [father]3307-father dead ? If [he]3307-father were dead — if only [he]3307-father had been dead ! "[3325-one] The unglazed window was large and rather high up , but [Rawson - Clew]74-rawson - clew was [a man of fair height]2652-a man of fair height ; [he]74-rawson - clew was also usually considered [an honourable one]2653-an honourable one , but when [he]74-rawson - clew heard the voice , saying something which was plainly only meant for the hearing of Omnipotence , [he]74-rawson - clew did not go away . [He]74-rawson - clew put [his]74-rawson - clew hands on the flintwork of the window - sill and in a moment found [himself]74-rawson - clew in the twilight of [the unceiled kitchen]2654-the unceiled kitchen . [Julia]58-julia was crouching in a corner , [her]58-julia elbows on the old chopping - block , [her]58-julia face hidden on [her]58-julia tightly - clenched hands , while [she]58-julia struggled angrily with the shaking sobs . For a moment [she]58-julia struggled , then mastered [herself]58-julia somehow and looked up , perhaps because [she]58-julia meant to rise and set about [her]58-julia work . [She]58-julia had been crying hard and tears do not improve the average face , certainly they did not [hers]58-julia ; and [she]58-julia had been trying hard to stop , cramming a screwed - up handkerchief into [her]58-julia eyes and that did not improve matters either . [One]3325-one would have said [her]58-julia face could have expressed nothing but the extremity of unbecoming woe , yet when [she]58-julia caught sight of [Rawson - Clew]74-rawson - clew standing just under the window it changed extraordinarily and to anger . " Go away ! "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " go away ! Do [you]74-rawson - clew hear ? [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington was watching a pan of jam . It was the middle of the day and warm ; too warm to be at work out of doors , as [Johnny]57-johnny was , at least so [the Captain]172-the captain thought . [He]59-captain polkington also thought it too warm to watch jam in [the back kitchen]2272-the back kitchen and that occupation , though it was the cooler of [the two]960-the two , had the further disadvantage of being beneath [his]59-captain polkington dignity . The dignity was suffering a good deal ; was it right , [he]172-the captain asked [himself]172-the captain , that [he]172-the captain , [the man of [the house]175-the house]2674-the man of the house , should have the menial task of watching jam while [Julia]58-julia talked business with [some one in [the parlour]2677-the parlour]2676-some one in the parlour ? [He]172-the captain did not know what business [this person]2678-this person had come on ; [he]172-the captain had seen [him]2678-this person arrive a few minutes back , had even heard [his]2678-this person name — [Mr. Alexander Cross]79-cross — but that was all [he]172-the captain knew about [him]2678-this person ; [Julia]58-julia had taken [him]2678-this person into [the parlour]2677-the parlour and shut the door . Naturally [[her]58-julia father]210-her father felt it and was annoyed . There was a door leading into [the parlour]2677-the parlour from [the front kitchen]2480-the front kitchen . It was fast closed but [the Captain]172-the captain , leaving the jam to attend to [itself]2684-itself , went and looked at [it]2684-itself . While [he]172-the captain was standing there [he]172-the captain heard three words spoken on the other side by [the visitor]374-the visitor ; they were—"your new daffodil . "[374-the visitor] So that was the business [this man]402-this man had come on ! [He]402-this man was trying to buy [Julia]58-julia 's ugly streaked flower . [The Captain]172-the captain 's weak mouth set straight ; [he]172-the captain felt very strongly about the daffodil and [[his]172-the captain daughter]298-his daughter 's refusal to sell it . [He]172-the captain knew [she]58-julia might have done so ; [she]58-julia had had a good many letters about it since it was exhibited in [London]9-london . [She]58-julia said little about the offers they contained , but [he]172-the captain knew [she]58-julia refused them all ; [he]172-the captain had taxed [her]58-julia with it and argued the question to no purpose . Now , to - day , it seemed there was a man so anxious to buy the thing that [he]172-the captain had actually come to see [her]58-julia ; and [she]58-julia , of course , would refuse again . [The Captain]172-the captain sat down in the easy - chair ; [he]172-the captain was overcome by the thought of [Julia]58-julia 's contrary stupidity . The chair was near the door , but [he]172-the captain would have scouted the idea that [he]172-the captain was listening ; [he]172-the captain was [a man of honour]2690-a man of honour , and why should [he]172-the captain wish to hear [Julia]58-julia refuse good money ? Also it was impossible to hear all that was said unless the speakers were close to the door . Apparently [they]2691-they must have been near for no sooner had [he]172-the captain sat down than [he]172-the captain heard [the man]820-the man say , " Have n't [I]820-the man had the pleasure of seeing [you]58-julia somewhere before , [Miss Snooks]147-white ? [Your]58-julia face seems familiar though [I]820-the man ca n't exactly locate it . "[820-the man] " [We]4309-we met at [Marbridge]61-denah , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered ; " at a dance , a year and a half ago . "[820-the man] " At [Marbridge]61-denah ? Oh , of course ! Funny [I]59-captain polkington should n't have remembered when [I]59-captain polkington heard [your]58-julia name the other day ! "[59-captain polkington] [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington did not think it at all funny ; [he]59-captain polkington did not know who [Mr. Cross]79-cross might be , nobody important [he]59-captain polkington judged by [his]59-captain polkington voice and manner — [hostesses at [Marbridge]61-denah]2693-hostesses at marbridge often had to import [extra nondescript men]2694-extra nondescript men for [their]2693-hostesses at marbridge dances . But whoever [he]59-captain polkington was , if [he]59-captain polkington had been [there]180-there once [he]59-captain polkington might go [there]180-there again and carry with [him]59-captain polkington the tale of [Julia]58-julia 's doings and [home]249-home and other things detrimental to [the Polkington]59-captain polkington pride . [The Captain]172-the captain listened to hear one of [the two in the other room]2699-the two in the other room refer to the change of name which had prevented an earlier recognition . But neither did ; [she]58-julia saw no reason for it , and [he]172-the captain had forgotten [her]58-julia original name if [he]172-the captain ever knew it . " [I]172-the captain remember all about [you]58-julia now , "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain was saying ; " [you]58-julia danced with [me]172-the captain several times and asked [me]172-the captain about the [Van Heigens]78-the van heigens ' blue daffodil"—he[172-the captain] paused as if a new idea had occurred to [him]172-the captain . " [You]58-julia were not in the line then , [I]172-the captain suppose ? "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain asked .
