"[684-her companion] [They]2882-two girls moved on to another window ; [they]2882-two girls , no more than [the passers by]2863-the passers by , noticed [the old man]441-the old man who stood just at [their]2882-two girls elbow . When [they]2882-two girls had gone [he]441-the old man looked drearily in where [they]2882-two girls had looked . There were the woolly things [they]2882-two girls had spoken of , short woven strips of loopy wool , to be tied about the neck by the two - inch ribbons that dangled from the ends . " Ostrich wool boas in all colours , price , one shilling and three farthings , "[441-the old man] they were ticketed . [He]441-the old man read the ticket mechanically . [He]441-the old man still held [his]441-the old man two coins ; [he]441-the old man held them mechanically ; had [he]441-the old man thought about it [he]441-the old man would scarcely have troubled to do so , they were so cruelly , so mockingly inadequate . [He]441-the old man read the ticket again ; it obtruded itself upon [him]441-the old man as trivial things do at unexpected times . But now its meaning began to be impressed upon [his]441-the old man brain—"one shilling and three farthings"—that[1587-the servant girl] , then , was the interpretation of [the servant girl]1587-the servant girl 's " shilling three . "[441-the old man] [He]441-the old man had a shilling and a penny — a shilling and three farthings . [He]441-the old man could buy one of those ostrich wool boas — [he]441-the old man would buy it — that pink one for [Julia]58-julia . [The Halgrave carrier]2890-the halgrave carrier made it a rule to receive [[his]2890-the halgrave carrier passengers]2891-his passengers ' fares at the beginning of the expedition ; if [they]2891-his passengers were coming back as well as going with [him]2890-the halgrave carrier [they]2891-his passengers paid for the double journey at the outset in the morning . [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had so paid , and it was that fact , coupled with the early arrival at [the stables]2892-the stables of [his]59-captain polkington one purchase , which induced [the carrier]2798-the carrier to wait nearly half - an - hour for [him]59-captain polkington . [The cart]2804-the cart was packed , everything was ready , and [the good man]1451-the good man and [the only other passenger [he]441-the old man was taking back]2896-the only other passenger he was taking back were growing impatient , when [the Captain]172-the captain , carrying a small crushed paper parcel , appeared . [He]441-the old man had lost [his]441-the old man way to [the stables]2892-the stables and had wandered hopelessly in [his]441-the old man efforts to find it . [The carrier]2798-the carrier was rather short - tempered about it , and [the other passenger]2900-the other passenger said something to the effect that " [They]2905-they did n't oughter let [him]441-the old man out alone ! "[2900-the other passenger] [The Captain]172-the captain payed no attention but climbed into the back of [the cart]2804-the cart and sat down near [his]172-the captain whisky . [The other passenger]2900-the other passenger got up beside [the driver]883-the driver , and in a few minutes [they]2905-they were lumbering down [the crooked streets]2906-the crooked streets . Soon [they]2905-they were out of [the town]569-the town and jogging quietly along [the quiet lanes]2908-the quiet lanes ; [the driver]883-the driver leaned forward to get a light from [[his]883-the driver passenger]2910-his passenger 's pipe ; [his]883-the driver face for a moment showed ruddy in the glow of the one lamp , then it sunk into gloom again . [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington did not notice ; [he]59-captain polkington did not notice the voices in intermittent talk , or the fume of [their]2905-they tobacco that hung on the moist air and mingled with the scent of the drooping violets in [his]59-captain polkington coat . [He]59-captain polkington knew nothing and was aware of nothing except that [he]59-captain polkington was [the most miserable , the most unfortunate of [men]3625-men]2911-the most miserable , the most unfortunate of men . Throughout the whole interminable journey [he]59-captain polkington dwelt on that one thing as [he]59-captain polkington sat by [his]59-captain polkington whisky in the dark , clutching tightly the soft paper parcel and finding [his]59-captain polkington only fragment of comfort in it . [He]59-captain polkington had after all bought something ; poor , disappointed , fleeced as [he]59-captain polkington was , [he]59-captain polkington had spent [his]59-captain polkington last money in buying a present for [[his]59-captain polkington daughter]298-his daughter .

[The cottage]4035-the cottage was very quiet . Although it was not late , both [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington and [Johnny]57-johnny had gone to bed , the one to suit [himself]59-captain polkington , [the other]338-the other to oblige [Julia]58-julia ; [she]58-julia was in [the kitchen]220-the kitchen now , as completely alone as [she]58-julia could wish . And certainly [she]58-julia did wish it ; by the hard light in [her]58-julia eyes and the grim look about [her]58-julia mouth it was clear [she]58-julia was in no mood for company . [She]58-julia had got at the truth that evening , or most of it ; the whole affair , with the exception of one point only , was quite plain to [her]58-julia ; not by [[her]58-julia father]210-her father 's wish or intention , but plain none the less . Subterfuge was an art [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons understood so well that it was exceedingly difficult to deceive [them]56-the polkingtons ; [Julia]58-julia was the most difficult of [them]56-the polkingtons all to deceive , and [the Captain]172-the captain was least clever at subterfuge ; it was not wonderful , therefore , that [she]58-julia knew nearly all there was to know . [Her]58-julia heart was bitter within [her]58-julia , but against [herself]58-julia as well as against [[her]58-julia father]210-her father — after all [he]210-her father had but done what [she]58-julia had once thought to do . [She]58-julia had stayed [her]58-julia hand because [the one who owned the daffodil]2920-the one who owned the daffodil was [a child]824-a child to [her]58-julia . [[Her]58-julia father]210-her father had had no such reason for staying [his]210-her father ; the one who owned this daffodil was as cunning as [he]210-her father . [He]210-her father had done what [he]210-her father had , badly of course [he]210-her father could not do otherwise — a foredained failure such as [he]210-her father — bungled it hopelessly ; but the idea was the same — a bad travesty of a bad idea , badly worked out . For a moment [her]58-julia mind glanced aside from the main issue in disgust and contempt for the method . It was sin without genius , a puerile theft without adequate return , a miserable fall , and for such a purpose ! To expect to find the streaked daffodil unguarded in [an outhouse]2923-an outhouse ! To sell it for five pounds and think to spend the money on creature comforts ! It is hard to say which of the three was the worst . [The really good]2924-the really good have little idea how [such fool]2925-such fool 's knavery looks to the shadily clever ; it brings home to [them]2924-the really good the wrongness of wrong , disgusting [them]2924-the really good with it and with [themselves]2924-the really good , as no preaching in [the world]208-the world can . The moon had risen by this time ; its first beams shone in at the unshuttered window . [Julia]58-julia went to the door and , opening it , looked out . There was a little mist about and the moon , quite [a young one]2927-a young one , was struggling through it , shining with a soft , diffused light that made the landscape very unearthly . [It]2928-it was wonderfully still out of doors , quiet and damp with belts of unexplained shadow here and there , and a sense of illimitable space and silence . [Julia]58-julia sat down on the door steps and smelt the good smell of [the earth]1361-the earth and felt the nearness of it . But it did not comfort [her]58-julia ; [she]58-julia was not in tune with the night ; [she]58-julia had neither part nor lot with these things . " [Thief]4334-thief , and [daughter of [a thief]3916-a thief]4335-daughter of a thief ; "[2930-you] the words kept coming to [her]58-julia — and [he]2930-you , [the man whom [she]58-julia never named to [herself]58-julia]2931-the man whom she never named to herself , had called [her]58-julia [[his]2930-you good comrade]2932-his good comrade ! [She]58-julia bowed [her]58-julia face to [her]58-julia knees and sat motionless . [She]58-julia had told [him]2930-you the truth about [herself]58-julia ; [she]58-julia had not been ashamed ; [she]58-julia would not have been even if [she]58-julia had taken the daffodil . But [[her]58-julia father]210-her father ! [She]58-julia was ashamed for [him]2930-you with a bitter shame ; ashamed of [herself]58-julia and [him]2930-you too , in thought and intention at least [they]2934-we were [one , double - dealers]2935-one , double - dealers . " [Two grubby little people]4337-two grubby little people , "[2934-we] as [she]58-julia had seen [them]2934-we long ago when [they]2934-we first stood in company with [that man]3837-that man . " But [you]2930-you do n't know ; [you]2930-you have not [our]2934-we temptations . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia almost spoke aloud , unconsciously addressing the dewy silence as [her]58-julia mind called [the man]820-the man plainly before [her]58-julia . " [You]2930-you have never wanted money as [I]2938-her wanted it , or wanted things as [father]3307-father wanted them . Oh , [you]2930-you would despise the things [he]2930-you wanted — so do [I]2938-her ; they are miserable and mean and sordid ; [you]2930-you could n't want whisky and comfort as [he]2930-you wanted them , but [you]2930-you ca n't think how [he]2930-you did ! [He]2930-you would have justified it to [himself]2930-you too ; [you]2930-you would n't , could n't do that , while [we]2934-we — [we]2934-we could justify the devil if [we]2934-we tried . It is not right , any the more for that , [I]2938-her know it is not ; it is dishonest and disgraceful , [I]2938-her know that as well as [you]2930-you ; but [I]2938-her know how it came about and [you]2930-you — [you]2930-you can never understand ! "[2938-her] [Her]2938-her voice sank away . That was the great difference between [herself]2938-her and [this man]402-this man ; it did not lie in what [she]2938-her did ; that was a remedial matter — but rather in what [she]2938-her knew and felt . Things that did not exist for [him]402-this man were not only possible but sometimes almost necessary to [her]2938-her and [hers]2938-her . The gulf between [them]2940-them which had almost seemed bridged in the early summer was suddenly opened again by the day 's work ; opened beyond all passage for [her]2938-her — [thief]4334-thief , and [daughter of [a thief]3916-a thief]4335-daughter of a thief . [She]2938-her sat on the doorstone looking out with unseeing eyes while the moon rose higher and the light grew so that the belts of shadow melted and [the misty land]2944-the misty land was all silver , a world of dreams , very pure and still . But neither [her]2938-her dreams nor [her]2938-her thoughts were pure and still ; they were full of passion and pain , longing and regret and shame , and yet an underlying hopeless desire that all could be known and understood .

At last [she]2938-her rose and went in . The pink woolly thing [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had bought [her]2938-her lay on the [kitchen]2578-kitchen - table , half out of its paper wrappings , a silly , useless thing . As [her]2938-her eyes fell on it they grew dim and hot while the colour crept up in [her]2938-her cheek . [[Her]2938-her father]210-her father had bought it for [her]2938-her ; [he]210-her father had thought to please [her]2938-her with the foolish thing ; it was like [a child]824-a child 's or [a fool]3758-a fool 's gift ; [she]2938-her hated [herself]2938-her for hating it . But [he]210-her father had deceived [himself]210-her father into thinking [he]210-her father was generous to make it with [his]210-her father illgotten gains ; [he]210-her father had salved conscience with it — it was [a liar]2949-a liar 's gift , a self - deceiver 's , [a thief]3916-a thief 's . There was no kindness , no generosity in it , and [she]2938-her despised [him]210-her father — and [he]210-her father was [[her]2938-her father]210-her father ! [She]2938-her picked up the thing , paper and all , and crammed it into the dying fire . Then suddenly [she]2938-her burst into tears . [The world]208-the world was all wrong , justice was wrong and suffering was wrong and mankind wrong , all was wrong and inexplicable and pitiful too . For a minute [she]2938-her sobbed chokingly , then [she]2938-her forced back the tears with the angry impatience of a hurt animal , and fetching a sheet of paper and pencil , sat down to write . [He]210-her father was [[her]2938-her father]210-her father and [he]210-her father was [a man with a warped idea of honour]2954-a man with a warped idea of honour , one whose self - respect had been taken away ; it was too late to teach [him]210-her father , one could only safeguard [him]210-her father now . Opportunity did not make [[thieves]2955-thieves of such as [her]2938-her]2956-thieves of such as her , but it did of such as [him]210-her father , and [she]2938-her had left the opportunity — or what [he]210-her father took to be it — open . [She]2938-her would close it now for ever ; [she]2938-her would be rid of the bulb , the cause of so much trouble . So [she]2938-her wrote hurriedly , a mere scrawl , while the passion was still upon [her]2938-her , and [her]2938-her eyes were still dim with tears — " [Joost]77-joost , if [you]77-joost have ever cared for [me]2938-her , take back the daffodil ; take it back and do n't ask [me]2938-her why . "[2938-her] The next morning [Julia]58-julia posted a small parcel , and at dinner time told [Johnny]57-johnny and [[her]58-julia father]210-her father that [she]58-julia had sent the famous daffodil back to [[its]2958-its [native land]2960-native land]2959-its native land . [Johnny]57-johnny looked up in mild surprise ; [he]57-johnny had been to [the outhouse]2961-the outhouse that morning to see if the bulbs were keeping dry . " Why , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said , " it 's in [the shed]2758-the shed ! "[57-johnny] " No , it is not , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered , " and it never was . The one [you]77-joost think it is one of [the large double pale ones]4340-the large double pale ones ; [I]58-julia told [you]77-joost at the time [we]4341-we put them away , but [you]77-joost have got mixed , [I]58-julia expect . "[58-julia] " Ah , yes , of course , "[66-mr. gillat] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat said ; " [I]66-mr. gillat remember now ; of course , [I]66-mr. gillat remember . "[66-mr. gillat] [The Captain]172-the captain swallowed something , but contrived to keep quiet , and only darted a glance at [Johnny]57-johnny , [the muddler , whose information could never be depended on]2963-the muddler , whose information could never be depended on . When the meal was over and [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat in [the back kitchen]2272-the back kitchen , [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington spoke to [[his]59-captain polkington daughter]298-his daughter . " [Julia]58-julia , "[59-captain polkington] [he]59-captain polkington said , moistening [his]59-captain polkington dry lips , " [that man]3837-that man [Cross]79-cross thought it was the streaked daffodil that [I]59-captain polkington , that — "[59-captain polkington] [His]59-captain polkington voice tailed away , but [Julia]58-julia only said , " Well ? "[58-julia] " [I]58-julia pledged by word of honour that it was [the true one]4343-the true one . "[58-julia] Again [Julia]58-julia said , " Well ? "[58-julia] " What is to be done ? "[172-the captain] [the Captain]172-the captain asked . [She]58-julia showed no signs of grasping [his]172-the captain meaning or at all events of helping [him]172-the captain out . [He]172-the captain burst out irritably , " What on earth have [you]58-julia sold it for ? Nothing would induce [you]58-julia to do so before when [I]172-the captain asked [you]58-julia to ; now , all at once [you]58-julia have taken a freak and parted with it without any consideration whatever . [I]172-the captain never saw anything like [women]3573-women , so utterly irrational ! "[172-the captain] " [I]58-julia have not sold it , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia told [him]172-the captain ; " only sent [it]4345-it away . "[58-julia] " What for ? It is perfectly absurd ! [I]58-julia suppose [you]58-julia can get it back ? [You]58-julia must get it back . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia asked " What for ? "[58-julia] in [her]58-julia turn . [The Captain]172-the captain enlightened [her]58-julia . " There is [Cross]79-cross , "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain said ; " [I]172-the captain told [him]79-cross that was the daffodil , and it is not . Something must be done ; [we]4346-we ca n't cheat [him]79-cross ; [we]4346-we must send [him]79-cross the daffodil , or else refund the five pounds . [We]4346-we should have to do that — and [we]4346-we ca n't . "[172-the captain] " No , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia agreed grimly ; " and [we]4346-we would not if [we]4346-we could . "[58-julia] " But what are [you]58-julia going to do ? "[210-her father] [[her]58-julia father]210-her father asked . " Nothing . "[210-her father] " Nothing ! But [I]58-julia pledged [my]58-julia word ! [You]210-her father do n't understand , [I]58-julia am in honour bound . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia forbore to make and comment on [[her]58-julia father]210-her father 's notion of honour ; indeed , it struck [her]58-julia as almost pathetic in its grotesqueness and certainly very characteristic of [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons . " [Cross]79-cross paid five pounds for the streaked daffodil , "[172-the captain] [the Captain]172-the captain went on to say , believing that [he]172-the captain was stating the case with incontrovertible plainness , " and if [he]79-cross does not have the true bulb [he]79-cross must have the money back ; otherwise [he]79-cross will , with justice , say [he]79-cross has been cheated , for [I]172-the captain guaranteed the thing . "[172-the captain] " [He]79-cross paid five pounds for a speculation , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; " [your]59-captain polkington guarantee was nothing , and though [he]79-cross may have asked for it , it was just a form and did not count one way or the other . [He]79-cross knew there was a chance that [you]58-julia had come by the true bulb somehow and so had it to sell ; [he]79-cross risked five pounds on that — and lost it . "[58-julia] [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington looked bewildered . " [He]79-cross paid five pounds for the bulb , "[59-captain polkington] [he]59-captain polkington persisted ; " [he]79-cross said it was worth no more to [him]79-cross . "[59-captain polkington] " Very likely not , if [he]79-cross could get it for that , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; " but if [he]79-cross could have been sure of it , it would have been worth two hundred pounds . "[58-julia] " Two hundred ! "[59-captain polkington] [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington gasped , turning rather white . [Julia]58-julia nodded . " With [my]58-julia guarantee , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said . " [You]59-captain polkington had not got that ; [I]58-julia suppose [you]59-captain polkington let [him]79-cross see it when [you]59-captain polkington wrote first so [he]79-cross knew that , though [you]59-captain polkington might have the real bulb , [you]59-captain polkington were not in a position to sell it well . "[58-julia] [The Captain]172-the captain flushed as suddenly as [he]172-the captain had paled . " [You]58-julia think [he]79-cross thought [I]172-the captain had not come by it honestly , that [I]172-the captain had no right in [[my]172-the captain daughter]4188-my daughter 's affairs ? "[172-the captain] " [I]58-julia do n't see it matters what [he]79-cross thought , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered , taking up the dishes . " [He]79-cross risked [his]79-cross money , and lost it , knowing very well what [he]79-cross did ; [he]79-cross does not mind doing business in that way ; [I]58-julia do n't admire it [myself]58-julia , but [I]58-julia guessed [he]79-cross would do it when [I]58-julia first made [his]79-cross acquaintance . "[58-julia] " [You]58-julia — — "[172-the captain] [the Captain]172-the captain said . " [I]172-the captain have nothing to do with it , and shall have nothing . "[172-the captain] " But the money must be paid ; it is a debt of honour ; [I]58-julia must clear [myself]58-julia . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia shrugged [her]58-julia shoulders . " [You]58-julia do not wish [me]58-julia cleared ? "[58-julia] [[her]58-julia father]210-her father demanded haughtily . " Paying the five pounds would not clear [you]58-julia , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " neither that nor anything else . No , [I]58-julia am not going to pay it ; [I]58-julia do n't feel any obligation in the matter . If [Mr. Cross]79-cross goes in for those sort of dealings [he]79-cross must put up with the consequence , and [I]58-julia am afraid [you]58-julia must , too . "[58-julia] And with that [she]58-julia went away . This was the last reference that was made to the sale of the daffodil and the expedition to [town]238-town ; after that the matter was left out of conversation and [Julia]58-julia behaved as if it had never existed . But [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington was very unhappy ; [he]59-captain polkington could not get over the affair and [his]59-captain polkington own failure ; [he]59-captain polkington brooded over it in silence , feeling and resenting that [he]59-captain polkington could not speak to either [Johnny]57-johnny or [Julia]58-julia , [they]2975-they being quite unable to understand [his]59-captain polkington emotions . Once or twice [he]59-captain polkington raged weakly against [Cross]79-cross , who had given [him]59-captain polkington five pounds when [he]59-captain polkington had asked twenty for a thing worth two hundred ; who had doubted [his]59-captain polkington word , who had behaved as if [he]59-captain polkington were [a common thief]1045-a common thief — who would , doubtless , think [him]59-captain polkington one . More often [his]59-captain polkington indignation burnt up against [Julia]58-julia who would do nothing to remedy this last catastrophe , and clear [him]59-captain polkington and reinstate [his]59-captain polkington honour in the eyes of [this man]402-this man and [himself]59-captain polkington . Most often of all [his]59-captain polkington quarrel was with fate , and then [his]59-captain polkington anger broke down into self - pity as [he]59-captain polkington thought of all the troubles that were crowding about [his]59-captain polkington later years ; of [his]59-captain polkington lost reputation , [his]59-captain polkington lack of sympathy and comprehension ; the failure of all [his]59-captain polkington plans and hopes , the poverty and feeble health that oppressed [him]59-captain polkington . In these gloomy days [he]59-captain polkington had one ray of comfort only ; it lay in the purchase [he]59-captain polkington had made on that day that [he]59-captain polkington went shopping . That whisky was the solitary thing in the day 's adventure about which [Julia]58-julia had not heard ; everything else [she]58-julia had been told , but somehow that had escaped . One reason of this , no doubt , lay in the fact that [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had not brought [his]59-captain polkington purchase [home]249-home with [him]59-captain polkington that evening . [He]59-captain polkington had meant to ; when [the carrier]2798-the carrier set [him]59-captain polkington and [[his]59-captain polkington property]2980-his property down just outside [Halgrave]47-halgrave , [he]59-captain polkington had fully meant to carry [it]2981-it to [the cottage]4035-the cottage . But [he]59-captain polkington found it so heavy and cumbersome in [his]59-captain polkington weak and dejected state that [he]59-captain polkington had to give it up . So [he]59-captain polkington found a suitable hiding - place in [the deep overgrown ditch beside [the road]3464-the road]2983-the deep overgrown ditch beside the road , and , thrusting it as much out of sight as [he]59-captain polkington could , left it there and went [home]249-home unburdened . [He]59-captain polkington meant to tell [Julia]58-julia and [Johnny]57-johnny about it , [they]2986-they of course were to have shared , and [one or both of [them]2986-they]2341-one or both of them would go with [him]59-captain polkington to fetch it [home]249-home in the morning . But [he]59-captain polkington did not tell [them]2986-they ; it did not seem suitable at first ; [they]2986-they , each in a different way , were too unsympathetic about the expedition to [town]238-town ; [he]59-captain polkington determined to wait for a fitting opportunity . The opportunity did not come ; but in course of time the whisky was moved and gave comfort of sorts during the autumn days to [the Captain]172-the captain 's drooping spirits , if it had a less beneficial effect on [his]59-captain polkington failing health . In the meantime the daffodil , " [The Good Comrade]4101-the good comrade , "[77-joost] had gone back to [[its]2991-its [native land]2960-native land]2959-its native land , and with it an appeal , written in English , badly written , scrawled almost — but not likely to be refused . [Joost]77-joost read it through once , twice , more times than that ; it said little , only , take back the bulb and ask no questions , yet [he]77-joost felt [he]77-joost had been honoured by [Julia]58-julia 's confidence . The very style and haste of the letter seemed an honour to [him]77-joost ; it showed [him]77-joost [she]58-julia had need and had turned to [him]77-joost in it . Of course [he]77-joost would do as [she]58-julia asked ; [he]77-joost would have done things far harder than that . [He]77-joost folded the slip of paper and put it away where [he]77-joost kept some few treasures , and for a time [he]77-joost put with it the bulb [she]58-julia had sent ; and sometimes when [he]77-joost went to bed of a night — [he]77-joost had no other free time — [he]77-joost took both out and looked at them . But " [The Good Comrade]153-the good comrade "[2994-a sentimentalist] did not remain locked away from the light of day . [Joost]77-joost was [a sentimentalist]2994-a sentimentalist , it is true , and the bulb had come from [Julia]58-julia , winged by an appeal from [her]58-julia . But [he]77-joost was also [a bulb grower]3413-a bulb grower , and [he]77-joost was that before [he]77-joost was anything else and afterwards too , and the daffodil was a marvel of nature , a novelty , a thing beyond words to [a connoisseur]3432-a connoisseur . [The lover]2997-the lover asked that the token should be kept hidden from the eyes of [men]3625-men ; but [the grower]4221-the grower cried that the flower should be given to the light of heaven and should grow and bloom accord ing to [Nature]93-nature 's plan . For days [the lover]2997-the lover was uppermost and the old pain back . But in time the bitter - sweet madness died down again and , in the atmosphere which was saturated with the beloved work , [the old love]3001-the old love , [the first and last and soundly abiding one]3002-the first and last and soundly abiding one , reasserted itself . The daffodil must bloom , the little brown bulb must go back to [the brown earth]3003-the brown earth , the strange flower must unfold itself to the sun and wind and rain . So [he]77-joost went to [[his]77-joost father]614-his father . " [[My]77-joost father]3392-my father , "[77-joost] [he]77-joost said , and it is to be feared [he]77-joost had learnt something of guile from the source of [his]77-joost bitter - sweet madness . " [[My]77-joost father]3392-my father , [I]77-joost have heard from [Miss Julia]58-julia ; [she]58-julia would wish [us]4351-us to have the narcissus ' [The Good Comrade]153-the good comrade . ' "[77-joost] [Mijnheer]90-joost was pleased . " That is as it should be , "[77-joost] [he]77-joost said ; [he]77-joost had felt strongly about the gift of the bulb in the first instance , but that was an affair over and done with long ago between [him]77-joost and [[his]77-joost son]623-his son . [He]77-joost did not reopen it now , [he]77-joost was only gratified to think there was a likelihood of the daffodil coming back to [[its]3006-its birthplace]3007-its birthplace , where it certainly ought to be . " How much does [Miss Julia]58-julia ask for it ? "[77-joost] [he]77-joost inquired . " Nothing , "[77-joost] [Joost]90-joost answered ; " [she]58-julia does not wish to sell it ; [she]58-julia wishes to give it back . "[77-joost] " But , but ! "[90-joost] [Mijnheer]90-joost exclaimed , pushing up [his]90-joost spectacles in astonishment ; [he]90-joost knew the value of the thing and the offers that must have been made for it ; this way was not at all [his]90-joost notion of doing business ; also [he]90-joost found it hard to reconcile with the Julia [he]90-joost remembered . [He]90-joost recollected talk [he]90-joost had had with [her]3008-she when [she]3008-she had proved [herself]3008-she [an apt pupil in trade and trade dealings]3009-an apt pupil in trade and trade dealings , and shown , not only a very good comprehension of such things , but also an eye to the main chance . " This is nonsense , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said ; " it is not business . "[90-joost] [Joost]90-joost looked distressed . " [I]90-joost gave [her]3008-she the bulb , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost ventured ; " [she]3008-she does not want to sell [me]90-joost back [my]90-joost present . "[90-joost] [Mijnheer]90-joost did not recognise any such distinction in business transactions , and for a little it looked as if " [The Good Comrade]153-the good comrade "[90-joost] would be sent wandering again , sacrificed to [his]90-joost old - fashioned notions of integrity . [Joost]90-joost should not have it unless [he]90-joost paid for it , [he]90-joost said so with decision . [He]90-joost [himself]90-joost would buy it if [Joost]90-joost would not , and if [she]3008-she would not sell it to [him]90-joost then [neither of [them]3011-them]2042-neither of them should have it . And [Joost]90-joost could not , even if [he]90-joost would , explain why and how the paying was so difficult . [He]90-joost used all the arguments [he]90-joost could ; indeed , for one of [his]90-joost nature , [he]90-joost spoke with considerable diplomacy . " Supposing , "[90-joost] [he]90-joost said at last , " that it was only a sport , and that next year it reverts and is blue as are the others , [the parent bulbs]4352-the parent bulbs ? [Miss Julia]58-julia thinks of that — [she]3008-she would not like to be paid for it now in case of such a thing , will [you]90-joost not at least wait until the spring ? [She]3008-she has given nothing for it [herself]3008-she ; it is not as if [she]3008-she had sunk money and wants an immediate return . "[90-joost] [Mijnheer]90-joost did not consider that made any difference and [he]90-joost said so , reading [[his]90-joost son]623-his son a lecture on business morality according to [his]90-joost standard , of a very severe order . [Joost]90-joost listened with meekness to the entirely undeserved reproof for meanness and dishonourable views ; then [the old man]441-the old man announced finally what [he]90-joost should do . [He]90-joost should write to [Julia]58-julia and offer [her]58-julia a smallish sum down in case the bulb proved to be of no great worth , and a promise of a proportional percentage afterwards if it proved valuable . This idea pleased [him]90-joost very well ; it satisfied [his]90-joost notions of integrity and fair dealing and also [his]90-joost thrifty soul , which found trying the otherwise unavoidable duty of paying a long price for what had been freely given . From this [Joost]90-joost could not move [him]90-joost , so there was nothing for [him]90-joost to do but write distressfully to [Julia]58-julia and explain and apologise .

[Julia]58-julia was at work in [the kitchen]220-the kitchen ; it was ten o'clock on a November morning and [she]58-julia was busy ; [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had had breakfast up - [stairs]300-stairs , [he]59-captain polkington often did now , and it delayed the morning 's work . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat brought in two letters which [the postman]2769-the postman had left ; both were for [Julia]58-julia , but [she]58-julia had not time to read them now , so [she]58-julia put them down on the table ; they would keep ; [she]58-julia did not feel greatly interested to know what was inside them . Things did not interest [her]58-julia as they used ; in some imperceptible way [she]58-julia had aged ; some of the elasticity and youth was gone , perhaps because hope was gone . It had been dying all the summer , ever since the day when [she]58-julia crouched behind the chopping - block ; but gently and gradually , as the year dies , with some beauties unknown in early days and little recurrent spurts of hope and youth , like the flowers that bloom into winter 's lap . But it was dead now ; there had come to [her]58-julia , as it were , a sudden frost , and , as befalls in the years , too , the late blooming flowers , the coloured leaves , the last beautiful clinging remnants of life withered all at once and fell away . It was unreasonable , perhaps , that [the Captain]172-the captain 's theft of the daffodil and what arose from it should have had this result ; but then it was possibly unreasonable that hope and [youth]3018-youth should have had any autumn at all and not died right off when [she]58-julia said " No "[58-julia] and meant it that after noon in the early summer . But then the mind of [man]1052-man — and [woman]2588-woman — is unreasonable . It was nearly half - an - hour later when [Julia]58-julia picked up the letters ; both were from [Holland]7-holland ; one , [she]58-julia fancied , was from [Mijnheer]90-joost , one from [[his]90-joost son]623-his son . [She]58-julia opened the latter first ; [she]58-julia rather wondered what [Joost]90-joost could have to write about ; [he]90-joost had acknowledged the receipt of the daffodil bulb long ago . The matter was soon explained ; the letter was as formal and precise as ever , but the emotion that dictated it , the distress and regret , was quite clear to [Julia]58-julia in spite of the primness of expression . Clear , too , to [her]58-julia were the conflicting feelings that lay behind [the lover]2997-the lover 's contrition for what [he]2997-the lover feared was abuse of [[his]2997-the lover mistress]3023-his mistress 's trust , and [the grower]4221-the grower 's desire that the treasured token should be resolved into , what it was , a wonderful bulb , a triumph of [the horticulturist]3025-the horticulturist . [Julia]58-julia smiled a little sadly as [she]58-julia read ; not that [she]58-julia regretted the existence of [the grower]4221-the grower with [the lover]2997-the lover ; [she]58-julia was glad to see it and to know that it was triumphing . But the whole affair seemed so far off , so unimportant , so almost childish . [She]58-julia did not care who knew [he]2997-the lover had the daffodil , or whether it bloomed or rotted . In these days , when [her]58-julia self - apportioned burden was beginning to press heavily upon [her]58-julia shoulders , such things did not seem to matter . [She]58-julia had a sense almost of disloyalty in feeling how little it mattered to [her]58-julia when it appeared to be so much to [this loyal friend]3028-this loyal friend . [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had of late had several sudden attacks of a faintness which more often than not amounted to unconsciousness . " Heart , "[3029-the doctor] [the doctor]3029-the doctor had said when [he]3029-the doctor was summoned after the first one ; [he]3029-the doctor had not regarded them as very dangerous , that is to say not likely to prove fatal at any moment if properly treated at the time . [He]3029-the doctor had given instructions as to suitable treatment , emphasis ing the fact that [the patient]3030-the patient ought never to be long out of ear - shot of some one , as the attacks required immediate remedy . [He]3029-the doctor forbade excitement and much exertion , orders easy to fulfil in this case , and also stimulants of all sorts , an order not quite so easy . [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington was much displeased about this last ; [he]59-captain polkington said it plainly showed [the doctor]3029-the doctor [a fool who did not know [his]59-captain polkington business]3032-a fool who did not know his business ; stimulant , as [every one]582-every one knew , being the first necessity for a weak heart . [Julia]58-julia pointed out that that must vary with the constitution , nature and disease ; [she]58-julia also recalled the fact that alcohol never had suited [[her]58-julia father]210-her father . [He]210-her father was naturally not convinced by [her]58-julia logic , and so was decidedly sulky ; even in time , by dint of dwelling upon the subject , came to regard the treatment as a conspiracy to annoy [him]210-her father . [Julia]58-julia regretted this but did not think it mattered very much , seeing that [she]58-julia had the keys ; but then [she]58-julia did not know of that purchase made in [the town]569-the town . [The Captain]172-the captain , rebelling against [the doctor]3029-the doctor 's order , hugged [himself]172-the captain as [he]172-the captain thought of it and of the comparatively sparing use [he]172-the captain had made of it so far — for fear of being found out . There was no need of [him]172-the captain to die by inches while [he]172-the captain had that store of life and comfort ; so [he]172-the captain told [himself]172-the captain , and secretly made use of it , with anything but good result . [Julia]58-julia , marking the disimprovement in [his]210-her father health , thought it was the natural course and saved [him]210-her father all work , carrying out [the doctor]3029-the doctor 's instructions more carefully than ever . The hidden whisky remained unknown to [her]58-julia , for although in the larger affairs of duplicity and diplomacy [she]58-julia easily outmatched [[her]58-julia father]210-her father , in matters requiring small cunning [he]210-her father was much nearer [her]58-julia equal . In this one [he]210-her father showed almost preternatural skill ; [his]210-her father whole heart was in it , and [his]210-her father wits , where it was concerned , were sharpened above the average ; [he]210-her father clung to [his]210-her father secret as [a man]406-a man clings to [his]210-her father one chance of life , made only the more pertinacious by the contrary advice [he]210-her father had received . But on that November morning , after [Julia]58-julia had brought [[her]58-julia father]210-her father round by the proper remedies , [she]58-julia began to have suspicions . They were not founded on anything definite ; [she]58-julia could not imagine how [he]210-her father should have got stimulant , and [his]210-her father condition hardly justified [her]58-julia in suspecting it , yet [she]58-julia did . And [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington knew by experience that that was enough to prove unpleasant ; it did not matter much at which end [Julia]58-julia got hold of [his]210-her father affairs , [she]58-julia had a knack of arriving at the middle before [he]210-her father was at all ready for [her]58-julia . [He]210-her father resented what [she]58-julia said to [him]210-her father that morning very much indeed . [He]210-her father denied everything and defended [himself]210-her father well ; although [he]210-her father was in fear all the time that some unwary word or unwise denial should betray [him]210-her father to [[his]210-her father cross - examiner]3042-his cross - examiner who , being [herself]3042-his cross - examiner [no mean expert in the double - dealing arts]3043-no mean expert in the double - dealing arts , could frequently learn as much from a lie as from the truth . In the end , what between anxiety and annoyance , [he]210-her father lost control of [his]210-her father temper and from peevish irritability broke out suddenly into a fit of weak ungovernable rage . [Julia]58-julia was obliged at once to desist , seeing with regret that [she]58-julia had transgressed one of [the doctor]3029-the doctor 's rules and excited [the patient]3030-the patient very much indeed . [She]58-julia left [him]210-her father to recover control of [himself]210-her father and went to look for [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat . " [Johnny]57-johnny , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , when [she]58-julia found [him]210-her father . " [I]58-julia believe [father]3307-father has got whisky . [I]58-julia do n't know where , but [I]58-julia shall have to find out ; [you]57-johnny must help [me]58-julia . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny professed [his]57-johnny willingness , looking puzzled and unhappy ; [he]57-johnny looked so at times , again now , for even [he]57-johnny had begun to discern a shadow coming on the life which for a year had been so happy to [him]57-johnny . " [You]57-johnny will have to keep a watch on [father]3307-father , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said . " [He]3307-father wo n't do much while [I]58-julia am watching ; [he]3307-father will wait till [he]3307-father is alone with [you]57-johnny . Do n't try to prevent [him]3307-father ; that is no good ; just watch and tell [me]58-julia . "[58-julia] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat said [he]66-mr. gillat would , though [he]66-mr. gillat did not like the job , and certainly was ill - fitted for it . [Julia]58-julia knew that , but knew also that to discover anything [she]58-julia must depend a good deal upon [him]66-mr. gillat , unless [she]58-julia could by searching light upon the store of spirit which [she]58-julia could not help thinking [[her]58-julia father]210-her father had in or near [the house]175-the house . [She]58-julia determined to make a systematic search ; but before [she]58-julia did so [she]58-julia found time to open [Mijnheer]90-joost 's letter . It was rather a long letter and very neat . It set forth in formal Dutch [the old man]441-the old man 's ideas concerning the daffodil bulb and [his]441-the old man offer regarding it . It should be kept , [he]441-the old man said , if it was paid for , not otherwise . Something now , [she]58-julia was to name [her]58-julia terms , while it was still uncertain whether its flower would be blue or streaked or even common yellow — more later , in accordance with the flowering and the profits likely to arise . So [Julia]58-julia read and sat staring . An offer for " [The Good Comrade]153-the good comrade . "[58-julia] Money from [the people to whom it had always practically]3049-the people to whom it had always practically belonged in [her]58-julia estimation . [She]58-julia could not take it from [them]3049-the people to whom it had always practically , it was impossible ; the thing was virtually [their]3049-the people to whom it had always practically own ! But if [she]58-julia did not . [She]58-julia re - read [Joost]90-joost 's letter with its protestations , and [Mijnheer]90-joost 's with its offer — if [she]58-julia did not , the little brown bulb would be sent back to [her]58-julia . [Mijnheer]90-joost , now that [he]90-joost knew of its coming , would insist on its return unless it were paid for ; and [Joost]90-joost , [she]58-julia knew very well , would not deceive [[his]90-joost father]614-his father and keep it secretly , or defy [[his]90-joost father]614-his father and keep it openly ; the money or the bulb [she]58-julia must have . And the bulb [she]58-julia could not , would not have again ; so the money , unearned , distasteful , having a not too pleasant savour , must be [hers]58-julia . At last , in this way , without [her]58-julia contriv ance , against [her]58-julia will , there had come a way to pay the debt of honour ! [She]58-julia sat down and wrote to [Mijnheer]90-joost and named [her]58-julia price . Thirty pounds [she]58-julia asked for , no more in the future , no less now ; that was the only price [she]58-julia could take for " [The Good Comrade]153-the good comrade , "[58-julia] it was the sum [Rawson - Clew]155-rawson - clew had paid to [[his]90-joost cousin]3389-his cousin two years ago . [Johnny]57-johnny posted the letter that afternoon while [Julia]58-julia began [her]58-julia search for [[her]58-julia father]210-her father 's hidden whisky . All the afternoon [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington sat in the easy - chair , watching [her]58-julia contemptuously when [she]58-julia was in sight and moving uneasily when [she]58-julia was not . [He]59-captain polkington did not think [she]58-julia would find anything , at least not at once , though [he]59-captain polkington was afraid [she]58-julia would if [she]58-julia kept on long enough and [he]59-captain polkington left [his]59-captain polkington treasure in its present hiding - place . It would not last so much longer — [he]59-captain polkington dared not contemplate the time when it should all be gone ; it was characteristic of [him]59-captain polkington that [he]59-captain polkington was easily able to avoid doing so . The principal thought in [his]59-captain polkington mind was a determination that it should not be found while any remained . That could not and should not happen ; the last little which [he]59-captain polkington had carefully hoarded , which [he]59-captain polkington had stinted and deprived [himself]59-captain polkington to save — to have that taken away , to be robbed of that — the tears gathered in [his]59-captain polkington eyes at the pathos of the thought . But the whisky was not found that day , and [the Captain , who slept but badly at this time]3054-the captain , who slept but badly at this time , lay awake long in the night planning how and when [he]59-captain polkington could move it to [a place of safety further away from [the house]175-the house]3055-a place of safety further away from the house . [He]59-captain polkington would have gone down then and there , in spite of the fact that it was a blustering night of wind and rain and [he]59-captain polkington not fitted to go out in such weather , but [he]59-captain polkington was afraid of [Julia]58-julia . [She]58-julia was certain to hear and follow ; [she]58-julia had almost an animal 's alertness when once [she]58-julia was on the trail of anything . So [he]59-captain polkington lay and planned and waited , hoping that a chance would come during the next day . It did not . [Julia]58-julia was at [home]249-home all day and , as [she]58-julia had foreseen , [he]59-captain polkington made no move while [she]58-julia was about . But the following morning [she]58-julia had to go to [Halgrave]47-halgrave about the killing of a pig ; [Johnny]57-johnny was hardly equal to making the necessary arrangements and certainly could not do so good as [she]58-julia . Accordingly , [she]58-julia went [herself]58-julia , not very reluctantly , for [she]58-julia was nearly certain [[her]58-julia father]210-her father would make an effort to get at [his]210-her father whisky , if [he]210-her father had any , as soon as [her]58-julia back was turned , and so give [Johnny]57-johnny a chance of finding out about it . Of course it was quite likely that [Johnny]57-johnny , being [Johnny]57-johnny , would miss the chance , but [he]57-johnny might not , and even if [he]57-johnny did they would not be much worse off than before . So [she]58-julia thought as [she]58-julia started , leaving [the Captain]172-the captain , who was still in bed , with a very vague idea as to when [she]58-julia would be back . [He]172-the captain was a good deal annoyed by this vagueness ; it meant [he]172-the captain would have to hurry , a thing [he]172-the captain hated and did very badly ; and , perhaps , entirely without reason , too , for [she]58-julia might be three hours gone ; though , equally of course , only two , or perhaps — [she]58-julia was capable of anything unpleasant and unexpected — only one . [He]172-the captain began to dress as quickly as [he]172-the captain could ; but , owing to long habit of doing it as slowly as [he]172-the captain could so as to postpone more arduous tasks , that was not very fast . [He]172-the captain wished [he]172-the captain had known sooner that [Julia]58-julia was going to [Halgrave]47-halgrave , [he]172-the captain would have begun getting up before this ; [he]172-the captain would even have got to breakfast if only [she]58-julia had let [him]172-the captain know ; so [he]172-the captain fumed to [himself]172-the captain as [he]172-the captain shuffled about , dropping things with [his]172-the captain shaking fingers . At last [he]172-the captain was dressed and came down - stairs to find [Johnny]57-johnny , pink and apologetic as [he]57-johnny used to be in the [Marbridge]61-denah days , laboriously doing odd jobs which did not need doing . There was not [a detective lost in [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat]3060-a detective lost in mr. gillat , [he]172-the captain had not the making of a sleuth - hound in [him]172-the captain ; or even a watch - dog , except , perhaps , of that well - meaning kind which gets itself perennially kicked for incessant and incurable tail wagging at inopportune times . The half - hour which followed [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington 's coming down - [stairs]300-stairs was a trying one . [The Captain]172-the captain went to the back door to look out ; [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat followed [him]172-the captain , though scarcely like [his]66-mr. gillat shadow ; [he]66-mr. gillat was not inconspicuous , and neither [he]66-mr. gillat nor [his]66-mr. gillat motive were easy to overlook . [The Captain]59-captain polkington said something approbious about the weather and the high wind and occasional heavy swishes of rain ; then [he]59-captain polkington went to [the sitting - room which lay behind [the kitchen]220-the kitchen]3063-the sitting - room which lay behind the kitchen , and near to the front door . " To — to see if the register is shut , "[172-the captain] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat said , beaming at [his]66-mr. gillat own deep diplomacy and the brilliancy of the idea which had come to [him]66-mr. gillat — rather tardily , it is true , still in time to pass muster . " It is a funny thing [I]172-the captain ca n't be let alone a moment , "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain said .
