"[172-the captain] Then , after a long pause , as if [he]172-the captain had just made sure of the fact , " It is cool in [here]371-here . "[172-the captain] It was , very ; it might even have been called cold and raw , for there had not been a fire there for days , but [the Captain]172-the captain did not move , and [Johnny]57-johnny , stooping by [the fire - place]224-the fire - place , examined the register of the chimney , fondly believing in [his]57-johnny own impenetrable deceptiveness . " [I]57-johnny ca n't help thinking it ought to be shut , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny observed , looking thoughtfully up the chimney ; " the rain will come down ; it might rain a good deal if the wind were to drop . "[57-johnny] " The wind is not going to drop for hours , "[172-the captain] [the Captain]172-the captain snapped ; " it is getting higher . "[172-the captain] A great gust rumbled in the chimney as [he]172-the captain spoke , and flung itself with the thud of a palpable body against the window - pane . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat heard it ; [he]66-mr. gillat could not well do otherwise . " Still , "[66-mr. gillat] [he]66-mr. gillat said , " it might rain ; [one]3325-one never knows . "[66-mr. gillat] [He]66-mr. gillat took hold of the register with the tongs and tried to shut it . It was obstinate , and [he]66-mr. gillat pulled this way and that , working in [his]66-mr. gillat usual laborious and conscientious way . At last it slipped and [he]66-mr. gillat managed to get it jammed crossways . Thus [he]66-mr. gillat had to leave it , for [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington , apparently cool enough now , wandered back into [the kitchen]220-the kitchen . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , of course , followed and arranged and rearranged pots on the stove till [the Captain]172-the captain said [he]172-the captain had left [his]172-the captain handkerchief up - [stairs]300-stairs . [Stairs]300-stairs were trying to [his]57-johnny heart , so [Johnny]57-johnny had to go for it . Up [he]57-johnny went as fast as [he]57-johnny could , and came down again almost faster , for [he]57-johnny tumbled on the second step and slipped the rest of the way with considerable noise and bumping . After that [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington gave up [his]59-captain polkington efforts to get rid of [his]59-captain polkington guard and resigned [himself]59-captain polkington to fate . At least , so thought [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , who no amount of experience could instruct in the guilt of [the human race in general]3074-the human race in general and [the Polkingtons]56-the polkingtons in particular . The first hour of [Julia]58-julia 's absence had passed when [Johnny]57-johnny went into [the back kitchen]2272-the back kitchen to clean knives . [He]57-johnny left the door between [the rooms]640-the rooms open , but from habit more than from any thought of keeping an eye on [his]57-johnny charge . [They]3077-they had been talking in the ordinary way for some time now , [the Captain]172-the captain sitting so peacefully by the fire that [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat had begun to forget [he]57-johnny was supposed to watch . And really it would seem [he]57-johnny was justified , for [the Captain]172-the captain , of [his]172-the captain own accord , left the easy - chair and followed [him]57-johnny into [the back kitchen]2272-the back kitchen , standing watching the knife - cleaning . [He]172-the captain had been talking of old times , recalling far back incidents regretfully ; [he]172-the captain continued to do so as [he]172-the captain watched [Johnny]57-johnny at work until [he]172-the captain was interrupted by a loud sizzling in [the kitchen]220-the kitchen . " Hullo ! "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain said , " there 's a pot boiling over ! "[172-the captain] and [he]172-the captain made as if [he]172-the captain would go to it but half stopped . " It is the big one , "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain said , " perhaps [you]57-johnny had better take it off ; [I]172-the captain 'm not good at lifting weights now - a - days . "[172-the captain] " No , no ! "[57-johnny] [Johnny]57-johnny said hastily ; " do n't [you]172-the captain do it , [you]172-the captain leave it to [me]57-johnny , "[57-johnny] and [he]57-johnny hurried into [the kitchen]220-the kitchen to take from the fire a pot which , had [he]57-johnny only remembered it , had not been so near the blaze when [he]57-johnny left it . " It is too heavy for [you]57-johnny , "[172-the captain] [he]172-the captain went on as [he]172-the captain lifted it ; " [I]172-the captain do n't know what is inside , only water , [I]172-the captain think ; it will be all right here by the side . "[172-the captain] A gust of wind swept round [the kitchen]220-the kitchen , fluttering the herbs which hung from the ceiling and blowing the dust and flame from the front of the fire . " [Dear]3320-dear , [dear]3320-dear ! "[66-mr. gillat] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat exclaimed as [he]66-mr. gillat drew back , " What a wind ! "[66-mr. gillat] Then , as [he]66-mr. gillat caught the whisper and whistle of the leafless things which whisper to one another out of doors even in the dead winter time , [he]66-mr. gillat realised that the outer door must be open . " Shut it ! "[66-mr. gillat] [he]66-mr. gillat said . " The latch is so old , it is beginning to get worn out , and the wind is so strong , too . Let [me]66-mr. gillat see if [I]66-mr. gillat can shut it . "[66-mr. gillat] [He]57-johnny went to [the back kitchen]2272-the back kitchen for that purpose and found that [he]57-johnny was talking to empty air , [the Captain]172-the captain was gone . In great consternation [he]57-johnny went out after [his]57-johnny charge . [He]57-johnny had not had a minute 's start ; [he]57-johnny could not have got far , not much more than round the corner of [the house]175-the house . So thought [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , and started round the nearest corner after [him]57-johnny . [Julia]58-julia would not have done that ; with the instinct of the wild animal and [the rogue]3087-the rogue for cover , and for the value of the obvious in concealment , [she]58-julia would have looked by the water butt first . It was not [a hiding - place]3088-a hiding - place ; the bush beside did not half conceal [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington , yet [he]57-johnny stood dark and unobtrusive against it and so close to the door that in looking out for [him]57-johnny one naturally looked beyond [him]57-johnny . As [Johnny]57-johnny went round one side of [the house]175-the house [the Captain]172-the captain left the meagre shelter of the butt and went round the other , bent now on finding some better hiding - place till it should be safe for [him]57-johnny to go to [[his]57-johnny precious store]3091-his precious store . And seeing that [he]57-johnny was braced by an insatiable whisky thirst and so possessed by one idea that [he]57-johnny had almost [a madman]3092-a madman 's cunning in achieving [his]57-johnny purpose , it is not wonderful that [he]57-johnny succeeded . While [Johnny]57-johnny hastily searched [the out - buildings [he]57-johnny lay hid]3093-the out - buildings he lay hid . And when at last [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat went back to [the house]175-the house , being convinced that [his]66-mr. gillat charge must have gone back before [him]66-mr. gillat , [he]66-mr. gillat , nerved and strengthened by a dose of the precious spirit , carefully climbed over the garden wall , carrying with [him]66-mr. gillat all that was left of [[his]66-mr. gillat store]3095-his store . It was rather heavy , and the rising wind was strong , but [he]66-mr. gillat was strong , too , and [he]66-mr. gillat bore more strength with [him]66-mr. gillat . [He]66-mr. gillat could carry a weight and fight with the wind if [he]66-mr. gillat wanted to ; [his]66-mr. gillat heart was well enough when it was properly treated . And it should be properly treated as long as [he]66-mr. gillat had [his]66-mr. gillat comfort , [his]66-mr. gillat precious medicine safe and in a place where prying hands could not touch it . [Julia]58-julia came [home]249-home from [Halgrave]47-halgrave later than [she]58-julia expected , but the wind had increased to a gale , so that walking along [the exposed road]3097-the exposed road had been no easy matter . [Johnny]57-johnny by this time was almost desperate with alarm , for [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington had not come back and , in spite of a continuous search in [likely and unlikely places]3098-likely and unlikely places , [he]59-captain polkington had not been able to find any trace of [him]59-captain polkington or [his]59-captain polkington whisky . It is true [his]59-captain polkington search was not very systematic at the best of times ; it is not likely to have been now ; as [his]59-captain polkington alarm increased , it grew worse , until , by the time [Julia]58-julia came in , it had become little more than a repeated looking in [the same unlikely places]3099-the same unlikely places and an incessant toiling up and down [- stairs]364-- stairs and across [the garden]4034-the garden in the howling wind . [His]59-captain polkington account of [the Captain]172-the captain 's vanishing was much obscured by self - condemnation and anxiety , still [she]58-julia managed to make it out and [she]58-julia did not at first think so very seriously of it . [She]58-julia concluded from it that [[her]58-julia father]210-her father had succeeded in getting at [his]210-her father whisky and [Johnny]57-johnny had failed to prevent [him]210-her father or find out the whereabouts of [the store]3104-the store — a not very astonishing occurrence . The fact that [the Captain]172-the captain had not returned or shown [himself]172-the captain for so long was surprising and to be regretted , seeing the badness of the weather . But it was not inexplicable ; [he]59-captain polkington might be anxious to demonstrate [his]59-captain polkington freedom , or , by frightening [them]3106-them , to pay [them]3106-them out for the watch lately kept on [him]59-captain polkington ; or — and this was the one serious aspect of the matter — [he]59-captain polkington might have taken more of the spirit than [he]59-captain polkington could stand in [his]59-captain polkington weak state and be too stupid and muddled to come back alone . [Julia]58-julia reassured [Johnny]57-johnny as well as [she]58-julia could , and then , accompanied by [him]57-johnny , set to work to search thoroughly [the house]175-the house , [garden]4074-garden and [out - buildings]3109-out - buildings . It was dinner time before [they]3110-they had finished . [Julia]58-julia came to the doorway of [the bulb shed]3111-the bulb shed uneasy and perplexed . " It is clear [he]59-captain polkington is not [here]371-here , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , and turned to fasten the door . A gust of wind tore it from [her]58-julia hand , flinging it back noisily . [She]58-julia caught it again and secured it . " It is dinner time , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " come along indoors , there is no reason why [you]57-johnny should go hungry because [father]3307-father chooses to . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny followed [her]58-julia to [the house]175-the house . When [they]3110-they were [indoors]2711-indoors [he]57-johnny said , " Do [you]58-julia think — [you]58-julia do n't think [he]57-johnny has had an attack?—that [he]57-johnny is lying unconscious somewhere ? "[57-johnny] That was precisely what [Julia]58-julia was beginning to think ; there seemed no other possible explanation . [Johnny]57-johnny read [her]58-julia mind in [her]58-julia face and was overwhelmed with the sense of [his]57-johnny own shortcomings and their possible consequences . " It is not [your]57-johnny fault , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia assured [him]57-johnny ; " [you]57-johnny might as well say it is [father]3307-father 's for being so foolish and obstinate about [his]3307-father whisky — a great deal better and more truly say it is [mine]58-julia for leaving [you]57-johnny , and for driving [him]57-johnny into this corner , for not having managed the whole thing better . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny , though a little relieved that [she]58-julia did not think [him]57-johnny to blame , was not comforted . " Let [us]4363-we go and find [him]57-johnny , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said ; " [we]4363-we must find [him]57-johnny ; never mind about dinner — [we]4363-we must go and look for [him]57-johnny — though [I]57-johnny do n't know where . "[57-johnny] " [We]4363-we must look beyond [the garden]4034-the garden , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; " [he]57-johnny must have got further than [we]4363-we first thought — but [I]58-julia do n't see how [he]57-johnny can be far in this weather . Cut some cheese and bread ; [we]4363-we can eat it as [we]4363-we go along . "[58-julia] In a little while [they]3114-they set out together , [Julia]58-julia taking restoratives with [her]58-julia , though [she]58-julia was also careful to leave some on the [kitchen]2578-kitchen - table in case [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington should make [his]59-captain polkington way back and feel in need of [them]3116-them in [her]58-julia absence . Outside [the garden]4034-the garden wall one felt the force of the wind more fully , and realised how impossible it was that [the Captain]172-the captain should have gone far . [Julia]58-julia stood a moment by the gate . Before [her]58-julia lay [the road]3464-the road to [Halgrave]47-halgrave ; [[her]58-julia father]210-her father might have gone down [it]3464-the road a little way ; but if [he]210-her father had [he]210-her father must have turned off and sought conceal ment somewhere for [she]58-julia had seen no sign of [any one]187-any one when [she]58-julia came [home]249-home . To the left stretched [the heath - land]3123-the heath - land , brown and bare , to the belt of wildly tossing pines ; it was hard to imagine [[her]58-julia father]210-her father choosing that way . To the right lay [the sandhills]1304-the sandhills , [a place of unsteady outline]3126-a place of unsteady outline , [earth and sky alike pale and blurred as the north - west wind fled seawards]3127-earth and sky alike pale and blurred as the north - west wind fled seawards , lifting and whirling the fine particles till the air seemed full of them ; it was impossible to think of [any one choosing that way]3128-any one choosing that way . " [We]3129-we will go down [the road]3464-the road to begin with , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said , and started . All through the early part of the afternoon [they]3129-we searched ; sometimes stopped for a moment by a gust of wind ; [Julia]58-julia caught and whirled , [Johnny]57-johnny brought to a panting standstill . But on again directly , struggling down [the road]3464-the road , looking in [ditches and behind scant bushes]3131-ditches and behind scant bushes , leaving the track first on the right hand then on the left , searching in likely and unlikely places . But always with the same result , there was no sign of [the missing man]3132-the missing man . At last , when [they]3129-we had reached a greater distance than it was possible to imagine [the Captain]172-the captain could have gone , [they]3129-we turned towards [the house]175-the house across [the heath]4162-the heath . It was difficult to think of [the Captain]172-the captain going that way , seeing [he]172-the captain would have been walking in the teeth of the wind , but it almost seemed [he]172-the captain must have done it . The short day was already beginning to close in when [they]3129-we reached [the belt of pines]3137-the belt of pines . It had grown much colder ; [one]3325-one could almost believe there would be frost in the air by and by . The wind was lulling a little ; it still roared with strange rushings and half - demented tearings at the tree - tops , almost like some great spirit prisoned there , but it had spent its first strength . The rain clouds were going , too ; already in places the sky was swept clear so that a pale light gleamed behind the trees . [Julia]58-julia stood in the vibrant shelter of the pines , pushing back [her]58-julia hair ; [she]58-julia was bareheaded ; a hat had been an impossible superfluity when [she]58-julia started out . " [Johnny]57-johnny , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " [we]3129-we have come too far ; [father]3307-father could not have got to the trees in such weather as it was when [he]3307-father started ; [we]3129-we must go back . [I]58-julia expect [he]3307-father is somewhere nearer [home]249-home ; [we]3129-we have not half searched [the possible radius]4368-the possible radius yet . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny said " Yes . "[57-johnny] [He]57-johnny was dog - tired , so tired that [his]57-johnny anxiety was now little more than dull despair animated by an unquestioning determination to continue the search . [He]57-johnny would have done so somehow , and with [his]57-johnny flagging energies been more hindrance than help , had not [Julia]58-julia prevented [him]57-johnny ; as [they]3139-us neared [the house]175-the house , now almost merged in the dusk , [she]58-julia said — " [I]58-julia am going to fetch a lantern ; the moon will be up soon , but until then [I]58-julia shall want a light . [I]58-julia am just coming in to get it , then [I]58-julia shall go out again ; but [you]57-johnny must stop at [home]249-home ; [father]3307-father may come back , and if [he]3307-father found [us]3139-us both out after dark [he]3307-father would think something was wrong and start to look for [us]3139-us ; then [we]3139-us should be worse off than ever . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny said " Yes "[58-julia] ; but suggested , " [I]58-julia think [we]3139-us 'd better look round about [the house]175-the house once more . [I]58-julia think [I]58-julia 'll take a light and look round again . "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia did not think it would be much use ; however [she]58-julia consented , though [she]58-julia had to go with [Johnny]57-johnny ; [she]58-julia did not trust [him]57-johnny with a lantern among [the out - buildings]2276-the out - buildings . [They]3142-they looked round once more , in [the sheds]2755-the sheds and in [the dark garden]830-the dark garden ; afterwards [they]3142-they went out and looked beyond the wall all round , on the side where the heather grew and also on the side where the loose sand came close . It took time ; [Johnny]57-johnny was too tired to move quickly or even to understand quickly what was said to [him]57-johnny . At last [Julia]58-julia stopped and spoke decisively . " [You]57-johnny had better go in now , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " it wo n't do for [us]3142-they both to be out any longer ; [one of [us]3142-they]4200-one of us must go in , and [I]58-julia think it had better be [you]57-johnny . Make a good fire , see that there is plenty of hot water and get something to eat so as to be ready to do things when [I]58-julia come back . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny acquiesced and [Julia]58-julia , having watched [him]57-johnny into [the house]175-the house , took up [her]58-julia lantern and set out in the direction of [the sandhills]1304-the sandhills . It was [her]58-julia last resource ; it did not seem to [her]58-julia likely that [[her]58-julia father]210-her father could have gone [there]180-there ; at the best of times [he]210-her father disliked [the place]241-the place , finding [it]241-the place very tiring . Still , with the wind behind [him]210-her father as it would have been this morning , it is possible [he]210-her father would have found it the easiest way — if [he]210-her father could have managed to forget what the coming back would be . At all events [she]58-julia determined to try it , so [she]58-julia set out for [the waste]3150-the waste . By this time the moon was rising , and , in spite of the driving clouds which had not all dispersed , at times it shone clear . Beneath [it]3151-it [the stretch of sand]3152-the stretch of sand lay pale and desolate , a new - formed landscape of fresh contours , loosely - piled hills and [shallow scooped hollows shaped by to - day 's wind]3153-shallow scooped hollows shaped by to - day 's wind . An easy place for [a man]406-a man to miss [his]406-a man way with a gale blowing and the sand dancing blinding reels . [A hard place for [a man]406-a man to travel far when [he]406-a man had to face the wind]3155-a hard place for a man to travel far when he had to face the wind ; [a strong man]3942-a strong man would have found it very tiring , [a weak man]3158-a weak man might well have given it up , driven to waiting for a lull in the weather . As for [a man in [the Captain]172-the captain 's health]3159-a man in the captain 's health — when [Julia]58-julia thought of it [she]58-julia hurried on , although [she]58-julia knew if [[her]58-julia father]210-her father had to - day , as [he]210-her father had all through [his]210-her father life , followed the line of least resistance , the chances were that [her]58-julia help would be of little avail to [him]210-her father now . [She]58-julia carried [her]58-julia lantern low , looking carefully for foot prints ; soon , however , [she]58-julia put it out ; [she]58-julia would do better without in the increasing moon - light . But [she]58-julia found no prints ; after all , as [she]58-julia remembered , [she]58-julia was hardly likely to ; the wind and blowing sand would have obliterated them . Over the first level of sand [she]58-julia went to the nearest rise without seeing anything ; up to that and down [the following hollow]3162-the following hollow , looking in every curve and indentation , still without seeing anything . Then [she]58-julia began to climb [the next rise]3163-the next rise . The moon was struggling through a long cloud , one moment eclipsed , the next shining with a half radiance which made the landscape unevenly black and white . For a second it looked out clear , and the sand showed like silver , tear - spotted with ink in [the hollows]3164-the hollows ; then the cloud swept up and all turned to a level grey . [She]58-julia had climbed to the top of a rise by now , sinking deep and noiseless into the soft sand . It was too dark to see what was below ; all was shadow , black shadow — or was it a blackness more substantial than shadow ? The cloud passed from off the moon 's face , the light shone out once more , turning the sand to silver . All [the great empty space]3165-the great empty space , where the dying wind still throbbed , was white silver , except down in [the hollow where , black and still]3166-the hollow where , black and still , lay [the man who had followed the line of least resistance]3167-the man who had followed the line of least resistance .

On the day of [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington 's funeral , a letter was brought to [[White]147-white 's Cottage]2228-white 's cottage . [Julia]58-julia [herself]58-julia took it in , and when [she]58-julia saw that it was from [Holland]7-holland [she]58-julia asked [the postman]2769-the postman to wait a minute as [she]58-julia would be glad if [he]2769-the postman would post a letter for [her]58-julia . [He]2769-the postman sat down , nothing loth ; [the cottage]4035-the cottage was [the last place on [his]2769-the postman round]3171-the last place on his round and [he]2769-the postman never minded a rest [there]180-there . [He]2769-the postman waited while [Julia]58-julia went up - stairs with [her]58-julia letter . [She]58-julia opened it before [she]58-julia got to [[her]58-julia room]400-her room and barely read the contents ; there was enclosed a cheque for thirty pounds , the price of " [The Good Comrade]4101-the good comrade . "[58-julia] It had come , then , at last , this money for which [she]58-julia had been waiting two years — but too late . [The man in whose name [she]58-julia would have paid the debt]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt lay dead . [She]58-julia had planned to clear [him]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt without [his]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt knowledge , reinstate [him]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt in the good opinion of [[his]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt debtor]3175-his debtor without letting [her]58-julia hand be seen ; and [she]58-julia could not , for [he]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt was dead , and there was no hand but [hers]58-julia , and no name to clear . It was not a week too late , yet so much , so bitterly much . Too late for [her]58-julia cherished plan , too late for any of the things [she]58-julia had hoped , too late for triumph , or joy , or satisfaction ; too late to demonstrate the once hoped for equality ; too late for the fulfilling of anything but a dogged purpose . For a moment [she]58-julia looked at the cheque , feeling the irony which had sent [her]58-julia the means of paying [his]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt debt now that [[her]58-julia father]210-her father lay in [his]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt coffin , indifferent to [his]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt good name and [his]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt honour ; unable , alike , to clear or be cleared , to wrong or be wronged ; removed by kindly death from the scope of earthly judgment , even the just thoughts of one who had suffered on [his]3174-the man in whose name she would have paid the debt account . [She]58-julia put down the cheque and pencilled some hasty words—"In payment of [Captain Polkington]59-captain polkington 's debt ( to [Mr. Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew ) discharged by [Hubert Farquhar Rawson - Clew]155-rawson - clew on the — November 19 — "[58-julia] So [she]58-julia wrote , then [she]58-julia put the slip with the cheque in an envelope and addressed it to [the [London]9-london club where the explosive had been sent]3177-the london club where the explosive had been sent . " It will be posted before the funeral , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia thought ; " [I]58-julia 'm glad — it will all end together — [poor father]4374-poor father ! "[58-julia] [She]58-julia went down - stairs and gave the letter to [the postman]2769-the postman . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington came into [the kitchen]220-the kitchen as [she]60-mrs. polkington was doing so , for [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington was at [the cottage]4035-the cottage now . There are [some women who seem designed by nature]3181-some women who seem designed by nature for [widows]3182-widows , just as there are others designed for [grandmothers]3183-grandmothers and yet others for [old maids]3184-old maids . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington was of the first sort ; [she]60-mrs. polkington seemed specially created to adorn the position of [widow - hood]3185-widow - hood ; [she]60-mrs. polkington certainly did adorn it ; [she]60-mrs. polkington was a pattern to [all widows]3186-all widows and did not miss a single point of the situation . Of course [she]60-mrs. polkington came to [the cottage]4035-the cottage as soon as possible after receiving news of [[her]60-mrs. polkington husband]230-her husband 's death . The journey was long and expensive , the weather somewhat bad ; that weighed for nothing with [her]60-mrs. polkington ; [she]60-mrs. polkington was there as soon as might be , feeling , saying and doing just what [a bereaved widow]3189-a bereaved widow ought . The fact that [she]60-mrs. polkington and [[her]60-mrs. polkington husband]230-her husband had been obliged through the force of circumstances , to live separate the past year did not alter [her]60-mrs. polkington emotions , [her]60-mrs. polkington real tears or [her]60-mrs. polkington real grief . Considering the practice and experience [she]60-mrs. polkington had had it would have been surprising if [she]60-mrs. polkington had not succeeded in deceiving [herself]60-mrs. polkington as well as most of [[her]60-mrs. polkington world]3191-her world in these things . So acute were [her]60-mrs. polkington feelings that when [she]60-mrs. polkington came into [the kitchen]220-the kitchen and saw [Julia]58-julia dispatching the letter , [she]60-mrs. polkington felt quite a shock . " What is it ? "[60-mrs. polkington] [she]60-mrs. polkington asked ; " What is the matter ? "[60-mrs. polkington] " Only a letter that could not wait , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered . " Surely it could have waited till to - morrow , "[195-her mother] [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother said ; " under the circumstances surely [one]3325-one would be excused . "[195-her mother] [Julia]58-julia thought differently but did not say so , and in silence set about some necessary preparation . [The Reverend Richard Frazer]63-richard frazer came to the funeral ; [Violet]101-violet was unable to do so ; [he]63-richard frazer represented [her]101-violet and supported [[his]63-richard frazer mother - in - law]3194-his mother - in - law too . [The banker]2090-the banker , [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby , also made the tedious journey to [Halgrave]47-halgrave ; [he]2090-the banker came out of respect for death in [the abstract]3196-the abstract , and also because [he]2090-the banker expected affairs would want looking to , and it would suit [him]2090-the banker better to do it now than later . [These two]1124-these two with [Johnny]57-johnny , [Julia]58-julia and [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother , were [the only mourners at the funeral]3199-the only mourners at the funeral ; [a few village folk , moved by curiosity]3200-a few village folk , moved by curiosity , attended , but [no one else]3400-no one else ; there was not even an empty carriage , representative of [a good family , following the humble cortège]3202-a good family , following the humble cortège . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington observed this and felt it ; an empty carriage and good livery following would have given [her]58-julia satisfaction , without in any way diminishing [her]58-julia sorrow and proper feeling . It is conceivable [she]58-julia would have found satisfaction in being shipwrecked in aristocratic company , without at the same time , suffering less than [she]58-julia ought to suffer . After the funeral [they]3203-they returned to [the cottage]4035-the cottage and had a repast of [Julia]58-julia 's providing , eminently suitable to the occasion . Everything was eminently suitable , [every one]582-every one 's behaviour , [every one]582-every one 's clothes ; [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer 's grave face , [the banker]2090-the banker 's jerky manner — the manner of [a man con cerned with [the world]208-the world 's money market]3208-a man con cerned with the world 's money market and ill at ease in the intrusive presence of death . [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington 's voice , face , feelings , sayings , everything . [Julia]58-julia 's own behaviour was perfect , though all the time [she]58-julia saw how it looked as plainly as if [she]58-julia had been [another and disinterested person]3210-another and disinterested person , and once or twice [she]58-julia had an hysterical desire to applaud a good stroke of [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother 's or prompt a backward speech of [[her]58-julia uncle]2085-her uncle 's . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat , of course , did nothing suitable ; [he]66-mr. gillat never did . [He]66-mr. gillat kept up a preternaturally cheerful appearance during the meal , stopping [his]66-mr. gillat mouth with large corks of bread , answering " Ah , yes , yes , just so , "[66-mr. gillat] indiscriminately whenever [he]66-mr. gillat was spoken to , and starting three separate conversations on the weather on [his]66-mr. gillat own account . As soon as the table was cleared , [he]66-mr. gillat fled into [the back kitchen]2272-the back kitchen , shut [himself]66-mr. gillat in with the dishes , and was seen no more . [The others]312-the others remained in [the sitting - room]579-the sitting - room and talked things over , arranging plans for the future and for the immediate present . And when the time came and the conveyance was brought to the gate , [they]312-the others set out on the homeward journey together . [Johnny]57-johnny did not come out of [the kitchen]220-the kitchen to say good - bye ; only [Julia]58-julia came to the gate . [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby was going back [home]249-home ; [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer and [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington were going with [him]137-mr. ponsonby to spend the night in [town]238-town and go on westwards the next morning . [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer was anxious to get back to [[his]65-mr. frazer parish]3219-his parish , and [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington to [[her]60-mrs. polkington daughter]408-her daughter , who was expecting [her]60-mrs. polkington first baby shortly . It was this expected event which prevented [the young rector]3221-the young rector from asking [Julia]58-julia to stay with [him]3221-the young rector and [Violet]101-violet until such time as [she]58-julia and [[her]58-julia mother]195-her mother could settle somewhere together . It was this same event which prevented [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington from remaining at [[White]147-white 's Cottage]2228-white 's cottage and sharing [Julia]58-julia 's solitude until [their]3224-their plans were settled . All this was explained to [Julia]58-julia in the best [Polk ington]157-polk ington manner and [she]58-julia seemed quite satisfied with the explanation . [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby had to be perforce ; there seemed no alternative ; all the same [he]137-mr. ponsonby was not quite pleased . It was all sensible enough , of course , only as [he]137-mr. ponsonby saw [Julia]58-julia standing at the gate in the November afternoon , [he]137-mr. ponsonby did not quite like it . " Look here , "[137-mr. ponsonby] [he]137-mr. ponsonby said shortly , " [you]58-julia shut up [this place here]4376-this place here , send [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat to [[his]66-mr. gillat friends]1846-his friends , or [[his]66-mr. gillat rooms]4378-his rooms , or wherever [he]66-mr. gillat came from , and come to [me]137-mr. ponsonby . [You]58-julia can come and make [[your]58-julia home]3555-your home with [me]137-mr. ponsonby , and welcome , till things are settled ; there 's plenty of room . "[137-mr. ponsonby] This was a good deal for [Mr. Ponsonby]137-mr. ponsonby to say , considering what an annoyance [the Polkington family]3225-the polkington family had been to [him]137-mr. ponsonby , how — not without wisdom — [he]137-mr. ponsonby had set [his]137-mr. ponsonby face against letting [them]3225-the polkington family into [[his]137-mr. ponsonby house]1886-his house for more than twenty - four hours at a stretch , and how much [this particular member]3227-this particular member had thwarted and exasperated [him]137-mr. ponsonby at [their]3228-we last meeting . [Julia]58-julia recognised this and recognised also the kindness of the brusque suggestion . [She]58-julia thanked [him]137-mr. ponsonby warmly for the offer though [she]58-julia refused it , assuring [him]137-mr. ponsonby that [she]58-julia and [Johnny]57-johnny would be all right at [the cottage]4035-the cottage . " [We]3228-we do not find it lonely , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [we]3228-we are quite happy [here]371-here , happier than anywhere else , [I]58-julia think . "[58-julia] [The banker]2090-the banker grunted , not convinced ; [Mr. Frazer]65-mr. frazer shook hands with [Julia]58-julia and said [he]65-mr. frazer hoped it would not be long before [he]65-mr. frazer saw [her]58-julia ; [Mrs. Polkington]60-mrs. polkington reiterated the remark , kissing [her]58-julia the while ; then [they]3231-they drove away and [Julia]58-julia went into [the house]175-the house . [She]58-julia went into [the back kitchen]2272-the back kitchen ; [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat was not [there]180-there ; the dishes were all put away and [the place]241-the place was quite tidy . [Julia]58-julia went through to [the front kitchen]2480-the front kitchen ; there [she]58-julia saw [Johnny]57-johnny ; [he]57-johnny was kneeling by [the Captain]172-the captain 's old chair , [his]57-johnny arms thrown across the seat , [his]57-johnny silly pink face buried in them , [his]57-johnny rounded shoulders shaking with sobs . [Johnny]57-johnny loved as a dog loves , without reason , without thought of return ; not for wisdom , worth or deserts , just because [he]57-johnny did love and , having once loved , loved always ; forgiving everything , expecting nothing — foolish , faithful , true . So [he]57-johnny loved [[his]57-johnny friend]245-his friend , so [he]57-johnny mourned [him]245-his friend now , be - blubbering the seat of the shabby chair which spoke so eloquently to [him]57-johnny of the irritable , exacting presence now gone for ever . " [Johnny]57-johnny , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said softly ; " [Johnny]57-johnny dear . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia put a hand on the round shoulders and somehow slipped [herself]58-julia into the shabby chair . " [Johnny]57-johnny , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " let [us]3239-us sit by the fire awhile and not talk of anything at all . "[58-julia] So [they]3239-us sat together till twilight fell . The next day there came another to [Julia]58-julia , one who knew nothing of what had befallen in these last days . It was almost twilight when [he]245-his friend came ; [Johnny]57-johnny had gone out to collect fir - cones ; [Julia]58-julia sent [him]245-his friend , partly because [their]3239-us stock was low and partly because [she]58-julia thought it would do [him]245-his friend good . [She]58-julia did not expect [him]245-his friend back much before five o'clock ; it would be dark by then certainly , but not very dark for the day was clear , with a touch of frost in the air ; one of those days when the last of the sunset burns low down in the sky long after the stars are out . It was not much after four o'clock when [Julia]58-julia heard something approaching , certainly not [Johnny]57-johnny nor anything connected with [him]245-his friend , for it was the throb of [a motor]3240-a motor coming fast . Only once before since [she]58-julia had been at [the cottage]4035-the cottage had [she]58-julia heard that sound on [the lonely road]3242-the lonely road , on the day when [Rawson - Clew]155-rawson - clew came . It could not be [him]245-his friend now , [she]58-julia was sure of that . [He]245-his friend might have received the money this morning certainly , but [he]245-his friend would not come because of that , rather [he]245-his friend would keep away ; there was no reason why [he]245-his friend should come . [She]58-julia told [herself]58-julia it was impossible , and then went to the door to see , puzzled in [her]58-julia own mind what [she]58-julia should say if the impossible had happened and it was [he]245-his friend . The throbbing had ceased by now ; there was the click of the gate even as [she]58-julia opened the door , and [he]245-his friend — it was [he]245-his friend and [no other]3243-no other — was coming up [the little brick path]3244-the little brick path in the twilight . [His]245-his friend face was curiously clear in the light which lingered low down ; and when [she]58-julia saw it and the look it wore , all plans of what [she]58-julia should say fled , and the feeling came upon [her]58-julia which was like that which came when [she]58-julia crouched behind the chopping - block and [he]245-his friend barred the way . It seemed as if [he]245-his friend had been pursuing and [she]58-julia escaping and eluding for a long time , but now — [he]245-his friend was coming up [the path]566-the path and [she]58-julia was standing in the doorway with the pale light strong on [her]58-julia face and nowhere to fly to and no way of escape . " Why did [you]58-julia not tell [me]245-his friend before ? "[245-his friend] [he]245-his friend said without any greeting at all , and [he]245-his friend spoke as if [he]245-his friend had right and authority . " Why did [you]58-julia let this thing weigh on [you]58-julia for two years and never say a word of it to [me]245-his friend ? "[245-his friend] " [I]58-julia was ashamed , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia answered with truth . Then the spirit which still inhabits [some women]3246-some women , making [them]3246-some women willing to be won by capture , prompted [her]58-julia to struggle against the capitulation [she]58-julia was ready to make . " There was nothing to speak of to [you]245-his friend or [any one else]3366-any one else , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , with an effort at [her]58-julia old assurance , and [she]58-julia led the way in as [she]58-julia spoke . " [I]58-julia never meant to speak of it at all , [I]58-julia meant just to pay the debt as from [father]3307-father , and not [myself]58-julia appear in it . [I]58-julia did not do it that way , [I]58-julia know ; [I]58-julia could not ; [I]58-julia did not get the money till yesterday and — and"—the[58-julia] assurance faded away pathetically—"that was too late . "[58-julia] [Rawson - Clew]155-rawson - clew looked down , and for the first time noticed [her]58-julia mourning dress , and realising what it meant , remembered that convention demanded that [a man , whose claim depends on another]3247-a man , whose claim depends on another 's death , should not push it as soon as the funeral is over . However [he]3247-a man , whose claim depends on another did not go away , the pathos of [Julia]58-julia 's voice kept [him]3247-a man , whose claim depends on another . " Late or early would have made little difference , "[3247-a man , whose claim depends on another] [he]3247-a man , whose claim depends on another said ; " it is just the same now as if it had been early . Do [you]58-julia think [I]3247-a man , whose claim depends on another should not have known who sent the money at whatever time and in whatever circumstances it was paid ? Do [you]58-julia think [I]3247-a man , whose claim depends on another know [two people who would pay a debt , which can hardly be said to exist , in such a way]4383-two people who would pay a debt , which can hardly be said to exist , in such a way ? "[3247-a man , whose claim depends on another] But [Julia]58-julia was not comforted . " It is too late , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia re - repeated ; " too late for any satisfaction . [I]58-julia thought [I]58-julia would prove that [we]4384-we were honest and honourable by paying it ; [I]58-julia wanted to show [father]3307-father — that [I]58-julia — that [our]4384-we standard was the same as [yours]58-julia , and [I]58-julia have not . "[58-julia] " No , "[3247-a man , whose claim depends on another] [he]3247-a man , whose claim depends on another answered , " [you]58-julia have not and [you]58-julia never will ; [your]58-julia standard is not the same as [mine]58-julia ; mine is the honour of an accepted convention , and [yours]58-julia is the honour of a personal truth , a personal experience , the honour of the soul . "[3247-a man , whose claim depends on another] But [she]58-julia shook [her]58-julia head . " It is not really , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " and [father]3307-father — "[58-julia] " As to [[your]58-julia father]3306-your father , "[3247-a man , whose claim depends on another] [he]3247-a man , whose claim depends on another interrupted gently , " do [you]58-julia not think that sometimes [the potter]4388-the potter 's thumb slips in the making of [a vessel]4389-a vessel ? "[3247-a man , whose claim depends on another] [She]58-julia looked up with a feeling of gratitude . " Yes , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " yes , that is it , if only [we]4390-we could realise it — [poor father]4374-poor father . It was partly [our]4390-we fault , too , [mother]3346-mother 's , all of [ours]4390-we — and [he]4374-poor father is dead now . "[58-julia] " [I]58-julia know . Let [him]4374-poor father rest in peace ; [we]4390-we are concerned no more with [his]4374-poor father doings or misdoings ; [our]4390-we concern , [yours]4393-yours and [mine]58-julia is with [the living]4394-the living . "[58-julia] [She]58-julia did not answer ; a piece of wood had fallen from the fire and lay blazing and spluttering on the hearth ; [she]58-julia stooped to pick it up and [he]3248-i watched [her]58-julia . " [I]3248-i know [I]3248-i have no business here now , "[3248-i] [he]3248-i said . " Had [I]3248-i known of [his]4374-poor father death before , [I]3248-i would not have come to - day ; [I]3248-i would have waited , but since [I]3248-i have come — [Julia]58-julia — "[3248-i] [She]58-julia was standing straight now , the wood safely back in the fire ; [he]3248-i put [his]3248-i hands on [her]58-julia shoulders and turned [her]58-julia to [him]3248-i . " [Julia]58-julia , [you]58-julia and [I]3248-i have always dealt openly , without regarding appearances , let [us]4395-us deal so now — since [I]3248-i have come . Wo n't [you]58-julia let [me]3248-i give [you]58-julia a receipt ? "[3248-i] [Julia]58-julia said afterwards that receipts for the payment of such debts were unnecessary and never given ; which was perhaps as well , for the one [she]58-julia received in the dusk was not of a kind recognised at law . Could it afterwards have been produced it would not have proved the payment of money , though at the time it proved several things , principally the fact that , though friendship and comradeship are fine and excellent things , there are simple primitive passions which leap up through them and transfigure them and forget them , and it is these which make [man man]3249-man man , and [woman woman]3250-woman woman , and life worth living , and [the world]208-the world worth winning and losing , too , and bring the kingdom of heaven to earth again . It also proved how exceedingly firmly [a man who is in the habit of wearing a single eyeglass]3252-a man who is in the habit of wearing a single eyeglass must screw it into [his]3252-a man who is in the habit of wearing a single eyeglass eye , for , as [Julia]58-julia remarked with some surprise , the one which interested [her]58-julia did not fall out . [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat came [home]249-home with [his]66-mr. gillat fir - cones at a quarter to five . And when [he]66-mr. gillat came [he]66-mr. gillat saw that , to [him]66-mr. gillat , most fascinating sight — [a motor - car]4252-a motor - car , standing empty and quiet by the gate . [He]66-mr. gillat looked at [it]4252-a motor - car with keen interest , then [he]66-mr. gillat looked round [the empty landscape]3255-the empty landscape for [its owner]585-its owner , and not seeing [him]585-its owner , wondered if [he]585-its owner was in [the house]175-the house . [He]66-mr. gillat put away the cones and came to the conclusion that [the owner]3258-the owner was not [there]180-there and [the car]2552-the car was an abandoned derelict . For which , perhaps , [he]66-mr. gillat may be forgiven , for there was no light at the parlour window and no sound of voices that [he]66-mr. gillat could hear from [the kitchen]220-the kitchen ; even when [he]66-mr. gillat opened the door and walked in [he]66-mr. gillat did not in the firelight see [any one besides [Julia]58-julia]3262-any one besides julia at first . " [Julia]58-julia , "[66-mr. gillat] [he]66-mr. gillat said , bringing in the astonishing news , " there is [a motor - car]4252-a motor - car outside ! "[66-mr. gillat] " Yes , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia answered composedly ; " but it is going away soon . "[58-julia] " Not very soon , "[66-mr. gillat] another voice spoke out of the gloom of the chimney corner , and [Johnny]57-johnny jumped as [he]57-johnny recognised it . " Dear [me]57-johnny ! "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said ; " dear [me]57-johnny ! [Mr. Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew ! How do [you]58-julia do ? [I]57-johnny am pleased to see [you]58-julia . "[57-johnny] [The motor]3263-the motor did not go away very soon ; it stayed quite as long , rather longer , in fact , than [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat expected . And when it did go , [he]66-mr. gillat did not have the pleasure of seeing it start ; [he]66-mr. gillat somehow got shut in [the kitchen]220-the kitchen while [Julia]58-julia went out to the gate . When [she]58-julia came back [she]58-julia shut the door carefully , then turned to [him]57-johnny , and [he]57-johnny noticed how [her]58-julia eyes were shining . " [Johnny]57-johnny , "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said , " [I]58-julia am [a selfish beast]4397-a selfish beast ; [I]58-julia am going to leave [you]57-johnny . Not yet , oh , not yet , but one day . "[58-julia] [Johnny]57-johnny stared a moment , then said , " Of course , oh , of course , to be sure — to live with [[your]57-johnny mother]3323-your mother , [she]3323-your mother 'll want [you]57-johnny . [A wonderful woman]3322-a wonderful woman . "[57-johnny] " Not to live with [[my]58-julia mother]4400-my mother , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said emphatically . " Sit down and [I]58-julia will tell [you]57-johnny all about it . "[58-julia] And [she]58-julia told , slowly and suitably , fearing that [he]57-johnny would hardly understand the wonderful goodness of fate to [her]58-julia . But [she]58-julia need not have been afraid ; [he]57-johnny took [her]58-julia meaning at once , far quicker than [she]58-julia expected , for [he]57-johnny saw no wonder in it , only a very great goodness for [the man who had won [her]58-julia]3265-the man who had won her , and a great and radiant happiness for [himself]57-johnny in the happiness that had come to [her]58-julia . As for [his]57-johnny loneliness , [he]57-johnny never thought of that , why should [he]57-johnny ? Of course [she]58-julia would leave [him]57-johnny , it was the right and proper thing to do ; [she]58-julia would leave [him]57-johnny anyhow . " [You]58-julia could n't go on living with [me]57-johnny here , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said ; " [I]57-johnny mean , [I]57-johnny could n't go on living with [you]58-julia ; it would n't be the thing , [you]58-julia know ; [you]58-julia must think of that . "[57-johnny] [Julia]58-julia caught [her]58-julia breath between tears and laughter , but [he]57-johnny went on stoutly : " [I]57-johnny shall go back to [town]238-town , to [Mrs. Horn]127-mrs. horn ; [I]57-johnny shall like it — at least when [I]57-johnny get used to it . It is quite time [I]57-johnny went back to [town]238-town ; [a man]406-a man ought not to stay too long in [the country]760-the country ; [he]406-a man gets rusty . "[57-johnny] " [You]57-johnny wo n't go back to [town]238-town , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia said ; " [you]57-johnny will never do that . [You]57-johnny will stay [here]371-here in [the cottage]4035-the cottage , and [Mrs. Gray]143-mrs. gray from next door to [the shop]2442-the shop will come and live [here]371-here as [[your]57-johnny housekeeper]4410-your housekeeper ; [I]58-julia am going to arrange it with [her]143-mrs. gray . [She]143-mrs. gray will come and [she]143-mrs. gray will bring [[her]143-mrs. gray little grand - daughter]4411-her little grand - daughter and [you]57-johnny will keep on living [here]371-here always . "[58-julia] For a moment [Johnny]57-johnny 's face beamed ; the prospect was exquisite ; but [he]57-johnny sternly put it from [him]57-johnny . " No , "[57-johnny] [he]57-johnny said , " [I]57-johnny should n't like that ; it 's kind of [you]58-julia , but — "[57-johnny] " [Johnny]57-johnny , "[58-julia] [Julia]58-julia interrupted , " [you]57-johnny should always speak the truth — [you]57-johnny do anything else so badly ! "[58-julia] " But [you]58-julia will want to come [yourself]58-julia , "[66-mr. gillat] [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat protested . " Never , unless [you]58-julia are [here]371-here . "[66-mr. gillat] In the end [Julia]58-julia had [her]58-julia way . [Johnny]57-johnny lived at [the cottage]4035-the cottage , and [Mrs. Gray]143-mrs. gray and [[her]143-mrs. gray grandchild]3267-her grandchild came to keep [house]1446-house . And [Billy]137-mr. ponsonby , [[Mrs. Gray]143-mrs. gray 's nephew]3269-mrs. gray 's nephew , came to help in [the garden]4034-the garden and take care of the donkey ; in the spring there was a donkey added to [the establishment]3271-the establishment , and a little tub - cart which held [four children]3272-four children easily , besides [Mr. Gillat]66-mr. gillat . And it is doubtful if , in all [the country]760-the country round , there was [a happier man]3274-a happier man than [he]66-mr. gillat who tended [Julia]58-julia 's plants in [[Julia]58-julia 's garden]2324-julia 's garden , and drove parties of [chattering children]3276-chattering children along [the quiet lanes]2908-the quiet lanes , and sat on warm summer evenings beside [[[his]66-mr. gillat old friend]3943-his old friend 's grave in [Halgrave churchyard]47-halgrave]3279-his old friend 's grave in halgrave churchyard . [He]66-mr. gillat had forgotten many things , old slights and old pains , and old losses ; forgotten , perhaps , most things except love . [Foolish Johnny]57-johnny , [[God]104-god 's fool]3280-god 's fool , basking in [God]104-god 's sunshine . And [Julia]58-julia and [Rawson - Clew]75-rawson - clew were married , very quietly , without any pomp or ostentation at all . And if , on the honeymoon , [he]66-mr. gillat did not show [her]58-julia all the places [he]66-mr. gillat had thought of on the day when [he]66-mr. gillat travelled [north]3281-north with [the girl with the carnations]1800-the girl with the carnations , it was because [he]66-mr. gillat had not several years at [his]66-mr. gillat disposal just then . Afterwards [he]66-mr. gillat made up for it as work allowed and time could be found . In the record of [their]3283-they lives there are many days noted down as holidays , even such holidays as that first one spent on [the Dunes]1799-the dunes . In the springtime , when the bulb flowers were in bloom , [they]3283-they went once more to [the Dunes]1799-the dunes and to [the little old town]3286-the little old town where [the Van Heigens]78-the van heigens lived . [They]3283-they were received with much ceremony by [Mijnheer]90-joost and [[his]90-joost wife]168-his wife , and entertained at a dinner which lasted from four till half - past six . It is true that afterwards state had to be lain aside , for [Julia]58-julia insisted on helping to wash the priceless Nankeen china while [[her]58-julia husband]230-her husband smoked long cigars with [Mijnheer]90-joost on [the veranda]618-the veranda , but that was all [her]58-julia own fault . [Denah]103-denah came to tea drinking , [she]103-denah and [[her]103-denah lately - wed husband]3290-her lately - wed husband , [the bashful son of [a well - to - do shipowner]3292-a well - to - do shipowner]3291-the bashful son of a well - to - do shipowner . [She]103-denah was very smiling and all bustling and greatly pleased with [herself]103-denah and all things , and if [she]103-denah thought poorly of [Julia]58-julia for washing the plates , [she]103-denah thought very well of the glittering rings [she]103-denah had left on [the veranda]618-the veranda - table and well , too , of [[her]103-denah husband]230-her husband , who [she]103-denah recognised as [the mysterious " man of [good family]4416-good family "[103-denah] [they]3296-they had seen on the day [they]3296-they drove to [the wood]591-the wood]3295-the mysterious " man of good family " they had seen on the day they drove to the wood . And afterwards when the tea drinking was done and the dew was falling , [Julia]58-julia walked with [Joost]90-joost among [his]90-joost flowers , and heard [him]90-joost speak of [his]90-joost hopes and ambitions , and knew that in [his]90-joost work [he]90-joost had found all the satisfaction that [a man]406-a man may reasonably hope for [here]371-here . Later , [Julia]58-julia and [[her]58-julia husband]230-her husband walked through [the tidy streets of [the town]569-the town]3301-the tidy streets of the town , looking in at lighted windows , listening to the patois of [the peasants]3303-the peasants and recalling past times . It was then that [he]230-her husband told [her]58-julia how [he]230-her husband had that day tried to buy back the streaked daffodil . " And [Mijnheer]90-joost would not sell it ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia asked . " No , "[230-her husband] [he]230-her husband answered ; " not at any price , so [I]230-her husband am afraid that [you]58-julia will have to do without ' [The Good Comrade]4101-the good comrade ' after all . "[230-her husband] " [I]58-julia ? "[58-julia] [she]58-julia said ; " [I]58-julia can do quite well . Thank [you]230-her husband for trying to get it ; all the same [I]58-julia am not sure [I]58-julia want it back . "[58-julia] " Do [you]230-her husband not ? Then [I]230-her husband am quite sure that [I]230-her husband do not , indeed , [I]230-her husband rather fancy [I]230-her husband already have the real ' Good Comrade . ' "[230-her husband]
